2X6xcVWik_jTG9Y04H-qlw.text: A few points:  1) Service can be better -- the way the seater spreads out the customers gives each one privacy, but with how the restaurant organizes, it makes it difficult to get back to guests in time when they are ready to order. I noticed that another waitress had to step in when I started getting impatient.  2) Good ingredients on the sushi -- the fish is on point. There was fish with sesame oil on top of my chirashi donburi that was fantastic. I didn't expect sesame oil to pair so well.  3) The rice for the sushi sucks. It's bland, it lacks proper levels of acidity. It takes away from the deliciousness of the other ingredients.

OwVRF4rj3t5mGQV8xBKEpw.text: Fish is fresh and they use real wasabi. They toast their nori in sesame oil for their handrolls and it males a difference in texture, fragrance, and taste. Highly recommend of their happy hour from 4-7 for amazing deals on sushi and apps and $3 sake carafes.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b6PQBVY56z5byyABCxdaGQ.text: 7/25: Located in Forum Shops at Caesars Palace casino. I looked up a site that lists sushi restaurants with Happy Hour available. This place was one of them and had a good rating as well, so I decided to give it a try. The food was pretty good, and most of the service was great.   It was pretty quiet a little before 6PM on a Thursday, and I walked up to the front without a reservation. My friendly hostess promptly and politely sat me down in the bar dining area, although I requested to sit at the bar. Not sure if she misunderstood me or not. (FYI: it was pretty hot in that area; I'm not sure if the A/C was on...the bar was just right). A Happy Hour menu requested, which wasn't available in that area, so one of the waitstaff courteously moved my beverages to the bar.   My bartender/waitress Lauren was awesome! She works pretty fast; there was an instance or two when I felt rushed, but that's better than slow service. She was very friendly and social, and we introduced each other as well. The rest of the staff was meh. Food was served in a reasonable amount of time, and the presentation was pretty cool.   TIP: I was told that locals get 20% off regular menu prices! (double check on that before you go)  -Kobe Meatballs ($6) -Fried Calamari ($4)  -Spicy Yellowtail Roll ($5 cut) -A2 Fusion Roll (albacore, onion, avocado & jalapeno...$5)  -Eel & Avocado Roll ($5)...I'm a fan of unagi and this was fresh and delicious!  -Mini Tropical Fruit Cheesecake ($3)...one of the best, if not the best, desserts I've ever had! They don't give you a huge slice, which can be a good thing. It's pretty sweet and rich, tastes like coconut with oreo crust. SO good!  -Iced Tea was "only" $3.50 as well (I think it's usually $4+ on the Strip). Lauren even offered a full cup to go, which I accepted of course.  All of the food was great, although I wasn't expecting a couple of items to come in such small proportions (meatballs and calamari). Happy Hour might actually be more profitable in terms of cost/profit margin and bringing in customers; not just here, but at most places.   Overall a pretty good experience. I have no doubt that I would be satisfied with the quality of the other appetizers. I'd come back again for "Red Sun" Happy Hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Red Sun&#34; Happy Hour
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari

4cW4iO1D96qNp2je4FwiDA.text: Excellent and fresh sushi with imagination and great flavors.  Loved this place!  The baked lobster is a must.

wCPCUf_3h3AAevv--Bpzlw.text: Best sushi me and my family has ever had. Instantly seated and ate within minutes. Awesome staff.

c0DXehj0qmyJBUI9x6mX3A.text: Really excellent sushi. We tried a variety of rolls, sashimi, as well as the baked cod. Everything was great, although we ordered a few too many of the "eccentric" rolls that are either partially or entirely fried, or have a combination of multiple types of fish. I prefer the simpler items, and we had plenty of those, and they were just incredibly. The baked cod is also a great item to mix in with cold sushi.  For sake, we had cold unfiltered sake and it was delicious. A great alternative to the steak and shellfish restaurants in this area!

poym0yXb2wfHTBl3I4jZAA.text: It's ok. Ate there on 7/12 with the family. Nothing really special for the price they charge you. Didn't have saba or the white tuna sashimi we wanted to order. Feels like resturaunt in a mall. Meh...I would not choose to eat there again.

yVD-eSywZdkjSa1PjCK_fA.text: I would give it 10 stars if I could. The service was outstanding and the food was off the charts. We had the Brussel sprout chips and tempura vegetables for an appetizers. The chips were amazing. The baked lobster roll was to die for. I might eat here again tomorrow.

PP6Z_zxUZqFKA86JJ5Dh3w.text: 5 star dining experience. The sushi was unreal and so was the service. I was very impressed once I walked in to when I left. I will be back with friends!

Gk1s_Binm7YINv_I20adRQ.text: Good service, amazing sushi  The miso soup is very flavorful and just a little salty, the eel avocado hand roll was delicious and the California hand roll had sweet crab.  The katana roll was a delight with yellow tail, tuna, tempura shrimp and salmon inside of it.  Highly recommend!

HzQQA4kb7ALIjssUYdTPJQ.text: Nicely decorated restaurant. We were seated at a separate table as I requested in reservation. The makoto roll and spicy tuna roll were quite tasty. Also ordered the ramen and the pork finally didn't taste so fatty for once! The ramen I have had at other places had really fatty pork. For dessert, we ordered banana flambe and it was a nice finish for the dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Makoto roll

NRFqC6Kb6oXlv5Dbg9FZZw.text: Our service was terrible. We waited at least 30 minutes for our waiter, and then another hour and a half for our meals, and this was when the restaurant was NEAR EMPTY. The food was average for being overpriced and the overall experience was basically moot.  Our server Romi, specifically, was not communicative and responsive to our needs until after we complained. They tried to reconcile with dessert but it didn't outweigh the poor service.  In short, you're better off buying fast food. At least then it's affordable and the service is timely.

wzToauSjyP50rf9T1o3dFw.text: First time here. Delicious sushi and chefs sashimi. Excellent service. Specialty cocktails are great and don't forget dessert!! Donuts are best finish!!  Pricey but great views and great food! What do you expect on the Strip?!?!

gX_lrOi-ncKuVgq-JRzUPw.text: This place is located on the 3rd level of the Cesar's Palace Shops.  It was a bit of a walk, but well worth it.  We were craving sushi, so we were looking at all the reviews on yelp and decided to give this place a try.  Came at about Noon on a Tuesday, so it wasn't busy at all. We ordered the following:  - Salmon sashimi - the color is a bright orange and the taste was so fresh.  Definitely a very good grade of sashimi.  It's buttery and melts in your mouth.   - Cucumber roll - this was very good as well.  Most of the time cucumber rolls are just ok everywhere, but this was delicious.   - Spicy Tuna roll - I love spicy tuna rolls and this one was very good.  Just enough tuna and spiciness to make it a great roll.  - Pork Belly Fried rice - my husband loved this and so did I.  The fried rice is already packed with flavors, but when you mix the pieces of pork belly with it, it adds an explosion in your mouth.  So delicious!  - Uni pasta - this one was very disappointing. I've had uni pasta before, but this one just tasted like an alfredo sauce with pieces of uni.   Overall the sushi was great.  It's a bit pricey, so be prepared, but you get what you pay for.  Good sushi doesn't come cheap.  Staff was friendly and service was fast with the exception of my uni pasta.  That one took a little bit longer then everything else, but the server did prepare me for that.  I would definitely come back here for the fresh sushi and the fried rice next time I'm in town.

97K9kaX86UI-jFzAaTQyDA.text: Fantastic.  Katana roll is where it's at.  They even gave my wife a set of chopstick helpers to help the struggle. Haha

qav3zgtr-tH9SXeM_rTiww.text: This place is awesome. I don't eat a bunch of crazy stuff lol but my boyfriend does. We went for a birthday dinner their. They ordered sea urchin with quail egg, beautiful blue fin tuna, pig ear with cartilage lol, raw beef liver with garlic. Everyone loved the food. I didn't. Try any of that but I did get the tofu and that was really good! It's definitely something to check out!

OPBzqKwyTh58AsCqc5v2Vw.text: Holy sh*t this place is awesome. First, the atmosphere - it's loud, lots of people, fun music. Cool interior design and lots of big windows to look out over the strip.   More importantly - the food. Wow. I don't want to say too much lest I oversell here, but it was soooo good! We started with the shishito peppers - very crunchy and good spice. We also ordered the Brussels sprouts - so delicious with chunks of bacon and sweet sauce. Then we had the katana sushi roll - the fish just melted in my mouth. We then had the toro roll, which was delicious and had a wonderful crunch from the jalapeno (but not very spicy). My friend ordered the pork belly fried rice - such a delicious, flavorful bite with fantastic texture and yummy egg. She also had the braised ribs which had a wonderful, unexpected melange of flavors. Our other friend ordered the chicken, which was delicious if not a little boring in comparison to all of the other amazing flavors on the table.

9l1qFQ5iAIwOZzy5WLtQRg.text: Overall solid experience. We came for lunch & sat at the sushi bar. Restaurant & dining area were clean. Service was par. Was a bit pricey but we are in Vegas. We ordered the lobster tempura & a 4 sushi rolls. Enjoyed the food but with so many options to eat at I'd probably try somewhere else. I heard they have a good happy hour...

gEML04LjJu3BFhWWwdFY1A.text: Sushi Roku is inside Caesar's Palace on the third floor of the Forum Shops. The inside is a mix of modern and Asian design. It looks sleek and posh.   The food is a little pricey, but it is understandable since it's on the Strip. The view from the dining area is really nice. I ordered the spicy tuna roll because I am a huge fan of spicy tuna. It did not disappoint. The tuna was very fresh and it was obviously much better quality than other sushi places.   This is a good place to go for dinner before a night out. Nice and classy.

N1Wjrhxdzknor1DzPOIpFg.text: Once again - Sushi Roku does not disappoint. My favourite need a snack while shopping at The Forum shops. Located on the top floor it takes a little patience to find this quiet spot. Enjoyed their signature rolls - make sure to try the Katana and Sima rolls.  Our server was friendly and made sure everything was perfect for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katana Roll - fabulous!

HF8OpRoi8xshsOp1__5Rww.text: I never tried sushi until visiting here about a year ago.  I'm hooked now.  This place has a few areas to sit.  There's the sushi bar if you want to simply experiment and order as you please.  There's a more cozy seating area near the entrance.  There's also a large area near some huge windows with a great view.  The staff has always been patient and willing to help a sushi-noobie figure out what to order.  I enjoyed sitting at the bar a couple times (I visit Vegas often) and the chefs are almost like bartenders.  They have personality and will talk with seated customers.    I've tried a number of different dishes (don't ask me to name them).  Before I took the plunge, I had steak and it was well prepared.  I haven't tried anything exotic like eel or squid and kept mainly to the safer meats like tuna and shrimp.  The food has been great.  This restaurant is usually near the top of my list to visit when I simply want to stick with what I know instead of exploring other restaurants.

DLM01t4tqOaDWzh3H2gvKw.text: On our last visit to LV, we had lunch at Sushi Roku based on a friend's recommendation and I'm glad we did.   Everything was absolutely delicious. Each dish was prepared with thought  and was full of flavor. It was quite an expensive meal for the amount of food but it was definitely worth it. Quality over quantity.

YyhIa0aoMlIiSo1nvRlT9w.text: We went to this place on NYE. It was a classy place. We ordered tofu 3ways and salmon sashimi carpaccio for appetizers. The tofu dish is decent. The sashimi carpaccio is very flavorful. We also got matsu sushi selection and Japanese style ribeye steak and they both taste great.

iaAgDUW-KPjO0qjDfDIyCQ.text: Excellent Sushi. Very good view. Service was excellent. Not a fan of the signature cocktails. Expensive, but this is Vegas... So to be expected.

m4E5AvHRH09eqSeoh-j75A.text: My experience here has left me with no words. Bad service. Mediocre food. I can definitely say I'm never coming here again. It took over 20 mins to get our table some water and the waitress didn't own up to her mistakes and blamed the busboy for not bringing the water. When we got the water, it tasted horrible. Our hotel room sink water tastes better than that. The food came so late as if they left to catch the fish we were going to consume. The waitress then forgot to put in one of our rolls and apologized in the most stand offish way possible saying it was a "human error" as if she wasn't even sorry about it. As we received the bill, my friend realized she got spicy tuna when she had wanted yellowtail. All in all worst place ever! The only decent person was the busboy. Avoid the waitress with a feather tattoo behind her ear.

Mjgr7peXcX8WxD9bxviqzw.text: Food: 4/5 Service: 4/5 Cleanliness: 5/5 Decor & Style: 5/5  The food is definitely good. Nice view of the strip. You can tell it's a pricey place by the way it looks. The place is pretty dark, but that is because they want everyone to notice their huge view of the Strip.

LSY4WVGX-aRPsNJnqe-kGA.text: My fave sushi place in Vegas! The view is killer, food is amazing and the drinks are FANTASTIC.  Try the filet mignon-wrapped asparagus and any of the sashimis--wash it down with a spicy passion and spice...I order mine with muddled serranos instead of jalapenos and it's DELISH.  The manager is super nice as well!  All of the staff are very attentive and helpful, and it's a great place for lunch or dinner.  I'm there every time I visit at LEAST once!

Y6dGNMzyQVOjqVlGUJTWuw.text: Went here during a visit to Vegas. Debated the oh-toro (fatty tuna) out loud and even our server commented that it was great and "just melts in your mouth". Ended up ordering 2 orders (4 pieces) of it along with our entrees.  The tuna we had looked like they were less than ideal cuts. Not only did they taste bad, they were likely the worst tuna I've ever had. A complaint to our server simply resulted in her shaking her head and saying "not so good?" with no offer of a remedy.  Two stars because the fried rice was pretty good.

68VNwCxsrB_JA5VEQUgSrw.text: I love sushi!  I am also picky about my sushi.  Sushi Roku does it beautifully.  The fish was melt in your mouth delicious and the service attentive and helpful.  We had the katana roll - great mix of fish and you could add/remove as much of the spicy mixture as you like, a salmon sashimi special with yuzu foam - nice balance of flavor although slivered radish was a little strong for the delicate fish, a couple of hand rolls - the California had sweet mild Alaskan crab and the eel sauce on the unagi  was top notch. I love uni, and this met my expectations of fresh sea goodness.  The dessert of banana flambe was a huge wonderful surprise.  I am not a dessert person, but my nephew was there and he ordered this dish.  I had two bites before he finished it and OMG!  No flames at the table, but his spoon was on fire as he dug in!  Go here instead of Nobu when in Vegas if interested in creative sushi.

EoyicGExWjVtMgpjXyj3fA.text: Great service!  Super clean and neat. Fast service!  Delicious bar. The bartender was amazing. I got tipsy off one cocktail lol I'm not even a lightweight.  Went here for my 21st bday and wedding reception. So amazing. Wonderful service. Wonderful people. Beautifully designed Asian fusion theme and soft music. Very relaxing time.  I will definitely be coming back another night.  Excellent food! Everything was fresh and delicious. I expected to pay At least 1000. Bill was half that, plus tip. Got a hookup on champagne for my wedding :)  So great!  I guess the only thing people should know is portions are very tiny. Good for me cuz im teeny but not the hubby lol For men you might end up hitting up a burger joint after but for the ladies it's perfect! I would definitely go again and again!

yOuj-XzCrxlxq5MaLSc-gg.text: Really fantastic sushi, but the service is what sets this place apart. Everyone from the manager to the busboys were friendly and attentive.  Fantastic miso soup and spicy tuna rolls, in particular.

apYqoq0SKtbevsp8I1_HnQ.text: I'm picky when it comes to my sushi. I went to Sushi Roku for the first time last week and I was blown away. The food is SO fresh and the rolls were unique and delicious! The prices are average for the strip, but totally worth it!

Mdj5WfPMXaDMVs1VOZaN4w.text: Why come here to eat? We just spent $130.00 and going home hungry. On top of it we found a long piece of plastic in our rice but they said it was crab. For this price they should make sure no UFOs are found in our food. Overpriced and not so good food. Very small portions, I mean small.

oEY01qglnatcrkXv7HoFIA.text: Fantastic!!!! From the food to the service, all was absolutely wonderful. The view from the diningroom is a real treat. The tuna tartare was delicious!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The vie from the diningroom

qYwmv2gadj2MEPWBE7F3fg.text: Inside the world famous Forum Shops, Caesars Palace.....wonderful.   The service was incredibly wonderful. The ambiance and the location are amazing with a superb view of the strip. The decor is beautiful and very romantic.     Only draw back for me is that they are a bit pricey, however locals do receive 20% off.

a38AK_grxZYR9D7mnT-Q_w.text: This is a review only for their Happy Hour.  Taking in consideration Vegas prices, this place is a steal if you go during Happy Hour.  I suggest only ordering the rolls because i ordered the sashimi albacore and it was literally 2 tiny pieces. My friend ordered the calamari and it was not enough to share.  The rolls run $5-6 and the drinks (including beer and champagne) were also around $5 a pop. The dessert is around $3 and it was a decent size.   We had great service also.

cEkUU8OLwUTsq6y4mG5sQg.text: Had a great meal with my mom. The staff was very attentive and courteous. Although they couldn't make an expresso to save their live, the food and service made up for it. If you can sit next to the windows. The "booths" suck for comfort if you're a sloucher like me.

a_SOmxP2SRgZdSPX9cGCPw.text: Loved the atmosphere, friendly chefs! And absolutely delicious food!  I recommend the Hakata ramen!!

JDJ-edvShNj_NXjvzKSYjg.text: A friend and I stopped by during their happy hour. The bartender was real nice and held a good conversation. The sushi though was underwhelming. No real taste and left us unimpressed. Wouldn't stop here again but I imagine you could do worse.

vFOVExKTpJDaEWdcopjq6w.text: Even better than the LA location. The sushi is good, not mind blowing, amazingly fresh, OMG....but a solid good. So you get an enjoyable meal, with an intimate dining experience, and great ambiance. Good views of the strip and a little bit of a breather from the chaos. But what made it a fantastic night was the service. It was EXCELLENT. Best restaurant experience we had the entire trip! I will go back next time I'm in Vegas which I hope will be soon!

Pzgt1AOhA-_7usZcLFZZUw.text: first spot me and my gf decided to go when we arrived in vegas.  i was really dressed down, as a matter of fact the only person in the place dressed down.  But still, did the hostess have to look at me like i was a scrub?  cmon, you're a hostess in vegas, probably hoping some rich guy knocks you up.  anyways, the place was crackin, like most spots in vegas.  very nice, upscale place.  the food was great, the best salmon sashimi ive ever had.  i couldnt stop thinking about it 2 days later.  they set a new standard for myself when it comes to salmon.  id also reccomend the baked lobster.  prices are really steep, so if your taking someone here, i hope you get some action afterwards.  minus the snobby hostess, and i would have gave this place 5 stars.

EOAJDWmuKt1WvAyTS4xOVQ.text: Great, especially better at the happy hour. Been here several times before, and we love it each time. Pricey, but good. Ambiance was great, and great location, you can shop after too work off the calories. Spicy tuna as usual was the bomb, juts enough flavor not too greasy. Volcano dessert was awesome.

wUxku58Fq33ReN28d5vpZQ.text: We stopped in because we wanted just a quick bite before going out for the evening and it was right there and seating was available.  The sushi itself was good, the limited menu options are very traditional. We sat at the sushi bar and were served quickly, which was fine with us because we needed to meet friends.  There was nothing special about the presentation it was just sushi and sushi quickly.  If you are looking to have a top quality Japanese meal in Vegas this probably isn't your place, but if you need to grab something quickly it fits the bill.

2yM8Hjvwz-1TzOv4OHtQDw.text: Very nice place with great service. The steak was great, the only thing I would hope they fix is the sushi. It's a very romantic place and my gf enjoyed it for VDAY

prv4I4O-J3fSmpDhCfu4rQ.text: After having a hefty brunch at Bouchon, we opted for a lighter dinner of sushi.    We made a 8:30 reservation while we were shopping at the Forum Shops.  My gfs and I order a couple bottles of sake and a mixed tempura plate to get the evening started.  We all really enjoyed the pricey sparkling raspberry sake ($34 a bottle!) and the tempura.  We also got a couple of rolls to share as our dinner and all were delicious.  Our only annoyance was when we wanted to order more food and drinks our server could never be found.

yW164RuYCvogQVy8VE_l2w.text: I've been to the Santa Monica location yelp.com/biz/qZNLvgtZ89P...) and heard good things about the Hollywood one (yelp.com/biz/9LvbzUke1gS...), so the expectations were high. I made a reservation with Open Table (yelp.com/biz/W2rSvA2Vvt5...) and I was not disappointed. The ambiance is great; I love the decor and I got to peek in the private banquet room which was lovely. Our food was excellent as was our sake. Be sure to check out the quirky menu of cocktails (including one that comes in a glass rimmed in crushed graham crackers).

bLlXGx2PU3l2ZewyHN5RbA.text: When going to this restaurant you need to know what to order to get the greatest experience, my friend of a friend was server and when I went I knew just what to order which was the...  -Chilean Sea bass with Yuzu Butter Sauce (Amazing)  -Yellow tail Sashimi with diced Chile's on top and Ponzu (Came out super fast and was really refreshing)  -Lobster or Popcorn tempura, it comes in a sweet miso sauce which is to die for! ( I got the lobster)  -Katana Roll (lots of fresh fish and tempura in it, it was large so we were able to share)  -Shima Roll,( if you like spicy this roll is the way to go)  -Salmon Carpaccio with Truffles ( anything with truffles and I'm in!)  -Hanabi , which is spicy tuna on thees rice cakes ( takes a little while to come out but worth the wait)  -Filet Mignon wrapped around asparagus it had a sweet sauce on top almost like teryiyaki but better (not a huge portion but perfect for an App with a couple people to share)  -Banana Flambe, its on the dessert menu but the menu doesn't do it justice( i might come back for that alone!)  So I went with 4 people and we all shared everything I think that was best way to go by far because we were all able to try so many different things, Oh and I cant write this review without mentioning the cocktails which were absolutely delicious ,my friend and i got the Tokyo Cooler and i could have drank about 10 of those! i will for sure be going back as soon as I can!

RmR2LZGE2daGn6Pz9VJVsw.text: It's a beautiful restaurant with a great view looking over Vegas.  The food is great and you definitely pay for it.  Its a cool, trendy scene with "cool" trendy people.  Great sushi.

Mzy5cnl4Nw6risB57YnwWQ.text: I wasn't blown away by Sushi Roku. I only went to the bar so maybe that was the problem. The drinks were great, bartenders were awesome and it was pretty easy to grab a beverage. There didn't seem to be too many places to sit down as most of the bar seating had already been monopolized.  The menu looked good and prices good, so I recommend at least a happy hour there!

3wWpJfc6PaMRu7S5mMA_Gg.text: I love this restaurant.  The sushi was fresh and creatively prepared, decor is very contemporary and sets the mood and the view was awesome. I don't know why, I just have this thing for views in big cities. Went here with hubby and it was very romantical. If anything else, come check out the bathroom doors. lol... you'll know what i'm talking about. I've been to the Pasadena location and nothing but good things to say 'bout that location too.

eiIBOs95oauj6n4FEBxqdA.text: I agree with others. My wife and I came here for a quick and quiet anniversary dinner. Although it was not the least bit quiet as a result of Karaoke (sp) night at the club across the way, it was pretty quick. We had a very good rainbow roll, some nice hamachi, etc. The fish was very fresh and delicious. The rolls were a good size and not too over-priced. We thought it would have been even more expensive considering the atmosphere, but it was a pretty good price. I would go back to this place because it is conveniently located on the walkway that connects the Forum Shops to Caesars and was actually not far from the elevator to our room. I thoroughly enjoyed it and will likely be back as soon as I can get back to Vegas.

mbROl691uBNYojlql3tBWQ.text: Came to Sushi Roku with a bunch of friends and was able to secure the private room for a private dinning event. Located on the 3rd floor of the Forum Mall, Sushi Roku is probably one of the best Japanese restaurants that I've been too offering a beautiful view of the strip.   We got here and the room was all set for the 20 of us that would be dinning that night. As I mentioned before the private dinning has a great view of the strip. The atmosphere here is definitely hip with low lighting. You have the high end modern Japanese with lots of dark wood used throughout with hints of red and stone accent pieces. We had a prefix meal sampling meal served family style so all we had to do was sit down, drink several rounds of Saki bombs, and let the food come to us.   First up was the edamae. Fresh with a touch of sea salt was just the right way to start off a night of eating and doing Saki bombs. Next up was a Chinese chicken salad. Good, nice fresh mixed green lettuce with a dressing with a nice blend of balsamic and sesame to it. The shredded chicken was also very good. Chicken skewers were next up on the menu, again, very good. Chicken was done perfectly and the sauce that I had was a sweet sauce with a little bit of heat at the end. After the chicken out came the rolls, there was a traditional California Roll, (good but not mind blowing), the Spicy Tuna (though small, everything here tasted really fresh and with perfectly cooked sushi rice and a nice amount of heat, really really good) and probably the one item that everyone raved about was the fresh Soft Shell crab roll. While simple, it was just very fresh and outstanding. This alone I would come back for again. We got two desserts for the nice a chocolate lava cake with a vanilla cream sauce (second best I've had with the best being at Roy's in Maui) and Ice Cream Mochi which was pretty good.   The service here was excellent. Very professional and friendly especially considering how rowdy this group can get. Overall all the food and Saki cost around $80 a head which seemed reasonable for the amount of food and drinks we got that night. No one in our group of 20 left hungry and there was plenty of food left over. I have to say, this is one of the best Japanese restaurants that I've been to and will give Sushi Roki a rare 5 star rating!

HOZ0gdt8IkaVXDH2EIVWow.text: Made reservations on Opentable but like others have pointed out, it wasn't necessary but still, it was better to be safe than sorry esp on a Thursday night in Las Vegas.  We were seated by the windows which had a gorgeous view of the strip overlooking the neon lights of Harrah's, Imperial Palace Hotel and Paris in the close distant.  We started with edamame, closely followed by a tuna tataki salad which had a hinge of too much vinegar but the tuna was good. Then we tried the toro with scallion roll - excellent, melted in the mouth, Roku and roll roll which had combination of 3 fishes, unagi sushi and toro sushi. Then we finished with the Chocolate Volcano which was a warm chocolate cake oozing with chocolate sauce in the center with vanilla bean ice-cream, it was delicious! 3.5 stars. I thought the sushi at Nobu was a tad better. But service was impeccable considering other prime restaurants with very poor and s-l-o-w services in the last few nights!

mkMLwPJgwfWi1jkBi10mOA.text: Great ambiance.  They sat us at a two top over by the big window that overlooks the strip.... that combined with the mood lighting(dark) and music, you could really feel the energy of vegas.  The sushi was pretty good too.  Lots of fancy rolls along with the basics.  Got the seaweed salad as an app.  Good portion for 2 people.  It was different because they mixed in some baby green with the seaweed which added a different dimension to the dish.  The best thing we had was the fresh sweet shrimp(amaebi).  A little pricey but worth it.  It was served along with the deep fried heads.  Don't want to disgust anyone but if you been to new orleans, "pinch the tails, suck the heads"  Seafood perfection!

aDDc6dkH6zZBCUfy9mffjQ.text: The food was delicious and the decor was beautiful.  The service was excellent and the prices were the typical Strip prices, expensive.

APauPhhVTu5CKA-mM2oDRw.text: This place is in the Forum Shops so the location and view of the strip are the attraction.  Don't valet in front of Caesar's, go to the right of Caesar's (as you are approaching it and driving towards the valet area) and there is a driveway on your right.  Take that and it puts you in front of a steakhouse with valet.  Go to the 3rd level and there it is.  Nice place, great view, and the service seemed to be very good.  It wasn't busy for lunch though.  I had the basics - miso soup, yellow tail and halibut sashimi, and tuna nigiri.  It was all fresh and very good.  It is an expensive place though relative to sushi that can be had elsewhere.  If you're going to spend that much you may as well go to Nobu in the Hard Rock.  Nobu has marginal atmosphere but good crowds and great sushi.  I would come back here but only for dinner on a busy night.

9U3EVc18DSzKxi0a8SZPOg.text: Food was excellent. Their beef dishes, fish, sushi, everything. Best Sushi Roku out of their four locations. Great atmosphere for hanging out.

bdmWGQXolODIMZlQPlgNOA.text: Great place...excellent sushi, and they encouraged pounding on the table for our Saki Bombs! love it.

UT21AQlS0RmaKlhF0bO4EA.text: Went to the LV location instead of the one in Santa Monica.  This is next to the BOA steakhouse in the ceasar's forum shops.  We ate here to celebrate my sister's birthday.  We didn't make any reservations ahead of time, but they were able to accomodate eight girls and were given a good table with a view of the strip  We ordered different kinds of sushi, salmon terriyaki, to soba noodles.  We each thought our dishes were pretty good.  They even provided my sister with a bday dessert.

zqVDYcVkPuLeCyS8UnzH7Q.text: My favorite sushi place in all of Las Vegas. When I visit the city, I make sure to make a stop here. The sashimi is really fresh, I even remembered the sushi chef saying that some of it comes from Japan. Toro has to be my favorite sashami there. Tastes like butter and melts in your mouth. I think I've tried just about everything there and all of it really stands out and makes me dream about coming back.

Oe7UEeu4RBKbboZDMl-t2w.text: Amazing food Fantastic service  Great decor What more could you ask for Desert- the chocolate volcano, chocolate filled donut holes or fresh berries

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KGOKAItxFiQV4oDePT8kww.text: Amazing food and great service. We came here tonight for a birthday and to feel special/fancy and were not disappointed one bit on either front. The spicy udon was amazing, as were all the skewers we ordered. Will definitely be coming again!

BkEPpa7TlWS12WlRyV34HA.text: This place is a lot more fun whenever I come with my friends who once worked here.  It seem very serious when I come alone without my friends.   The chef don't smile as much, they don't crack jokes but the food is always good

JA7E4IZ0VjRlNW-Y2W6NBA.text: Our group came for Happy Hour on a Friday. We ordered right before HH ended at 6pm, the waitress was super friendly and patient as a few of us who arrived late ran in just in time to place our orders.    The table had the hummus with pita bread ($6) to share after hearing good reviews on it.  I found this dish was just OK though I'm not normally a fan of hummus anyways. We ran out of Pita bread and had to order more as we still had plenty of hummus left. I personally had a Hot Sake ($3), the Brussel Sprouts ($5), the RibEye wrapped Asparagus ($7), and the A2 Fusion sushi roll ($6).  The veggie dishes all tasted great! The crispy pork that came with the brussel sprouts added nice contrast in texture and taste to complement the already well flavored brussel sprouts. The asparagus dish was also done well - loved the soy-mirin sauce - and easy to cut through and eat (meaning the rib-eye was done just right and wasn't too overcooked or tough). The A2 Fusion sushi roll was disappointing though, I don't even remember how it tastes now...   The prices are great for being in Caesars Palace, the quality was there, and the food had great flavors for the most part. Service was also excellent; we were checked on frequently but not intrusively, and all with friendly smiles. Would definitely come here again to try more of their dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour seating only at the bar or tables outside the restaurant.
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel sprouts with kurabuta bacon ($5 HH), Rib eye wrapped asparagus ($7HH), and my friend&#39;s order of Spicy Tuna on Crispy Rice ($7 HH).
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A2 Fusion supposed to have jalapeño in it but didn&#39;t really taste it. Not a memorable roll. ($6 on HH menu)

n-yybKrZdcKqY4t6ztlVXw.text: This was the BEST sushi I have ever had! The service and ambience was excellent! The food was to die for. The spicy tuna crispy rice (which is called something else here) and the white fish carpaccio special were insanely delicious. I am a sucker for spicy tuna and they have ample spicy tuna dishes to choose from. We tried many rolls and we figured out that basically anything you get is amazing!! Definitely book a reservation ahead of time and I recommend requesting a booth!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ebola8tVr6gd7YkpU_5wyQ.text: Great sushi happy hour. Great service. I was so busy eating I didn't take enough pictures. The rolls on the happy hour menu are either hand rolls or 6 pieces. I ordered 2 rolls, sashimi and wine for $25.00. It was a great deal and it tasted amazing. My favorite dish was the sashimi. I ordered the Tuna Tataki w/Garlic Ponzu and I was in heaven. It was so fresh and just melted in my mouth. I loved it. I wish I had went back today just to get more lol. I also ordered the A2 Fusion, this role was good but it was a grayish color do ascetically it wasn't very pretty. But it wasn't bad. My second favorite roll was the Rock Shrimp Tempura w/Jalapeno...this was just delicious. Fresh, a little spicy and very filling. Writing this review, I think I know what I'm having for dinner...my mouth is watering!!! :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi on the happy hour menu: Tuna Tataki w/Garlic Ponzu

AoC49qXu6wQXaT3toOOR3g.text: Sushi Roku served an amazing lunch. The sushi chefs take great pride in what they serve. One of the preferred specialty rolls is the Baked Lobster. I also love roku because they offer Japanese A5 Wagyu in gyozas. A must try appetizer. The filet mignon skewers are also delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UVEOXHDGWA3zWQWrONlNog.text: We had the 6-course omakase + the sake tasting flight. Everything was incredible! I asked for my set to be gluten-free and the staff was very accommodating. My favorite course was the nigiri. The fish melted in my mouth like butter.

HD1P_f_IV2STw7c3BXC7zA.text: You must try the crab tartare (crab with uni, caviar, and truffle oil), toro sashimi (cubes of toro with caviar on top), and wagyu beef. Other carpaccio dishes were amazing as well. Oh, the green tea tiramisu was pretty good too.   Their oyster shooters were a big disappointment. Oysters were slimy, the sauce was too salty and warm (ewww), and mind you, it was $15 each!  Their sushi rolls sucked!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea tiramisu
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu, Fluke, Salmon, Crab tartare(must try), Steak, Tuna; Uni, Toro, and Oyster shooter (eww)

Q58k3MO57Blq7dlXoW2-EQ.text: Don't doubt this place at all! The food is amazing and everything we ordered was delicious! As well, the restaurant has a beautiful view of the strip!! Our servers were very attentive and gave us guidance when it came to the menu. You can share almost every plate to try a little bit of everything and I recommend doing that because we did and every plate was great!

7-uWOeMc28SwgRP96CVuFg.text: Very over priced, but worth it. It was the best sushi I have ever had. Views were great, service pretty good. The pork belly fried rice was amazing!!! The drink menu is fun. I had the Roku Infusion, It came out with smoke like dry ice, but it tasted pretty bad. I wouldn't recommend it. Cant go wrong with any of the food..it was so perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6J869VQ0d5HfxfUBzoqqKQ.text: Very upscale flavored fish and sushi. Classy ambience great for special occasions and birthdays. Came here with a group while visiting Vegas and was very impressed. We tried assorted sushi, sliders, salmon plates, and dessert. Everything was fantastic. Will definitely be coming back one of my favorite sushi experiences.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon entree amazing and filling. Sushi was also fantastic

uqlqszFqzWdMsS_B42IenQ.text: Wow THIS is Japanese food at its best. Don't be fooled by its location in a tourist trap mall, this place is excellent and is a must try if you want a Japanese lunch. I had the beef bento box which came with some of the best beef I've had anywhere and tasty California rolls, a salad with ginger dressing, and a huge portion of rice. Try the beef here and you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Bento box with California roll, salad, and rice

0YpF7x3wmHdIyDQFAjrIlw.text: Luckily we noticed that las vegas was having some type of restaurant week.  Kind of craving some japanese food and the choices for this place sounded great.  We had the dinner which included appetizers, main course and dessert.  Theme was hot and cold so since there was two of us we decided to try each one.  For cold appetizers we had a trio of salmon, albacore and tuna carpaccio.  Delicious especially the salmon.  Hot included sea bass, rib eye wrapped asparagus and tatsuta age chicken.  Also really good especially the sea bass.  Main course included a variety of sushi nigiri and a BAKED CRAB handroll which was amazing!! We ended up ordering more.  The other dish was filet mignon with mushrooms and garlic truffle oil.  It was good but that baked crab took the prize.  Dessert was a Yuzu creme brule with green tea ice cream along with a trio of flavors of mochi ice cream.   All in all the meal was great and Ill definitely have to come back again for the baked crab hand roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q9-A1Kx67vtKGvmf5vxHAA.text: Come here for Happy hour Sunday night. Rib eye w/asparagus, Popcorn shrimp & Sushi rolls are good.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ulBp1x12u1M_DxJtKgHAiw.text: Very nice wait staff, the sushi chefs were friendly and helpful making choices. We had several different icees and a couple of rolls and everything was very good, a beautifully prepared. But the highlight of dinner for me was my cocktail. You have got to try the Asian pear!

Ge4ip13zxkquwO8DC65ivw.text: I saw this restaurant on yelp and figured I'd give it a try. I made a reservation on open table because we needed to eat before heading to see the Backstreet Boys! When walking in we were greeted warmly by the staff and chefs. The ambiance and decorations are comforting and fit well with the type of cuisine. We ordered edamame and two rolls and I felt like we were moaning with every bite. One of the rolls (something with crab I think?) tasted like it was broiled over a flame and it was absolutely the best tasting roll I've ever had in my life. We ended the meal with their take on s'mores, which was served on a plate of crushed graham cracker with a small flame to melt the marshmallow, chocolate pieces and mochi. It was cute, packed with flavor, but difficult to eat. Still, we really enjoyed our experience and will definitely come back here the next time we check out Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;more dessert !
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another roll with avocado. So delish!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honestly the best sushi Ives ever had!!

jJhLd6pMIsDF4cY4vKRlFQ.text: Went for a girls night out and the ambiance was nice. We had cocktails first which were delicious, small but strong. We had some rolls , popcorn shrimp tempura , fried rice, and the cauliflower. All of it was great. Our waiter was nice as well :-) we are locals so we will return . Roll , appetizer and a drink was about 45 bucks total.

9FiTPXwbhHgSDmIwBsmU0Q.text: If you're in the mood for overpriced, subpar sushi then this is probably the place for you. But if you want decently priced, good quality sushi - I recommend you take your money elsewhere. The boyfriend and I made reservations during our recent trip to Vegas to celebrate his birthday and we felt like we ordered a good amount of food - but the portions are pretty small, more like tapas and not main courses. We got the baked lobster roll, the tuna jalepeno roll, the eel avocado roll as well as free range chicken dish. The sushi wasn't quite as "fresh" as we expected and the chicken was... dry. The check came up to a little over $100 and we although we are pretty small eaters we had to go and get a round of burgers at shake shack later that night so we didn't have to go to sleep hungry.

kwEq2ocA1AzRRuuKhA7MpQ.text: I've had plenty of sushi from various places but this restaurant blew my mind. We had three rolls, all recommended by our waiter, and all three were absolutely amazing. Their tuna jalapeno roll (modified without the jalapeno) was my favorite. The citrus olive oil in the roll complimented the tuna and avocado really well. Their tuna melted in your mouth like butter and the soft shell crab roll was amazing. I've never had crab in sushi before but I gotta say, this exceeded my expectations. The pineapple fusion was also delicious. The vanilla bean in the drink was a nice touch and the drink went well with our rolls.   The atmosphere is nice and we were seated right away. I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for something good to eat on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red sun roll, tuna jalapeño roll, soft shell crab

NIooAiV1_07ni67o7uyPmg.text: I went here during lunch time to celebrate my husband's 31st birthday. His parents were in town and we were with my family, so we decided to do a meet and greet. My husband and I have been together nearly 9 years, and my family has never really met his family. Since my husband loves sushi, I found this place on yelp, due to the incredible yelp reviews as well as they serve affordable lunch combination plates. However, when we got there, since it was on the weekend, I guess they did not have and lunch specials. We ordered quite a bit here, we were a party of 6. My family being doesn't really eat sushi, or anything raw, I knew it was going to be interesting. We ordered tempura and miso cod fish for them. We ordered this delicious sashimi with shaved blacked truffles on it. Also a couple of yellowtail rolls. This was my first time trying ikura, and it was delicious and very fresh. We also ordered some bluefin tuna and it was very fresh and practically melted in your mouth.  For fresh delicious sushi, this is a definite must.  On an unrelated note, the women's bathroom stalls are really really low. Considering I'm already short, I had the stoop pretty low. That I found amusing.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside the restaurant
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3h7XL7NF_oLbZwwHlwBZxA.text: My husband and I had a beautiful dinner and a great time, Johnny Executive GM/Regional Director gave us an amazing experience! Definitely coming back, food was amazing! So worth the money. Thank you Johnny, and your staff for a wonderful service/experience.

CrRuSTP0_sRJwp62r48A-g.text: Our new favorite sushi place in Vegas. Food is absolutely delicious. Not many sushi rolls to choose from but a lot of unique items and uniquely tasty combinations. Dimly lit, not overly loud suits for a client dinner or a date night. Fantastic views straight down the strip.  Highly recommend.

ekWlrgDqT8HBDkEJHqVPfg.text: All the steak dishes are absolutely amazing! So is their chicken fried rice. I come back everytime i come to vegas and will go again!

vStPSgZDz9-Cr9hKb8bMnA.text: Dinner was awesome! Very nice, clean and trendy restaurant. We had the toro roll, crab dynamite, baked crab hand roll and special roll all were outstanding! Can't go wrong with any of their rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t remember the name of the roll but this was also sooo gooood!!!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon and live octopus was delicious. Careful on the octopus it&#39;s spicy.
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outstanding baked crab hand roll..

rBY1h3Kz8_kRliOW1VOcmQ.text: As impossible as it was to find this place, it was worth the run through Cesar's to make our reservation. The place was very clean, the staff was incredibly friendly, and the service was pristine. We had a group of nine on a Saturday night, and they didn't miss a beat.   Everyone ordered something different and we did a lot sharing, so I think I had a taste of 10+ rolls! I absolutely loved the crab roll, and the edamame and hummus appetizers were outstanding as well. What is that bread they use with the hummus?! It's other worldly, and I must have more. I would definitely recommend!

4IRNGNM-nPnq4vl41LLfzw.text: We found this gem on Open Table and after checking reviews on Yelp, and decided to dine here while visiting for a conference. The three of us were very impressed by the quality of the sushi. The White Lotus roll was amazing, the albacore just melted in our mouths. The Tuna Jalapeno,Eel Avocado, garden roll, Curry and California roll were also just as amazing. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and the light and fruity cold sake. Will definitely be back when in Vegas again!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garden roll, crab dynamite roll and the melt in your mouth white lotus roll.

yUqhJENdAS_uWx46bI7YDg.text: Came for happy hour and loved it! Sushi rolls, veggie tempura, and mochi were fantastic and I'd recommend to anyone.  Without happy hour pricing, it was definitely out of my reach. So heads up.

nek1GMi2gwClNTQBpEqrzg.text: A company took me and my coworkers here for a meeting and both the food and service were exceptional! We were in the private back room and had several appetizers to start including tempora shrimp and veggies, kobe beef that we grilled ourselves, and edamame. Everything was stunningly displayed and tasted great! We even cooked our own kobe beef on little grills over hot coals, which was fun! The sushi was delicious (and i dont usually like sushi!!!) i would HIGHLY recommend this restaurant if you want to make a good impression on your group and have an amazing meal! Pricey but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert platter. Little donuts in the back, chocolate cake, wonton bowl of ice cream with berries, mint tea cake.

KFQolrCBu9Y8LkdYhAbStQ.text: Hands down best sushi meal I have ever had. Food was amazing, service was amazing, and the view of the strip can't be beat.

JwT5kpgsAAwOIv4veLQCsg.text: love their happy hour.  mushrooms especially!

l5olzYv-W4-D1CJ0_WpOQQ.text: Happy hour! :) For food and drinks, but I only had water here. The water itself was deng sexy. LOL. Lemon placed in the cup with a toothpick, you wouldn't feel like it's just water.  The happy hour items had was:  - Filet Mignon Wrapped Asparagus w/Soy Mirin: It was good! The sauce and juice from the meat thinly wrapped around 4 stalks (two halved asparagus) was delicious. The asparagus was cooked, but still had it's crunch in the center. (HH: $6)  - A2 Fusion: consists of albacore, onion, avocado & jalapeno. One of the best rolls I've had in a while. (HH: $5)  You'd get more with sushi roll, $4 handroll isn't worth the quantity.  Decor was simple, had a hint of modern, and even thought it's in Vegas, felt like I was in California, if that makes any sense. LOL  For Happy Hour, you'd have to sit in a designated spot. Only minus 1 star, because I had to sit with people who were trash talking about Asians at the same table. It's not their fault, but I wasn't able to move from the table to another spot to avoid hearing them continuously bash on my culture. Made my eating a bit awkward.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $3 mini chocolate volcano.
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. How comfortable.
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The other sitting areas.

oc_oYNl-fro0dpkXEdW87Q.text: Great view of the strip and good sushi. I like the dim lighting and it wasn't very busy late in the evening on a Monday.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CIccv8eSyVek7rMb5R8voQ.text: Used to live in LA and loved the Sushi Roku in SaMo but the Vegas location just didn't bring it. Great sake but all food was underwhelming, especially the Blue Fin Tuna sashimi that costs $15 for 2 pieces! Just low quality vibe

4cAzJtvqdLMJMeFpMJNMfg.text: Excellent food and service!  They have awesome Oregon Four Graces Pinot Noir wine  and the cod is awesome.  For a real treat try the steak with a little charcoal grill at your table.  Great birthday celebration place as they provide fireworks and free deserts.

YPhguxskZDIu7lp8LFkURg.text: Best Happy Hour for Sushi on the strip. Customer service is on point, everyone is super friendly and go out of their way to accommodate you. Sushi is fresh and delicious. We come here for happy hour every time we come to Vegas. Enjoy the view at night. SUSHI ROKU ROCKS!!!!

wWknLeNks9UjSfVjcIJd9g.text: Had lunch here with friends after a local recommended it. Fabulous view of the strip with great lunch specials.  The server was very friendly and efficient. Highly recommend.

qxFB2NkoNYkqjNpGRmu4Qw.text: I was fortunate to grow up on the California coast and have eaten some really incredible sushi. That said, being hundreds of miles away from the Pacific Ocean was not encouraging me to consume sushi in Las Vegas. But, Sushi Roku was a pleasant sushi slap to the face! The Happy Hour was a True hour, 5pm to 6pm, so if you are local and looking to head there at this time... do not underestimate the traffic! We made it with about 15 minutes to spare and were able order our meal, happy hour prices and all!  Said prices were around half off, and hand rolls were cheaper than cut rolls, but are not great for sharing. The rolls were a good size and the fish was good quality. I have found few places that use real crab in their CA rolls and luckily Sushi Roku's were on the money!  My favorite rolls of the night were tuna / avocado, tempura sweet potato, rock shrimp / jalapeno, & spicy scallop  (which I absolutely had to try because it was new & exciting).   I will be trying more sushi restaurants on the strip. But will also be a reoccurring customer at Sushi Roku for their happy hour! Loved their quiet location in the Forum Shops, hip / cool ambiance, and sushi bar / table / bar-bar options for seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow Roll, Spicy Scallop, and Ebi Hand Roll

kF41Gp-QSnkooo0kFTz83w.text: I really like the ambience of this place.  It has a great view of the strip, great location in Caesars palace beside the fountains & statues.  I like the sushi selection and the way they presented the food made it more appealing.  Besides aesthetics,  the food was great.  I've been to plenty of sushi places & this is one of my favorites.  The desserts were great as well!  I forget exactly what it was I had but someone posted a picture of it (it was a decadent chocolate cake with ice-cream). . . it was delicious.  Must try this place.

8OXtlgc6HMj3dD-oTuqERA.text: Today I had the farty part of the tuna thanks to Jeff. And you know what, I liked it!  I need more farty parts in my life.  You have to try it. This was part of a delicious feast. The food is honestly great here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The man who introduced me to the farty part of the tuna!

oiRt93CNFAynB5uL9E-BCg.text: Decent selection of good quality of fish for sushi or sashimi. AND their hakata ramen was very pleasant and appreciated surprise.  Good rich broth, firm noodles, green onions, and seaweed. The pork slices were about average.

q3HhN9f9nqRryZci2bdHkg.text: I came back to Sushi Roku 3 times in 2 weeks.  The staff, food, and ambiance were wonderful!

N4FDFp2dlho3uNmzMQnAtw.text: food: got the worst food poisoning after eating at sushi roku in vegas.  worst.  service: bad  final thoughts: awful

uhxGl5APFljYBGhdrRBEYg.text: my second time at sushi roku and all of us loved it! ask for a table by the window so you can enjoy the view of the strip. the tuna tataki and black truffle hand rolls were a taste explosion in my mouth. we kept ordering more of those! to celebrate our anniversaries we ordered the tropical cheesecake which was tasty too, and enough for the four of us. I love sushi roku and definitely recommend it for a tasty meal, without breaking the bank. go for sushi happy hour (4-6 or 3/5??) to really get a good deal!!

LbbgpwZrb1DN9TGWdujo0Q.text: My husband and I had dinner here on a lark while on vacation in Vegas. We were both craving sushi and staying on the strip and we just picked this place because it was close and had good reviews. I am so glad we did! Every single thing we ate was absolutely superb! Even the miso soup was amazing! We had shrimp dumplings, makoto rolls, a roll with tuna, shrimp and asparagus and a spicy salmon roll special. All of them were so light and fresh it was unreal. They were also very accommodating to substitutions, as I have an avocado allergy. Service was on point and the atmosphere was dim, but very pleasant. The lava cake was unlike any we had ever had before, and I have had a few! Some people have expressed displeasure with the prices, but we found them to be fair given the area. We live in Miami and most dinners are on par, if not slightly more expensive than the one we had at Sushi Roku. Definitely one of the best sushi restaurants I've ever been to. Highly recommended.

-igpUhnA1b5iUK6rfAtuPw.text: I have an iron stomach and the sushi I had here put some chinks in it.  Obviously something wasn't fresh.  The service was good. The Toro Sashimi wasn't good due to the stringiness of the fish.  It's supposed to melt in your mouth and be the best.  So disappointing. The tempura and edamame was really good. The rolls were good but I can't remember which one.  Next time I'll be going to BOA instead.

3ksaNjXhccVsagOkERFZsg.text: My husband and I really enjoyed the generous happy hour here. Out favorites were the spicy yellow tail, the filet mignon wrapped asparagus and the albacore sashimi with garlic aioli. The bar staff was fun and friendly. We will return!

NAuvnuOYttzIKEIcHmppkA.text: Pricey but it's Vegas! The sushi was awesome, the waiter was very knowledge and had a wonderful experience.

EToKsqBOcX17_FCqczNsLg.text: I wanted so badly to love Sushi Roku... but alas, poor service has ruined an otherwise wonderful restaurant.  But there's just no excuse for bad service in a high-end, expensive Vegas restaurant like this. Not when there are so many other amazing restaurants to enjoy.  The first time I came here, we were promptly seated at the sushi bar, where we just sat... forever... with nothing.. no drinks, no water, no menu. We looked uncomfortably around wondering if the restaurant was really even open yet. I finally had to awkwardly ask the sushi chef if we were supposed to order drinks from him (which is normally bad etiquette in a sushi restaurant, as the chefs only make the sushi). Finally a waitress showed up with menus and took our drink orders. And at some point later in the evening, those drinks finally found their way to us.  In sharp contrast to the incompetent waitress, the sushi chefs were AMAZING. We ordered several of the high-end specialty sushi rolls (at about $26 a roll), and what we received was as delicious as it was beautiful. My favorites were the Titan roll, which was like a piece of art, and the Katana roll. Everything was so fresh and tasty.  Meanwhile, we finished our drinks and ordered a second round. Once again we waited.. and waited... and waited. Keep in mind, there wasn't ANYONE else in our section... the restaurant was not busy at all, the bartenders at the bar looked bored... yet we waited and waited and waited some more for our drinks. By now, we had already finished the meal, and honestly, probably even digested it already. Once again I had to awkwardly ask the sushi chef for help. Only this time I asked for a manager (after explaining to the chef that he had done nothing wrong!).  The manager apologized, and soon we had our drinks. But really, we didn't even care at that point because we were ready to leave. Then I was shocked when I first received the bill, as nothing had been comped, but later when the slip came for me to sign, I found that he had comped the drinks and some of the sushi, so at least there's that.  In our most recent trip to Vegas, we decided to give this restaurant another shot, since we liked the sushi so much. This time we sat at a table with a great view of the strip. I really liked the decor of the dining room, and felt quite comfortable there. But once again, the service disappointed us.  The first item we tried to order was the Oyster sushi, and were told they were out.  Next we tried to order the Spanish Mackerel sushi, and were told they were out of that too. Finally we ordered some rolls that they did have... and the waiting began again. As more and more time passed and we still hadn't received our sushi, I realized that this restaurant just has fundamental service problems. The waiter apologized and explained that sushi chefs were "slammed," but really, there's just no excuse for that when you are paying $26 a roll. We had tickets to see a show later, and I was starting to stress about whether we were even going to make it on time. I was also annoyed when the waiter gave us only a little bit of wasabi and ginger, to share, and then he even took that away partway through the meal!  I had to ask for more.  I think this restaurant has so much potential, and I really do think the sushi here is very good. But bad service just ruined the whole experience for me. If it weren't for the great sushi and wonderful view of Vegas, I'd definitely be giving this restaurant only one star. Later in this same trip, we ate at Blossom in the Aria hotel, paid $20-$25 per entree, and had some of the most amazing service we've had in a restaurant. When you are in Vegas, you want to have fun and be treated like a king... and Sushi Roku just didn't do it for me. So disappointed.

GCYgJJVpXjhKYLqO6RSGVg.text: I ate at Sushi Roku along with two other people last Sunday at around 5:30pm.  It wasn't crowded so we got a booth overlooking the window.  The waitress was attentive and the Asian-influenced ambiance was nice.  We ordered just enough food to feed the three of us.  The cost was around $120 dollars for three people, including two small sakes.  The dishes we ordered included:  APPETIZER Hanaki Spicy Tuna on crispy rice cakes - This was quite good with a nice amount of spicy tuna on top of individual rice cakes.    The tuna had just a touch of spiciness.  There were about 5-6 pieces.  Sweet potato tempura (two pieces) - We had to send it back the first time because the sweet potato wasn't cooked enough.  It came out better the second time.  I probably won't order the tempura again.  SUSHI Unagi Hand Roll - It was a standard unagi hand roll, which is my favorite sushi.  The sauce wasn't overpowering like some unagi hand rolls. California Hand Roll - It was tasty since they included generous portions of real crab meat.  MAIN ENTREES Chilean Sea Bass with Sauteed Spinach entree (Added Miso Soup and Rice for $6 which was a bit pricey) - I felt the fish was moist but had a fishy aftertaste but one of my guests thought it was perfectly cooked.    Pan-fried  spicy jumbo shrimp with homemade potato chips - The shrimps were good-sized and were perfectly cooked. The sauce was not overly spicy.  The homemade chips were an interesting addition and tasted good with the sauce.

aU4OKjACQNHQs09qcD2k0g.text: My boyfriend and I really enjoyed this place, I ordered salmon sashimi (the best that I've tasted) a few other rolls and my boyfriend ordered the Uni which he swears by...it is good quality fish and the views of the strip are awesome!

oRUP-b6J-5GBjx23AVRUNQ.text: Environment slightly dark, very high class feel. The food was extremely expensive, so I was expecting some high quality food. Ordered some sushi, sashimi, maki rolls, and the salmon with scallops entree. I have to say, I was very dissapointed. The food was good, but no more than average, absolutely not worth te ridiculous prices. I've had WAY better, cheaper, elsewhere. But it's Vegas, so what do you expect? =p I would not go back here for the food because I could get the same quality other places, for AT LEAST half te price.  Total came to around $150+. only reason to go is environment, or if you want to spend a lot of money.

yEAOtRUJM5MFnctmSoCp3A.text: Delicious, delectable but pricey sushi with a great view of the strip.   Highlight: hand rolls - Eel Avocado and popcorn shrimp washed down with an Asahi draft

zHxf9A8nEzoHNDlkTJcVMw.text: Took my wife out for our 10th anniversary.  The sushi was great!  We'll be back.

jAX_EgBzGLs32XDL4YmHqQ.text: The food was GREAT (very fresh and yummy) but our servers - yes, we had about 4 - were about as hot as a bowl of ice cream.  They forgot our edamame.  They were slow with our food and drinks.  They kept switching servers on us.  I guess after hearing so many great things about this place I was expecting more.    Question:  The table next to us got warm towels for their hands... Were we left out? Do they do this for everyone?

zfo_8D9pHeHZNnbNAJW0qg.text: Dined here for my boyfriends birthday on vacation in Vegas. I chose this restaurant based on the price vs. reviews and we were NOT disappointed! Both of us eat sushi regularly, and tend to be a bit picky, but Sushi Roku delivered. After finally locating the restaurant (we got lost in the HUGE Ceasars hotel), we were greeted by the super cute and friendly door girls. I was pleased that we had a table with a great view of the strip. Our server was helpful in recommending drinks, and we both started off with an order of Miso Soup and Vegetable Tempura. The soup was the perfect amount and so flavorful, the Tempura hot, fresh, and delicious. For sushi, we decided on the Yellowtail, Salmon, Crunchy Spicy Tuna, and Tuna. Everything was spectacular! The yellowtail was fresh and melt-in-your-mouth delicious. I wasn't a HUGE fan of the Crunchy Tuna, only because I don't really like 'hot' rolls, but it was still yummy and hit the spot. For dessert we had the Creme Brulee Trio, which topped off the meal perfectly. I would definitely return, the service was great and for the price (especially in Vegas), you cant go wrong!

cmLcFbujBIAnOWVy8thWog.text: I've now eaten twice at Sushi Roku in Vegas. First time was the one that earned four stars. I placed one order at a time trying a lot of different fish and had the best o-toro sushi I've ever. What was great was that the sushi chef recognized right away that I was basically creating my own omakase and so he tried out a couple things on me like searing one of the o-toro sushi pieces, brushing it with some sort of a sauce and placing a truffle on top for what was an amazing one bite food experience. Unlike at Okada a couple of days earlier, Mirugai was very different tasting it was very fresh and much better. All of the sushi was very good, best sushi I've had in Vegas. The one kitchen dish consisting scallops and foie gras wasn't good. Each scallop was huge and lightly seared on the outside raw on the inside but just didn't do it for me.    On my second trip to Sushi Roku I sat at the sushi bar once again, this time with a different chef. I didn't go all out like the last time but the sushi that I did eat this time was once again very good.

7ylMPTIrdtzxMDyvFv_9Zg.text: This place never disappoints - food is always amazing, service rocks, and the view of the strip kills! Make sure you yell at the sushi chefs when you enter.

heOpUpDMSv1ossr3XV9AYw.text: Dined here two years ago and haven't found a sushi place as good since. Friendly staff, yummy cocktails and tasty rolls.  He doesn't like sushi, so he got beef teriyaki.  The portion was small for the price, so stick to the rolls and tempura. It was the day after my bday and they gave me a complimentary dessert with a really cool sparkler in it...Vegas style, super flashy.

cEbcdGliigD1rkfvVG3YFw.text: Amazing service! Carmello was our server and was able to keep my whole bachelorette party of 9 happy! Loved him! The baked lobster roll is my absolute favorite at every Sushi Roku I've gone to and it didn't disappoint here. The servings are small and overpriced, but pretty typical for an upscale sushi restaurant. Loved my fireworks sparkler with dessert (on the house.. thanks Carmello!!)

iATuC0EBE1sUhNVaYyS0BA.text: Really pleased with the food and service. The yellowtail sashimi was delicious as was the Valentine's Day lobster special. Also, not too ridiculously priced compared to other Vegas restaurants. Definitely recommend coming if you have a chance.

wUY3_rlr57Wls0NPlQGsvQ.text: Roku doesn't disappoint in terms of freshness.  The sushi however lacks any innovation in terms of combining ingredients and wowing the taste buds.  The entrees are all decadent and savory on the taste buds but the steak is a bit over drenched in salt and oil.    The desserts on the other hand are scrumptious and to die for.

wUoHAWUC7uvrAWmhSn3z0w.text: This was really the only restaurant I went to in Vegas that didn't let me down for the price. Overall, dining in Vegas is quite a challenge. For the upscale eaters like myself, things feel overhyped and overpriced. Not this place. I ordered a raw sushi combo and the fish was fresh, large pieces and with a beautiful presentation. Service was prompt and the environment was pleasant. The edamame was also notably good...I make edamame at home so it's not very easy to impress me, but that was good. Would definitely go again

ENBjc0_gb9glGQIe4NrlGg.text: Best sushi in Vegas period!! Jason our sushi chef was awesome and Rene was great to make sure we had everything we needed. Food was amazing! Fresh and unique with a fun vibe.

A4Yz6aZj1zAJ-8go_THTtw.text: Went with a large group, and the food was wonderful.  Unfortunately, our service was not.  We had a party of 18, and our server seemed very annoyed that we didn't want to order family style (at $85 per person), and then proceeded by telling us he would not split the check more than 6 ways- which was fine, but he also brought the manager over to tell us the same thing.  His annoyed attitude as if we were inconveniencing him by being there left a bad taste in our mouth, and two of our guests decided to leave and dine elsewhere.  Luckily, we really enjoyed the food very much, but were definitely disappointed with the service.

XZs5UtuRpTHg-omvvzB3WQ.text: By far the best sushi in Las Vegas or Henderson. Always fresh, great variety and special fresh fish flown in every day.

uZUs4uHPf7eq_HZj6wHYiQ.text: I had the opportunity to dine in at this location awhile back. The food was great especially the Oysters, it's was amazing. The Unagi was also the best. I would recommend any one who visit Las Vegas to visit this restaurant. Free valet parking..

zRRQXDPbed7WEUhN2AO5rg.text: We had a family dinner here prior to me and my fiance getting married. This place has totally ruined sushi for me anywhere else. It was absolutely amazing. We did a tasting type deal where they brought out many different dishes of sashimi, rolls and such, everything was fresh and nothing like I had ever had before. And I am one who did not eat much raw sushi before this trip. It is going to be very hard for me to eat sushi just from anywhere from now on and previously I was ok with eating Kroger sushi :) This will be a definite stop for me when I return to Vegas and a definate recommendation for those who are in the vicinity. I love this place!

2O8TKoMsG4_H29tvzCsmLw.text: Food not bad.  Wine list decent. Service and presentation and follow through - horrid. Non-educated staff as well. Disappointing. Will continue to go to Tao or elsewhere for Asian cuisine.

ePQKnUn1pmN1t_dabynJoA.text: We ordered togo.  Blackened cod $28.  We arrived at our hotel room.  For &28, all we got is a tiny piece of cod- that is all. A piece of fish; no greens; no rice.  Just a tiny piece of fish.

nPrTgL8VWMYyWIblQtA1sw.text: The ambiance (dim lighting and Japanese modern furniture) and view of the strip really drew me in on my first visit here.    The sushi was good.  I really enjoyed the spicy tuna hand roll, California roll, & the Shima roll.  Everything we had was fresh and delicious.  I highly recommend calling ahead and booking a reservation.  Also, plan to spend at least $75 for a dinner for 2, and that is without drinks.

V1JNEgzZRzQI9hBZ5hl0ZA.text: I went to Sushi Roku about a week or so ago for the first time along with some colleagues and business partners. Although it was a little tricky to find well worth the travel through the forum shops to the 3rd floor. Our waiter Greg L. was phenomenal. His passion and experience made the food that much better. I highly recommend not looking at the menu and giving your waiter some time to ask you a couple of questions (hopefully they are as good as Greg L.) and letting them show you the ropes. Between the service and the food, members from our group grabbed seconds of rolls and sushi that the dont normally eat. I don't have to think twice as to where I'm taking my clients and partners to eat next time I'm in the area.  Great food, great atmospher, great service.

VZm3lb38bO2LUpFm-mJdjw.text: Not the best, but still fresh and good. Good sake selection and fabulous lava cake. For being sushi, I didn't think the prices were horrible when you consider it is on the strip in Vegas.

ifEByFDooQmjupd54RaOCA.text: MY FIRST REVIEW IN OVER A MONTH, sorry I've been away for so long Yelp!! Now onto the review.  Cute place BUT looks can be deceiving, as we all know.   AWESOME VIEW Located on the second floor inside Caesars Palace, Sushi Roku looked promising because of the attractive decor and beautiful seating, the place practically looked like a lounge. Oh and I forgot to mention that the view is pretty awesome.   Our reservations were made for 10pm on a Thursday night, which I kind of thought was weird because they close at 10 BUT hey whatever.   KEEP ON ROLLING WITH THE DISAPPOINTMENTS We ordered at least 10 rolls, might have even been 12. But each roll that came out was just as disappointing as the next!!! I'm not use to eating crappy sushi, can't expect too much from a Japanese restaurant on The Strip. The last roll that came out had my friends wanting to spit it out, they described the taste as rosemary soap (WE SENT THE DISH BACK BECAUSE IT WAS THAT BAD). Needless to say I did NOT try it because knowing me and my gag reflexes, I would have thrown up on the person sitting across from me after eating that.   One star for the laid back ambiance and awesome view.

RxYZp6oOwy12YziyauJ5sg.text: Cute place. The interior is very upscale, and intimate. It's a nice place to have a nice romantic dinner with the love. I would suggest to request the strip view when dinning in because the strip view is just lovely.   The menu is ok. I personally prefer authentic Japanese cuisine at a local area (Spring Mountain!), but there are a few things here that I like. Their signature martinis are good! I would definitely recommend the Lychee martini. You get a big piece of Lychee as a garnish, and you can taste the Lychee flavor of the martini. So if you are all for a nice sweet taste to your martini I'd definitely recommend it.  Our group ordered the Seared Tuna Tataki, Seaweed Salad, Yellowtail Sashimi, Crunchy Spicy Tuna, Rock Shrimp Tempura, and Chicken Yakitori Skewers. To me, it was nothing special or anything that stands out to where I feel like this place might be the only place to satisfy a distinct craving. The food is very light, fish is fresh, and the portions are small.   I haven't tried the Omakase yet, but I would like to actually try it once to see if it is worth spending $90 for. The Omakase might be the only thing worth gambling on. All in all the experience was nice and the service was wonderful. If you don't mind burning a big hole in your pocket for a nice fine dining experience, and a small stomach and appetite then I would recommend it.

rSai7mkq0Cf7g9hbu93Cqg.text: The sushi was over priced and not that good. We ordered a shrimp tempura/jalapeno roll. It was literally just that. A small piece of tempura shrimp with jalapeno slices rapped in rice. No sauce, no other filling. What a waste. The waitress was very good as was the rest of the service. But when you spend over 100.00 on sushi, you'd like it to be memorable. It turns out it was because I woke up at 2:30 in the AM running to the bathroom...

mG7RM01UYtMaKh5aYLX73A.text: I came here after shopping in the forum shops and have to say the day I dined in all the fish were very fresh. It's a bit pricey, but the atmosphere is nice and if you're craving sushi after shopping this is a great place to go!

V5lNh3XkGSaPd_uwo0TQuQ.text: Great, fresh sushi! Healthy options. Super sweet hostess' + waitress! Great view of the Strip. Love the ambience!

UTQxzKiVUOGdkGukCCyEFg.text: Much better than some other outlets in this chain. The trick here is to order appetizers, such as the tuna sashimi with crispy garlic chips, or yellowtail and spicy tuna on crispy rice, not conventional sushi and rolls, which are just so-so.

zs2tCtNo6m2YRi6s8mhA_Q.text: Doesn't even need a review. Just go. Get the yellowtail sashimi with ponzu appetizer and thank me later. ;-)

yi4073pFJTL4BU33qT1Jzg.text: Excellent Japanese restaurant in upscale location. The food and service couldn't have been better. The views of the strip are phenomenal.

HlK5nI8SSPiM_NohSCTgFQ.text: If you're looking for sushi that has sushi without tons of obnoxious sauce and rice this is it. The menu is far reaching and exceptional!

0P0FgHSrjzEOlK0whvJ6Gw.text: The restaurant is kind of tucked away from the stores inside Caesar's but it's a hidden gem. The inside is presented very nicely. They have happy hour between 4-7pm and has a decent number of options for a good price considering the price of the original menu. They have a whole variety of liquor at their bar. It's perfect for a late lunch between touring all around Vegas. The sushi was really good and fresh. They aren't that much though but I did not complain because the side dishes/apps were pretty filling m.
