Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UNXCi65XBmON8st-XSG9ZQ.text: Yummy quality fish and unique flavors. Great view of the strip and great service. We started with the kale salad, but it was the only thing we didn't like. It was strangely salty. We were disappointed that they didn't offer a good deal on a combination plate of sushi or sashimi. We loved the baked lobster roll- it was super rich and indulgent. We also shared the gensai roll- which was fresh and crunchy. We had never tasted such a unique roll. It was okay enough to eat, but I don't think we would order it again. We also had the chicken fried rice, which was yummy. We would go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked lobster roll- so rich
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kale salad- too salty to finish

-fQvkvMA1Lie4Vm6rFmIfQ.text: Came here with some coworkers and friends and we decided to do the chef's tasting menu. It was quite pricey at around 100.00 per person but the quality of the food was SO WORTH IT. I've never cared for oysters. I've tried them several times but they have always tasted like ocean death snot. So I was pretty amazed when I discovered here oysters that I -not only- don't hate, but actually enjoy eating. Big win! But what really impressed me was that literally every dish they brought to our table was mouth-wateringly, succulently, mind-blowingly tasty... and amazingly FRESH. I'm not usually into sashimi but DAMN. Just wow. Even the lobster dish (we're from Maine so of course we have pretty high standards for lobster) was absolutely the bomb.com. We had a friend with a gluten allergy with us and they were extremely attentive and understanding, offering alternative dishes for every one that had gluten in it. They made him a fresh crab leg roll that didn't look like much, but he couldn't finish it so asked if anyone wanted it. I was stuffed but I wanted to try it. I was so blown away at the simply fantastic, sweet-savory flavor of the crab roll that I couldn't stop eating it. I ended up finishing it because apparently I have no off switch and let's face it, you only live once. Bonuses: the cocktails were on point, the atmosphere was comfortable, and our server actually spoke Japanese! Sushi Roku was not only the best sushi restaurant I've ever tried... I legitimately believe it was one of the best restaurants of any kind that I've ever tried! I'm starting a savings account so that next time I am in Vegas I can be sure to afford to eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I miss it already :(
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OMG NOMNOMNOM
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I loved the cocktail but I forgot what it was called... something to do with matcha

dGcQ0N_iZ4JyjAXxpQRepg.text: Amazing fresh fish and excellent service. Had a great dinner here last night. Started out with two nice cocktails the mojito and the lady had something fruity which I can't recall but it was purple and she enjoyed. On to the food sea bass skewers, yellowtail sashimi with chilies, lobster noodles, assortment of nigiri, and the chocolate lava cake which my lady also said was one of the best she ever had. Service was very good with the manager or owner even stopping by and checking up on us. Highly recommend this spot for dinner. Deliciousness!

gefmMMyTYid2HcmrWrFRVg.text: Came on a Monday night. Everything was insanely good! Our sever Tommy was super informative, attentive and friendly! Such an amazing experience. We will definitely be back!   Favorites:  Fluke kumquat  Hokkaido scallop Hamachi Serrano Toro carpaccio   The hostess could have been a little more welcoming but overall great experience.

DZ8-4OEAJEia42UR8aaIJA.text: Been here a couple times. Nice atmosphere for dining. The sushi hits the spot. And the service is great.   Our server was really a sweetheart (had tattoos). And even the portions were a little on the small side, our food was tasty and plentiful.   Save room for dessert because the donut hole things with chocolate in the middle are some of the best things ever made!  I would recommend this place (obv)

lcdt2PUGwU86tLSs5zK1HQ.text: Interesting story. I first heard about Sushi Roku because I knew one of their employees from previous restaurants. But I hadn't seen her in person in 5-6 years. So last Friday, I decided to surprise her. Guess what? I had a really great time. I ordered the Wagyu Beef skewer, Gensai roll, Crunchy Spicy Tuna roll, and finally, the Banana Flambe dessert. Wow, everything was "oishii". I wanted to savor each bite as long as I could. "Gochiso-sama deshita!" It was fun chatting with my friend again, the other servers were very respectful too, and on top of that, she gave me the 20% discount for Las Vegas locals, which I didn't know about. Nice! I may need to return for that discount, haha. Thank you, Pam!

h6FO3yttxaPeEGaJWueiHA.text: Sushi Roku was excellent. I spent some time looking for a good sushi place on the strip and surprisingly, it was harder than I thought.  I saw Sushi Roku was in Caesar's Palace Forum shops (2nd Floor in the top left corner) and it had great ratings, plus it wasn't extremely expensive like all the others within walking distance. It was not crowded and was very trendy inside. We started with calamari, edamame and dirty martinis.  The calamari was so good.  It was lightly fried and the tempura was somewhat sweet. It had a light jalapeno glaze on it which was not hot at all but had just the right amount of flavor. Additionally, their dirty martinis were fantastic.....it's very hard to find a good one.  I will note, they are expensive, but worth it.  For dinner we had the White Lotus Roll and crab fried rice. The rice was delicious and had a very fair amount of crab in it. The White Lotus Roll was light with popcorn shrimp, avocado with tuna and crispy onions.  For desert we had the Cinnamon Sugar Doughnut Holes (HIGHLY RECOMMEND).  We will be back. You can also make reservations on their website or open table :)

14j5XIoWIFaDnXzpg0Lp_g.text: This restaurant is inside the shopping center attached to Caesars Palace. Great atmosphere, romantic if you are on a date, quiet, clean. Our meal is ok. We had the spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, California and the lobster rolls.  The lobster roll was amazing. The best roll hands down that we chose. My second favorite was the spicy tuna followed by the California roll.  The waitress didn't seem to have it together that evening. My sister ordered the soup which she said wasn't that good. It was my friends birthday and they graciously comped our bill for the cake (chocolate) that we ordered. It was really good.

UBIU0DNUlZraXsIQU8CYzA.text: Freshest sushi in a desert. Made me welcome from the moment I entered to the very last second. Sushi were incredible. All suggestions by sushi shelf were welcomed and well executed. Definitely coming back every time I am close to Vegas!

2ADwBjE5prxzFNFnJjTJ4w.text: I don't like sushi. I don't like seafood. I went here with a group because I had to. The steak and chicken were AMAZING. This review is only for people who are in my same situation and aren't sure if they want to go here. Do it.

WBarB-4AvH9B8Hp3q-FQ5Q.text: We were looking for good Sushi in the strip. Tried this restaurant based on reviews. We weren't diss appointed. Good fresh fish and friendly service. We ate at the sushi bar and our sushi Chef was awesome. If your looking for awesome fresh sushi this place will not let you down. By the way I recommend the grilled sea bass skewer. Melt in your mouth

P3pVFOTINb4tlQ3fxc0sGA.text: Best sushi Happy Hour! The lychee mojito mas so refreshing and delicious. I will definitely be coming back!

CiWzv5gW0DaJivG-6NgYcA.text: I have been here many times and it never disappoints. The food is incredible no matter what you chose and the staff is friendly and service is great. I'm a foodie and a sushi/Asian aficionado and this ranks pretty high.  I recommend it highly. Check out my photos and see why I have high marks. Not only did it look good it tasted great.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso Tempura Shrimp delicious
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi Collar was delicious
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The place to be anytime but great happy hour spot

y4BNDBWvQwSJJ22fw_bRMg.text: Wonderful experience, really cool vibe. My 14 year old son loved the atmosphere. He said it looked like we could have been on the set of guardians of the galaxy. Food was amazing and we certainly spent a lot less than if we'd gone to Nobu. Service was great. Our server kept calling my son "Boss" and it made him feel so cool.

8BiNXOcK0zOgky0jWpuQKw.text: Top notch sushi + Japanese style steakhouse.  let's talk about the sushi first - sushi is all about the rice, it literally means prepared rice.  I say sushi executed at the highest level is 70%rice 30%fish.  The rice at the bar is prepped meticulously;  perfectly al dente, exact same temperature as the fish, just enough moisture and wasabi paste to stick onto fish.  The fish is aged PERFECTLY, breaking clean at the teeth and giving enough funk to remind you what you are masticating afterall.  The steak, oh the steak - absolute, beautiful piece of prime rib eye charred to a perfect medium rare,  served with roasted garlic butter with a side of blanched green beens.  Heaven my friends, absolute heaven.  Great place to grab dinner after some shopping.  It's top notch sushi and steak for about $25 per person.  Worth every penny.  5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent rib eye

qVAsccmiI0X2QPH52adgng.text: Came in for a quick lunch while I was in town and I was lucky to get the Executive Chef at the sushi bar. I started with the spicy miso which was excellent. Perfectly prepared miso with a touch of spiciness made it an innovative take on a staple.  I then had the toro carpaccio which was rich and unctuous. The toro was ultra-fresh and minimally topped so the flavor of the fish stood out.  For my entree I went with the Matsu special which was 8 pieces of nigiri each with it's own special toppings and/or sauces. I particularly liked the toro and salmon offerings which were dressed with ingredients that completely enhanced the flavor of the sushi.   Service was great and while it is indeed pricey you are having your meal prepared by a classically trained sushi chef who puts care into each preparation.

rKCIMdLRwtvDjJpBc8FhGw.text: I had a great experience with Jenna and Carlos as my bartenders. So personable, fun, and didn't miss a beat. They were 100% awesome. I would make sure they stayed on my team at whatever cost! The food was great, loved the happy hour deals. I will return here every time I come to Vegas as long as Jenna and/or Carlos are working. Congrats on having a great team!!

A1xcwiA31I6utOPVj78l3g.text: Excellent service, great view, chic decor, and perfect chilly soundtrack.  The toro was rich and fatty, incredibly decadent, and meltingly delicious. Roll were nice, if a bit standard. Seaweed salad was cool and refreshing, and piled high, more than enough for two to share. Mochi ice cream was the perfect topper.

-vYdYLI5LUjrFMp-Z4vxnA.text: Of course everyone comes here because of their great ratings, but from my experience this place deserves 3 stars!  Ambience: This is probably what gets this place such great ratings. No lie it's really nice and high up with great views. The lighting is dim, creating a nice romantic evening vibe! Everything is nicely decorated too. Ps. I hope you guys find this place easily if you're still planning on coming after this review because it took me 30 mins haha it's in the mall!!!! 3rd floor!  Food: the food is really really bland and mediocre unless you came with the notion that you are going to spend 300$. I got two sushi rolls (shrimp tempura and spicy tuna) and they were both not appealing at all. If this place had Mikuni quality sushi I would have been okay with paying such high prices, but literally the food was so plain and definitely not worth what we paid.   Drinks: We got a sake bottle that was like flavored sweet sake which was good, it was 40$ and is around 8 shots worth of sake  Service: the service wasn't bad, our lady frequented our table around 3-4 times total when we were there! The weird part is that they already add the tip to your bill, and she added 21%. I usually understand when there's 8+ people that they do that but there was only 4 of us! A little strange...   Also heads up for if you are planning on coming during a special holiday; because on New Years to cancel your reservation they charge 50$ a person

Z5wf6xTOG62TZ9P0PZLOqg.text: While shopping in the Forum we happened to go up to the 3rd floor and found Sushi Roku.  Both times I have been here has been in between lunch and dinner, so it has been quiet and practically have the place to ourselves.  Service has always been fast, friendly and thorough.  Everything I have had here has been amazing.  One of my favorite things is their kimchee cucumber appetizer.  This is the best "pickle" I have ever had. This is so delicious and it takes them 4 days to make it and it is worth it!!!  Two other of my favs are the Unagi and the Korean Pork Belly Fried Rice.  Unagi is cooked perfectly and is so delicate it melts in your mouth.  The Pork Belly Fried Rice is not only a beautiful dish to look at, but it tastes amazing.  There is a good sized portion of pork belly and the poached egg is really the cherry on the top.  For you Saki drinkers, they have an extensive list to choose from.  This has become a must visit restaurant every time I'm in Vegas.  Definitely worth finding the elusive 3rd floor in the Forum Shopping Mall

i6Orf5guptc71q1CE_4r-g.text: I came here again this past weekend for Valentine's Day and had to write an update because our waitress Erin was just so great. And also, they DO still offer a 20% local discount! Just not on holidays. I did not like the R'eye cocktail, but Erin switched it for me to a Salary Man which is the same one I had last time. I still LOVE their crispy rice with spicy tuna (it's called something else there) and their baked crab hand roll. We ordered the Katana Roll, Tuna Jalapeno Roll, and Baked Lobster Roll and all were delicious, our favorite was the Tuna Jalapeno. We didn't have dessert but next time I want to try the cinnamon donuts, Erin said they are awesome. Can't wait to come back for another date night and use our local discount!

wjhoqruwW20wgI1fzDtZOA.text: I gave them a try on July 4th because I actually had a holiday off for once(Whooo!) but I dislike all things barbecue related. So on this American holiday, I decided to go Japanese..and was glad i did!  The place is somewhat hard to find in the forum shops of Caesars Palace, being on the third floor of a mall that is built to confuse tourists and make them spend more money on high end items that they think they need. Anyway, once it's found, it will be easier to make your way back on the next visit.   I heard happy hour is amazing, unfortunately I didn't make it in time. But the view of the Las Vegas strip, away from the bar helped ease the pain of missing out on cheap drinks. I still ordered a cocktail but it was a bit overpriced for the size-good nonetheless, just small.   My group ordered the baked lobster rolls, eel avocado rolls, popcorn shrimp rolls and shrimp tempura rolls  I couldn't complain at all on any of the rolls. Very flavorful and plated beautifully.  The lobster rolls were very different..but good! Definitely worth trying.   Service was also excellent and my waitress was very helpful with explaining things on the menu. Also, before I was seated, the manager was standing near the front and struck up a conversation with myself and the person i was with. He was surprised to find out we were Vegas locals and let me know that "locals are always treated well." We most certainly were treated well and I will always come back to a place that loves locals! Hopefully next time for happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good drinks! Expensive but good
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E6xMeChOaed4ytxum8g41A.text: Dinner food was excellent! Restaurant week 3 course dinner did not disappoint!  We were seated right away at one of the window tables and got a stunning view of the strip. The restaurant decor was tasteful, elegant, zen, modern, but still inviting. There was 2 choices for 1st course and 2nd course on the restaurant week menu, so we decided to order both and share. Each appetizer came with 3 different items, so we got a total of 6, and every one of them was amazing! We then shared the surf and turf, and the chef's sushi selection. I would have to say that the sushi here is the best I've had in town. It's better than Nobu, better than Blue Ribbon, better than Samba, and better than Raku. Then to complete our meal, the trio mousse just completely satisfied my palette, beautifully presented, and tasted just as beautiful.  Our service was a bit lacking, my tea was filled here and there, but not constantly. Other than that, it was a great experience, and I would definitely be returning to try some of the other

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio mousse
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi selection

rwKoW21n42IzVQVwHraM5g.text: I had a work dinner here and it was fantastic. The brussel sprouts chips, yellowtail sashimi, avocado hakani and rolls were really quite tasty. The cocktails were original and yummy. Would definitely go back. Our server was also super sweet.

arBYUZ3NicTdf4U6tNWhSQ.text: I went there for happy hour today at 5:58 and the hostesses say that it ended. How is that possible when it says that happy hour is until 7? It's a good thing I asked but that's a little sketchy when their website and yelp says that happy hour is 4-7 Sunday thru Thursday.

IlLTwsLuiq23K6U0h8J9pQ.text: We were looking for a sushi place with a good happy hour, and SO happy we stopped here. Probably one of the best happy hours I've seen, and the food is absolutely amazing. We ordered a spicy tuna roll, blistered shishitos, calimari, and tempura mushrooms. Every plate had its own incredibly unique flavor that blew us away. Definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to get great flavor on a budget!

aOcwADRmFHNvAZ5LEqzhdQ.text: Great food and friendly service. The shishito peppers, tofu, and crab and uni tartare were really good. The Titan roll was just ok but all nigiri were really good. I'm glad my friend got the local discount because it was a very expensive dinner! That said, the sushi was excellent.  I was a bit apprehensive because the pictures on yelp didn't look that appealing but I'm happy I came here.

Ly8buCn6C_EmLI24tCWKgQ.text: What a great dining experience before making our way to Elton John (it is a quick 5 Minute walk to the theater - ask them for the "short cut").  First off kudos to our server as well as GM Johnny who was personable and gave us local love.  Room is awesome - very cool with tall glass windows with view onto the strip.  Every item order was on point.  We were big fans of the jalapeno tuna roll and wagyu dumplings.  Look forward to returning soon!

4Z8opPZhl9FPcZdv28RgvQ.text: I have been to Sushi Roku twice and had an ok experience each time. I sat in the front area on one of my trips, which felt like I was paying high prices to eat sushi in a mall (because basically, that's what I was doing). If possible, asked to be seated in the back area. The setting is dark and romantic, and the windows showcase a spectacular view of the city. On a scale from 1-5, I would rate the sushi here a 3.5. Fairly middle of the road with a few nice surprises. I eat mostly raw rolls, and their menu has a lot of cooked rolls on it, which they were willing to modify for me, but the menu selection was quite small. If you are debating between Nobu and Suski Roku for sushi, let this place be the winner. Overall, not a bad place to visit, but if I come back to Vegas, I will likely check out a new place for sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rAWgqE5uXUmFOrzh_pt77Q.text: Let me be clear that we may have gone on the wrong day as it was Valentine's Day. The place was noisy, very crowded & the tables near each other. The food is great but we felt rushed perhaps because they wanted to turn the tables. The lady who waited on us was knowledgeable and elegant. It's a bit pricey to not be able to relax but then again it was Valentine's Day.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yhoJJE-4mUZq18O46J3_fQ.text: My boyfriend and I went for dinner before a show on Sunday night. It was not busy at all. When we arrived we first sat at the bar to wait for a table. We ordered some saki and a couple apps to start. The happy hour was great! We finally got a table and decided to do the chefs tasting.  The waitress told us it was a good portion and we would be fine each getting one.  Mind you it's $120 each.  When the food started coming out, the portions were insanely large which would have been great if we hadn't already purchased apps.  We ended up stopping at course 5 bc it was just too much and we were very annoyed that the waitress didn't just tell us and instead was just trying to up her sales and we didn't even get to enjoy it.  We don't mind spending the money but the waitress was very dishonest, we won't be going back.

Su-xZ8OP-uDhz1vvCtT-Lg.text: Best Sushi restaurant in Vegas! I've been to them all and Sushi Roku can't be beat. A must get is the cauliflower app and the Senshi Roll! Very friendly staff.

R6ThX2_htysFV7dwMBcNpA.text: Great sushi. Everything was really fresh and came out very fast. Service was excellent. Definitely recommend the Hanabi, Yellowtail Diced Chile's and the Katana roll.

OA23joBF5r2K8eMB-q0vnw.text: Love me some Sushi Roku in all locations (there's a few of them).  This review is about Las Vegas.  Food is always delicious. Pretty much same menu across locations. The menu is unique (gourmet?) and a bit limited. They do not create substitutes. (in other words, if it ain't on the menu, you can't have it)   Definitely make a reservation for this one because it's hard to get into to after 6pm.  And ask for a strip view (table by the window) if you're on a date. ;)   The staff is always on the ball and pretty quick - even with a large group.  Like it's sister restaurants, the seating is somewhat 'tight' (if you're a big dude or gal, caution the seating set-up: not just distance between tables, but also distance from your lap to table top in some areas)    As far as location - it's on the end of the Forum Shops inside Cesar's (strip side) Take the windy escalator all the way to the top.   When i stay on that end of the strip, i like the convenience of walking to Caesars and slipping in the side door. (I call it the "sneaky door" -- right after (or before) Mirage.) Thus avoiding the casino completely and that loooonnnnggg walk through the length of the Forum shops.  We are repeat offenders when we're in Vegas. We often bring guests or business associates (when there for convention) because we know we can rely on the food quality, atmosphere and  service every time.

TMYa2HMUYOL1u8QiRzEOow.text: We ate at Sushi Roku at an off-time around 2 pm, and the restaurant was not very crowded.  Much of the seating in Sushi Roku offers excellent Strip views which is a definite plus.  We were originally going to be sat at a booth/table close to another couple, but asked to be sat at a separate table for a bit more privacy.  The hostess got very huffy and irritated when we made this request, so our dining experience did not begin well.    The server was efficient, but not overly-friendly.  We ordered edamame, miso soup, and several sushi rolls (Katana, spicy tuna, California, and toro & jalapeno).  The food was good, but overpriced, and the quality/taste wasn't heads and tails above more economical sushi restaurants.  Of course, you're on the Strip, not to mention paying for a Strip view, so the high price is to be expected.  All in all, if you're looking for a sushi restaurant with a Strip view, Sushi Roku is not a bad bet.  For me, however, there are several other "Strip view" restaurants that I prefer over Sushi Roku, so I can't say I'll be eating here often.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Edamame
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California, Toro and Jalapeño, and Spicy Tuna Rolls
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katana Signature Roll

8GD31HdI5QUoc3hjIR-EcA.text: Great food and fantastic ambiance!  What a pleasure it is to see the General Manager walking around greeting every table and ensuring the guests were happy.  He made great suggestions to our dishes and even made us laugh.  I haven't seen this type of service from the top down in decades from an establishment especially in Vegas! Definitely a place to visit!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TNfZKklOl7aYrWuwCL6ZDA.text: Made a reservation here on my most recent Vegas stay.  Place was highly recommended by a frequent Vegas visitor friend so made it a priority to come here.  We were seated at a table that had great view of the strip; more amazing when lists lit up at night.    Started with some miso soup and seaweed salad along with sake; all were perfect.  Ordered the yellowtail diced chilies - unique dish with a great kick that complimented the yellowtail.   Next we moved onto the Katana and Tuna Japaleno; two dishes that went down so well.  To finish off, we went off the menu and ordered the gold truffle yellowtail.  This may be the best kept secret in Vegas - inside the yellowtail is some foie gras tucked in.  The sushi was heaven on earth; one of the best I've ever had.  Overall this is one of best sushi restaurants, period.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gold truffle yellowtail.  Sushi gods gift to mankind.

_29e3Oatz5EIdQTr9RwxBQ.text: It took awhile to find the place, but had I read the directions on the website first, that could have been avoided! At first glance the restaurant seemed very dead.  All of the seats in the front were empty, but as soon as the hostess took us to our reserved seat around the corner, we saw a whole other part of the restaurant where all of the tables were full.  Great service by the wait staff, excellent sushi and non sushi items.  The truffle sushi roll was AMAZING!  The restaurant has a great view of the strip and was exactly what I wanted for my birthday dinner in Vegas.  The waiter brought out a dessert and a candle/sparkler to help my group celebrate my birthday.  The prices not out of control either.

Nsb5NDzd1GMIY3VStPiy6A.text: Do not under any circumstances try and get to this place by going through Caesers....you will go hungry :-(   We made that mistake and 40 minutes later, on foot, we finally found it.     At this point, it was worth it because we were frustrated, needed a drink and were super hungry after the unexpected workout.   That being said, they must get that often because they held our reservation or they just weren't that busy.   I'm guessing it's the latter.  In it's hey day, it was probably the talk of the town and it's still a nice restaurant with just a touch of over ambiance but they do offer gorgeous views of the strip.    The food was great  and priced really well if you need a sushi fix.   Our waitress was super nice and on top of the service.   We let her know that we were short on time and had to make a show.   She was attentive but not pushy and made sure we got our food timely.   Ask for recommendations on food because there are a number of special rolls that are available and not on the menu.   The Lotus roll in particular was very good.  There is seating by the windows and booths along the wall.   Ask for the booth because it is more comfortable and also a raised section, that's where the best view of the strip can be found.

sSbjsaJRF5U-3XB75dJ7Pg.text: I can't say it enough. I love Sushi Roku. We came back this past Friday for my girlfriend's 30th. Everyone LOVED it. The food was delicious. The service was prompt. The drinks were tasty (I couldn't resist ordering the Lychee Martini again). The ambiance was incredible. We were an hour early for our reservation and they still sat us with no issue!  Pricing is very reasonable (for dining on the Strip) and the staff was super friendly.  We had the Baked Crab Handroll (yummy), Albacore Tuna sushi (the fish melted in your mouth and the rice didn't fall apart), and the Rock Shrimp Tempura with Jalapeno roll. DIVINE. Everyone scarfed their meal down.  I can't wait to go back again.

zLpqIkwbFr1ETS2mA9W-hQ.text: This was my first visit to Sushi Roku. It was a nice setting and the decor is very pleasant. The service was just okay, nothing special. The food was good. We had a premium priced edamame beans that were pretty much the same as I have had everywhere including the frozen food section of my local store. The Ikura, Uni were both good, but again not over the top. The soft-shelled crab was very nice. We also had a couple of rolls that again were good, but not memorable. All in all it was a good dinner. Had a chance to catch-up with friends. The noise level was good so having a conversation was easy.

_a1K7O6Pbgiq52RggStfVg.text: I did not expect to find good sushi out in the desert. This place was a very pleasant surprise. We were seated at a square table with comfortable leather bench seats for all. The big windows gave us a great view of the strip.  Props to our waiter for pushing the yellowtail diced chilies hard. In addition to the great service he provided, his recommendation was maybe the best thing we ate.   We ordered several rolls, most of them some variation on spicy tuna. We also ordered the crab roll. With the exception of the tuna jalapeno roll, all of them were great. Nothing mind blowing creatively, just quality ingredients and great execution. The jalapeno in the tuna jalapeno roll was just too spicy and washed out all of the other flavors. Just remove the jalapeno and you have a fine tuna roll. In addition to the rolls we ordered the short rib fried rice which was also delicious.  For dessert we had the donut holes and the green tea tiramisu. The tiramisu was a little light on flavor and I wasn't a big fan of the donuts but at this point I was completely full so I wasn't in the best position to judge.  The bill also wasn't as much as I'd expected to be. Good times.

SQ3Um0f3qlcPULV9pskgAg.text: I went to Sushi Roku with my colleagues. This restaurant is located in Caesars Palace Hotel. The food itself is OK. I liked some kind of sushi rolls.From this restaurant, we could see nice strip view(south direction).

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi Rolls(MAKOTO)
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi Rolls

e2f6Yb-JVK654VCI9j9bDg.text: Absolutely one of the best sushi restaurants that I've experienced in Las Vegas. Great location, amazing sushi, and great prices.

3AsUanU02lMS0BYx4od7og.text: I really wanted to have great sushi in Vegas and I found it in Sushi Roku. The view at night is awesome. Service was great. Ambiance was on point. You must try the Kobe gyoza, unagi, and the green tea ice cream dessert. I haven't really tried a lot of sakes but the server hit the nail with his recommendation of the Sawanoi "junmai ginjo" sake.   When I go back to Vegas I will definitely go again.

YXT-NSVKFdH6QFWvxQ_a7A.text: It was a nice surprise when we found out that they have lunch special! Bento box with teriyaki salmon and 4 pieces of sashimi priced at $19, super delicious! My friend ordered unagi donburi and it was to die for, sweet and melt in your mouth eel! Service was excellent! I recommend to go during lunch time if you come to town with kids, it was nice, quite and still great food and service!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Bento box with teriyaki salmon and sashimi

1huC_vbqwbINTACLuboPQg.text: I always hit up my favorite sushi joint when I'm in Vegas.  The fish is so fresh and yummy

RhOOoME77gbYV3ZVXfqAkg.text: Great sushi, great atmosphere, great service and innovative cocktails.  I really enjoyed this place.  The room has hanging wook panels throughout and is reminiscent of a jungle somewhere far away.  Even the bathrooms are beautiful.    The sushi is perfect and service was attentive.  I enjoyed my sake cocktail and my friend enjoyed her lycee mojito.  There is a great view of the Strip.  The restaurant closed at 11, but it was a Sunday night.  This might be a 5-star restaurant, but we arrived at closing time and there was a medical incident in the dining room just prior to our arrival.

7LfdsV5IuP0wRZcsXkNj2Q.text: Went here for dinner....the view is just gorrrgeous, but the food was just "okay" for the prices.  I had the dragon roll and it was somewhat bland, but it wasn't horrible. Service was fine, except our short changed us and got her math messed up....lady, can you just use a normal calculator and not your iphone to calculate our change, then maybe you'll get it right and not confuse our whole group??? what about that?  Other than that incident, it's a nice restaurant with a good vibe and of course great view!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. with the pretty view
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0B5HoCuE-YdrTMVxTi6VxA.text: I had the truffle edamame and they were delish. The truffle tempura roll wasn't as truffley as I'd like. The salmon truffle carpaccio was good but not very truffley either. And the lobster roll was really meaty!

Je65WUtxO8EgM9vgufvcHA.text: Excellent sushi here. All chef at the bar are Japanese too.  They have traditional Sushi and also creative menus upon request.  I recommend you to sit at counter. Very nice chefs can explain you about where the fish comes from, etc.   The atmosphere at other tables are more like upscale bar lounge and totally different feeling from the counter.  It is pricy but it worth to try in this town.

3h3SD1c0YThqEsDcBfdFSw.text: Ordered the freshest fish from the sushi chef and it was amazing! Absolutely delicious. I suggest everyone order sushi that way, so you'll know you're getting the best. Can't wait to come back.

inkPVGhssQFKDR5eVMfwdg.text: I can't go to Vegas without hitting up Sushi Roku...I love everything about it, from the service to the drinks (my favorite is the Tokyo Cooler, although the Pineapple Upside Down Cake martini is a close second) and the view and the food (hanabi, I dream about you!).    On my most recent visit, my husband and I went for happy hour on a Monday afternoon.  Happy hour is only available at the bar, but it is an amazing deal!  We had a spicy tuna roll and the rock shrimp and jalapeno roll.  Roku has the best spicy tuna of any sushi place I have ever visited.  We also had the popcorn shrimp - ask for a side of spicy mayo to make this even more delicious - and the miso eggplantt.  They even have dessert on their HH menu and how can you go wrong with a mini chocolate volcano cake?

IGHaF4ivB9PTaBoGQVZAww.text: We've got great sushi in the Bay Area and I was skeptical add there's not an ocean for hundreds of miles from Sushi Roku. But my cousin from North Cackalaki wanted sushi so wet went. It was UN. BE. The waitress recommended a few house specials which were unique and creative. Then we got some standard rolls and they blew my mind. My only complaint is that eating at Sushi Roku in Vegas has ruined sushi in the Bay Area for me.

bP2rXqaPQ9PlNL-F9SI_bg.text: Ok, I was wandering around Caesars Palace for snips and giggles and found myself on the top floor at Sushi Roku (which they have one out here in LA) and this place, though pricy, was what I expect from a great sushi restaurant. Friendly and quick service, happy customers (even sat next to some guests from Toyko, they were very nice) and the chef was top notch, he even gave me something on the house. I think business was slow so he was just warming up his knives.   I shared a meal with myself and was very happy I did. When you're here for a month you try a little bit of every cuisine so expect more from me the whole month of April.   But if you happen to come across this place it may be fancy, it may be pricey, but it's worth the extra 2 bucks on the rolls for the service and quality.   Enjoy!

yJSeoq7Xj4pSP-sm_axGjQ.text: I needed a little snack to tide me over until an evening event at Caesar's Palace, so I stopped in for a quick graze at the sushi bar.  I ordered a couple pieces of tuna and salmon sushi, as well as a spicy tuna hand roll, which I use as a measure of any sushi restaurant I visit.  Both were excellent, but the hand roll was a real surprise.  Many times I have had a hand roll that was acceptable, but this restaurant went the extra step to crisp the nori before wrapping the spicy tuna.  The result is an extraordinary crunch of the seaweed before biting into the perfectly seasoned tuna.    Excellent atmosphere and great staff coupled with the food made me want to bail on my appointment and stay for a major feed.  Next year I plan to do just that!

UuNpJ1-vol4Yp7zGWP3P6A.text: I have lived here for nine years and this is by far the absolute worst sushi restaurant I have ever eaten at!  Hamachi was 'fishy' and had to be sent back.  GM offered to replace the returned dish with another one and ended up charging us for both.  After we received the bill he was nowhere to be found.  Everything else was just mediocre and way overpriced!  Chilean Sea Bass was cut wrong and very tough.    Very disappointing and will never go back nor will I ever recommend Sushi Roku to anyone!

ajm8cTKBZuug9hWx0tSZhQ.text: Absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas.  I come here not for "Authentic" Japanese food, but for fresh seafood and great drinks served in a very fun environment.  I usually go for several assorted sashimi/appetizer dishes, followed by a couple hot entrees.  The lobster tempura is excellent, as is the hirame sashimi, prepared with citrus and jalepeno.  Service is just as good as the food, as the waitstaff is very attentive yet not overbearing.

mrh4L3uC66yxRVDaZUhNng.text: Tasty, unique rolls. My fav sushi in vegas so far.  love the location- in the forum shops... overlooking the strip.  Fresh fish and they do something different than K-RAB!!! thank goodness!

HWZk1mt1FK-JYJr73ovcbg.text: Met my BFF for lunch during the week. We were practically the only ones there at the time, which is great. Sat by the window and had a view of the strip. I was starving so I just ordered a bunch of things. I LOVE the spicy tuna on crispy rice. In fact, we ordered a second serving. Sushi was fresh and excellent. Albacore in particular.   Now remember we were pretty much the only people in the restaurant. So I have to say that the service was not the best. It wasn't horrible, but it was a bit slow and our server was MIA most of the meal. In fact, one of the items never came, but she didn't even notice. I brought it to her attention and said that we were full and to go ahead and cancel it. Her response was "okay". I'm not sure if she took it off the bill, I didn't check which is a very bad habit that I have. I will give them the benefit of a doubt and will say it was an off day. Other than that, I will go again. I would have given it 5 stars.   Great food and great view.

lIpa3EeacJHKundvWqRDng.text: This is a great way to start a night in Vegas. Sushi Roku was amazing and such a great place to begin our night. The sushi and drinks were delicious! The staff very helpful and nice and the ambiance great! I highly recommend going here.

iYoGxb_Ja4f7p7YLvta2lg.text: Rolls were okay.  Hamachi okay.  Seabass was overcooked for my taste. but okay.  should've went to nobu...

4WZPSFQla76LOg3tWn703g.text: For our last night in Vegas, we were looking to do a show and a fancier dinner. And a show and a fancier dinner we did! Our first choice for dinner was booked out a month, so we fell back on our trusty old friend, sushi. This restaurant did not disappoint. My boyfriend made a reservation (just to be safe). We get there and we are promptly seated in the back room; the windows behind our table looked out over the strip. Everything was prompt - the service and the time frame in between ordering our drinks and food and those getting to the table. Not to mention the service was so friendly - for some reason, they speak in rather quiet tones, which normally would frustrate me (I'm mostly deaf) but for some reason, it contributed more to the already soothing atmosphere. It was very intimate and peaceful. My boyfriend got some sashimi, soup, and rolls (forget what, exactly) while I got a little bowl of rice and rolls. The food was great! Normally, I'd go into much more detail, but I'll just leave it at that and let you find out how good it is. Dessert (mochi) was also good, three flavors of your choosing and one piece (which is then halved) of each flavor. I appreciated this, so I could indulge my sweet tooth but not feel overwhelmed/too full from it. Overall, this is a romantic and peaceful restaurant, equally good for couples as well as groups. We went early (6 PM) so this probably helped out with the peacefulness a lot, but nonetheless, I highly recommend it.

KVAM7aVdkEta81LCZZScRQ.text: Service was awesome. My husband and I ate there on 10/17/2010 for dinner and it wasn't too busy.  We were seated right away, and our server was extremely attentive. She even suggested some sushi that wasn't on the menu and she had good suggestions.  The sushi was decent but extremely pricey. You're on the Vegas strip. You have to expect it.  Seaweed Salad = yum Crab Dynamite = yum Shima Roll = yum Red Sun Roll = yum premium sashimi special = alright  If you get the Crab Dynamite, order it first. It takes some time to prepare.

g81nsXA5Qm8EkAJROnV9pA.text: This one's in Ceasar's Palace and our table had a nice view of the Strip.  We were also lucky enough to be sandwiched in between 2 big rowdy bachelor parties!  Sake bombs!!  Loved the scallops!  And the salmon.  We're roll peeps so we ordered a grip of them.  All were great, can't go wrong.

URUjnxrPWMG6GC4XBC8cWg.text: Service and food was very good.  We had three rolls and all were very tasty.  We recommend this restaurant.

CZqweH-ANNAGOrVlqTGknQ.text: Had my bday dinner here. I had a spicy tuna octopus roll which was SO good. I love octopus. Also, for dessert they gave me chocolate souffle with a sparkler on top. Love it

cUeFjMT6nvrGxZO5iX0pFQ.text: I would expect so much more from a fancy sushi place in Vegas.  The food was very mediocre, and the drinks were okay.  I would not suggest this place to friends.  If anything, go there for the view of the strip.. although you could go to many other places and get the same.  This is a pass for me.

1pC1yzHuC-u2M960fE_kDg.text: The food and device was absolutely phenomenal! And Joy the bartender was top notch! She was amazing. We will definitely be back!!

G_JHHpJQ8KdIxULNWU5Pig.text: I heard they were very good at catering to food allergens, but we had a pretty poor experience.  Their gluten free menu was really limited compared to their normal menu.  I have a soy intolerance, and they brought me crab in a soy wrapper.  We didn't figure this out until I was a couple of bites in.  Then they didn't discount my meal.  The waiter took forever even though the place was pretty empty.  Lame all around.

nrmFb9fLkFQz7PFLvzSSGQ.text: I come here every time I go to Vegas, normally more then once in my trip. The sushi is amazing along with the staff.

SY9ol4LBgOK5w59bVQzphw.text: WOW! Have you ever tried Popcorn Shrimp?? one of the tastiest things I've ever eaten!! EVER!!! The beef teriaki was succulent, rich, juicy,rare...sublime basically! Eat the sushi here and you'll never be able to get cheap rubbish sushi ever again!

8Zvk-lE1CZhZMxcA54opDQ.text: Ehh...the sushi ain't soo good! The servers were not soo nice, the ambiance is great, but the server-no not soo great! You problably could get better sushi somewhere else, we tried this place because we were staying at Caesers! I won't be returning!

tlIsOM2OiaO0AiEgAzibkw.text: I haven't been to the locations back home but I was pleased with my Sunday afternoon lunch here.  Nice decor, including the restrooms.  I had a $17 lunch combination (teriyaki chicken and tempura) which comes with rice and miso soup.  The tempura was tasty.  For you chocoholics, the volcano cake is to die for.  It's really yummy with the vanilla bean ice cream and strawberries.

0-mKGfWsKKQW05icGOkKww.text: Cool decor. good sushi.. colorful bento boxes. i loved their mushed spicy tuna over rice.. apparently only they have that dish bc i havent been able to find it elsewhere. and when other places try to make it, it doesnt taste the same.

LHJm24MlNdyQlmNc1C9Qqg.text: I gave an extra star, or a second star for the decor. Very nice place and view. Otherwise, the food is so bad and skimpy that one star is too much. I don't mind small and tasty portions, but these were embarrassingly skimpy and notg so good. Udon soup came with tempura on a side, as we requested. Tempura consisted of one shrimp split in quarters and you only get two skimpy quarters of that one shrimp. Nada mas.  My sushi box should have had four slices of sashimi, but what they did, they took one piece of tuna and split it in four pieces. So the four slices are paper thin and see through! It also came with beef, which was overcooked and not good.  I was still hungry and went ahead and ordered a sushi roll. It was decent size but not great tasting.  They should be ashamed of serving such food for such price. But even if it was cheap, which it wasn't, they should be ashamed, you don't serve two quarters of a shrimp as your tempura.

H3xOz9MCmHOAfX1CRFJFYg.text: I made reservations on Opentable a month or more in advance and we still got a table basically in the mall.  We watched other people that had put their name on the list and waited get seated by the window and the view. Strike 1.  Service SUCKED.  The waitress actually didnt talk.  She would walk up to the table and look at us and wait for us to talk.. She would walk by and we would say excuse me and she would clearly hear us and keep walking.  She never checked on us once during the meal and believe me her tip showed how unhappy we were. Strike 2.  We ordered a sampling of items.. we had The shrimp dim sum, which was the best item we ordered.  Does anyone else think thats funny?  The best item was a chinese dish.. haha  We ordered chicken yakitori which was pretty good but kind of overly yuzu'd up.   Way too overpowering on some bites.  We ordered a scallop dynamite which was ok, again overpowered by a flavor, which this time was the bonita flakes on top.  And halfway through eating it you could see oil puddling at the bottom of the dish, signaling we should be done and we were.  Last and least we ordered the Spicy Tuna crunchy roll (or something to that effect)  It was undercooked on the tempura outside, yet somehow overcooked on the Tuna inside.  Once this got a little cold it was disgusting... Strike 3.  Price is outrageous really for the quality of food and quality of service.  It showed us that they really dont care if or when we come back and we wont. Strike OUT.

Gh865Ez_mk5k-WWSFQAjAQ.text: Nice view friendly staff okay food

vuYkQuLRg4Jifp5urOYnmg.text: We had miso soup, crab dynamite roll and the sushi mix with spicy tuna roll.  The spicy tuna roll tasted very fresh.  Miso soup was also excellent!  In comparison, the food prices seemed very reasonable.

gcpk5EMPKrwq0Z5MAzhu3g.text: Loved it.  Donald at the bar was awesome!!  Food was great.  Went for happy hour.  Great deal!  Great ambiance.

LQQ5TYpd5XNg4Y-tualgbw.text: Let me just cut to the chase... I wasn't impressed...  The restaurant is beautiful, but oh so noisy!  It's like trying to eat on the center divider of the 405 during rush hour.  The food was very hit or miss.. The Lychee martini was nasty, but the Lychee mojito was very good.  The shrimp dim sum appetizer was very good, but the sushi was very mediocre.  It made Todai seem delicious.  Service was VERY substandard.  Everything we ordered came out in the first 15-20 minutes instead of being properly paced throughout the evening.. and then we waited forever to find someone to bring the check.  And for the prices (almost $100 per person with tip), I'd expect everything to be perfect.  I don't see any reason to ever go here again.  Next time I'm in vegas I'll be trying one of the many other sushi restaurants in town and I suggest you do the same.

-D34mWEktR5CR4Xelrh_9w.text: Sushi Roku was an awesome experience during my brief weekend vacay in Vegas.  My girlfriends and I enjoyed quite a few appetizers, including perfectly cooked edamame and scrumptiously fresh pieces of nigiri sushi.  For entrees, we ordered various rolls, more nigiri sushi, and a salmon/scallop entree that was absolutely delicious.  Service was also excellent.  We had a very attentive server who recommended some fabulous drinks and also dinner choices.  I've got nothing bad to say about the Roku--except that the prices aren't exactly cheap.  But you get what you pay for, I suppose.  And the last thing I wanted in Vegas was for bad sushi to ruin my luck!

Ukb7Sqxr2rF89_7BEsTJrw.text: Made a reservation the day of without any problems. Had to wait just a few minutes, but gave us some time to get some drinks, which were quite good. Food-wise, we split the kobe beef cooked on a hot stone and then shared a bunch of rolls as well as some sake. No complaints from anybody about the food, but the only issue we had was our i'm-better-than-you waiter who served us. Definitely talked down to us and tried to make us order the more expensive sake, the more expensive rolls, and another appetizer of the already expensive kobe beef. But even the annoying waiter couldn't keep us from enjoying our food and the restaurant.  For the four of us that ate there, the bill came to about $250. Luckily we were there for work, so it wasn't actually our money we were spending. Might not have enjoyed the place as much otherwise.  The table next to us had a man in his late-60s or early 70s flanked by two busty girls in their late-20s or early-30s. We tried to figure that relationship out. Ah, Vegas.

aKgyTW8jQl0CPxkhCpfrDw.text: One of the most fun nights I've ever had was spent at Sushi Roku.  Ambiance excellent, service excellent, food excellent, experience excellent!  The 50 minute wait even with 7:00pm reservations -1 star.    We were a group of 8.  Cold and hot/ filtered and unfiltered sakes came out very fast.  On to the apps.  Everything ranging from edamae to homemade tofu to traditional house salad with ginger dressing was ordered and everything was delicious.  For dinner everyone was there for sushi except for one couple.   The meat eater chose the Japanese Kobe Wagyu dish which almost made me wish I got that instead of sushi and his wife chose the Chilean Sea Bass dish..... beautiful presentation on both.    As for the sushi goers:  Blue Fin Tuna, I've never had it before, fresh and amazing!  All of the basics... Toro, Yellowtail, Salmon, Snapper, Halibut, Eel, etc.  (Don't hate my review because I'm using the American names... I don't want to screw up the spelling......) and then the rolls.....Spicy Tuna, Spicy California, Rainbow Roll, Caterpillar Roll.....mmmmmm.mmmmmm Good!  This was an excellent dinner......the server was really upbeat and even did a sake bomb with us!  Next time I'm in Sin City I'm definitely coming back to Roku.

9wezSNs47GnR-Hk3ghbHxQ.text: I know-Sushi, Vegas? What? um...  I have to say the West Hollywood location is way better.   I had the Hamachi and scallion roll, crunchy spicy tuna (fried, over cooked the tuna) and the Hamachi jalapeno sashimi.   Over all is was an "ok". I wouldn't go back based on this experience. But next time i'm down in the west area, I'll go there.

PXLG2ZnyAClnu9kbVAqQbw.text: After reading others reviews, I am now so sad that I missed the view of the strip.  We were seated in the "mall view" area.  Not sure why, the place was not that full.  I guess that is the low-rent district.... Ah, but Sushi Roku, I can't stay mad at you.  Your sushi is delicious.  The Toro Tartare blew my mind (pinon nuts... Sushi Roku, you are a genius!) The yellowtail and fresh scallops were succulent.  The presentation was nice and the cocktails... quite inventive.   Okay, I guess we made up.  This will be my go-to sushi place in Vegas.  And next time, I'm gonna see that view.

FCpOLvTtcXR3i5pfLBLaGA.text: Not bad not bad at all. If you're looking for "asian fusion" cuisine: sushi with spicy sauce and fried stuff, teriyaki steak and expensive sake - you'll like this spot. Cool, dark, trendy decor overlooking the strip - perfect for a dinner date or group dinner. Feels like you stepped into a different world from the shopping mall exterior - well, cause you technically did.  Expect to spend $50 min for some food (enough to make you full but ready for late night pizza later) and A drink. My sushi combo - spicy tuna roll and about 7 basic nigiri was about $28, glass of Rombauer chard was $18. Yes, a little pricey on the wine, but oh well, it's Vegas.  A fair comparison to this place is Sushi Samba in the Venetian...Would I go back? Sure, if it were suggested. No, if I had my choice. Too many other places to check out in Vegas!

rVbpaindhef5MgmzavRIMw.text: The food was good however it was overpriced.  we got there around 8 p and got right in.  We had 4 rolls and after the tip we paid $100. We only had water to drink.  Like I said the food was good but the cost was high.

8bL5RG48SqQ9pyYcA-L2gA.text: Love it, Love it, Love it, Love it, Love it.  This place is fantastic.  The sushi was unbelievably good (we are in the middle of a DESERT!!!!), they have 22 oz. Asahi beers and the folks behind the Sushi bar are actually japanese and seem to have studied the art of sushi for a long long time.  I had an excellent experience here and hope that everyone else can experience the same as me at this wonderful restaurant.

1jxsiHoMPlhxLOWIIh1FnA.text: sushi was just ok, way over priced.  Service was slow for the amount of customers in this place.

muRm3QDCSzWXaWvOgekNnw.text: This place was good, but didn't meet our expectations.  The sushi rolls were just OK.  Service was fine.  View is good if you can get a window table.  My favorite was the kobi meatball lettuce cups.  Unfortunately, I'd have to say I would not go again.

hTvWYpIvfGhjShbRhceJCA.text: If there was a rating system for price, I'd give this place a 2 but being that every restaurant on the strip and in a hotel is expensive, I'll just level the playing field and ignore the price. In terms of the food and atmosphere, it was great! For an appetizer we ordered the edamame hummus which came with chips (although not enough and when we asked for just a few more chips, when we got the bill they charged us $3 for extra chips - not cool - you should tell us there is going to be a charge first). We also ordered the cod and the spider roll - both extremely good! I guess if we had gotten there just an hour earlier we could have gotten the same thing for half price - but oh well, good to know for next time!

2R1O0-TH7S-YxOX3xIDVZQ.text: Meh, sushi is not that great and they raised their prices over the last few years.   I get that commodity prices have risen but $15 for a sub par spicy tuna roll?  No thanks.  Also, the servers are not very professional and don't seem to communicate.  We were asked to order drinks and dinner twice and we paid our bill then a different server dropped off our bill asking us to pay when we are ready.  Total bill was $100.  I would rather eat at a fine dining restaurant like Mastro's or Del Frisco's.  Twice the price but better service.

PRp-UEp3fRYkBzC8qGDZ0g.text: One of the best sushi place I've been to in the USA! The sushi chefs are actually Japanese.  Our bill pre tax pre tip was $250, and the two of us only ate sushi, it's not an expensive place, that tells you how good the sushi is here, so we ate so much of them!

dnp-ifTD5umCI8Gqj7pcCQ.text: This restaurant is beautiful!! It is very modern and comfortable at the same time.  The service was amazing... almost better than the food.    The appetizers were very good.  The miso soup was hearty and filling - the best I have ever had. The popcorn rock shrimp was amazing - one of the best foods I have ever eaten!  The sushi rolls were good, but certainly not the best I have had (Crystal Fish in Monterey, CA is still # 1 for me).  Also, the pricing was quite high - about what I would expect for a tourist city like Vegas.  Overall, I really enjoyed my experience at Sushi Roku.  It was a great addition to our Vegas trip.

LgoKtbe_042ECMmwpIqrjA.text: Good.....not great. The food was tasty but I don't recommend doing a "trust me" menu with the waiter alone.....our waiter told us he would prepare one we could share and it was very lackluster (i'm taking about beyond basic...spice tuna roll, tuna sushi, pot-stickers) so that was disappointing. Nice ambiance, but for the prices, I would go somewhere more upscale and that takes more risks, like Nobu. Also it was a birthday and I told 4 people but they still forgot to bring my husband the desert and sparkler to the table.....I ended up having to remind them and they served it to him in the bar on the way out...pretty lame but better than nothing. Don't do a special dinner here is what I would recommend.

ngw0ww0RPSQ6A_8PXwe-aA.text: I went to the sushi bar. The sashimi was fresh and the sushi bar chef was nice but not too helpful-- "everything is fresh." The sake list is pretty short. Overall 4 stars especially for the Japanese scallops!  The toro was buttery but expensive. I would eat here again. The service for a slow Monday night was great.

a9bDVDYfbYM_3JlTBxjMxg.text: Lovely little spot. I ventured out for a solo dinner while friends were snoozing.   While I am a vegetarian, I cheated with a few seafood items while in Vegas, and Sushi Roku was one. I went with a sashimi app ($26 for eight pieces) and a spicy tuna roll (with add ons).   I agree that it was overpriced, but the service and location were stellar. I do wish they'd had a larger selection of specialty rolls.  The fish was of seriously impressive quality - it was worth my one-time cheat.   Back to vegetarianism, now and forever!

8CrTqPzHanXNy80Uxmm3pQ.text: Staff: Our server was nice, efficiently attentive.  No wow factor, but I'm not the type to go looking for one.  It did take a while for us to get our check, but I'm assuming it's because most people will loiter there after their meal.  The goods:  I had a steak teriyaki something or other.  It was good.  I guess I'm a little indifferent because people rave about this place, but I don't remember experiencing anything ethereal about it.  Still though, it wasn't bad.  I'm really picky and bias about my sushi, so again, not really wow'd.  As far as sushi goes, I could stand to eat it again.  My dessert was fantastic, but you can't go wrong with a molten chocolate cake and vanilla ice cream.  And my friend got the fruit mix with different dipping sauce.  Never heard of a kiwi dipping sauce, very unique.  It was sweet and delicate, very tasty.   The atmosphere: This is where it got good.  I loved the decor.  I did manage to trip on the round stones, but that's more my fault than the restaurants.  I liked the dark tones and wood and modern yet aged feel.  It was very pretty.  I gave it 4 stars because it wasn't bad.  I wouldn't mind going back, we had a nice view and a nice meal, but I don't think I'd plan my next get-together there.

ooG53VYGqzJMU-0KgFskIg.text: yes yes yes!  amazing happy hour sushi.  the bartenders are friendly, the expensive far east mule cocktail was to die for, and the sushi rolls were phenomenal.    Rock Shrimp Tempura Jalapeno and spicy tuna rolls were amazing, as were other I tried.  small seating area for happy hour, but force yourself in because it's well worth it.    I was able to get the free wifi from the close coffee place while eating.

egzfNkPnQAs-JtZOy-Dv-A.text: My girlfriend and I had a last minute trip to Las Vegas on Valentine's Day and of course just about everything was booked! So we went on Open Table and found out Sushi Roku had late night reservations. We went for a nice stroll and went to our dinner. We were sat at an great table next to an exquisite view of the Las Vegas strip. It was very romantic, the crowd was very hip, and the attire was semi-casual. We ordered the truffle edamame (definite recommendation) and 3 rolls of sushi to split. Don't bother going to Kabuki or any second rate sushi place because the sushi here is delicious! The only thing I would complain about is the price but you pay for quality and you look like a stud waving the check to your date at the end of the night!

GUHdk-3eEm3T053t7CRtVw.text: Great service and the food was very tasty, although the fish wasn't as fresh as I expected. You must try the octopus sashimi. Very pricey but it is worth it because of their unique and tasty dishes.

zRiDwsPDfQgGsUocXY4yLg.text: This is a very belated review as we were there in May of 2015. I meant to write a review immediately and got lazy. I had researched with the help of yelp to find good places to eat while in Vegas with my hubby. I worked in a sushi bar run by a very meticulous Japanese sushi master, with amazing standards, for 10 years, so I am quite particular in regard to sushi and Japanese cuisine. I saw that Roku had a great happy hour deal. We went and you sit in the bar area. There were tables but we sat right at the bar. The bartender, Tyson, and a waitress, I think her name was Emily, and a runner, who was super knowledgeable about all the dishes she served us. We had the Garden Salad, the Rib Eye Wrapped Asparagus (not me, as I do not eat beef or pork), the Mushroom Tempura with Creamy Truffle Miso, TWO orders of Tuna Tataki, Albacore Tataki and also the Spicy Tuna and Cucumber  Avocado rolls. I had sake and my hubby had a big tall bottle of mineral water, some brand from France. All of these dishes cost from $3-7. Tyson was very nice and personable and gave great recommendations, as well as giving us some personal background, which was interesting, and background about the restaurant owners and the professionalism and authenticity of the chefs. After a very decadent meal and drinks, our bill was $60, and with tip under $100. Definitely a great deal on the strip in Las Vegas! Not only that, but it was one of those meals that leaves you craving to go back to experience those flavors again. I would go back to Vegas just for a Roku!

YBPkECau3UMqcmQYTrqtzA.text: Went solo for some miso soup and sushi. The sushi was good, but the blue tuna sushi I had actually smelled a little fishy. Good spot to view the strip, but I wouldn't go back as there are other sushi places worth checking our.

7GhAqMqkiR4gCcYkiUON0w.text: AG made reservations here (Saturday night, 6:30PM) for us to celebrate the end of YM's days as a single lady.    AMBIANCE: Dim, sleek and sexy.  We were seated in a booth, which I think is the way to go (although the tables near the ceiling to wall glass windows with a view of the strip lights seemed nice too).  The noise level was low to start the night, but gradually got rowdy-- you could definitely tell that some of the tables were downing liquid courage.  SERVICE: Our waitress was super cute/friendly, but did mess up our drink order once.  The GM stopped by our table to say hello, but it didn't seem like we got any special treatment.  FOOD: Average.  I think there was either a set menu, or a previously decided upon order, since our food started arriving course by course as soon as our drink orders were taken.  - edamame: Sprinkled lightly with sea salt, I was disappointed the seasoning wasn't evenly distributed.  It also seemed strange that a seemingly nice place like Sushi Roku would charge for edamame (or include it as one of the charged for courses in a set menu). - Hamachi carpaccio (1 slice of fish/person): Eh.  Also slightly disappointing.  The flavors were good (yuzu drizzle, etc), but the fish could've been fresher.  The girls really liked this dish though, so maybe its just me. - Filet mignon wrapped asparagus (1 roll/person): Presentation was nice-- the rolls were stacked up on each other on top of a sizzling rock.  A soy glaze was poured on top before serving, and emitted an impressive amount of steam.  I ended up with a piece that was sitting on top of the rock-- the meat was fairly tough for a supposedly tender cut.  I'm also not a huge fan of asparagus, so this dish was meh for me. - Crispy miso shrimp (several shrimps/person): My fave of the night, but it was essentially honey walnut prawns, minus the sweet mayo. - Chicken & beef teriyaki skewers (1 of each skewer/person): The beef skewers featured nice tender chunks of beef.  The chicken wasn't as good as the beef imo, but at least they were juicy and not dry. - Assortment of sushi (a couple pieces of sushi/person): Eh.  Par. - Dessert trio: Cheesecake (thumbs down; it had a REALLY hard buttery crust), cinnamon sugar donut "holes" (good, very fluffy, came with caramel and vanilla dipping sauces), and a molten chocolate lava cake (very good, very lava-y).  The cocktails were hit or miss, but I really liked the bourbon one with cilantro and raspberries.  OVERALL: Solid 3 stars.  I actually have no idea how much the meal cost, so my rating may change after I see the bill.  Anything more than $40pp would be too much for what we ate.

PPeR-D4Rlo0ibPaLVmvdTA.text: One of the Killers', and especially singer Brandon Flowers', favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. If you want to spot celebrities anywhere, this is the place. Oh right, and the sushi is insanely good too... From LV's Daily Fiaso blog: "Even family man Brandon Flowers has to eat. Thus we have him being spotted enjoying lunch at Sushi Roku inside the Forum Shops at Caesars today with family in tow. Reportedly, the singer is a frequent visitor of the acclaimed restaurant." thesponge-dani.blogspot....

fxrsg-L7EhkPVW848xiJdA.text: My new favorite Sushi spot both in LA and in Vegas... Apparently you can get awesome Sushi ,reasonably priced in Las Vegas ,oh and great service !!

UPX8GiXNbIvf33y1nTCcWQ.text: Horrible. How this place has 4 stars is beyond me. A total waste of a dinner. I would never go back and I know good sushi be it masa, sushi of gari or sugarfish. Do yourself a favor and AVOID

Lo3VRiMNDvSNYMmE9H-nzw.text: Sushi Roku is amazing! The food, the view overlooking the strip, and the ambiance was superb. The restaurant manager greets every table and welcomed all guests.

hfbr0V4ndpmkoOK0Ilp1wA.text: Excellent customer service and amazing view of strip. The my really value their customers and want to please them. Definitely consider going here if you are wanting sushi in vegas. The desserts are great too.

VpOaq3bOKdAPFE58ErXb8w.text: Such a great experience! My husband and I celebrated our 1 year wedding anniversary.  Because I booked our reservation through yelp they knew it was our anniversary and surprised us with a delicious dessert! Sushi was delicious, service was great, and we'll definitely go back the next time we're in Vegas!

XpdSpM4WcShJxjzYY3XyTA.text: Ok I went here once before just thought it was OK. But I just tried it again and was pleasantly surprised.  The only thing that wasn't stellar was our server, but she was OK, so we left her 15% all the same.  This place is on the third floor of Caesar's Forum shops next store to BOA.  a) Foie Gras topped scallops $21 AWESOME, we ordered another round of these they were that good b) yellowtail and jalapeno sashimi platter really good and lots of it c) lychee martinis --yum yum d) Great view of the Las Vegas strip :)  e) regular sushi rolls very good as well f) great music g) nice ambiance h) availability to book online quickly makes me happy too!

NKw8z9uPmDZ5fEZJG9zy8Q.text: One of the best sushi restaurants in Vegas.  Rolls are a bit pricey but are very creative and have much more fish than most of the other "fine dining" sushi restaurants on the strip.   We had the Katana rolls which consisted of Tuna and Yellowtail on top of a roll with spicy tuna and shrimp tempura, these were fantastic, the shrimp was perfectly tender and the flavors worked well together.  Also had the crunchy spicy tuna with avocado which was perfect. And the spicy scallop roll which we really enjoyed.  I was quite hungry and wanted something hot so we tried the Chicken Yakitori  skewers, awesome, and the Kobe Beef skewers, alright but not as good as I would have hoped.  Service was excellent and the bar makes some very innovative cocktails, I am not much of a cocktail drinker myself but my better half ordered the Tokyo Cooler which I tried as well and agree with her opinion that it was fantastic.  Tab was just over $160 with three rolls, the chicken and kobe skewers, a shared dessert, two cocktails, and a couple beers. Not bad for Vegas.

XFTzn6sbOl5o7dGr0TPe0A.text: We had a late afternoon reservation but not late enough. They only opened the seating area with a view at 5:00pm. We didn't make a big fuss. We had a very attentive and friendly waiter. Service was quick and the food was good. The only issue we had was their system didn't accept our American Express Serve card even though the funds were available.

IeZ7_IKye5xsdIzPA9G8VA.text: Fresh, good sushi...in the desert? Call me skeptical, but yes, this is Vegas, after all. In the heart of Caesar's Forum Shoppes, the three curving escalators to ride to get here make it seem more exclusive than it is, but enjoy.  This place is all about three things: decor, wide selection of modern interpretation of Japanese cusisine, and overly friendly service. Let's get it out of the way: the place is beautiful. Very modern, very rich, and dark, it's a visual treat. Set against the overlook of the Strip (so, why DO people go to Imperial Palace?), it's a visual masterpiece. The bench seats that line the windows actually have lit rock gardens underneath them...very cool.  The food: good, but won't wow you into submission. I'm just a spoiled San Francisco sushi man, so it might be amazing for others. The Chicken Kara Age was exceptional, however; highly reccomended. The sushi? The sushi itself was good: fresh, flavorful. The rolls were overstuffed with so many things, it was hard to get a sense of the delicate flavor. Be warned: you are paying Vegas prices here ($100 for 2 of us with about 5 small plates), but the quality and ambience are good enough to overcome that.  Service was almost obsequious, although getting tea refilled seemed to be a foreign concept. Hey, I know the desert's hot, but I can't have my hamachi without some tea to go with it. ;-) Very prompt delivery of items, very courteous.   Odd notes: the place was only half full for an 8pm reservation. We used Open Table to ensure a seat, but we needn't have worried. And a note if you plan to sit by the windows: there is a typical Vegas video sign just underneath the restaurant outside, so you'll get a lot of flickering glow, which can be distracting.  I'd say it's a good casual sushi place, to take a date, or to enjoy the fun of being in Vegas without killing you on price with no quality to show for it.

oLWL1vJI-149bRixCvwWCQ.text: The bartender is so nice!  She gave me some helpful happy hour pointers.  Great service and food!  Miso blackend cod is the BEST thing on the menu!  I love it here- a Westside treasure!

tM4-bZvkb4eupWAX4oui2A.text: Pretty average sushi nothing too special. The restaurant was pretty empty on Wednesday night. We ordered multiple roles the best role what's a spicy tuna the little piece of jalapeno on top of each roll. I've had a lot better sushi at better prices but I guess this is what you can expect in Vegas. At least I can say the fish tasted fresh

MkrK7z9sun5IWXu0NXt_yw.text: Stopped in here for lunch after shopping in caesars..i was able to get a seat at sushi bar right away...i ordered a drink as recommended by server called the far east mule..it was refreshing n good...i ordered the 8 piece roku signature style sushi..it was absolutely delicious! The sushi chef described each one n explained that no soy sauce was needed..i enjoyed each one i cant wait to go back n order it again! Great food n service!

Je1b1AIkCbhULMajXk6rCg.text: This is a nice sushi spot right inside the forum shops at Caesar's palace. We came in for happy hour and I got a nice sampling of items, including some sashimi for a grand total of $23. Food is so pricey here it was great to come across a nice dining option, outside fast food, at this price point. Their happy hour menu is limited but they still have a nice variety of rolls, sashimi, hot appetizers and salad. Service was excellent. Las Vegas must have sent a memo to all the restaurant service workers because everywhere we have gone has the nicest people.

iAwgnY1TSxAQOexR-vU4Vw.text: Service was out of this world. I haven't been to a restaurant in town with this level of great employees in a long time. attentive, refilled drinks quickly without being asked, and kept the table satisfied with the entire experience. The table had a variety of sashimi, lobster, steak and dessert. The best part was the fried rice with spicy tuna on top. While pricey, you are taken care of for certain! Giving it four stars only because of the cost.

qYf2zZvcNUQ8vMehNakLHg.text: Wonderful, friendly service! Nice atmosphere and sushi was fabulous. Spicy tuna roll and katana roll were both very good. We also had one of the chefs, Jason, make us something special and fresh and he nailed it! It was delicious!

smesl3apCG03Aa_0zrRZYA.text: I'd say that the two times I've been here were just ok I really liked your little rice cakes a lot But they really weren't very accommodating to me because I really don't like raw fish and I really like my sushi done a specific way and if I can't get sushi done a specific way then I get a little weird  The service here is very good there is always parking I've only been here twice and prices are normal but I just think that the food is put me in a weird way because I just like getting what I want and if I can't get a certain way then it bothers me that's why took away a star so I had to settle for things on the menu and rely off of my friends And the things that my friends pick out are completely disgusting.  The desert here is absolutely amazing

XlsQmW5WtduBlJ-JJiEJYQ.text: We went for a late dinner before a 9.30 show. We got lost finding it and when we called they were great directing us to them. Once there we were seated immediately. Staff were friendly and great to work with. The food was excellent! Must try the baked crab roll! Too die for!!

UDchJBJGIFtcAg9794ci0g.text: Great sushi restaurant in the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace. The atmosphere is very open, with a modern Japanese vibe. We ordered a bunch of dishes to share. Among them, the roasted cauliflower, miso eggplant, tofu 3 ways, and a vegetable roll that they let us choose the ingredients for. The only item we didn't like was the slabs of cold tofu. I love tofu, but we couldn't even eat this. Everything else was great!

jF-2q8zB9T7hfX6skovu3g.text: I ate here 5 or 6 times now. In fact... I'm eating here currently haha. so idk if that makes it 7 times or what. pretty much I eat here whenever I can because it's the best sushi in the best location with the best chefs: Jason, Kyle, the blonde guy and Shu San. All very friendly, and skilled. Jason taught me all about soy paper haha.   The fish is all good. Bomb ass uni, but the baked crab roll was my drug of choice lately.  Way too good for $11.  I ate 45 of them lol, jk. 12oz of hot sake for $10. Good skewers as well. Really I don't think you can go wrong here. It's really very good bang for your buck here. I've had omakase a while back and it's was really beautiful and delicious. Good salmon nigiri, hella good snapper,  real wasabi, etc.. it's all good here.   Good loud bar in back but it's not part of sushi roku. But roku has its own bar as well. Really good service maybe they like me extra but the hosts, waitresses and chefs and everyone are very intelligent and helpful and super nice to me!
