uiI2408LYDHNNNvhKjFFpg.text: This is the sushi place you need to go to instead of nobu.  For a fraction of the price you get sushi that is just as delicious, and with happy hour bar and sushi prices.  Can't beat it.  Last time I was in Vegas I literally went to nobu, spent $100 alone, then left and went to sushi roku and spent $35 and got full. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the food is delicious.  Some of my favorite sushi ever, not just in Vegas.  It's hidden way at the top of the Caesars forum shops, but it's well worth it to go and eat there. So delicious!!

THQp-j4HkXTEc7l89a0RlA.text: Wow. I'm not easy to please, but this place just became a must visit on every trip to Vegas for us. Sushi Roku and Mesa Grill. Those are our two must hit spots.   The Salmon Carrasco and the Matsu were unreal. Tuna Poke was delicious, and the Chocolate lava cake was equally amazing. Nothing that we ordered was less than excellent.   Service was perfect.   Cocktails were good. A bit underwhelming for the $15 price tag, but all were good. Their beer selection even had a couple of beers that I haven't had, which is rare.   All in all, a home run.

Vd36QsNsmKp35jUJLuLgkA.text: Food quality is four stars, service is five. We ordered the A5 Wagyu, which they serve two ways. One is table side, cooked on a hot stone and two ounces. The other way is cooked in the kitchen, on the same grill they use to cook yakitori over binchotan and three ounces. We opted for the table side so we could watch the spectacle of cooking it, but not before we asked several questions about binchotan wood. Afterwards, in between other plates being brought to our table the server took the time to bring a cut of binchotan wood out for us to see and understand why it's so great for grilling (no flames, but hot consistent temperature that is long lasting). For me, that was above and beyond what she had to do, and was really impressed with her overall service. It was only our second time there, but we will definitely be back again soon. It doesn't hurt that almost everything that came out of the kitchen was cooked or prepared to perfection.

oMW_h0ZRsbamzQ7LJSNvoQ.text: Great sushi, great prices, and all the staff are very friendly and nice. It is always a great view if you sit towards the strip

HqJA-XovAd7oCoSWAY11_g.text: This place was absolutely delicious. I got sick in Vegas. The worst place to be sick, by myself on a work trip. So I came here for dinner (mainly out of convenience) because it was on the way to the Bellagio where I was going to see Cirque du Soleil (O).   HH is pretty damn good here. So many options, which were reasonably priced. Hot sake for $3?!??!?! WITH 3-4ish shots?! The hanabi. OMGGGG out of this WORLD. Spicy tuna on top of crispy rice. Just do yourself a favor and get this.   I sat at the bar, and both bartenders were extraordinary. Seriously, an uplifting meal for me. I went hard. I ordered rolls, hanabi, wagyu skewer (SO TENDER AND MELTS IN YOUR MOUTH), some mushroom tempura? and a chocolate lava cake. You can get so many different little bites and flavors. All of them were awesome. I would say the wagyu & hanabi were my favorite things.   I wish this place was right next to work. You'd see me here practically everyday.

OfFoBk7msIdiuD5Bg8ZHvQ.text: It's sad when chain places lose that sense of service. No one was rude, but by no means was anyone welcoming. The spicy scallop roll I ordered was on the fishy side (usually an indicator of bad seafood) and I told them I didn't care for it. So awesome - I still had to pay for it! (Please hear the sarcasm.) Hummus was great, presentation of everything was beautiful, but I think they should work a bit on customer service.  Try smiling while you're at work, not telling me your back hurts and you can't wait to get off.  Also, quick tip - don't order the red wine that's on happy hour. Thinner than a Pinot noir, but supposedly it's a Cabernet Sauvignon. Tasted like wine tinted water.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best part of our meal.

V8oQ1CGz0gGE4xOg5mVHyQ.text: Really wasn't impressed. Ordered several different rolls and an appetizer but meh. Service was fine, got seated right away. There's gotta be better sushi  somewhere else in LV.

udN3ZGmvWJi5OlODNMybrw.text: Our group had a FABULOUS meal here. It was pretty easy to get reservations, even for our group of 14 people. We ended up splitting the table "in half" and have each side order their own food to share (family style). I think our side won:  For appetizers, we ordered:  Tuna Sashimi Carpaccio: 4 out of 5 stars Yellowtail Diced Chilies with Olive Oil & Garlic Ponzu: 4 out of 5 stars Organic Garden Salad with Yuzu Ginger Dressing: 5 out of 5 stars (as far as garden salads go) Seaweed Salad with Cucumber Sunomono: 3 out of 5 stars Shishito Japanese Peppers in Soy Garlic: 5 out of 5 stars (so much flavor!) Brussel Sprouts with Bacon and Yuzu Kosho: 5 out of 5 stars (it's BACON!)  For Entrees and Special Rolls, we ordered:  Uni Udon Creamy Pasta: this was actually more like fettuccini, not udon noodles. It was definitely very creamy and heavy. I liked it, but I wouldn't say it was my favorite dish of the night. 3 out of 5 stars. Well, let's make it 4 out of 5 stars, since the uni pieces were huge. Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus: it comes on a hot rock. 4 out of 5 stars. Crunchy Spicy Tuna Roll (this is typically deep fried, but there is an option to just get the deep fried crunchy flakes on top of the roll). 4 out of 5 stars. Katana Roll: Spicy tuna & shrimp tempura topped with tuna and yellowtail. 5 out of 5 stars. Makoto Roll: Yellowtail & shrimp tempura wrapped with seared tuna, spicy creamy sauce. 5 out of 5 stars. These rolls were pretty similar actually...oops.  The other side ordered the Prime Rib Eye Steak to share, and we each tried a piece. If I go with a large group again, we are ordering that fosheezy.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2FRcCylzagmv-2bpoNYMjA.text: I have to say that the sushi didn't "wow" me...unfortunately!  I expected more for the price.  The ambiance almost made up for it as it had and absolutely beautiful, zen like decor and a view of the strip.  Our server was very friendly and gave great suggestions.  The yellowtail he recommended was fantastic, but, again, nothing out of the 10 sushi orders was anything I would come back for.  I enjoyed Nobu more.

y8zTeaURoNcbH_dGmWxGBw.text: Sushi Roku is the most amazing Japanese high quality restaurant I have been to in Vegas. The 8 years plus I have spent in Las Vegas I haven't been to a better sushi bar. The food although a bit pricey is well worth the investment. Sushi Roku is located in the forum shops located right next to Caesars Palace. This restaurant is located on the third floor which contains a variety of fashion stores to enjoy after your meal.  The appetizer i started with was the lobster Tempura for the price of $35.00. The meat of the lobster came from the the tail very juicy and delicious. The lobster was chopped into nuggets with a sweet and golden miso glaze. The first bite made me think I struck gold with this one. The baked crab hand-roll was my next appetizer and it did not disappoint me. This little morsel was $11.00 classically made with lobster,rice, and butter wrapped in soy paper. This like the lobster tempura had very juicy succulent lobster in it.  Then, I went on to my entree... the best steak ever. The uniquely delicious prime rib-eye steak  "JAPONAIS" was a meat lovers dream at the price of $48.00. The steak I chose was medium rare it was very tender and garnished with tomatoes. The sides included Japanese style potatoes in a delicious sauce and mini wedge shaped.Lastly, this dish included garlic green beans and a delicious garlic sauce that would make A1 cry.  Last but not least, the chocolate lava cake that blew my mind. The minute I took my spoon and cut into this chocolate volcano, chocolate flowed out. Their was also a small scoop of vanilla ice cream and a small cookie. The combination of all three would satisfy anyone after a 3 course meal.  The end of my meal included a birthday surprise for one of my family members. The staff brought my aunt a free creme brulee and brought a wine glass with a sparkler. The fireworks show was the fork in the steak and made the meal wrap up splendidly. Definitely a great destination for a birthday or any other sort of get together.   This is my first post on Yelp! and well I hope you enjoyed it. Lets see where my taste buds take me next...Talk to you soon!

L7h-E9ezpU7jq4PXGSEeRw.text: I have nothing negative to say about Sushi Roku. I had the seaweed salad and lobster tempura. The salad was very generous as was the lobster. The service was superb! My husband got the tasting menu and it did not disappoint. A lot of variety and they happy switched out the scallops to which he's allergic to. I can't recommend Sushi Roku highly enough.

M1vURwJ_ocFRwCbkKXOXCA.text: I've been to many Japanese Restaurant and I always get the chef's special and custom but this restaurant for me I guess this one has no talent at all.. the food is fine but the price doesn't fit to what I ordered, I got a boring plate of sushi ( 6 piece ) and a small bowl of miso soup and volcano chocolate  cake for dessert and it cost me $60 bucks plus $10 tip so total was $70 for one person and I'm still hungry and I only weight 96 pounds. The name of the sushi I got was sushi UME it said in the menu " Roku signature style sushi " " our master sushi chef's custom creations "  not even close to that. Money is not an issue for me but I feel like I'm stupid of paying something not even worth to pay for. I recommend to go to Mizumi or Sushi Samba

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tk7XLUH-L9W1ViixCA7fTQ.text: I went with a friend on a Saturday night. Wasn't too crowded so we were seated immediately. I love the openness of the front of the restaurant!  We ordered a lot -- miso soup, fried calamari, the senshi roll and the spicy scallop roll. My favorite was the fried calamari, which has some jalapeno sauce so it's a unique addition to your traditional calamari!  The senshi roll is very rich and filling, and we were already full by the time it came out so we had to box it to go. Very tasty though!  A great spot at the top floor of the Forum Shops. Service was quick and friendly!

5LnNaMFc85bhCg07ZqOTaQ.text: MEH. Anyone who gave it a 5-star probably gives Red Lobster a 5-star. They don't know food.   Reservations aren't guaranteed, even if you make them directly through them or Open Table. You will still have to wait. Be prepared for 40+ minute wait after reservation time. Very loud atmosphere. Tables spill out into a mall next to a Planet Hollywood. Not recommended for business for sure, if considering. Maybe better for bar atmosphere maybe if you like standing 3-layers behind people to get to bar. Don't go during a conference.   Sushi was over nitrated, so hard to say if it was "fresh", but also had mush texture. It is sushi in landlocked desert Las Vegas though, so no sushi will be that fresh. Prices over inflated, but it's Vegas, so to be expected. Dish descriptions didn't quite match quality/expectations. Everything was overtly drenched and drowned in mixed flavors to cover nitrated sushi. Drinks weak and on sweet side. Not balanced. Meh.   Waiter was very good, gracious, and apologized for the wait. He was the only redeeming factor.  Great guy. Tommy C is fantastic. Applaud him.   $300 dollars later for 4 people, 3 rolls, 3 small apps, 4 pieces sashimi, 3 cocktails, 1 beer. Spend your money elsewhere and read the reviews thoroughly. Don't be fooled by reservation availability!   Meh.

Ig8L0zyCRaW96942_hD8Zw.text: We had dinner here and it was very good. The rolls were fresh, the customer service was great, and the view was beautiful. Totally worth the price.

13nP7yYh_kvFbQlUoDl5Og.text: What a great find!  We stumbled upon this restaurant and it was so good the first night we went back the second night for more.  The food was so fresh and delicious.  There is a cool vibe to the whole place.  The portion sizes were very good.  The food was very authentic tasting.  This would be a fun date restaurant too.

3zZZol89uVG-Z5U1cA8AGQ.text: OMG!!!! Why haven't we dined here before?!!!  Came in a 1/2 hour before closing on a Saturday night. Too bad they don't have late hours---This is Vegas!!  Although empty, the hostess sat us right away at a crappy spot. I kindly asked to be  moved & she had an attitude.  Besides that, our gorgeous server was great! We ordered the Cruncy Spicy Tuna Tempura Roll w/Avocado and a Baked Crab Hand Roll (soy paper)--Both excellent!!! Sadly, the Edamame was on the bland side.  Located on 3rd Level of the Forum Shops at Cesars Palace--fair pricing, great view of the Strip, hip music & romantic. We can't wait to go back!!! And they have locations in Pasadena & Santa Monica, Yasssssss!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-nSCSs2chXVgXbtibuYt8w.text: My Oyako donburi just arrived. It smells totally authentic. After living in Japan, I know what's legit. 5 bites in and this is the real deal. First donburi I've had in the US that tastes "right."  Well done!  Sushi Roku sits over the strip so it would be a great night time spot as well.  Music playing in background is at a perfect volume so conversations can be had and you can still enjoy the music.   Prices are reasonable for the Strip.  Based on the donburi, I highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hTDFVxKK8_LomKCjvCCdyg.text: Location/Ambiance: Sushi Roku sits on prime real-estate. Located on the 3rd floor of caesar's forum shops (east-wing), Sushi Roku offers their guests a stellar view of the Vegas strip. Elegant and tasteful decor pair well with the romantic and warm atmosphere of the restaurant.   Food: Everything I ordered throughout the night either met or exceeded my expectations. Here are a few of my favorites: The Beef Ribeye Wrapped Asparagus is relatively simple but very delicious - the full flavor of savory beef was well balanced with a properly cooked asparagus center (plus 10 points for the great presentation on a hot rock!). The Filet Mignon Tobanyaki has to be one of the most flavorful dishes at Sushi Roku. A garlic-truffle ponzu sauce made this vegetable-filet medley very complex and addicting till the last bite. Lastly, the Yellowtail Diced Chiles is OUTSTANDING. The rich oils dress the fresh yellowtail impeccably - give it a shot!  Service: Definitely saved the best for last in this review. I've been to Sushi Roku three or four times in the last year, and each experience left me thoroughly impressed with regards to quality of service. My most recent dining experience, in particular, was incredible. My GF and I were celebrating our 2 year anniversary, and our waitress, Maiko, helped make our special dinner an unforgettable one. Her knowledge of the menu was impressive - providing great food and wine recommendations, but her warmth and positive energy really made the experience for us. Ask for Maiko if you dine at Sushi Roku and you are guaranteed to have a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A dessert assortment that my waitress, Maiko, had put together on my anniversary! The donut-holes are unreal.

OWmaamnVNrk1WljS1GSUaQ.text: This is our new favorite sushi restaurant in Vegas. To begin, being celiac I always appreciate a gluten free menu and they have one of the best I've seen. Our server was amazing- very knowledgeable and going out of the way to double check with the kitchen and bartenders to ensure that everything I ordered was gluten free. I had the crab fried rice, salmon and tuna sashimi. Everything was outstanding and a great value. Great atmosphere although a bit loud. 100% will be back!

Ok2m_5Y2ePPWh0OnfZIjkA.text: We went during happy hour time (4-7pm), only a few tables around. But the service was very bad. The server disappeared most of the time. We ended up had to take our check and credit card up front. We ordered calamari, crab fried rice, pulled port bun, two special rolls, lots of sushi rolls, not bad but nothing worth mentioning either

KqvBTscZfG1G8drA59D2JA.text: Hands down the best sushi spot in Vegas. I feel it's even better than Nobu. Great options and you can taste the luxury. Love this place.

zZg-P6MlXoygfgQbgCY-qw.text: One of the best and most personable experiences I've had in Vegas. The manager, Johnny, is so attentive and makes great recommendations. The sushi is amazing!!! The spicy miso soup is amazing and the spicy panko shrimp roll was our favorite. All of the drinks are awesome. Don't miss this place.

3D5saz3Ld8NGZiHjk8ooQA.text: Sushi Roku one of the best places on strip to go during happy hour.They have great prices, yummy Champaign, big selection of sushi and appetizers, great design and welcoming service. We came here after I found this place on Yelp and as a True sushi fan I had to try it. Well bar was full during happy hour so they gave us nice table outside ( close to cute Christmas tree). I was more than happy because I don't like laud bars.  All sushi and sashimi that we ordered was extremely tasty, savory and fresh. $6 Champaign sounds reasonable. I will definitely come back!

qNsFxmJFKDTt9nhAav1vkw.text: 5/5 for the experience. All the servers are dancers so you get a dance show while you eat that was cool. Food was ok not the best sushi. I would revisit next time I'm in Vegas.

qEJqnwlsqTAFFjBoYHtIcA.text: Came here for dinner and had the omakase which runs about 120$. Seating was by the bar but at the corner and not in front of chef. The music was loud so it was really hard to hear what was in the dishes when they were brought out. It was 6 courses which each course having 1 piece of sushi with the exception if sushi sampler and meat dish.  1st was the tofu and some fish dish that had a spicy taste to it which was my favorite of the night 2nd was the seared scallops with butterscotch  sauce 3rd was the sashimi with tuna and another type of fish. Also tasted great. 4th was some type of steak on top of mushrooms and onions 5th and final was 6 piece sushi sampler 6th was dessert which was creme brulee  Overall it was tasty but menu wasn't huge and still was a bit hungry after and also which there was better communication about what's in the dish considering the price.

z6RWGh03Uedj_XRitNYuOw.text: Sushi selection was ah OK, but their hot house sake blew.  Overall good joint.  Will be back.

NXvROoYyyv3cNJI_QgLD6g.text: Meh. Came in for sushi after reading pretty good reviews. It just so happened to be happy hour score! They had 6 piece sushi rolls for 6 bucks cant beat that and specialty rolls 30% off. Tried two happy hour rolls and one tempura  spicy tuna roll. The tempura oddly enough tasted stale/old just not good at all. The other rolls one with rock shrimp and one with scallops. I didn't really care for the rock shrimp one like eat one piece and done. The scallop one wasnt awful. Overall really unimpressed. The bar tender was nice on a positive note.

I love black truffles and so excited that so many aps and rolls had them incorporated, such a brilliant touch! This place is highly recommend.

zHpg7ezsV5mNEsSaIbwDHw.text: Great food, no wait on a Saturday and great view of the strip. Service was top notch and everyone enjoyed their meals

80ZukvwRYwSXpbFQKuAzZQ.text: Really bad food. Like, seriously. Disappointed for Vegas level....tuna was tasteless and salmon was fishy. Had to return it. The only good thing was the garlic edamame. Rolls are just average....

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna carpaccio - 3 pieces for $9 happy hour! !! Ugh

lSXDatG6mq9g6yYkfVxj9w.text: I heart Sushi Roku.  Atmosphere, Food, Service - this place as it all.  Despite being located in an upscale section of a "mall - "Forum at Caesar's Palace, the dark, rich wood, ponds with koi, multi-leveled seating (booths and platforms) and the warm lighting made this place irresistable to not walk into during a break in my shopping frenzy. This place had the hints of a warm romantic restaurant with the modern edge that made dining here accessible to all.  No matter where you are sitting (even if you aren't near a window) you'll enjoy the view.  I was ready for a huge meal and my dining partner and I (having walked from MGM) were ready for a giant meal.  We took the server's suggestion of a Tokyo Breeze (a sake cocktail).  It was amazing!  Perfectly balanced - not-too-sweet citrus cocktail made from sake, to this day, as not found it's equal in ANY establishment i have been to.  It was amazing..  Starter: Chilean Sea Bass Eggrolls- I think this has forever changed my view on eggrolls.  The buttery flavor of the Chilean Sea bass was perfect with this dish.  The tender fish paired with the crispy wonton skin... amazing.  Sushi: Uni - Delicious! Salmon - tAMAZING! the server mentioned that this was suggested by the chef because I had ordered so much salmon sashimi (it was a special kind - i can't remember, but had thicker bands of the delicious fat and was a more deeply hued orange than what I am used to)  Eel- (freshwater) it was prefectly sauced with great consistency.  The slices of fish were well matched size-wise with the perfectly seasoned rice  Sashimi: Salmon, Yellowtail, and Tuna - all were delicious!  Rolls: The rice was NOT smashed into the nori and the balance of all the flavors were perfectly matched! We had the Kani Kani roll because we are crab lovers!  A roll done with crab 2 ways - inside (Alaskan snow crab) and outside - fried/tempura!  Delicious. there was a great selection of rolls that seemed to cover everything from the extremely lavish to the simple but delicious.. TRY them all!  Service was extremely helpful, prompt and polite.  They were very attentive when we needed them and magically disappeared when they were no longer needed.. its that 6th sense that great servers are known for.. Sushi Roku servers had it.  This will be pricer than what you are used to, but it is every bit worth it.

x24lih4gT_acO8SFSOHXCA.text: The sushi had a fishy smell, so we didn't feel comfortable eating it. The spicy tuna roll appears to have canned tuna instead of fresh. Over priced and underwhelming. Do not recommend!

s9aurWNbP3a09m2djX_9GA.text: I really wanted to like this place more but, after our recent (and only) experience, I'm barely able to give 2 stars. First: it took us close to 20/25 minutes to find this place after entering Caesar's and asking several hotel employees. *No, we weren't drunk or stoned; it's that hidden. Second: When we did finally arrive to the hostess stand and nobody else was around, they both just stared at us. We said hello and that we had a reservation. One of them lead us to a table right next to a table of ladies and all their bags. We looked around the empty restaurant and asked if we could possibly be sat a bit farther away. Done with hesitation. Third: I eat fish/seafood but, my husband doesn't but, can usually find something on any menu. I asked our waitress what she recommended for both of us given the no fish deal. She suggested a shrimp dish. ??? My food came first while we waited for my husband's. This is the fault of our waitress by misfiring the order to the kitchen;  any good waitperson knows all food for the table should come relatively around the same time. The sushi was good; they have ankimo!! The best? No way! For $200 (no booze) I expect much better than good. I think the most insulting was being charged $3 for extra "pita" pieces when we wanted more than the 4 slices the hummus originally came with. On a completely personal bitchy note: our waitress' grill was all over the place (possibly missing teeth, jagged, crowded) and very distracting when looking at her. Her appearance didn't match the chic/trendy look this place is going for. As a local, we probably won't go back anytime soon.

kCNuaAQW43hKiFZ5gY-qTA.text: Unfortunately the sushi we received was subpar.  The crispy tempura and the crispy shallots were cold and soggy.  The rice was not fresh and the short ribs were extremely tough and rubbery.  This had such high reviews but the food did not live up to expectations.   On the up side our server was amazing and did everything she could to make our night enjoyable.  If you are coming here for food, I would urge you to rethink.

b4-0Af9sgcxQySakTl2OUA.text: The food was really good! I'm glad we stumbled upon this place and tried it. It was everything I needed to get my sushi fix. Our server Juliana made it a delightful visit. She was very attentive and friendly. We will definitely be back!

qy56UNe4dIsnVhP9LMZmtA.text: Sushi Roku is hands down my favorite sushi restaurants from all around the country. I have been to multiple sushi places in Vegas and all over the east coast. As a super sushi lover, it is extremely rare that I am impressed with the quality of sushi the way I was with Sushi Roku. Growing up my parents owned their own sushi restaurant and I am confident when I say.. I know my fish. I don't know or understand how they manage to always have the freshest quality of fish despite the fact that LV is in the middle of a desert but I hope they keep it up.. forever.   Servers are helpful, kind, and knowledgeable of the menu. If you don't know where to start, ask them for their thoughts and they'd definitely help you. I highly recommend the Shima Roll but to be really honest, it seems that you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The price range tends to be on the higher end but hey, you're in vegas--the city of excess/riches and you're in a desert yet you are being served fresh fish.. what did you expect? And as I've said, the quality and taste is as good as it gets.   If you are a sushi lover, I recommend that you give this place a go!

CnM-gmxxT7TsYkNn0VIbXw.text: After staying in Las Vegas for a few days, we wanted to try something outside of the buffet line, so we turned to Yelp to help us find a nice sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. Sushi Roku came up with moderate views and we have been noticing quite a bit of advertisement for them around the Strip. Every sign we saw was promoting them as "The most romantic spot in Las Vegas". And Sushi Roku could have pass for the most romantic spot too. Their decor was fantastic and their tables near the window had an amazing view of the Strip. However, the food was simply horrible, not to mention expensive. I know I am paying for the ambience so I wouldn't have mind if the food would have tasted half as good as it look, but it was barely edible. Everything felt dry and was seriously, lacking flavor. They didn't even use the Japanese short grain rice that is known for its stickiness. Instead, we were given a bowl of dry long grain, possibly day old rice. A small bite of the rice was more than I could handle and ended up finishing the meal without it. Sushi Roku looks amazing and could be a very romantic spot to take your date to, just as long as you don't eat the food. Order some drinks or hot tea and enjoy the ambience and view. lwehttam.wordpress.com/2...

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1Zqett6yUNS6PAGmLIp31Q.text: This place is ALWAYS awesome.  Great food, good cocktails, and a great atmosphere!  Go here!

KNoBOlK7gikqILp8QxDc7A.text: Came to Vegas on vacation with my cousin, aunt, and mom. Walked in and got excellent service, our waiter Frank was very attentive and friendly and was accomodating to our jokes and such. On top of that Pablo, super cute waiter as well, forever refilling my water. Needless to say that was the fastest I've ever fallen in love. Great service, amazing food. !!!

RWoKfYqnWWAnHRW9rfbwcQ.text: This restaurant truly deserves 5 stars. Let me start off by saying they have a GLUTEN FREE MENU, which is amazing for any sushi lover who can't have regular soy sauce and tempura. They have gluten free soy sauce and they have gluten free rolls which makes it really easy to order. The fish was so fresh and delicious. The ambience of the restaurant was very nice with the dimmed lighting, strip view, and great decor. I definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone that is looking for great sushi in Vegas for a reasonable price.

I8NKN3v138FW-tLPh1IULQ.text: I came here for Happy Hour last week. Got an $18 raspberry cocktail and two of the happy hour special sushi rolls for $4 each. Both of the ladies working at the bar were very nice and friendly, and my cocktail, while pricey, was also very good. The sushi was great. The salmon was perfectly fresh, and the tempura shrimp nicely cooked. Good rice, too. The lady next to me ONLY got happy hour food-- no alcohol at all-- and they were just as nice to her-- no grudging the lack of drink-buying. It's an attractive space and a pleasant Happy Hour environment. This place gets a thumbs-up by me.

FIGwB4Oh8lN37zzWigjK9w.text: Beautiful view of the strip.  Service was fast, but a little off putting in the haughty way.  We got the shimi roll, a rainbow roll (not on menu), wagyu beef potstickers and soft shell lobster roll.  Food was delish but not out of this world.  I regret not getting the tasting menu at $120.  Would have given 4 stars, but they messed up the bill and charged me several drinks that I did not order.

zMBIu2YgtoB1nW-ySbGArg.text: Wow. I've been lucky enough to eat at some wonderful sushi restaurants where we live in NYC, LA and Vegas when we're visiting but I'm truly impressed by Sushi Roku! They have an inventive menu and an excellent staff to guide you through a unique experience in an unexpected place for such a different type of sushi meal - the forum shops at Caesars Palace. It needs to be said that my entire experience was 100% elevated by one of the best servers I've ever met - Maiko - thank you for taking the time to guide us through an extensive menu and helping us curate our order, personalizing it to us. I'm sure you had many tables but you made us feel like a priority - you made our night, thank you!!

A5eQG22ySfh-avYIC-SNcA.text: Pleasantly surprised with the quality of sushi here. Everything is fresh as can be including some killer uni and monk fish liver. The black cod was also cooked just right. Good vibe and space with good views of the strip. If you're looking for top notch sushi this place has it covered just that it comes at a premium price. But it is Vegas and someone has to pay for all those lights.

Da27MHBBopHewwUi0vhGWA.text: Ok, I understand. It's Vegas and the primary object of the town is to separate me from my cash as quickly and painlessly as possible.  But to be charged 120.00 for 2nd rate sushi is a little much. Understand, it wasn't bad, the Uni was not #1 grade. The Saba had a strange spoiled note, but overall everything was ok. But the price was absurd, the quality overall was second string and I walked away feeling a little used. I was a volunteer and made the decision to eat here. If the bill had been 40-50, no problem. But it wasn't. Eat somewhere else.

LtdV25Efg6FdSPN-BixBWg.text: This is another 2 star 4 star averaging out to 3 star type place.    The 2 star stuff.... Don't get me wrong, the food was awesome.  But I walked out feeling like an idiot for paying what I did for what I got.  Eighteen bucks for spicy tuna with shrimp, cilantro, and avocado?  Ouch.  It did have 10 pieces, but they were the size of one of those budget happy hour California rolls you get for 3 or 4 bucks at a normal sushi place.  The baked lobster roll only had 6 pieces, barely fit for an appetizer (and the asparagus spear inside was about half of the volume of the interior of the roll).   The 4 star stuff.... The view of the strip was pretty sweet, although it was predominated by the Caesar's Palace TV thing.  The decor was nice, very dark and trendy/classy.  The service was great, they were very attentive and even brought out some cheesecake for my friend's birthday.  The fish was very fresh (impressive, being in the middle of the dessert) and everything tasted very good.  Simple, elegant flavors with a lot of attention to presentation.  The sake selection was extensive and had a decently priced and very good house sake and a 3-sake tasting flight with big pours.    The funny thing is, I'd come back.  It's hard to find good sushi and even though I felt pretty dang close to being ripped off, this was good sushi.  I'll probably try some other places nearby first.  Oh, and this would be a fantastic date place.

n8G3pEU6-BpYvD2LELK2Cw.text: Great place, reasonable prices, and great quality. We enjoyed grilled chicken, eel rolls and salads

aUF1n6EIe8sef4IHbhhyhQ.text: My husband and I enjoy sushi and the reviews recommended this place. I DO NOT agree. The atmosphere was nice. The Sea Bass skewers were delicious. Service was average. However, everything else we ordered tasted like it came from a dirty street corner eatery. We ordered three kinds of sushi none of which tasted good. The tea was the worst. It smelled and tasted like fish water. I do not recommend this place.

sFW0v_oWGowy523x3dZhqQ.text: Unbelievable meal.  The only way to go imo is to do the omakase at the sushi bar.  That way you're literally salivating at what's coming up next.  Call ahead and make sure Kichi is the chef that night.  Every course is like heaven.  Comes to about $90/per person not including alcohol and would gladly spend that again anytime my friends want a fantastic sushi dinner on the strip.

L_k1NIreqKvAYoJXBnIm-A.text: On our girls trip to Vegas this past weekend, we were craving something other than the typical Vegas quick-fix like burgers and tacos. Instead, we literally took a journey down Las Vegas Blvd, through Caesar's casino, through the Forum Shoppes to get to our destination.  We were quickly led to a table that overlooked Las Vegas Blvd. This restaurant is gorgeous and one of the best decorated Japanese restaurants I've been to. Even their bathroom is art in itself. Us 5 girls sat in one of the leather booths in the middle of the main dinning hall. 4 of us ordered the lunch special of teriyaki salmon with tempura or sashimi that came with a side of miso soup, salad, and rice (about $17-$19), and the last lady ordered 2 sushi rolls (their rolls vary from $12-$30). We had 2 large hot sakes which gave us girls about 4 shots each. Don't waste your money here because those shots did absolutely NOTHING! For $9 a bottle, put your money towards a Fat Tuesday drink instead.  The salmon, tempura, miso soup, and rolls were pretty good. However the salad was a different story. For a salad that took up almost half a plate, why did it feel like only 2 spoonfuls of dressing was mixed in? I'm not a dinosaur. I don't eat grass and plants and greens by itself. Yuck.   Our bill for lunch came out to $125. Luckily we were only 5 because like all major restaurants, 18% gratuity is added to a party of 6 or more. If you're looking to spend around $30 for one of their special sushi rolls, come here. Other than that, look for a better lunch special elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BHxC5PdgFgyGAjGJ6xeaNA.text: We went there since it was suppose to be the "happening" sushi place on the strip. While sushi was good, I didn't find this place that much fun. The view of the strip is quite spectacular though.

hJXFtwQa81LhDSto-uZk6w.text: View was awesome. Sushi so so. Do not order the toro. Lmao quite the rip off. Other then that it was a fun place

f0H-0u5i1Yd9NnhBtU4lvQ.text: Great ambience, exceptional service and over the top food.  I have been to this location many times and it has been consistently top notch.  Usually get the "Omakase" (chefs choice).  I have tasted many different offerings and everything is fresh and tasty.  Not a sushi person...they do have beef as well and I wouldn't pass that up either.  I am told all their chefs are master sushi chefs from Japan...and it shows.  If you're looking for a $10-15 meal...this is not the place for you.

q-ocfBCf3ispfsh6WxVEJg.text: This place was horrible! When we first got there the wait staff was a bit rude (not usual for vegas). There was plenty of seating but we were sat with a view of the mall, when asked to move they said the other part of the restaurant was closed but after we got our food they sat people by the windows?!?!? Didn't make any sense! This place was very over priced for such crappy food and service. I will never go back.

a9EZHEwUQ-doFZBHH62GPQ.text: Typical high end Vegas restaurant which in no way is a bad thing. Fantastic atmosphere, very interesting decor, our waitress was very knowledgeable and attentive. Service overall very good. The food was prepared and presented extremely well. Everything we ordered we thought was excellent. We had a couple different types of spicy rolls along with some yellow tail tuna sashimi which was incredible. We also had some raw kobe beef, yakatori and some tempura seafood which was also fantastic. Even the little bowl of miso soup I had was exceptional. We sat right at the windows with an incredible view of the strip. You will pay the price for this level of quality and surroundings but as a special occasion sushi place, I would certainly go again. Was a great place for a special date night.

UqQGtBDEfkYMLV-FykNCdA.text: DON'T DO IT!  You're in Vegas, looking for a dining hot spot, and you're gonna be tempted to buy into the the Sushi Roku hype.  Don't do it!  I'm usually skeptical of people who give a place 1 star - I mean how bad could it have been if a sophisticated Yelper went there in the first place, right?  But I have NO idea how this place has 4 stars: there is nothing special AT ALL about the food, the service was pretty poor, and the prices are outrageous.  I've figured out why people go here - there's very little sushi competition in Vegas.  But that doesn't mean it deserves 4 stars.  I think Vegas restaurants must beget a chicken-head lemming syndrome (i.e. girls who didn't pay for the meal highlighting that they have wealthy boyfriends who take them to Vegas headline spots in order to impress their "friends" on Yelp).  I hope I'm wrong, but I don't think I am.  A group of us ordered a wide variety of a ton of food there this past weekend for dinner on Saturday night.  I personally tried a few pieces from the Chef's sashimi selection, the braised pork belly, and a couple rolls (crab dynamite and tempura shrimp).  The fish was fresh and tasty, but that's to be expected right?  To me, that's just securing fresh inventory via reliable transportation, so the credit should go to the inventory buyer, not the chef.  While I realize that rolls are the good-intentioned, but unaccomplished cousin in a good sushi restaurant, shouldn't they be pretty easy to make fairly enjoyable?  These were entirely forgettable.  The pork belly was well prepared from a cooking standpoint, but was gaudily overseasoned with ginger, which everone knows can easily overpower a dish.  Another point that irked me was that we made a 9:30PM reservation after a Cirque show.  We showed up early, waited an hour, then were given 2 separate tables for 12 people, despite having requested one large table for our group.  We declined the two tables and waited a while longer to be seated at a clearing large table.  I usually don't mind being split up, but in this case ppl had flown from all over the country to meet in Vegas 1 year after graduating from b-school - we wanted to sit together, and weren't asked about being split up.  The food took FOREVER to order and FOREVER to come.  The waitstaff noticed how long it took, so they brought our group 4 free desserts, which was a nice gesture, but only delayed them bringing the check and prolonged a dinner that took 3.5 hours and killed the rest of our night in which we were planning to drop in on a lounge.  To summarize: Minus one star: Food flavor Minus one star: Service (our servers had great attitudes, but at a place like this, execution is what counts, not intentions) Minus one star: Value (I don't mind paying a premium for great food, service, and overall experience...but this wasn't any of those) Minus one star: overall poor experience from waiting one hour despite being early for our reservation to having post-dinner plans nixed due to slow service.  Would not recommend to anyone and would not return...can forgo sushi/japanese in Vegas and just get it here in LA.

h_3nvSn_L-QNeWrLHg248g.text: The sushi was ok,but they have trouble cooking a steak properly.  First one was too wel done and second was too rare.  Service was ok.  Not sure I'd go back.  Mostly empty on a saturday night should have been a tip off.  The view is great!!!

fXb97IHYvGGpdPdRYKHe2g.text: This restaurant is a fancy contemporary Japanese restaurant with extremely beautiful ambiance. The menu is quite large, with some traditional items, fancy, unhealthy rolls, as well as a couple of entrees as well. I tried the kobe beef skewers that was a bit overcooked to me. Perhaps that was their take on it, but I definitely think that kobe is best cooked to the minimal. I was not too impressed. The slow cooked pork dish with rice however, was delicious! The pork was so tender and the sauce was amazing. I would definitely have that dish again! Great view of the strip as well, and the service was decent but not the best. Pricing is decent for a nicer restaurant like this. Solid 3 stars.

BoWAWfcFWQUxHqUCPEr9gA.text: i made reservations for vday here they took my CC down to hold the reservation. then afterwards i realized they were a chain so i was hesitant to go through with it but seeing as how they were gonna charge me $25/pp i kept the booking. and IT WAS WORTH IT! the service was good but the meal was better!! had AMAZING yellowtail sashimi appetizer with scallion and ponzu sauce, then we did a Katana roll and added cream cheese to it (i know, how fraudulent) and then my bf and i shared the RibEye cooked to the most perfect medium i've ever had. everything was delicious! i admit a bit pricey but it was vegas and valentine's day so we let it go. a great view of the strip and really nice place. the only thing was the seat cushions we sat on had little room to spare between us and the table so if youre a bigger person or have big thighs then..id steer clear of those booths.

aPwgEJnN4LpNVGDq2wd7KQ.text: My fiance & I love this place.  They have a happy hour in the bar only, but a few good food choices & drink discounts.  We have eaten in the main restaurant a few times too and enjoyed everything we have had.  Try the Tokyo Cooler drink...very fruity & delicious.

EeOkgRsxwmdn7aLe5-eBkQ.text: A great place to make you feel like you're NOT in Vegas, and what a view from the dining room!  Although dinner can get expensive, it's worth it every once in a while; what's even better is the Happy Hour at the bar- delicious rolls and small appetizers for cheap; it's calm and the bartenders and waitstaff are friendly but not too talky, which is great.  Went there almost every day for two weeks straight on a business trip- totally worth it.

3NZ6pssVAFXS1NDTd0XLkA.text: From 4-6 PM every single day of the week, you can go and forget that bitch, Lady Luck, totally ditched you at the baggage carousel, that you lost this month's mortgage at the Craps table, and that the "hot" slot machine you sat with for so long was nothing but a tease. Because from 4-6 every day at Sushi Roku, you can pretend that you're a high roller, order a large Kirin beer, a spicy tuna roll, a shrimp tempura and jalapeno roll, an order of spicy prawns and chips, and a mini chocolate volcano cake off the Happy Hour menu. And when you get the bill that's less than $20, you can feel like you've just hit the progressive jackpot. Except that you are still leaving with an even lighter wallet. But at least you don't have to worry about paying that pesky winnings tax.

3D9M--1fcPo7-7vUoHnBrQ.text: Best california roll I've ever had made with fresh alaskan king crab and not the imitation crab roll.  I also got some yellowfin sushi that was delicious. Service was excellent and I really enjoyed sitting at the sushi bar.  The chefs cut up fresh whole fish right there.

UGcnZ9q7oGQ7m2YzVKpIIQ.text: I went there for lunch during my last trip to LV.  The environment is pretty nice, and the decoration is modern, but the service is kind of slow even though there weren't too many customers when we were there.  We ordered the lunch combo from their lunch menu.  The food is just ok.  Everything is just on the average level, but I was expecting it would be better given the price they charge.  So overall, this is not really a place you must try in Vegas.

wheUJ0duQOFBEQr5U6tKYw.text: Sushi Roku was a great experience for us.  My boyfriend and I stopped there on the way to a Circ show at the Wynn.  The food was delicious and the service was nice.  I will admit, there wasn't much of a crowd when we went, but that's better for us.  We sat at the sushi bar and asked the chef to create something special for us, and boy did he ever.  He delivered some very fresh sashimi, served with truffles....yummy!  It was not cheap, but so worth it.  It u want cheap, go to sushiRUS!

Oe9TuLQ7ioDNP9NJ8d1lpQ.text: Decoration: Very unique and love the wall decoration. if you are interested in presentation, Should check out thsi place  Food: Wide vareity, fresh fish in the middle of desert .  Service: Excellent.   Why only 3 stars?? very expensive when you order one meat dish ( grill beef on the stone) and rest sushi

Rf3QrY78MF2gpmk_XHuyVg.text: While the view alone might be reason enough to dine here, I would recommend just having drinks and enjoying the vista because the food here is not good.  It's expensive, yes, but most things on the strip in Las Vegas are.  If it were expensive and quality it would be well worth it, but it is expensive and lacks quality.

fxaUh8Wt91LM98s2BgRmeQ.text: This place was recommended to us by a local at our hotel. Ambiance was great. Service was great. Food not so much. A coworker and I were there Saturday evening. We took suggestions from the chefs menu that day, an appetizer recommended by the waitress, sashimi, and then some rolls. Maybe we didn't order the right items but nothing seemed fresh. Really disappointed because I had high expectations going in.

2g-9QVozhk1kZrnwr2tnEQ.text: Sushi was good but not as good as Sushi Samba in Venetian mall which was cheaper.  We only ordered basic rolls: eel avocado was best tasting,  shrimp tempura was somewhat disappointing.  Big plus for waiter though, he was very friendly and patient even after it was apparent we were only order a few basic rolls and water.

2i8dLa3iQztd_j53HnNPjQ.text: Came in to the restaurant, seated, and given a wine list. No one came after that to take care of my order or even asked for my drink order. I was there for a bussiness trip but I was alone since my colleague left the day before. 15 minutes went by, NO ONE served me water or even asked me my order, not even gave me a dinner menu (I had to ask myself, even so, no one took care of my order, even after I tried to catch their attention).  A group of 4 people came in. A waiter IMMEDIATELY asked for their drink order!!! Is one person bussiness not as important as 4 people? Is this how you treat your customer? My night was ruined and I was disappointed! I told the ladies at the front desk about it and they said "really?" as if they did not believe me. I left the restaurant because I felt that I was treated unfair and that my business was not important. Who wants to eat their food after that? I work for a large coorporate company and I don't recommend your restaurant at all to my colleagues, an yes, we do a lot of of business in Vegas!

Z1INTPYISoFn1w_ilY4InQ.text: Very nice sushi place.  The service is great, the sushi is fresh but some of them were not fully closed, And were opened while holding a piece of cut sushi with the chopsticks.  Great view and location.

AGwl3TH62DFxC7aeMAm1Ng.text: Always great service and good food. A great variety of raw and cooked items. A view of the Ling Hotel and the strip.

8fT6AfbZSuLBOjMDNO13RQ.text: I was recommended to try Sushi Roku located in the Forum Shops and I'm glad I did.   The restaurant itself is nicely decorated.  I liked the decor that's on the restrooms doors. (See photo)   Service:  From the time I walked in to leaving the restaurant I felt like I was special.  I was warmly greeted by a young lady in which I mentioned that I would be dining alone and would like a view of the strip.  DONE! She sat me right along the windows that overlooked the south side of the strip.   Hugo, my server, was very helpful in recommending a sushi of my liking. He kept coming around to make sure that I liked my dish and we got to chit chat a little about the food.   (I don't eat raw fish often but in this case I figure I'd try it and see if it was fresh)  I'm glad I did. My sushi was topped with Tuna that was yummy and fresh. I also informed him that I don't like too much jalapeno's  so he made sure it was on the side rather than wrapped in my sushi.  The miso soup was tasty and very flavorful and I washed it down with a Blue Moon.  ( I know I should've had a Sapporo instead)   My experience here was amazing that whenever I'm in Vegas I will definitely return.

Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Panko Shrimp

OoXGFHuFrZ6y9T9KxqKmAg.text: Creatively different sushi, with surprising combination of flavors and textures. All our orders came out great.Delicious fresh cocktails as well. Service was friendly and prompt.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. balsamic strawberry cocktail
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UNrw-LXDPERda1Kv9PFOsg.text: Thieves!  Had a nice business meal a couple weeks ago.  Spent close to $700 that evening. But when I got my credit card statement they added an additional $300!  What the server or manager did was changed the first digit of the tip!! Called the manager and he responded with "oops".  Unbelievable!

wOiGeQ8Kn5aXb4IcCF0wPA.text: Walked the entire strip to have dinner here. Showed up during happy hour. The food was excellent and came out quickly. The spicy tuna on crispy rice, calamari and crispy shrimp are all to die for. We also got a few rolls including California, Crispy Shrimp w/ Jalapeno and Spicy Tuna on top of Crispy Shrimp. We enjoyed them all. Annie, our bartender/server, was very easy going, sweet and friendly. All in all, it was a great experience.

hcSfc_9JM8eqxu18877BKA.text: One of the best sushi spots in Vegas hands down!! And don't worry, if you don't like sushi, there are so many other options for you.  I was very impressed with this place. My sister and I dined here for a girls night and they took such great care of us. We got a seat with a view, when it was packed. The manager comped our dessert, just cause. Literally, I would give them 10 stars if I could. It seemed like the type of place to take care of their regulars, and locals.  A couple of the dishes that stood out to me were the Jumbo Shrimp, and King Crab fried rice.  The shrimp was served with potato style chips, and a creamy sauce. I am still wondering what was in that sauce. It had a savory, yet sweet honey butter flavor. So delicious.  The crab fried rice just hit the spot. There were huge chunks of crab, and the dish was packed with flavor. No need to add soy or hot sauce to this one.  There were a dozen or so sushi options, and a variety of small sharable plates, or full size entrees.  Park valet at the Forum Shops to avoid the tourist traffic. From food, to service, and even price, I was highly impressed all around. I can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King crab rice
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyoza with kimchi
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo shrimp and chips

FEKELb2hIEA7avQbWnk5OA.text: Short Story: Vegas has some good sushi?!  I'm surprised...  Long Story: I came here for lunch on Thursday, and it was not crowded.  We were promptly seated and we ordered the Karaage appetizer, the Teriyaki salmon, and the beef Teriyaki.  All the dishes were good and they came with sashimi.  I got to say, the sashimi was good, though I didn't have high expectations as this was Vegas...and not hear the coast.  It did take a bit of time to get our food, but it was forgivable.    Verdict: I would go back if and when I go back to Vegas.  Though I'm sure there are other good places to go too.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EjJgke6EML8FDBJZguS_Cw.text: Great food - we had a couple of rolls, miso and some amazing seabass skewers. Service was fabulous. We are at 8 on a Friday and there was NO wait. Perhaps people don't know you can go out the doors in Ceasear's by FIZZ and walk down the driveway for a 2 min walk to sushi Roku instead of wandering through the mall for a 10 min walk! We did the meandering walk back but when we were hungry the fast walk was better!

xarE7xp-E4BzHl8yIKKUGA.text: Our friends and us wanted to try this restaurant, I have always liked the one in Pasadena....We got seated at a window seat with great views of the strip, very beautiful.   My gf and I ordered specialty cocktails, both were sweet and refreshing, but a little weak.   Our food: Filet Mignon with Ginger Teriyaki Sauce, Japanese style potatoes, sauteed garlic beans: it was cooked perfect to medium rare, hubby liked the sauce, I liked the beans.   Miso soup: nothing special, it was OK  Premium sashimi (10 pc): they were very fresh and tasty, loved it.   Our friends food: 3 orders of albacore, baked lobster roll, California roll: I tried a little bit of each dish, they were yummy, but nobody liked the baked lobster roll too much, a little too creamy for our taste. They couldn't even finish their food, kept asking me to eat more. No problem, I love sushi too much.   The food was delicious, service was great, plus the amazing views, a very pleasant double dinner date, we enjoyed it so much.   I am a big fan of sushi Roku, it never disappoints!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Premium sashimi $50
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IDW9B9VSoz-PHu50xLwJsw.text: We went to Sushi Roku on their 10th anniversary day for the special menu.  - Shima roll: shrimp wrapped spicy tuna, cilantro & avocado - Katana roll: spicy tuna & shrimp tempura topped with tuna & yellowtail - Filet Mignon-wrapped asparagus - Popcorn shrimp tempura with spicy creamy sauce  A solid Americanized Sushi joint, priced high-end. Although it was good, I would say Katsuya and Nobu are better.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shima roll: shrimp wrapped spicy tuna, cilantro &amp; avocado
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katana roll: spicy tuna &amp; shrimp tempura topped with tuna &amp; yellowtail

IOXw-FeHn9k9KZF0wrec2Q.text: Make a reservation in advance so you can just walk in....  We went there for a birthday celebration and they went out of their way to make it perfect.  Great service, fantastic food and a dessert with a flame thrower on top....seriously...  One thing I like about yelp is when I make a reservation, I can discretely use the comments to make a birthday dessert request, etc...

NiVyUVhWz5HUnot2EEdVJg.text: Like everything in Las Vegas, this place is overpriced for what it is.  However, the few sushi rolls that were under $20 a roll were good, but not the best I've ever had. But I guess that's what you get for ordering raw fish in the middle of the desert.

Hsa5sGW3OAS7dqL9j71qCw.text: Came here for lunch with my boss. It was alright. Very American catered sushi. Fish freshness was average.  Spicy scallop handroll (3/5) too much mayo and meh...  Salmon skin handroll (4/5) it was crispy as should be  We had a cooked roll (2/5) it was alright hence why I cant remember the name  Hamachi nigiri (3/5) not as fresh as I liked.

C42vywo0vzatlvz2t1Qc3g.text: The location of the restaurant is awesome!  The main dining area faces out onto the main LV Strip.  The service is top notch. The food taste heavenly.  The beef ribeye wrapped asparagus was awesome! You have to try it.   My wife is GF and they have an awesome GF menu for her.  I'm not GF, but I ate the GF items and there's no complain on my behave. The beef ribeye wrapped asparagus is on the GF menu.  I would come back here again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All our orders.

o7XrwBWzpWWmDOm67TMAUg.text: Fantastic spicy tuna and pot stickers.  The sushi chefs were outstanding.

X0k7Ku6mJvIV-lAJrqDqog.text: I have mixed feelings about Sushi Roku.  It's not the best, nor the worst experience I've had.  I guess if I had to sum them up in one word, it would be mediocre.  My gf and I went to Sushi Roku on our first day in Vegas.  The two of us have had omakase at some of the best restaurants NYC has to offer.  We've been to Nobu, Nakazawa, Gari, and Akio.  Seeing that Roku offered omakase made us excited as we wanted to add another feather in our cap of excellent sushi, but in truth it was a bit of a dud.  The omakase is six courses, really just three sandwiched between an appetizer and a dessert.  The appetizer was an interesting salad, the dessert was a strawberry shortcake thing that you could likely find at a local diner, and the three sushi courses were more or less forgettable.  I'd like to give you more details, but honestly that's all you need to know.  There was no ah-ha moment were I thought that they had created something special.  I can't honestly say that it was bad though and had we not previously experienced some of the most amazing sushi you could eat, we might have been more impressed.  The one highlight of Roku was the service.  We had a great sushi chef and a great server.  Our server really went the extra mile and gave us some help in finding the perfect place to watch fireworks on the 4th of July.  Additionally, the beer and spirit offerings were great.  I had a fantastic rice beer that I wish I remembered the name.  Go to Sushi Roku, just don't have the omakase.  It's not worth the price.  You'll have a good time though.

m8Ny21KZJ0rPKi9I4Wke9Q.text: This was a fantastic meal in an excellent setting.  There was a group of 6 of us eating, so we had several dishes.  The service was excellent, as we never had to wait long for new items once the food started rolling in.  Although we had primarily sushi, the star of the dish for me was the wagyu beef.  For $60, you get 6 strips of melt in your mouth steak that you cook at your table on a hot rock.  Just a dip in a soy sauce based sauce, a few seconds on the hot pot, and you are set.  The mouth feel was "melt in your mouth," the fat breaking down and the steak seemed to melt as you chewed it.  The flavor was off the charts, all agreed.  It was a great way to get a couple of bites of such an excellent piece of beef and not totally break the bank.  As I stated, we had many dishes, the standouts were the yellowtail sashimi, the crab dynamite, and a tempura shrimp roll that was a special, but I can't recall its name.  This one had a lot of spice to it, and the tempura was fantastic.  Not greasy in the slightest.  The makato roll was such a favorite we ordered another.  We tried the baked lobster roll which for me was decent, but not nearly as good as the other items we ordered.  The wife had the sauteed spicy shrimp.  They make this dish out to be spicier than it really is.  It has a nice sauce on top that has a little sweetness.  The real star of this dish was the housemade potato chips.  They went very well with the creamy sauce.  Very solid drink menu with a lot of Asian beers, which is typically my preferred drink at sushi places.  The view, as many have noted, is great of the strip.  But, if you don't want to watch cars or random people walking, you can certainly sit in areas of the restaurant that don't have the view.  Will definitely return, and highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu beef which you cook on a hot rock at the table.  This is a must order for beef lovers eating at Sushi Roku.

p-kVVjJf6HzUWPvDBErK4A.text: We only came for the happy hour, and overall, it's a good deal.  For 6 bucks, you can get simple, yet decent rolls.  Beers were also  nicely priced.  For it being the strip, it was pretty affordable.

DjlwE2LNPdz_ZXBU-THx5g.text: We used to come here often in Vegas specifically for their tuna tare tare. They have a new tuna tare tare that has a crispy dough cup that has now replaced the infamous old tuna tare tare and let me tell you it pales in comparison to the old recipe.  We requested to have the old recipe made but to our shock sushi chef said no it can't be done. I thought wow! Since when does Sushi Roku NOT accommodate their customers even if they have all the ingredients?? Any sushi place I've been to would have done this.  It was explained to us that it's a corporate thing and they want to keep the menu the same across all locations.  IMHO this dilutes the wow factor of Sushi Roku as a top notch sushi destination.  Very disappointing as this was a signature dish that is no longer available because of a corporate strategy. This is not putting your customers first.   Service was great though.  But sadly we will not be returning to our once favorite sushi destination here in Vegas because they refuse to accommodate their customers. This place has lost its lustre.

Hj4SPUSg5t26pNodya6G1g.text: While in Vegas, we were looking for a Nobu alternate.  The reviews led me to S. Roku.  The decor was expected of a Vegas restaurant - sleek, dark and trendy.  The food was comparable to any other sushi joint.  We didn't have anything that was memorable, so I guess that makes this place forgettable considering all the other options on the Strip. Also, there was a rather long wait for some items to be delivered to our table considering the place was pretty empty.

ZqzcywevGWZntpYwDB9o3w.text: Me and my company really enjoyed our dinner here. The sushi is quality, the service was great, and they willingly catered to our special needs (shellfish allergies, needed to make sure there was no cross contamination).   We were seated at table with a wonderful view of the strip below us, all in all, very ambient, romantic atmosphere. Fair prices- some of the Japanese restaurants in Vegas can go quite high, but this was fair in terms of good quality and good prices.

ZIX0U_396WVI2IYF7ECRNg.text: Love this place! My  bf and I stumbled across it by accient while exploring the Forum Shops @ Ceasars. Not only is it romantic, and candle lit, but the sushi was amazing. Very fresh and reasonably priced. The staff was phenomenal and  so attentive. I Loved  the unsweetened iced tea - it was passionfruit flavored- omg. Great ambiance. Def cozy. We had a great time there and got a beautiful picture of us there. Def recommend it and would return when Im back in sin city.

KVXkMGTZLNfjMuryV-G0dQ.text: Like this place, came the day after thanksgiving for lunch, and it was nice, the place wasn't that busy, but it meant service was great.  Waiter recommended some items that didn't disappoint.  We didn't drink, but had a look over the Saki menu, looked good.

imWNRfbhIyK61ECCu1L1gg.text: I give this place 10* for the quality of sushi. One of the freshest sampling of Uni, Toro, Mirugai, soft shell crab rolls i have every tasted. The reason for 4* is the price. $250 for a party of two is a little pricy. If you are craving sushi and have $$$ than make sure you drop by here and enjoy.

theNeZIraRijqj6BBcjk5Q.text: Decided to dine here our last night in Vegas on a whim. Needed someplace we could just walk in. This was perfect! Went early evening with my husband and another couple and were seated immediately. It was Sunday night and pretty quiet. I ordered a dirty martini right off thebat. It was served quickly and was perfect. We decided to order some soups and a couple of rolls to start. The soup was delicious, just what I want in a miso soup. The waiter was very helpful in suggesting what rolls we might like and what looked good that evening. All were quite tasty and beautifully presented, simple but beautiful. He was very patient with us as we like to order just a couple of items at a time so as not to crowd the table or over eat. Great view of the strip as well. Prices were reasonable and I would definitely come again.

IgOV6DY-ijtSMPOBtaMitw.text: We ate here for lunch. The sushi is average for the price. The crunchy spicy tuna avocado roll was yummy. I'd recommend this place for lunch, but certainly don't head here for dinner. It's in the middle of Caesars Mall smacked in between a bunch of stores.

s52i4JKHH_6HAn8nu9C_Eg.text: One of my all time favorite sushi restaurants.  The service is very attentive and helpful.  My husband and I tried the chef's 6 course tasting menu and it was fantastic.  My favorite course consisted of the oysters with 3 different sauces.  Yummy! We will defenitely return the next time we are in Vegas.

4jsTfogXQJgTTghAPeMt_w.text: Sushi Roku has become one of my favorite places to go to while in vegas.  It's tucked away on the top level of the new Forum shoppes area at Caesar's. The ambiance is something special..it feels very intimate and at the same time you get a nice view of the strip.   I've dined there three times and all have been great experiences. The first was with a group of sorority sisters, the 2nd with coworkers and third with my mommy when I treated her to Celine Dion. During my first visit, the Manager (a young gentleman) came around to talk to us. We told him we were from the Bay Area and were celebrating 2 birthdays. We chatted a bit about various sushi places in the Bay..and he gave us his business card! By the end of the night, 2 'happy birthday' dessert dishes were brought to our table, compliments of the manager! During the second visit, the same manager came around again and I mentioned I had met him a few months before. At the end of the meal we discovered a nice surprise when the bill came, our dessert dish was removed from the bill! Once again, compliments of the manager. Third time, it was just me and my mom and it was just 4 months later..once again, the nice young gentleman came around and he recognized me. I told him I was back in Vegas treating my mom for her 60th birthday to watch Celine Dion in concert...and now this was the icing on the cake (literally!) ... he ordered the dessert for us and had it delivered to our table as soon as we were done with our main course.. because he didn't want us to be late for the concert!  Once again, compliments of the manager..   Now, besides all that luck (or coincidence that he is just always there when i'm there) ...the food is superb. I started to wonder how fresh seafood gets to the middle of the desert and stays fresh. But I immediately forgot about all that once I started eating at this place. Also, from my 3 experiences there I think i've tried all the dessert dishes. They're all delicious and the presentation is lovely.   Go to Sushi Roku ...and don't forget the dessert! =)

UGbFd50_Ojjj3jfRSh9FkQ.text: I was lucky enough to be with a group who all got the Omakase (chef's menu). That said, we had most delicious, freshest things that could be prepared that evening. Service was great, and presentation was lovely. Lots of high-end ingredients. I won't pretend this was cheap... its pricey, but the food was worth it. The wine menu is unfortunate... small selection, and crazy-over-priced.   If you really appreciate sushi, and are looking for tasty bites in the desert, swing through for sure. If you have the time, order the Omakase... it was so yummy!!!  oh! and the view from the booths was GREAT!

SeTaZjc42_9je0qOyZGzSA.text: Sleek contempary room with good people viewing seats within the Forum shops rotunda.  Very good sushi, very good service, reasonable prices by Vegas standards.  Worth a visit if you are in a sushi mood.

I7FWXS4DWx7ojhr6Yx6_EA.text: Located inside Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, Sushi Roku did not disappoint. First, our waiter Sherman Fu was exellent! Attentive, great with recommendations and very polite. We started with cocktails - the Sweet Poochi was deliiiicious, followed by an amazing Omakase menu - 6 courses at the chef's discretion, made with the day's freshest fish - all original and timed to arrive just at the right moment as we finished the previous dish. We left there extremely satisfied!

nPGSurDnIobgnnnTXEmfMg.text: I was in Vegas for a convention but made a mistake in planning the trip so I arrived a day early. I deciding on what to eat and was staying at Caesar's Palace and remembered that this place was in the Forum Shops at Caesar's so I decided on having lunch there. It was a Wednesday afternoon and the place was pretty empty which is a far cry from what it usually is like at night. I sat at the sushi bar and had one of their lunch combos (sashimi and tempura) and added an order of fatty tuna sushi. This was really tasty. I hadn't had sushi in a while and it really hit the spot. I also got a chance to chat with the head sushi chef, Kiichi, who was a really cool guy. I've been to the other Sushi Rokus (Santa Monica and Pasadena) but this one is my favorite. This place is highly recommended, but be prepared, it is not cheap.

sATJCvyzEp8w7jSTjGCFRQ.text: I ate here with a large group of girlfriends during my bachelorette weekend and was impressed with both the food and the atmosphere.  The view of the strip is excellent, and it is very chic inside.  We ordered a multitude of rolls and they were both aesthetically pleasing and delicious.  I recommend the sparkling blueberry sake (if you like sweet wine) and the scallop appetizer.  As with most sushi restaurants, it was quite pricey, but well worth it overall.  I would definitely return here in a group or on a date.

Clc5mNcgCqsF3ZLxsd3_yw.text: Ambiance: Great view of the Las Vegas strip if you sit near the window, nice dark interior  trendy decor, and the bathrooms were even nice!  Service: Top-notch service, couldn't ask for anything more.  Food:  I will make this short and sweet.  Me and my girlfriend both agreed we had the best roll (Spicy Dragon Roll)and best prime rib steak we ever tasted.  YES thats right, the best steak we have ever had was here at a Japanese restaurant.  Order the Prime Rib steak, SO juicy SO tendy SO flavorful.  Overall: Yes this place is a little pricey, but this is Las Vegas and this is not bad in comparison to other fine dining options.  The quality of food you are getting lives up to it.

DH85eU9Ix22rDjMKmyx_0w.text: Good sushi spot, cool views of the strip. typical vegas prices, ie you get half the quality at twice the price, but how else can they build all those casinos? cant rely on gambling loses anymore i guess. we very much enjoyed the meal. sushi was VERY slow coming out. everything else was quick  and good.

3ebZG1RsI6dOM9Z-MGOaVg.text: This place is located in the Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace.  The closest entry point from outside the hotel is via the valet parking (actually free, but tip req'd) at the forum shops.  We got there earlier than our reservation (a Sunday) and they were able to accomodate us.  We got a table w/ a great view of the strip looking southbound.  Very sleek, modern interior, dark, loud modern music.  We ordered: eggplant app (yummy), pork korubata (good but fatty and not for sharing), seaweed salad, kobe beef and scallop app (beef was too chewy), california roll, unagi avocado roll, and the chicken entree (a bit dry).  The rolls were alright, nothing elaborate for their pricepoint, perhaps the nigiri/sashimi would have been better?  They had a nice assortment of small plates that we should have stuck with.

Q5mxMdDjRkyvaqgzp3erPg.text: I went here a few months ago with some friends while visiting Vegas for a friends birthday, our server was amazing and helpful when trying to figure out what to order. The food was amazing and the atmosphere was great for a few lunchtime drinks with friends.

qSmPXWGMyaO3Ztz_0WB_mQ.text: The sushi was better than ok. The curry flavored sushi was not a hit, don't know the name of it now. We ate there last friday night  with the kiddies without a reservation and there was no wait. Wait staff was nice. They offered us free dessert afterwards, don't know why, i think the hostess was enamored with my daughter, who knows? The bill for two adults was 166- so a little pricey. the sashimi with chiles was my favorite.

Za207WDAiBLZRcYgzXtwdg.text: Arrived a little late and needed to rush the order so we could make a show.  The waiter was extremely helpful and ended up being an interesting guy who chatted with us a little.  The decor and view were pretty good, and I'm a sucker for their Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus.  Everything arrived quickly and we managed to get in and out in time for the show.

823MNVwVjLMN4cyJRwe9lw.text: OMG! I don't know why they only have 4 stars! They are the absolute place I have ever been to! And I have been to so many places to eat.  This is a must spot to eat at when you come to Vegas!!!!!!

wXhRvrYe32QOKH_AwdmECw.text: Loved this place!  Firstly, service and atmosphere make this restaurant very welcoming and comfortable. Great views of the strip, or cozy interior table with a modern decor. When you walk in, all the sushi chefs greet you !   Secondly, the food was ever so good. The best agedashi tofu I've had to date and somehow, they made simple avocado rolls just full of flavor. So good! Almost ordered seconds!..  My husband and I ordered a bunch of small plates to share - vegetable tempura, agedashi tofu, avocado rolls, and avocado & fried rice tartine. Considering that this is a sushi place, they had many good options for vegans!   Everything was just amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado rolls and unagi sushi
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Agedashi tofu
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Agedashi tofu

w9dWDe45ypFYNSrzkU7ibA.text: Great service, good steak, and good sashimi.  The bloody mary was..ok.  Good spot to have a mellow lunch

bQlkABc84PqMosdpVdHmhA.text: The sushi here was so amazing and fresh, so very happy we popped in... after a long day of shopping this sashimi hit the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

amMZZkshvKrRoD7QUFN8Sg.text: We are back at our favorite japanese restaurant! Master chef Haru made special creations for us and its absolutely great! I highly recommend chef Haru if you want to try off the menu special sashimi creations! The seafood here is always top notch and service is always impeccable! The rib eye is also very tender and tasty. We will definitely be back next time we are here in vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Master chef at the far left busy preparing our specials
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tempura!!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue crab, uni and caviar tatare

F4B1hVJgtLD343wO8HJs1A.text: This place is great! A little pricey but well worth it. Ordered the miso Soup, California rolls and my table got an assortment of rolls. I also ordered the green tea, but it had a nutty flavor to it. The rolls were fresh and all the ingredients were fresh as well. Soup was super delicious and my water glass never stayed empty. We had extremely attentive wait service and when we called and made the reservation, they asked if we were celebrating anything and have us donuts with a firework candle. Wonderful atmosphere and clean bathrooms. Would definitely recommend this sushi spot if you're in Vegas

q6_y4VnywluF4TSYe4EFsA.text: Absolutely THE best sushi place in Las Vegas!  Johnny Seo is a class act!  If you have a special occasion definitely let him know!  He and his staff will make it unforgettable!  Not to mention their menu is astounding and the fish is some of the best I have ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strip View!

3yi6AsUsc4Sl2e87XduBbA.text: Great sushi and service! Highly recommend the Katana roll and brussel sprouts with truffle oil.

9_fP_Mg0rVSgCyvu8b5wJA.text: I'm no expert in sushi but I certainly eat a lot of it. I've been to supposedly world class sushi restaurants and regularly drop circa $200 or more on sushi for 2 before the drink tab. Sushi Roku is a solid choice. If you want to eat on the strip, definitely recommended. Unfortunately, like just about all strip restaurants, there's better in the suburbs for a whole lot less money.   Service: knowledgeable, friendly, accommodating, an asset.   Atmosphere: I'm not into a shopping mall atmosphere's but my gf liked it. Casual, as opposed to some better sushi houses that make you feel like they're doing you a favor seating you.   Food: very good ingredients, recipes (where relevant), rice (so easy to mess up) and presentation.

hwGMw7RmpPhI2RXKjY8rlw.text: great people I enjoy myself they take care of me,  the main thing, Chef Allen was great the host everybody with good the staff and crew!!!! Best sushi on the Strip!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2_U5xByZKL8qKQvVa0XCNA.text: Good service.  Sushi chefs weren't very chatty.  The portions on the albacore very good. Also had a nice soft shell crab roll.  Loved that they had fresh wasabi.  The only black eye... was the crunchy spicy tuna roll was awful.  I would have given 4 stars of not for the last roll.  I'm pretty open minded when it comes to food but it really was awful in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spider roll and albacore tuna

RQL5pV1ZGCb89GStqggpkw.text: My fiance and I decided to wait for our anniversary dinner until we visited Las Vegas and we decided to give Sushi Roku a try. Man, am I glad I did!  I called to place the reservation and they asked if we were celebrating anything. I gave them a cursory answer about a late anniversary not expecting anything and locked in a later reservation.  We arrived and were seated immediately and they had no problem with a request for a view of the strip while we ate. The restaurant is quite and the ambiance was great. It was darker so you had more of an illusion of being alone and the server was extremely attentive!  My fiance ordered the Pork Belly Fried Rice and was smitten from her first bite. She didn't have to add any soy, a first for her! She loved ever bit and it was still good when we ate our leftovers almost 3 hours later, cold.  I had the "Chef's Choice" sushi platter. 8 pieces of finely crafted sushi, all with their own signature sauces. Eat bite was unctuous, delectable, and so satisfying!
