I couldn't remember them all, but the Uni, the Scottish Salmon & the King Crab leg were to die for!  At the end of the meal the wait staff surprised us with a complimentary chocolate lava cake that was the highlight of the meal. They even wrote Happy Anniversary on the plate, a special treat that showed they really paid attention to their customers!  We'll definitely be going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Fried Rice, amazing flavor!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef&#39;s Choice 8 piece sushi plate, possibly the best sushi I&#39;ve ever tasted!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view of the Strip from our table.

Lgq165mlfZ2Wl7E1g4oMKg.text: If I could give half stars, I would rate this place 3.5 stars. Portions are small for the price, quality is quite good - but nothing amazing. It's quite pricey but I was ok with it factoring in the decor that was beautiful. Service was excellent.   So somewhat mixed feelings about the place. Would I go back? Maybe, there just isn't any great sushi deals on the strip.

nFZK-x1dItTuKpU2nptC0w.text: Good fresh sushi. I had all the fish sashimi and they were all decent sized cuts and tasted very fresh. We also had the baked lobster roll, a tuna jalapeno, and a salmon roll. Good stuff.  Good service. We didn't have to wait for a party of 3 on a Friday night. Waitress was attentive.  Nice environment but our table and seating was a bit cramped.  Pricey but it's Vegas so whatever.

ag09essubU5rBwM7lF3HaQ.text: first time here, was recommended by a friend! a lot of unique sushi choices... we order the Brussel sprouts chips for an appetizer which was perfect cause it was a good snack and not so fulling so you can enjoy your meal. I ordered the toro-jalepeno roll which was about 8 pieces.. I also ordered the spicy scallop hand roll.. I did expect the scallops to be fresh but it was cooked but still delicious! We also ordered the crispy shrimp appetizer which was sooooo good! my friend ordered the chicken fried rice and the rice was perfectly cooked and nice and soft! my friends got other rolls as well but I don't remember exactly what rolls but they said it was amazing! After words, we ordered cheesecake and mochi for dessert which was delicious as well! I would definitely come back when in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. brusel sprouts chips
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. crispy shrimp
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. toro-jalepeno roll (bottom) spicy scallop hand roll (middle)

6IuQQDNIgPJBAxKwMPXtRw.text: Worst edamame I've had in my entire life.  It came out brown.   They told us our order made it in time for happy hour then said it wasn't.  Sushi was good, otherwise it would be a one star.

TI5pFUlYNy9S15Wx8qsGEg.text: The food and the service are outstanding!    The Roku Tower Rocks!    Will definitely come back again.

AWrMeaxcJk37WNnRZn8NWw.text: It's been awhile since we've been here as we're from San Diego, but holy cow this was very good. We sat at the bar and Ricardo was our bartender. Super guy! Very friendly and attentive. We like having ginger with our rolls, didn't say anything and next you know we have a small bowl of ginger next to us.

L0oq0_eM33Z4ZM7XU5wE-A.text: Like market sushi... $6-$7value market sushi quality.... So bad food.  ... .... .....

nVX4CRhFcJQO3QweCj2D0g.text: This has got to be one of the absolute best Happy Hours in Vegas - certainly the best on the Vegas Strip.  We came over after riding the High Roller...  it's very conveniently located to the Linq in the Forum Shops at Caesars.  It's on the very top floor tucked away in a corner...    HH is 4-7 on Sunday through Thursday and 4-6 on Friday and Saturday.  You can easily make a delicious meal out of their outstanding Happy Hour, which is what we did.  Skip the line and walk on into the front bar area to take advantage of the deals.  And come early - this is justifiably popular!  Cut sushi rolls are $6 (hand rolls are only $4) and I just HAD to have the shrimp tempura with asparagus - delicious.  My SO had the vegetable roll and the unusual sweet potato tempura roll, both of which she said were fabulous.  I also had the miso glazed popcorn shrimp tempura...  this is a specialty at Sushi Roku and this HH portion was large and wonderful and only $6.  The mushroom tempura with creamy truffle miso is a very similar dish, but for vegetarians.  And it is also a large portion ($5) and just as freakin fabulous as the popcorn shrimp dish.  The HH menu is just outstanding with so many reasonably priced choices in generous portions.  And a good mix of meat/seafood AND vegetarian dishes.  There are even dessert choices at HH prices.  When you throw in that champagne is $6 a glass along with all this deliciousness...  it's pretty much impossible to imagine a more perfect Happy Hour - which easily subs for a bargain dinner that will likely be one of the best meals you will have in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu part 2!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu!

yWybT_wmslT-Ah-109kIkw.text: We ate here mainly because the online menu looked like "normal" sushi. Although when we got there, it was mostly Japanese entrees with some sushi. I personally like the Americanized sushi rolls that contain very little raw fish. I know that's not what real sushi is, but I'd rather not eat a moving octopus.  Anyways, they had some good stuff. We had the Crunchy Tuna roll and the Katana roll. The Crunch roll was amazing, it had spicy tuna inside. The Katana roll had raw tuna on the top that was like warm, not a fan of warm raw fish. But it looked nice.   The atmosphere was interesting. It was super dark inside like a fancy restaurant but the techno music was so loud that I couldn't  have a conversation at all. The staff was super nice and very helpful though.   Did I like it?; sort of. Would I come back?: No.

aTayNxNYV0f1PIt_LsZW4Q.text: Lewis is an amazing server.  This was my fourth or fifth time here and this was my best experience. Lewis created a tasting menu for us that was bar none over the top delicious. We had the starter of yellowtail and ahi tuna tar tar followed by waygu steak wrapped asparagus and tempura shrimp (this was my least favorite). Then the lamb chop and sea bass skewers finished with a sushi combo of three of the top selling pieces. In conclusion, if you want an amazing experience with a server who knows the menu, see Lewis and enjoy!!

mDLBQVA1bxzX-O6Y1c104A.text: Ah... deliciously expensive.   After watching the Beatles Love show, we swung by here thanks to yelp. It took me a while to decide what to order, everything sounded pretty good, but the dollar signs were going off in my head. I ended up ordering the hamachi with heirloom tomato and watermelon salad ($18). Delicious... came with some sort of pesto dressing and all ingredients worked well together. Then the A2 roll for $12, 6 pieces with albacore, onion, cucumber and jalapeno. Unfortunately, I couldn't taste the jalapeno, but it was a decent roll. Then finally the baked crab handroll for $9. I was expecting seaweed, but it came in some sort of soy wrapper instead and was more egg roll shaped. It was yummy though. Then $3 for hot tea on top of that. I can't say that I was full, but I was satisfied. Overall a good meal, just at a higher premium.

OrQ9froli6twcxbgPvrLgA.text: I was shocked to stumble upon Roku having been at their other location in Phoenix.  My BF and I had lunch there last week. The food is amazing as always and the service was excellent!! The view is something hard to come by in Vegas and we enjoyed watching all the tourist walk down the strip.  The only issue I had is with the bartender and the man who appeared to be the Manager/GM. You can clearly hear him yelling at her in front of guest. Its so sad that people cant be pulled to the side to discuss employee related issues.

IbMo--5T7kV2q1u8rysuLA.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Vegas. The food and staff were amazing. I highly recommend to order the foie gras wrapped in yellowtail in truffle, everything from the menu you can't go strong.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cod fish
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras wrapped in yellowtail in truffle. This is delicious and amazing.

qU-piB-FUiPDPkw4mUO2Gg.text: Great sushi at a reasonable price for Vegas.  Fun staff with big smiles.  Excellent fish.  All purchased directly from Japan.

PCXjJwB6295Oq3keR_3-MA.text: It's so damn expensive.  but the food is legit.

iIXYo9VjRKm1ypd5RUXt4Q.text: Excel price, food, services during happy hour. I ordered miso eggplant, stuffed chicken in mushroom, rock shrimp tempura hand roll, albacore sashimi with fried onion, spicy yellowtail cut roll. The bartender made lychee martini and charge only  $5. The bill came $30, I paid $36total. You can't beat the service, food and price elsewhere.

nIr7ZiMZLunwVwYIv6JmVQ.text: Wow. Where do I begin? For a place so chic and modern, you'd think you'd be getting a pretty good meal.   Restaurants should NOT be comping you or sending you food because they can't deliver what you actually ordered in time. Plus, I don't want your shitty stir fry shrimp that tastes like it's from Panda Express because you're service is so slow. The lunch special sashimi with chicken and salad is a joke. The chicken was overcooked, and the salad was pathetic. I really wanted to be a bitch and send it back, but I always thought I'd just suck it up and never come back. I really worry that they think they food they're putting out is acceptable. The sashimi salad was alright, but the portion was ridiculously small. I tasted the rest of the sushi that the rest of the party had, and it was mediocre at best.   Come here if you're a "gringo" and don't care and just want some California rolls and a good view. Don't come here if you're expecting quality sushi and service for the price you're paying. Seriously disappointed!

yne0zz7J49ihrEXRqElR6g.text: Food was decent but pricy. Expected bento boxes to come with miso soup but it was extra. Sushi was very fresh but very small portions. Based on previous reviews expected a higher quality product. Would give another chance based on the great location, but there is better sushi in Vegas.

zn370xJFWKY21-u5CrRr4g.text: The Sushi was average. I found that the Eel/Avocado roll had muddy taste, like you sometimes get in catfish and talapia. Not the most appealing.   The Truffeled Sea Bass was the highlight of the meal, pefectly cooked and delicious.   The chicken fried rice and Soba noodles were average as well. Not my favorite sushi place, but a decent option if you are staying at Caesar's.

ldIbS3G1sQIW4EaYs-qX6A.text: We didn't have reservations and got seated at the restaurant front facing the Forum. Not really an ideal place since there was someone sitting just outside smoking a cigar from the neighboring restaurant.   We ordered the following: Tuna Carpaccio Chicken Karaage Shima Roll Makoto Roll  Everything tasted good except not really worth the price. All four items above totaled $75 plus tip. You are paying a premium for atmosphere. Make sure to reserve and request a table with a view of the strip if you decide to try it out.

EwHjl2IWgcAG0fORxQzwBg.text: There were six of us, and everybody was happy with their orders.  I had cold sake (excellent) but they did not have the monkfish liver sashimi that night which I was looking forward to.  The organic kale salad was very fresh and tasty.  I also had the filet foie and the lobster tempura which were exceptional.  My friends raved about the Chilean sea bass which one of them recommended since she goes to this restaurant often.  The chocolate dessert (so good I forgot the name) was delicious!!!  The service was attentive and knowledgeable.  And of course the view of the Strip from our table was unbeatable!

XFyDgydki280eCDphvtceg.text: Great sushi! Very fresh food and solid service. The beer list was good too. I had never had or seen Asahi Black before. Definitely worth a visit.

Ga8Hby9y1cxzTA9jgFr9mQ.text: We came on a Sunday night, and I think that was the perfect night to go. Originally, I had made reservations on opentable but had to cancel due to changing plans. I ended up going anyway, and we were seated right away. However, the waitress told us that the night before was insane and completely packed. She was really friendly :)  We ordered: 2 Eastern Mules (I think that's what it was called... deeelicious) Kobe Gyoza (yum!) Deep fried sea bass (om nom nom) filet mignon (i cannot attest to this plate but I can say that my spouse licked the plate clean)  Drinks were on point, gyoza yummy, and fish soooooooo good!!  Rolls sounded pretty yummy too.. I was happy with my choice to come here!

P7fEZZ5vio3otsnk7DNkdw.text: Another favorite of ours in Vegas didn't disappoint us on this trip.   My wife is not a fan of fish but there is plenty on the menu for her to choose from.   She chose a cucumber and avocado roll and had them use soy paper instead of seaweed.  And chicken teriyaki, rice, with vegetable tempura.   I had an assortment of rolls and a friend joined us late but the restaurant accommodated without any problems.    As others have said there may be better sushi restaurants on the strip but we live the view, food, and service and will be back on our next trip.

L1xRlDi95s3cxfFu5cZl-A.text: Average sushi joint at best. Showed up late which is a plus but had to wait for a 6top. That's pretty lame when there are so many open tables. We drank and ate and the food and service was good. I wouldn't go out of my way to go back with all the options out there but it was good enough to stop in again. Groups are rampant in Vegas so be prepared for them. Don't make them stand out front in ask way fashion while you quote 25min. Most people will leave. Invite us in to chill and we would've had a round of cocktails. Details really. All in all a good start to the night.

Ak-z90S9FBLdFOAf9zSZkQ.text: It was ok .... I guess maybe because I was not very hungry and the place was out of the way for me .... My favorite place is still Shari Downtown/Thornton Park ;)

YamMBN-mEMd9nQLuTs-UeA.text: This is no 4 star sushi restaurant!  Anyone that reviews this place 3 stars or more is used to eating sushi in Alabama gas station. I do not remember the last time I had worse sushi. The fish was flavorless and chewy and the tuna smelled. This is by far the worst sushi experience I've ever had and what's worse is I spent 60 bucks for 3 ITEMS and I'm leaving the restaurant still hungry.

Mw89_xzMrWBPZJJkdGbnAA.text: Poor customer service. The only I gave this place any stars is because the food was actually pretty good but the customer service is so bad here I don't ever want to come back. They waitress is rude!! We came here for lunch and spent $200 bucks for just a few people. The waitress serving us never smiled and when she made a mistake in bringing us the wrong order and after we told her about her she like" oh worries..I will get another one...no apologies, no ownership that she made a mistake..: there is soooo many places to eat in Vegas. I will not be returning.

QDEDG4TVK_Jq1_K4v-WPiA.text: Pretty good sushi - expensive for sure. Small pieces of nigiri..our waitress was really nice, service I thought was excellent. The daily special tako roll was excellent. Soft shell crab plate was like ..really..really small. And it was over $20. A+ for service. B for size portions. A for taste. I'd recommend you trying it.

B1J8uFZOJGbNUhAn3_cuJQ.text: Great restaurant with great views of the strip. Great service and atmosphere. I had their filet mignon, which was pretty decent for a sushi/Jap restaurant. Their sushi was good too. I think this restaurant is more for the atmosphere than for the food. Don't get me wrong though. It's not like their food is subpar or anything. It is decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our seat

QRZDAe8YCySAwdDC6D_2Sg.text: the toro is wonderful melt in your mouth and we have the soft shell crab roll, well fried and fresh vegetable. The tofu three way is a good choice for appetizer we then have the ramen to make us full, the soup in the ramen is pretty good not too salty not too plain this is the first time i ever finish the soup in the ramen great experience overall!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M_a6eXKONwBxojhJrAvJ4w.text: I'm sure there are other great sushi spots in Vegas, but, if it ain't broke...  The most recent trip to Sushi Roku is 4-star worthy, just like all the others. Wonderful sake and lots of different sushi selections. I still stand behind the spicy tuna hanabi and filet-wrapped asparagus. I'll also add the seaweed salad to the list of winners at Sushi Roku.  Service was super friendly as always, and the nigiri and sashimi was very tasty and fresh.

D9bC0uj5dUt79hUtqen5JA.text: Get the omakase.  I regretted not getting this.  3 people around me ordered it.  Looked so delicious.  Tofu 3-way was so yummy.  2 piece toro was $26!  But it melted in my mouth.  Sit by the sushi bar and get the omakase.  You'll leave happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels w/ kurobuta bacon, $9.5, it&#39;s okay, bacon has a texture of a jerky
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu 3-way, $13, so delicious

qfmDlH9ReU4c8FJDFGlFxw.text: Recently visited the Forum Shops location for Happy Hour and what an awesome experience it was! They have their Red Sun Happy hour (Sun - Thur 4 - 7 and Fri & Sat 4 - 6). Happy Hour is served in their lounge area with bar seating and a long 'communal' table. There are some may great hot & cold items, drinks and even deserts! Gosh we had so much food! Some of the items included: Miso Glazed Shrimp Tempura, Spicy Scallop sushi roll (it's got a lil kick!), Shrimp Tempura with Asparagus roll, Shishito peppers, Crispy Chicken and Vegetable tempura. Most of the HH cocktails drinks I think were $6 each and the hot green tea was served nice and hot! Carmelo was our server - did a great job and to show how committed they are to great experience - Johnny the GM and Guillermo - Asst. GM stopped by several times to check on how things were going. As other reviewers have noted - beautiful floor to ceiling glass window that overlooks the Strip - amazing views to go along with the amazing cuisine and service. I think this is one of the best deals for Happy Hour on the Strip with all of the great choices and the fact it's offered 7 days a week. Of course their regular lunch & dinner offerings are just as great! Next time you're at the Forum Shops or looking for a great experience - check it out! A MUST! ENJOY! ;-)

L969rgS7ltZCjPKOU6A5Zw.text: I did a reservation through yelp for about 9 people on a Saturday.   I have to say I was blown away by the service here. We got an awesome server who was very attentive and accommodating. Water was always full and the food and other things we requested came in a timely matter.They accidentally forgot the birthday girl's dish, but was able to provide her with a free dish to make up for it.   I got the Tako roll with the spicy octopus and salmon sashimi and both were delicious and tasted fresh. I also tried my friend's miso butter-fish dish wow! It was so soft and flavorful.  The birthday girl got a trio of pastry dessert and a candle to blow out to make her birthday extra special. A nice finishing touch to a great dining experience.  Atmosphere was pretty nice too - upscale ambiance. I would return when I go back to Vegas.

vc1Jwc4XJF3qdfqUUJmpzA.text: Oh dear god can someone get me another black truffle tempura handroll STAT. That's all you need to get from here. $10 or so and you'll have this beautifully crunchy and nutty mouthful of sushi. The black truffle is in the dipping sauce they serve the roll with so don't be an idiot and go dipping in your regular soy sauce! I would only come back to Sushi Roku to order this handroll.   Yes you do get a nice, undisturbed view of the strip (towards the Bellagio and Paris) but you'll definitely pay an arm and a leg for very small portions of sushi. Delicious, yes. Filling? Not so much.   The lobster roll we got has a special sauce drizzled all over the plate that tastes a lot like Todai's creamy sauce baked over their lobster halves and boy was it fingerlicking good. But it was $21+ for 5 (kind of small) pieces of sushi (see my picture if you don't believe me).   You are definitely paying for the view and atmosphere here. So go ahead, bring a date here if you want to splurge. But if you want a full stomach without breaking the bank, Sushi Roku ain't the place for you!  P.S. I'm all for ambiance and I understand that this is a sushi restaurant so the saying "quality over quantity" is taken very literally, but if a place is going to charge that much for their food, I expect service to be top notch as well and for me the service was just so-so. Hence, the 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decent view of the strip
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

GrOGRAImsVlAj14X9sHpCQ.text: Omg yellow tail wrapped foie. Need I say more? Yummmmn. Uni, crudo, chefs pick. Holy moly everything was amazing. I think this is one of the best sushi places that I have ever had. I want some now as I'm writing this. Come and you won't be disappointed. Good luck and good eats!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow tail wrapped foie.  Yumm

rq73KKb676ugTW8Qx23dgg.text: Some of the best sushi I ever head coupled with excellent customer service. This is a proper restaurant

smaw2kgvNBSnK51_CLjykw.text: If I were to rate Roku on the quality of the food, it would be much higher. However, they not only have a very limited sushi menu, but it is also OUTRAGEOUSLY overpriced while at the same time offering tiny portions.   I won't be back.

I0RNXFpauJVcQ6Uw1KDoBw.text: The oysters were amazing would definitely recommend this place delicious fish and very clean.

TF3pR7Ihvv2Py8Aol91djw.text: I felt like a lot of dishes were made before we even sat down because they came way to fast to be freshly prepared. The carpaccio seemed to be extremely cold and stuck to the plate as if it had be prepared beforehand and sitting in a refrigerator for awhile. The tastes of a lot of dishes were actually pretty good. The presentation was on point. Overall the food was meh for the prices paid.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m_Pi3B_syeuNJjwEPA0DmQ.text: We had a fantastic meal at Sushi Roku. The restaurant is beautiful and we were lucky to have been seated near the window, giving us a great Las Vegas strip view. We ordered a number of appetizers and rolls off of the happy hour menu and all were fabulous. The crispy rice and spicy tuna was a favorite of the group. The salads were great and the quality of the maki (rolls) was great. I ordered a few pieces of salmon sushi which were just good. To finish the meal I ordered two pieces of Oh Toro nigiri and it was amazing. The chef prepared the nigiri perfectly. Overall a fantastic restaurant and the price is right.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rb0MA0M613fhNYULG3teZA.text: I love this place! I always go for happy hour which includes cheap drinks and eats. The bar tender is always very friendly and fun to talk with. Sushi is fresh!

bDxUvoU2FSx8rzeqoB8trg.text: Horrible service. Made a reservation for 8:30pm & our party wasn't seated until 9pm...then we were held hostage unable to pay due to a system crash....the service was slow & the food was mediocre. The Chilean Sea Bass was over cooked & the desserts inedible.

D81ihcNj9ZVdjveCk3MIYA.text: I n my humble opinion this is one of the best, if not the best Japanese Restaurants on the Strip. Excellent service, amazing salmon carpaccio, beef wrapped asparagus, wagyu beef, very good rolls and alcohol selection. Very helpful and considerate staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus wrapped in beef
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Carpaccio

7aLo0flPKSix9LxprI8aGQ.text: I rate this place 2 stars because the calamari was dressed with this sauce that they did not even ask if you want it and the sushi was alright the rainbow roll the salmon and all the fish were not fresh that's all I gotta say very dissatisfied and disappointed

XAcXlNMsQmTqWeCA8ga2GQ.text: Three stars for the great service and chicken fried rice. The sushi had a horrible texture. The pieces were falling apart. 4/5 roles we ordered had no flavor. To say the least it was monochromatic and anticlimactic.

afqC2tvf6QPTaQIohAT4CQ.text: Really dug the vibe of Sushi Roku. Good decor and music. Hip vibe. Services was good. We had some yellowtail sashimi for an appetizer. It was very good. For my meal I had Hanabi off the appetizer menu that the waitress recommended and a signature roll. I didn't like the sauce that topped the roll at all. The hanabi was ok.  The person I was with loved his food.  He had the seabass and a roll. I'd give this place a second shot but would stick with the more traditional stuff I know.  I also had their gun blossom cocktail. It was delish!

wEnhdYus0217xIKzuIdouQ.text: I love coming to Vegas and trying different sushi places each time.  My roommate picked this place due to its reviews.  We were not disappointed!  Our favorite roll for the evening was the Jalapeno Tuna roll.  The server suggested the roll.  I was nervous about the Jalapeno so she had them make the roll without them.  It was such a mouthful of flavors.  The cilantro set the roll off and I never would have considered that combination but it totally worked.  As far as pricing I was not upset.  We ordered 4 drinks, 3 rolls and a side to share. When the bill came it was $130 before the tip.  Considering this was an on strip restaurant I didn't feel that was a bad price.   I'm sure you can find a cheaper place but the sushi won't be even close in comparison.

ytiJHIYBt1dZrrPn92HQIw.text: If you are coming for the view you will be very happy, if you are coming for the sushi you will be mostly happy.  My husband and I snuck away for a dinner from our group and based on reviews ended up here.  We started with mixed vegetable tempura and kobe beef potstickers....wonderful choices for appetizers.   The Katana roll was delish and we were very happy with our choice here.  After all that we decided to do one more roll...we shouldn't have.  The Crunchy Spicy Tuna disapointed. It was warm which we were warned about but it was just bad and not crunchy. Overall good experience but was hoping for amazing sushi which was not here.

b0svGS5WvoE78BmEqyMfqQ.text: Delicious fresh sushi. The seared albacore sashimi with fried onions and garlic ponzu is a must have! The yellow tail and tuna sashimi were good too. Just a heads up that they put wasabi between the rice and fish here for their nagiri's, so if you're like me and don't like that, you might want to ask them not to put the wasabi. Overall great service and food. And a nice view of the strip when you sit by the window.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow tail and tuna nigiri

TGbAbFM8ZvKip-u2GzfZLA.text: chain in LA, upscale. most entrees over marinated.  not as good as katsuya. Tuna Sashimi Carpaccio with Sesame Soy & Garlic Chips was ok with the chip crumbles. wouldn't recommend uni udon, which doesn't even use udon noodle.  several items try to be like morimoto but not close.  like Popcorn Shrimp Tempura with Miso Glaze. brussels sprouts with bacon and yuzu.  too heavy on the sauce but tastes ok. braised short rib, not the kakuni falling apart texture. specials section, had the white lotus roll. ikura was acceptable.

OOY4oE6pqwgASR424N6_pA.text: Just had an amazing dinner can't tell you what was more enjoyable the service or the quality of the food. Soraya was our server, we told her it was her first time there, and she basically highlighted the entire menu for us. The presentation & the quality of the seafood was outstanding. Our favorites were the hamachi appetizer & the white lotus roll. (Which I was told us not on the menu). I've gotten to the point now where I just ask the server " order dinner for us something that will make us want to come back here again".

KGCjDmGVaqZYRDxBBkXRGQ.text: Amazing view and service by Juliana and a lovely girl Janet who dropped off every plate with excellent descriptions.

gnTpvtV3yGlsO-nRRVK30g.text: Roku sushi :  Quality of the Fish:  3 *stars points Service: 4 * Interior: 3* Organizations: 2* Hygiene behind the sushi bar : 2*  (too unorganized should not be behind the bar)  For that price not worth .

qa7b7b28Gg-bLj0-aP2jIg.text: It was busy here, but there were plenty of tables and only two of us. They sat us at the worst table for two located by the kitchen. Luckily, my husband spoke up and asked to sit near a window so we could enjoy the view. There were several vacant tables for two. Yes, we moved. We kept an eye on that original table; no one sat there while we were here. Hmmm...  I ordered the Katana ramen. I enjoyed it. The broth was smooth and milky. It had enough goodies inside although a little bit more pork would have made it better. To tell the truth I wanted ramen and this place was the closest. Another note, I'm a light eater, I think my husband could have eaten more ramen than what they served. I didn't finish mine, he finished the rest of my noodles.   I also had the Makoto roll; it was nice, but not something I'd order again.   I wanted to give this place three stars for wanting to sit us in the worst place especially because it wasn't busy. We were dressed casual, but nice. Others were dressed even more casual and had better seats. I want to be fair and not knock them down for first impressions.   The hostess sitting us was very friendly and so was the waitress. This restaurant is expensive just like every other Vegas restaurant on the strip establishment. I'd be willing to come back if I want ramen and I don't want to move my car and drive someplace.

p-rp-mR-ZHitN8S4ntNv4g.text: I had THE BEST experience at Sushi Roku. When we went to the location, it was very easy to find and the restaurant was on the third floor of the Forum Shop at Ceasar's Place. The view outside the window was amazing. You can see the whole strip from the dining table if you get sitted by the widow. Perfect spot to go on a date.   The place seem to be constantly busy but not up to the point where we had to wait a long time to get seated. Our server name Maiko was the best server I ever had from all the different restaurant that I went to. We ordered Omakase with Sake pairing and she seem to be very knowledgeable on the food that she was serving as well as the sake that we had it paired with our sushi. Every time we finished our dish, she would come discreetly to clean our table and get it prepared for the next meal. When she was clearing the table of the empty plates, we were never interupted from our conversation and sometimes I didn't even realize that she took our plates. Our waters are always filled so we never had to ask for more water. Also our sake glasses are always filled as well so that's always a thumbs up~! (We order the bottle of sake and she would always be around to fill it our shot glasses whenever we took our shots) Also every time we get a dish, we always know what we are eating and how we should eat it. Chef that did our omakase came out himself to explain the dishes as well. We also got a chance to meet the Executive Manager of Sushi Roku and got to have conversation with him.   Finally the food, the sushi qualities are AMAZING~!! Every dish that came out was perfectly balanced and very pleasing to the eyes. We got all different kinds of dishes so our palate were never bored. There was a lot of times where I was getting full but I just had to keep eating because of the food look so appetizing and I just had to try more.   In the end, the overall experience was AMAZING and it is the go to place if you are craving sushi and happen to be on the Strip at Las Vegas. :D  **I will upload the pictures soon**

uD7v9Dl8_930KKakkaJrqQ.text: One of my fave stops whenever I'm in Vegas! Happy hour is the best! Yummy appetizers, and good drink prices & of course Saki! Nick our bartender was fun and friendly, he made our dining experience a cool one! Can't wait to come back!

BpJI7WFbuBaW5OM7VJU2nQ.text: Best filet mignon I have ever had. Like butter baby.  Teriyaki flavored steak and mashed potatoes at a sushi restaurant in Vegas?  Sweet baby Jesus that was so damn good.

OM2k-U7CI2Eyl08q8IPjQQ.text: The best restaurant experience I've had in Las Vegas, regardless of price point. Ask for Joy, she was our server and made the experience personal and memorable to the point that our group of 4 talked about her service and the great food all night and even the next morning. The scallop roll is amazing, but all the rolls we had were great.

AWc-qB8FXW8oF2iw6OJ_oA.text: Great space on the third floor of the forum shops with fresh, skillfully prepared foods. My husband thoroughly enjoyed his ramen and short ribs. I loved the hanabi which was tasty spicy tuna atop warm crispy rice squares. The large tuna jalapeno roll was tuna sashimi atop a spicy tuna, avocado roll, garnished with jalapenos and crispy onions. This was our second time eating here and we'd definitely come back.

T1UZ0S-rfMSbr4mQQRj-QA.text: Delicious and great atmosphere. Best yellowtail sashimi ever: "yellowtail diced chiles"....

khEKwU3e-tNMP2rF-msHwQ.text: Loved every thing on the menu. The miss soup is the best I have ever had. I had their specialty roll with spicy tuna and jalapeno (it's not on the menu but you can ask for it) the pork belly fried rice is unbelievable and I'm not usually a fan of fried rice. I would definitely recommend this resturaunt and come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view at Sushi Roku.

xXoGCJJzVTqEIeyoGmAN6A.text: really great seaweed salad. not too salty like i've had in the past. mama liked her sashimi with eel sauce.they had kirin on tap. very sophisticated looking spot. we only did bar service. bartender was helpful even when we had to return an item. didn't see too much spit on it.   nice location in the "mall".

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vbHL47wrcQY6HDowGxf8Fw.text: Great sushi and great views of The Strip. I'd highly recommend the Makoto Roll; although the crunchy Salmon and Crab rolls were tasty as well. Lots of choices.

AjXbj7NmvRalJAJaRb_2vw.text: Seriously....so glad we found this spot last year and returned during our week in Vegas. The happy hour is amazing and the bartenders they have now are cool. Good vibe in there for sure. Will return when we are back in town! Thanks guys!

x1M0JKppbFbZibvvrFLlIw.text: Quality sushi that uses top of the line nori for their rolls and it makes a big difference.  The spicy tuna roll has a nice kick to it and the katana roll is tasty as well.

8lvd6taS6e87XA_oiSFCTw.text: Totally killed my feet while treking through the Forum Shops at Caesars to get to this place, but hey I had to look flyyyy and wear my oh so unomfortable heels =\  Anyhoo, on yelp it says this place is located though Caesars Palace, and maybe that is the easiest way to get there, but damn it is far!  And in heels the walk seems so much further.  My SO and I came here for our anniversary dinner.  We were seated by the window, and had an amazing view of the strip.    We ordered:    Starters  -Chinese Green Beans with Garlic  - super delish.  I could eat these all day. -Tuna Sashimi Carpaccio - reallly fresh, and tasty.  Mains  -Baked Lobster Roll - this roll was so dissapointing.  The lobster was chewy, had an unusual taste to it.  I couldnt stomach more than 1 bite.  -Spicy Tuna Roll - so delish!  It was fresh, and melt in your mouth good. -Panko Double Shrimp Roll - My favorite!  So good!  I've been to the Sushi Roku in Arizona, and that location was so superb...I was hoping this location would be just as good, but turned out to be just okay.

VM2GUxqK4Va9O-AOAs8kbQ.text: Been here twice throughout the years and I've enjoyed it every time. Great sushi and restaurant. Nothing negative to say.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish liver, tuna roll, sweet shrimp sushi, special roll and a cocktail.

wHtfmqpSWejPkOQjMQd2bw.text: Great sushi options and the miso truffle Chilean sea bass is a must try. Absolutely delicious!  Cocktail and sake menu are solid as is the service.

WPA6tbLZonOOk18ii0u2Ig.text: As the others have said, all the other sushi places open later and we had show tickets for 7pm...and stumbled upon this place. On the strip, where every entree is $30 and every drink is $15, this place had amazing happy hour drink and sushi specials. Hubs and I got out of there on full stomachs with drinks for $87 before tip. Unheard of and made it to our show on time.

5y-_Co68CbAlMQLB0dkdTg.text: We were going to go to Nobu based on recommendations from several friends, but we had a show at 7pm and Nobu didn't open until 6. I realize going to dinner at 5 in Vegas is really early, but it worked out well for us. We sat at the bar and got happy hour drinks, rolls, and their crispy chicken appetizer. Everything was really great and we appreciated the happy hour prices after spending a pretty penny on dinner elsewhere the night before. The bartender was super nice and attentive.   The sushi was great - we really liked the tempura shrimp/jalapeno roll. The jalapenos were fresh so it gave the sushi a really nice crunch. No photo of the rolls, but they looked like pretty standard sushi rolls. :)   Location was super convenient and easy to get to most shows in that area.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour house drink - like a gin mojito. Really good!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken with cilantro mayo. (Good, but definitely happy hour portions.)

gbERPcPNjxChQuWnOBWGOg.text: Talk about awesomeness-Sushi Roku is the place. We couldn't get a reservation at Nobu, so we tried Sushi Roku. The next time I say this it will be in reverse! Sushi Roku was amazing. The food, the atmosphere, the server...a full package. We were not rushed, we ordered little items as we went. We all (4 of us) left full, happy and appreciated. Their drinks are really good too! They have something for almost everyone; sushi, cooked items, full meals, appetizers, etc. I think we must of ordered 1/2 the menu. The yellowtail diced chiles was incredible. The shishito Japanese peppers were something I wouldn't have normally ordered, but someone in our party did-they were delicious! The Hanabi-another dish I'd never had-that was SO good!! I could have just had a meal of that. But, glad I didn't everything was so good. Worth the walk!! We will definitely be back!

REr9XGQKeOuU8M0I17u-Cg.text: Trendier/Fancier sushi restaurant located at the far end of Caesar's Palace. It's a hike to get here from hotel registration, just FYI folks.  DO: -Order any of the rolls here. They are all very delicious! The fish is fresh here. -Order yourself a cocktail, something with Sake is preferable. However, my colleagues did order themselves a few Lychee Martinis that were apparently superb.  DON'T: -Expect the best service when they are packed with diners. Your food will come out in time. No worries. Just make sure your cocktail gets to you before the hangry mood sets in.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crime Brulee with Green Tea Ice Cream
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Senshi Roll

ZBfZthPMY7TAzdto1kD31w.text: I like the oysters. The food is tasty but not without fault. THE MUSHROOOMS WERE GREEZY. The lobster was a bit tough. Happy hour is worth it here. Full priced dinner? All I want is the oysters. One of the best views in the city for dinner. Always tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster in Ponzu sauce
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushrooms

ND-f37Who3X4_GH29NpgZg.text: Delicious, fresh sushi! Order the Brussel sprouts chips!!! OMG, absolutely delicious!   Good service, extremely pricey but I guess this is Vegas!  Fun atmosphere, perfect for a date night.

8vWu-iASHdvK-0Q6gZb86A.text: ***GUILLERMO GUTIERREZ*** you made our experience at Sushi Roku a 5 star visit. Not only did you recommend decadent dishes, but you guided us in making all of the best decisions for both our pocket and our tummies. Everything we had from our drinks, to our appetizers, to our entrees, to our dessert was top notch quality!   This establishment takes pride in their food to another level. Yes, it is one of those places where you pay a little more for a little less in portion, but was it worth it? Every penny! The quality of fish here is outstanding! If you're a fish snob like me, you can understand that quality matters and paying bigger bucks is worth the expense.   It's all in the experience, and the view of the strip is pretty badass.   Thank you to Guillermo for accommodating our need to watch the hockey game and making our satisfaction your absolute priority. Way to get personal and make us feel right at home. ARIGATO

Gy-opOeBmnRq93rheb_1OQ.text: Amazing place 7 Rolls beer and sake! UNDER 60$ Happy Hour 4pm-7pm  Great service!!!  Mention if it's your bday you get a free dessert!  5 outta 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cali rolls, cucumbers avocado, rice and fried rice ...  (2 spicy tune deep fried rolls missing)
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance

f_1Iy8ve1fp4fmtDMAiXKQ.text: Located in Ceasars Palace, in the Forum Shops, near the exit to the Strip, on the top floor.  We came at 4p for their Happy Hour & dinner.  Since we wanted both, we sat at the bar which was great because we wanted to watch basketball.  Happy Hour- Sunday-Thursday: 4-7p Friday-Saturday: 4-6p  Nice ambiance, friendly staff, but I wish they were more attentive because everything came out quick except our mochi which came out 20 minutes after we asked for it (& all they had to do was get it from the freezer...), & the food was okay, very pricey but yet very simple.  Spicy Scallop Roll:  Good, simple. Crunchy Spicy Tuna Tempura:  Very lightly crunchy.  Okay. Salmon Nigiri:  Fresh. Katana Roll:  Good. Strawberry Mochi:  Very old!  The mochi outside crunched into pieces. Cookies & Cream Mochi:  Good, the mochi on this one was soft.

V443GhNXC3wm2ZxNW2W3mA.text: Everything here was delicious with a beautiful presentation and wonderful service!  It was just expensive for the portions you're getting.  If you go during happy hour, you get half off many items but you sit at a crowded table practically touching elbows with strangers who can hear your conversations. Not romantic at all.  Happy hour also doesn't apply to regular tables so that was disappointing.  I'd come back if that was changed.

srL0gGYGU8OhTttWyR1k8Q.text: Let me start by saying I am a long time patron of Sushi Roku West Hollywood (which has since closed) so this is one of my favorites in Las Vegas. The food was beyond amazing. The Oh-Toro was so fresh and delicate. And the yellow tail belly was phenomenal as well. The lamb chop special as well as the rib eye tobanyaki were beyond compare.   Our server Tommy, I have to say, one of the best servers I have ever encountered 2 years living here in Vegas. Iced Green Tea was never empty which is huge for me and my wife. Unlike some places , Sushi Roku doesn't treat you differently if you don't order alcohol. Tommy went above and beyond and his service as well as the quality of the food will have us coming here again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H_eLzZxj3HPyf6QUOE1Zeg.text: Had dinner here last night and didn't need a reservation! We walked in and got seated right away. I love how the restaurant is on the 3rd floor and we were sat by the window so we saw the gorgeous view of the strip. Now .... let's get to the food!  We ordered pork belly fried rice, wagyu skewer, seared salmon sashimi, Salmon nigiri, baked crab handroll, and a roll.   The salmon nigiri was fresh and tasty. The baked crab handroll was simple but good! The pork belly fried rice had lots of flavor as well. The roll we had, had shrimp tempura, yellowtail, red tuna, and albacore I believe. All of these were satisfying dishes.  However - the most outstanding dish to my boyfriend and I were the wagyu skewer and seared salmon sashimi. The wagyu melted in our mouths and the seared salmon was absolute perfection especially with the avocado, ponzu sauce, and the veggies. They were so good we had to order them TWICE (along with another order of salmon nigiri)  Service was very attentive, I believe his name as Matthew. He was great. Always patient and kind.   So glad we came here. There were plenty of sushi restaurants to go to on the strip but the pictures sold me. Definitely will be back with my Sushi lovers whenever in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seared salmon

Vt_Do-dv63GsHY_fR9Bd2g.text: Don't let the $$$ discourage you... this place is worth it. I got a little bit of everything to make sure I covered my taste palette. Everything from a simple spicy tuna roll, fried rice, seared salmon sashimi, and ramen. Everything was full of flavor and good sized portions. In case you need more spice, you can request even more spices to give your entree more of a kick.  The service was excellent! The manager checked in regularly and even showed me the correct way to eat the seared salmon sashimi. I even forgot my sunglasses and got them back the next day. The hostess and server remembered me and asked about my dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g3z81I13nl2m5YHvGbRwAQ.text: A common theme with my reviews is sushi. My wife and I love sushi and love to try new places. After looking around for places on and off the strip, it seemed more convenient for ourselves as well as others to try this place because not everyone can get off the strip easily. We knew price was going to be higher than anywhere off the strip. We got a seat easily with a 5:30 reservation. We chose to sit at the sushi bar because it's a better experience. We started with the calamari which was super delicious. It was crispy but not over breaded. The spicy sauce it was just lightly coated in was good as well. We ordered four rolls: California, Senchi (or Senchu) katana and Titan. In that order they got better and better. The fish was fresh the presentation and was also great. Service was good and quick. All in all it seemed like all parties around us were enjoying their time.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uTj81Hnk1Vanh5KOSkfs4Q.text: This place has a nice relaxing atmosphere with a great view. The staffs were all very professional, courteous, and attentive. The sushi was really fresh and yummy, melts in your mouth. My son also enjoyed his ramen which had a little spice to it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZISlv2QCDTXSBZ2GBDNESg.text: I enjoyed dining here with my wife. It has great ambiance and a terrific second story view of the Las Vegas strip. Food was as good as the sushi you would get from your local sushi joint but with an inflated price. But, it's the Las Vegas strip so it's completely understandable. We splurged and got the toro sushi (fatty tuna) and it did not disappoint.  The only thing is that the place is located at the end of the Cesar's palace shopping forum so be prepared for a 5-10 min walk to get there.  If your looking for a no hassle easy spot to enjoy good sushi and have a spectacular view while eating, then Sushi Roku is the place for you

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi platter with tuna, toro, and salmon!

Bp1wj8Dlmop4Q5VXx47JLA.text: This was probably the best sushi I've had in my life. Not just from the chefs creativity and the freshness of the sushi but also this restaurant had great value. We went all out and ordered whatever we like and left with a $170 bill.   Hands down unbelievable sushi. We will return.

RUskU79g_dtGKL-c-1sDIQ.text: I must say this place is a gem , the food here is amazing the bartender Carlos, the server Alvaro and Emi the manager, were so amazing to my friends and I , we couldn't stop talking about there food and they way they treated us!!! THANK YOU!!!

PLpe6MRrQg63duGCY0Fx_w.text: Excellent service!, Manager Johnny is very attentive, he always come and check each table on how everyone is doing. Our waiter Eric, very helpful and lots of patience, the restaurant are very accommodating. We will be back!

0axs5LHe73eXILavkI1-TA.text: I can't believe this place wasn't packed out. The sushi was amazing. We got the 8 piece chefs choice and he hooked us up! Sea urchin, salmon, yellowtail, eel and more. All delicious with unique garnishments. We also got the Kobe beef potstickers which were abolsolutly divine and filled with beef, not just a little beef and a lot of fillers. And lastly don't sleep on the cold ramen appetizer because that dish was my favorite of the whole weekend in Vegas and I will go back just to eat it. Service was fantastic too. Manager came around and checked on us.

ZzFyzuWEL1FRENosz2V4uw.text: Everything we had was absolutely amazing.  After we finished our meals, a businessman sat down next to us at the Sushi Bar.  He began ordering some things that didn't sound familiar from the menu.....turned out he was a regular that had his own routine and they seemed happy to accommodate him.  We followed suit and ordered two pieces of gold truffle yellowtail.....simply put the best piece of sushi I have ever had....I fully expected each piece to run $30 for how elaborate it was but they ended up being $25 for the pair.  Still a pricey single piece of sushi but absolutely worth it.  Service was what you would expect sitting at a sushi bar....the sushi chef's were open to conversation and very polite.    Price point is on par for being in the Forum Shops at Caesars.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gold Truffle Yellowtail - It isn&#39;t on the menu but beg them to let you try it.

RtqWNOk6ibBgK62uVAkC9A.text: Oh my god!!! It was amazing!!! The Brussels sprout chips are a great appetizer. The Jalapeno roll is delicious. Everything is great. Service is excellent. I will definitely be back.

PQq1LEsKLx78pKrPwOeIRw.text: The only thing better than the food is the service !  Easy location, Attentive waitstaff, plentiful menu. The only struggle is deciding what to order.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I have visited many times and this is my favorite roll
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster was amazing

kDAvNa7StU4k6rtyVNkeRg.text: Mediocre food along with ok service. Sushi rolls did not seem to match its prices. They are regular rolls and also were not tightly rolled. They actually fell apart as I picked it up with my chopsticks. Drinks appeared to be filled with ice and watered done, definitely not worth $16- $18. I would not return or recommend this restaurant.

ieCnzX06Ezj1n27VJR36-w.text: Came here for a late dinner and the food was super good!! We met Johnny, one of the partners of the restaurant as he was going around the tables. This is a really nice touch! Quality service and we enjoyed talking to him. Our server was quite busy with another table, but we understood and he ended up making up for it. What a nice guy!    Must Try:  Baked Lobster Roll Beef wrapped Asparagus  Beef skewers (Waygu?)

gIPHOkr77l1xE4q8tdp7Cw.text: Awesome service, 100% attentive and endearing. Great food, beautiful view, and our waiter Matthew  was the best server we've had in a very long time. It happened to be our 1st wedding anniversary and they surprised us with a sparkler and special writing on our dessert. He rest of the staff was very accommodating as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z5hPokX60xvVCveqdrgfQQ.text: We came here after having a really bad experience at SUSHISAMBA at the Palazzo.  Service was attentive and the sushi was AMAZING. We were really impressed that the chef's 8 piece selection included uni and toro (not very typical as these are more expensive choices!).  It was a fairly expensive meal, but worth the amazing quality and flavours.

Lr3h8vPDpJkbwyLD8JEH3Q.text: We stopped in and split a sushi roll, and wow. That was the best sushi I have ever had in my entire life. my husband doesnt even like sushi and he hasnt stopped talking about this place. We loved sitting at the sushi bar too and watching the chefs. This is a great little spot

nlabDrdoEUdtfN5agiI-0g.text: Decent prices, King crab rice a must have, seaweed salad was real good. I wasn't happy with the fried calamari. The salmon dinner was awesome. I would definitely come again.

Jb17rvSUpm-eDTOxK3486w.text: We hit Sushi Roku before the Elton John show. We had 5:30 reservations but had to move them to 6pm in order to dine with a strip view table (only available after 6pm.) Happy Hour drink specials were great as was the wait staff. We were left wanting more, as the food was pretty average. The food quality was good but there was no "Vegas Flare" to the menu.

Reji70KVHLtFAMijzFlqUQ.text: Service was excellent! Food not so good, my son ordered the crab fried rice, it had little or no crab meat in it at all. The hand rolled crab roll had 50/50 half real crab meat the other half imitation crab? Portions were small also. Pork belly fried rice was good. Expected more was disappointed in the quality and the portions of the food.

3phGtBX9_F5YBrLjDgEOOQ.text: Outstanding meal here ...  Top shelf service. The Shishito peppers  were ON POINT! Amazing! You must order the American Wagyu potsticker Gyoza appetizer! Beef will melt in your mouth

cYxToVN81No2MgWmSdiu3w.text: We had the tasting menu with a party of six. Paid about 250$ each person. Food was as good as what you can expect for the price segment so no complaint even though I've eaten much better for half the price.  However the service was terrible to the point where I complained and got pretty annoyed. 1. They switched the waiter for our table during our stay. Pretty much a no-go. 2. And that's much worse is they started bringing the next course to the table when some of us haven't even started the previous course so food stacked up on our table and we felt rushed.

_fMku7_wbvIfH6KeJJDx4A.text: Our dinner here was outstanding to say the least!  They went above and beyond to help me celebrate my engagement to my fiance!   GM Johnny Seo was so patient & attentive to my requests prior to our arrival.  Long time server Alvaro was superb!  The food was fresh and delicious.  Wonderful atmosphere for a romatic dinner.  We will be back!

aHAUk4H03e3EdvSH4nbZyg.text: OK, many reviews mentioned Tommy as their server so when our server introduced himself as Tommy I told him he had a rep to live up to. And he did. Excellent service. Foodwise, the Brussels sprouts are a must have. And the Spicy Panko Shrimp roll was off the charts. Uni very fresh, sweet shrimp tender and sweet. And if you have never had an Oregon sake, Rock Sake is worth a try. Great lunch.

RxWWjSb99NSDxSf1CbUq_w.text: Elegant restaurant within the Caesar's Palace complex. The yellowtail diced chili appetizer was recommended by our waiter and was excellent. I also recommend the makoto roll - delicious!

v9yJ4xeOgZJNMr74zIdfPw.text: Sushi Roku is one of the must try for those looking to stay in Vegas on a Budget. They apparently have a great happy hour. Unfortunately, we missed that happy hour by a slight margin, so we were forced to pay the full price.   Located on the 3rd floor of the 'Forum shops' by Caesars. Just take those winding escalators all the way up. Take in the wow-mazement and gaudiness of it all.   The quality was very good... no complaints there.  The plating was typical. Nothing fancy or over the top. Drinks--Were delicious. Go for one of the cocktails. Not only are they tasty, but make a great palate cleanser. Downside: Not very strong.   Pricing here is on the higher end if you don't make it during happy hour. That was really only my disappointment.   Service was good. Not pretentious, or stuffy.   I think sushi Roku can come off as more frou-frou than it really is. We saw many of people hanging casual in here, despite the high ambiance feeling they try to portray. Then again, that's honestly the entire mall that encompasses this place. So come decked to the nines, or in your tennis shoes.   Definitely a decent spot for Sushi while in Vegas.

I04d9EnlTGe9toWeiqOXIQ.text: Day one in Vegas and we stumbled on Sushi Roku.  We tried 4 different rolls and had the Gyoza. Everything was amazing. You will wait quite a while for service but it is so worth it. Skip the California roll.

01q90eAO4STe2-R2LZPPNg.text: Incredible food. Great atmosphere. John the general manager is very professional and curtious

Mc5zf20fvyCLobONLNJgrg.text: Great view of the strip from up here!  hidden on the top floor of caesar's palace, i didnt know this existed since there's no signage outside. was taken here by a VIP and treated like a rockstar! shook hands with the GM and staff, who were all very friendly. ate plenty of delish food and left stuffed.

G0J5UjqMMBh8r6KxHaA7ig.text: Amazing sushi, love that place! All dishes were amazingly delicious, very friendly service and beautifully restaurant. Definitely will come back next time I'm in Vegas...

2ghRiodcfaBh6cPJh1eCwQ.text: WARNING!!! DO NOT ORDER THE CHEF'S OMAKASE MENU!   My husband, cousin, and myself were staying at Caesar's Palace this past weekend and we were craving sushi. Since Sushi Roku was located inside the hotel, we decided that it would be convenient to go there.   We decided to splurge a little and try the Chef's Omakase Menu ($90 per person). We were super excited. They even offered a complimentary glass of champagne which was so delicious.    The meal started off strong. We were served a piece of halibut sashimi w/ shiso leaf & yuzu gelee, a piece of king crab w/ caviar, and a piece of seared toro with a piece of truffle on it. All three of us were in ahhhh. This alone deserves two stars. We immediately thought that if the first course was an indication of what was to come....we definitely were in for a treat.  Unfortunately...it was all down hill after wards. Our second course was a seared albacore salad. It was good, but nothing special. The third course was 4 pieces of red snapper sashimi (this was one of our least favorite dishes). The 4th course was a miso glazed halibut (so common). Then came the sushi course. I was expecting this  to be the best course, but it ended up being the worst. We were served Spicy Tuna Rolls topped with pieces of sashimi (kind of like a rainbow roll), and three pieces of sushi (toro, mackerel, and yellowtail). All of this was followed by a chocolate lava cake for the dessert.   Our bill came out to $377 and it was a major disappointment. I've eaten at other Sushi Roku locations and they were good, but this meal just pissed me off. When someone orders an Omakase Menu....it pretty much represents what the restaurant has to offer. If I knew I was going to get Spicy Tuna Roll for $90, I would never had opted to splurge.   Note: The rating that I give Sushi Roku is 2.5 stars. The half star is simply for the complimentary champagne that comes with the omakase menu.

8uAXECff302E2QIhxk8pKA.text: Went here for lunch - great sushi (especially the Shima roll and the Tako roll) and nice view of the Las Vegas strip. The owner, Johnny Seo, made a point of coming round, talking with people, and really connecting. Rare you find someone as passionate and caring about his restaurant and guests. Definitely coming back!

6jp1U_Fvxs-Hrad9d3aO7g.text: Nice, friendly staff. Of course, we had met them first during our bachelorette party festivities at Ghost Bar.  What's not to love about single gals? ;p That's how they reeled us in. (Yes, we're suckers) Who cares they were fun and nice guys and I am a single woman in Sin City.  Pretty yummy food not necessarily the best Japanese food but tasty. On the pricey side though. Enjoy the Tokyo Cooler. I'm not much a drinker but I'll drink this and it was on the house. It soooo pays to a bachelorette in Viva Lost Wages.   Great view. And they know to treat repeat customers.   So is Kenji, the cute HAPA manager, on the menu? haha

fEpbgkJQ_1xmCIhU4r3TJA.text: Awesome atmosphere, spectacular views of the strip, picturesque sushi, very attentive and accommodating waitstaff.   Think of Miyake's in Palo Alto fun atmosphere and Miyagi's in LA scene blended and done right Caesar's style.

Luq1lmHq3bA6u3odaB2gpQ.text: I'm a fan of the Sushi Roku chain and this is my first venture to the Vegas one... we were staying at Caesars and wanted a close place for dinner our first night there.  Great decor and amazing view of the strip from our table by the window.  Considering it was a Tues night, the place was packed but service was top notch.  Prices are in line with the other Sushi Roku's, which means pricey.  I live in one of the cities with the best sushi, so in terms of quality, Sushi Roku is a not the best or freshest I've had, but it's damn good considering it's in the middle of the Vegas desert!  We had a nice mix of tempura, beef, popcorn rock shrimp, and sushi - we had toro, salmon, unagi and spanish mackerel which are my go-to's.  Everything was a solid 4* and a nice variety of good fishes on the menu.

qYOYZypnFTq30cPoluazOA.text: My friend and I hopped over to Sushi Roku for our last meal in Vegas on the recommendation of her family. Her family is Japanese and said that they experienced some great sushi here. You can't go wrong with that type of recommendation, right?!  RIGHT! This place was spot on. Everything from our edmame, spicy crunchy tuna rolls, and chefs sashimi plate was excellent. The fish just melts in your mouth and the rice was the perfect consistency.   This place isn't cheap, but either is the food quality. Great way to end our stay in Vegas!

lgiBfQ796nJH0JJJQlo7NA.text: This restaurant is always on the top of my list. The ahi melted in my mouth, it was awesome. I also had the filet; tender with a smokey flavor...this is a "must go" for the perfect dining experience!

Nh1S10rmFgQSbUPZb0Y82g.text: Oh what a night of culinary delights with my colleagues in Las Vegas at Sushi Roku.   In the famous Forum Shops at Caesars on the 3rd floor, this dark and sensual place is a great intimate place to gather with friends or on a romantic date. I had one of the most outstanding dishes I had ever had  - it was the tempura lobster with a miso glaze.  It was sweet and amazing because of the sticky miso and crunchy because of the panko tempura and juicy bits of lobster.  Our table couldn't get enough and was like heaven.  This item was a special on the menu and is a must have.

pUbbhen2Z0-ykeXkFRA82g.text: Roku ROCKED my world!  Fabulous view of the strip. All dishes were on par,fresh, delicious, unique, and presented nicely to us. Top it off with 5 star service, I couldn't ask for anything more! Hell yes every dollar spent was worth it here!
