1P4WpHGWTHdOEpTN4FCdeQ.text: Pricey, but very good. There are very few restaurants that serve monkfish liver sushi. They made it very good. We also enjoyed the sashimi with ponzu sauce and the Sake!

Tu34uTD9TrQtUIcEwbJOIA.text: For a place that I have expected to be trendy with amazing food, this place falls flat.    The cocktails were mediocre, and food was mediocre.  The only thing that was sort of OK was the atmosphere.    We were first there for drinks, but later decided to have dinner.  The bartender that day didn't seem too happy and had a straight face the whole time.  He didn't try to make any kind of conversation and just made drinks and took our order.  Ok, I don't mind it too much because as long as he made great drinks and didn't mess up our orders I didn't mind.  The drinks as I said, were mediocre.    We had a couple rolls and it was still mediocre, which was very disappointing.  I had hanabi with spicy tuna which I thought the flavors just didn't mesh well at all.  The tuna itself was amazing, but with the fried cube of sushi rice dipped in sweet soy sauce... it just doesn't fit.  The seaweed salad was a little bit on the salty side, and that it was nothing more special than the ones I can get from a Japanese market.   I also had Shima roll, which was shrimp wrapped with spicy tuna, avocado, and cilantro.  It was not bad, but not good either. Just bland I guess.  Not impressed.   Overall I thought with the price I paid I could have better sushi elsewhere.  If I wanted mediocre sushi I didn't have to come all the way to Vegas.

Xsj-M0DR5a5uFLa4JMd3_w.text: Sushi heaven!!  An truly unbelievable place!  A must if you are in Vegas!

tKmwKQ1eLXDUyXqUovRklQ.text: The sushi and appetizers (miso and garlic edamame) were really good!  We got in fast, service was excellent, and the ambiance was beautiful.

dTI9LXSBUduio2HvS5ohkg.text: While visiting Las Vegas, we popped in here for a quick lunch.  As typical for Vegas, everything was overpriced, but we'll let that slide.  We had a really tasty rock shrimp tempura roll with jalapenos.  It had a nice crunch and spice; we would definitely order that again.  The noodle dish we ordered was entirely forgettable though (so forgettable that I honestly don't even remember what it was!).  The service was courteous, but not engaging in any way.  Definitely okay for a quick bite, but not a place that is on my list to return to.

YYLvD6OvqtOm2HIla2KIbw.text: Food was so amazing. What made the meal special was our waitress Danielle. She knew the menu inside and out and made wonderful recommendations. My only complaint are the prices. Average $22/roll but the fish was very fresh. Ask for the White Lotus roll - it's not on the menu.

0XiFhu8excU-WQcwVP7Ijw.text: Not much to say. It's sushi in Vegas and it is damn good. Pricey but that is to be expected. Definitely added to my list of places to eat when I'm in Vegas.

jUTk8-P6wQ1Xh0Z4c8rxEA.text: Hands down some of the best sushi I've ever had. Not just in Vegas, but all over the world. Everything is so fresh and the dishes are unique and delicate. Well worth the price when you want the best sushi experience.

Tc-_-JZkIDEDvST7WSFk4w.text: My friends were in the mood for rolls, so we ended up here after wandering around the Forum shops trying to beat the heat.  I opted for the 3 course prix fixe for $45.  Appetizers were very good - glazed chicken, salmon with truffles, and kobe beef skewers.  Sushi plate was ok but nothing special, and dessert was a simple sorbet and fruit platter.     I think the non-sushi menu is the way to go - on the whole, a pretty decent place with a great view of the Strip, especially at sunset.

jKXc7dOIVBBrdOPkMzeL5A.text: Im not a fan of sushi, but this turned my experience around!!  I went to this place with my fiance, dad and 2 friends and they all had a great time.  We got the best table in the place and surely it got one of the best views on the strip! The server was great all thru the night and we got 2 free cocktail samples each, and gave us a very good recommendation of sake.  Later we had the pleasure meeting the owner, who was very friendly.  We never got to the dessert because the sushi rolls was really toooo goood!  I will come back thats for sure!

mw4kNdz5UiqrMreAqsS1Mg.text: Came here on a whim, Thank God!!  We were starving and my friend just finished shoping at the forums, we wanted sushi...wow, this place has it in it's name...  We arrive, no wait...we are sat at the most comfortable table that i have ever sat at, ANYWHERE to top it off, the most amazing view of vegas, it's just perfect  Our server was really cool, wasn't fake or overly nice  I only spent 50 on myself and was full  Definately coming back here again  .....5 stars, but still not as cool as the Geisha House :-)

h8B2T4uKykEjfqN1x-EAzA.text: One of the best sushi places i have ever been to in my life!  This is honestly not an exaggeration as I tend to do that at times.  I was only in Vegas for three nights and I came here two out of the three.  Highly recommend and absolutely everything we ordered was amazing.  There was a special crunch spicy roll that was to die for.

Ay4ffbosx6u0poTlM6F7fA.text: Hungry for Sushi we searched yelp n the net for a good sushi spot, when came upon this place.  will definitely not make it to my top sushi hit list. service was very slow and it took forever n a half to get out menu n the check. we sat at the sushi bar and we only got a few sushi rolls, though it was fresh i have to say it certainly was not memorable. we ordered the chefs sushi special where the sushi chefs choose the sushi. the place is very expensive so be prepared to empty your wallets for this one.  overall will probably not come back. definitely not for the sushi alone. but i heard the hot plates are good.... i guess.

Ves9ZU_CK1rAxhucDuXSWg.text: Love this Sushi Roku Location for its top notch views! Good sushi, much better than the Sushi Roku in Los Angeles as well as Pasadena, ca. The service was great, the manager was very very nice to us.  I think he had his eye out for our birthday girl ;) Over all great place if you are visiting or having a birthday celebration. But definately does not top Nobu!

NkNcd6sJmGu9ZZOBHCpiEg.text: Fresh, fresh, fresh seafood!!!!!!!! My hubby and I are huge raw food eaters and every time we come to LV we always go to Roku! Service sometimes could be better, especially during the day when there are not too many people are dining but overall delish food is what we love! Sashimi is a must to try when you go there and I would skip the soy sauce all together to taste the True flavors! They have a great choice of saki too - skip the usual warm cheap stuff and go for exotic cold real deal saki.

QD8FM2ESBcv-yZhFC-tfqA.text: View - Amazing, Ambiance - Killer, People-Watching - Oh Yeah.   Sushi...not quite five stars. We enjoyed our meal and the service was excellent, but I've had better sushi elsewhere. My biggest complaint was that I ordered a roll with jalapeno since I adore fresh jalapenos, and it tasted like celery. It had no flavor or spice, which didn't warrant the incredibly high price tag on this "special" roll. All it added was crunch. If I'm dropping over $20 on a roll, I think it should be perfect.   In a lot of ways this place is five stars, but at the end of the day, it still comes down to the food, and very good doesn't qualify as amazing.

qUsle8RZlyT2lLb9Q4vUCw.text: A gem in Vegas! The staff was very knowledgable on the fish and where it came from. We had the chef make a roll of his choice and it was spectacular!!! The king crab sashimi was incredible!! Will be back to this place again! Cocktails were A+!!

rCCVUjwItvcbsEzx-T5-qA.text: I saw Bette Midler here!!! And she was wearing no make-up so it was hard to recognize her at first.  It was my friend's bday and her mom (and her mom's friend) flew us all to Vegas to celebrate!  We had a nice table, a little higher up than some of the others and who was sharing our little corner/section of private tables? Bette Midler and her friends! Her friends were giving us some dirty looks b/c we were staring/I think they could hear us asking each other if that was Bette Midler.   Aside from that, our sushi was delicious! My friend and I shared the sake sampler and man that did the job. We were both pretty happy feeling and our sushi was so fresh, and so yummy! They service here was excellent, they really know how to provide upscale, quality customer service.  Our waiter was very friendly and got our food delivered fast.  One of the managers also came by to check on us and see how we were doing.  He was also taking care of Bette Midler's table, and after they left he was very friendly and polite in confirming that that was really her.   Anyway, Sushi Roku, thanks for the great times and the great sake! I'll be back someday to try more!

Evjmju_YcWrlajugAySWpA.text: My boyfriend and I decided to come here last minute, it was very empty during lunch time. This place did have a nice view of the strip but other than that it was just ok. We don't mind spending money on great food and good service but the food was just average. We both ordered miso soup, shared edamame, ordered one roll each and also each got the lunch combination. The food was just average but not worth $120.00. I would skip it next time.

VcdmDlhMO0WcE6j7EtGbdw.text: My friend and I decided to grab an early bite while shopping in the Forum Shops at Caesars and chanced upon their happy hour. Happens every day (as stated by other reviewers) between 4 to 7 pm. Talk about a great deal on sushi in Las Vegas nonetheless.   Well drinks cost $3 each and a large beer will set you back $5. Great way to begin any rock star adventure slinging a few drinks before hitting the tables and clubs. Hint: $$$-saver!!!  We had popcorn shrimp tempura, tuna tataki, shrimp and chips, spicy scallop roll, and fried calamari which cost $4/each. They don't skimp on the portions so order up.

CUzfmGsu5jUWtjOekktX_Q.text: Stared out with a lychee mojito. Sweet and strong...  If I wasn't tipsy I would have had a second!  The hot sake came out hot (not warm) and was nice and smooth...  Baked crab roll was like nothing I've ever tasted before. I was expecting a volcano/dynamite typical topping but the topping had a curry flavor.  Pleasant and refreshing surprise.   Also had a fried spicy tuna roll-don't remember what the restaurant called it. It was really good. I LOVE fried rolls!!!!!  Delicious and came out warm.  Yummmmmm!  Uni nigiri was sweet and left me wanting more...  Banana flambe was ok. I was expecting something more like banana fosters...  It was more like a fruit medley...    Restaurant is modern and decorated beautifully.  The view of the strip is gorgeous!  Really nice place to take your gf after you've spent all your winnings on her at the forum shops!!!  Hehehe!  =)  Overall, I was pleased with dinner minus the flambe. On my way out I read that they have happy hour from 4-6...

7a2Z6MOxWzYmFZXsYTrtPA.text: This was for my girlfriend's 30th birthday and she loves sushi so I wanted to treat her to a place that is nice. As we approached the front entrance of Sushi Roku, we were greeted by two skinny cold looking hosts. As one of them escorted us to the table, she nonchalantly asked how I was doing but it wasn't very sincere. She seated us right in front where we can see ... the outside to the mall. I caught a quick glimpse of the darker area of the restaurant that supposedly have a great view of the strip lit up.  Needless to say, at least our server was nice. I told him we had a show to catch (Peep Show) and the order came out very quickly. We ordered:  - Foie Gras wrapped in Yellow tail sashimi (foie gras was over powering and salty) - Toro (don't remember what it even tastes like, not impressed) - Japanese Yellow Tail Sashimi with Diced Chiles (too salty) - Chilean Seabass w/Yuzu butter (this was a flavorful dish. The bass was very well cooked) - Kobe Beef Skewers w/ Black Pepper Sauce (flavorful and tender; thumbs up) - Spicy Tuna and Rainbow Roll (rolls were pretty good size and tasted fresh)  Total for 2 people: $216 including 1 mojito and 1 cocktail  Would I go back? Only if I get a chance to have a nice view of the strip at night but besides that, not really.

mMjDrckjwL7TloHH0BHkew.text: We like to consider ourselves foodies. In our quest to merge a healthier lifestyle and our love of great food, we have been on a quest! Healthy, amazing, fresh and creative foods. This has lead us to many a sushi house. Avoiding the white rice ridden rolls, it has driven us away from the AYCE and towards the more expensive end of the spectrum, and of course the costlier (really a word?) strip. Being that we used to do a high price steakhouse about once a month and gone rolling out feeling nearly comatose from gorging ourselves, we have accepted this. Having said all that.... My other half and I have deemed that thus far Sushi Roku has the top slot for us.  Food was amazing, waitstaff was; attentive, patient and above all VERY knowledgeable about their menu. Other places in town act as though they are doing you a favor waiting on you... The staff here explained how things were prepared, what types of oils were used, sauces, etc. We could adjust to fit our healthier lifestyle, but honestly once we were clear on what we wanted the waitstaff took care of everything!  We did the Chef's tasting menu and what others are talking about on here I have no idea. This is not a Costco (bulk buying) type of sushi place. If that is what you are looking for this is not the place for you. Take time, ask questions.  Sake flight was also fun. Loved that they served it with the information card. The hardest part of these things is remembering what you are drinking after they leave and trying to remember. It was served with an info card that aligned with the glasses so you could read about them while you drank, and the waitress paired each with a specific course.  Sorry Tao, Social House, Little Buda, Nobu we have a new home.  View also is amazing!! Gorgeous atmosphere. Hats off to the entire staff you should be very proud of your operation.

-O8D4DlOiL2qP42XLHcKFw.text: Very impressive.  We had a lot of Nigiri tuna (and blue fin tuna) as well as some halibut and the crunchy spiy tuna with avocado (this was tempura, misleading dish name)  I had beer, girl a martini, some edamame to start, as well as some of the BEST miso soup I have had.  Seemed fresh and was delicious.  Would recommend to anyone who likes sushi.  The view of the strip was awesome, even though I had my back to it (gave the nice view to the girlfriend)

FRTdZNoDcr6xoMT-AjKVHQ.text: A very modern restaurant on the third floor of the Forum Shops. With such a high price piece of real estate you expect the prices to be a little higher then a normal sushi bar.  I don't mind paying a little extra as long as the fish is top quality.  The fish was real tender and full of flavor.  We had tuna, yellow tail, albacore, shrimp tempura hand rolls and spicy scallops. Great location Great Sushi

y-ZshEcaT6VnscA0icYuQg.text: Dimly lit, with hip, global influenced urban interior, Sushi Roku is sleekly packaged.  Fortunately, the food is on par with its decor. Everything we tried (beef tataki, kurobata pork, chilean sea bass, and lobster roll) was fresh and well cooked. The flavors was creative without trying too much. It was fusion while still retaining basic essence of good, clean Japanese flavors.The only complaint was the over peppering of the tuna steak. A very pleasant dining experience if one ever needs a break from buffet overload.

wovLrOutysmQYLzoKk2LYA.text: Food is average and service below average. Often a long wait after being seated.

L17ba0Efz0H-REfQBPjHZg.text: HAD A GREAT TIME !!!!!!! Service and Food Quality was fantastic. Great Server, suggested some of the best sushi I have ever had. My wife doesn't care for seafood so she ordered a Filet, it was great. We will return !!!!!!!!

GnjOBnf4aQJm_HTp3T-mHg.text: Sushi Roku was my favorite meal in Vegas on a long weekend trip. All the food we had was delicious - the sashimi was fresh, the rolls were innovative and the hot food was cooked and seasoned perfectly. My favorites were the yellowtail sashimi, kobe meatballs, and the rolls we ordered from the specials menu (unfortunately I can't remember what they were). While everything was great and high-quality, I would suggest ordering more of their unique dishes as those were the stand-outs. The baked cod has the standard miso coat popular at similar restaurants and the whole sea bass is reminiscent of what you can find in Chinese restaurants.  Service was excellent - our servers gave us great recommendations and were very helpful in helping us understand portions and accommodating special requests. We were celebrating a bachelorette, and they sent over complimentary desserts with a sparkler! Overall, our experience was memorable and I highly recommend  Sushi Roku for special occasions or just a nice dinner out.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe meatballs

5xJbUXCXYR4Bq0K0jAZjKQ.text: This was my first time eating at this sushi place. I am usually weary of overly expensive sushi places, because i'm in love with the AYCE options everywhere else in town....oink oink. We had gone for happy hour (Sunday4-7). It was so frakkin good. I think I literally might have tried every single appetizer on the menu and some even twice haha They had asparagus and crispy rice and popcorn rock shrimp! Everyone in the restaurant was also very nice and attentive to our needs. I swear I would only drink out of my water cup maybe once or twice, and they were already refilling my water haha  The waitress we had was named Ellen. Very cute and bubbly girl. She was very patient and kind in explaining all of the items for happy hour and in suggesting what she really likes. It was our friend's birthday, so she even had a little birthday dessert prepared - even though it was only happy hour! So cute and nice.  I would definitely come back here again.

2ABmnoD7_UAsP_Yl2eAC6A.text: One of the best sushi experiences of my life. I ordered the 8 piece chef's tasting plate and was very impressed. Each piece was so interesting and delicious. A bit pricey but very worth it. The crab roll is crazy good too.

Vneyz1zusuHnITcCktzRAA.text: Excellent, fresh fish and extraordinary side dishes - don't miss the crispy Brussels sprouts.  The service was efficient and accommodating to requests; highly recommended

tFJTwE4MXkUp3Vpnk1SoNg.text: Sparklers on your birthday?! Count me IN!  FOOD: My friend ordered the scallops with foie gras..and then ordered two more for the table. NO JOKE. This dish is a MUST ORDER. The scallops were cooked to perfection. Me, not being a big fan of foie gras, even loved the combination. I ordered the hot soba, which was pretty good! Their rolls are a good serving size, so I would suggest ordering rolls or an entree and splitting the scallops. Did I mention that they're amazing???  SERVICE: Our waitress was super nice. When the restaurant was a little less busy (we were seated at 5:30PM), the manager even came over and asked us how everything was. Superb service! We had mentioned that it was our friend's birthday that day, so they came out at the end with molten chocolate cake and THE MOST AWESOME SPARKLER EVER. Seriously, such good service.  Why the three stars? Everything was pretty expensive, and there is much more for your money on the strip. If it were anywhere else, this place would definitely get a four!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sparkler action
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C_BXAb0sLqpALzjpoVSe4w.text: Nice atmosphere. Great service  Halibut sashimi 9.5/10 Lobster duo 8/10 Wagyu potsticker 7/10 nothing special Edamame 7/10 ordinary Sake sampler 10/10 Katana roll 8/10 Eel and avocado roll 7/10

wJ3ckBjPf-HJ8ci48SI-MQ.text: I celebrated my 40th birthday here and everything was wonderful. From the event planning prior to the dinner (from a distance), the food, the service and the atmosphere it was five star. Thank you Johnny Seo (Executive GM/Regional Director) and the whole staff at Sushi Roku for making this a night to remember.

J-IoDvCc3hD2wPMYiFJYfQ.text: Absolutely the best sushi I've ever had!  Super fresh and creative rolls. My favorite is the jalapeno tuma roll! Fabulous view of the Strip too. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeno tuna roll! Fabulous!

kh9md9yp6jHWOrauvoQVjw.text: It just keeps getting  better. It's like being transported to heaven    Haru is one amazing chef.

1hj1LBR6sfL26iiIh8ZJNg.text: Las Vegas has tons of high-end sushi restaurants battling it out to be known as the best (Nobu, anyone?). We try a new one each time we are in town (eventually we will be able to name our favorite... maybe). This trip we tried Sushi Roku in the Forum Shops. We are sushi lovers, but for some reason other dishes called out to us more at this restaurant.  We decided to try a few of the premium (read high quality ingredients and therefore expensive) appetizers.  We started with Kobe beef tataki - a method involving a brief sear, slicing thinly, and marinating in vinegar or, in this case, garlic and ponzu. This was one of my husband's favorite dishes from the whole trip - he was very tempted to order a second round. Next we had a salmon carpaccio with truffle soy vinaigrette which was very tasty. Lastly we had panko crusted salmon with wasabi and tonkatsu sauces. This was one of my favorite dishes of the whole trip. The salmon was warm and flaky and moist on the inside with a crispy crust of panko on the outside. The wasabi cream and the tangy, savory tonkatsu sauce (typically served with breaded, fried pork) worked perfectly together. I could eat this every day and I would be very happy. We both love unfiltered sake, and Roku had a very good one that we had not seen anywhere else before.  2 out of three dishes being overall trip favorites gives this place 5 stars!

cJsqYT6Im_kGB6W9mboFNA.text: By far my favorite sushi place ever. I absolutely love love it.  I honestly would love to see where some of the haters on here have had better sushi! Its my fav and I come here every time I come to Vegas

l61hXDnj35QjlwCfQ__L8g.text: Food was ok. Drinks took half an hour to be served after we had ordered. Service was ok. Average restaurant. Way too pricey for the "ok" experience we had. There are better japanese restaurants in town.

KKtUNwczesgtxpmxM9G-hg.text: Wasn't a fan of this restaurant. The rolls were just OK. Tuna tataki was great and suprisingly (I am a beef lover) the veggies were great (brussel sprouts, eggplant, etc.). Other than that, nothing was above average. Las Vegas has better restaurants for the same price.

QN7xFVN3Lu4ilcJXniim-g.text: Ordered using Uber eats, delivery took about 1 hour which was fine. I ordered miso soup, crab fried rice, and shrimp tempura roll. The portion of soup was very small for the price. The fried rice was really good, the roll had cream cheese in it which I didn't really care for.  I would order from this place again when I am too lazy to drive.

Hu8eIvAhHjKnND3uxiqtcw.text: We came here for my birthday dinner last year.  Restaurant had good decor but a bit too dark for me. They DIDNT read on our reservation that it was my BIRTHDAY dinner so did not get anything for the occasion. The food was good and the service was okay too.  Was a good experience overall but wouldn't come again for that price.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Fried Spicy Jumbo Shrimp, was very good, had enough shrimp although lots of chips which were okay, ($26)

LzX_L68mIyY1NnSBp_IrAw.text: We had dinner here and the Chilean sea bass was amazing. So was the filet mignon and the poke. The only thing I didn't like was the lobster sushi roll. Everything else was amazing right down to the asparagus.

gVxVdN3JLmE80bZBtVG3Rw.text: Fine establishment! The food was delicious and prepared perfectly. We had various sushi plates, amazing rib eye, perfectly cooked fried rice, finished with mochi ice cream and donut holes.

TLgsJwYqdi3sCRBdDMjTog.text: I love Sushi Roku.  I have never had something that I didn't enjoy here.  My favorite: Yellowtail Sashimi w/ Diced Chilies $17 5/5  Popcorn Shrimp Tempura with Spicy Creamy Sauce. $17 5/5  The edamame is always a great way to get started  Local Secret...they offer a 20% locals discount with a valid Nevada Id.

lOFqzOfh9Cxju1v_UnLOYg.text: Sushi was good. The seaweed salad was really good. This was the most expensive sushi place I have dined at. Good view of the strip if you sit near the window.

YpqP0xgkag5-RL79kAaaXQ.text: I went to Sushi Roku on a Tuesday night after a convention. This restaurant is amazing on all fronts. Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere.   Service- The hostess was extremely nice and asked us for our preference in seating. We chose a table, rather than the sushi bar. After being seated, we were greeted by our server. He was very friendly and extremely knowledgeable about the menu. I asked him for his recommendation in sake and food, both of which he answered with great detail. Throughout the meal, he was extremely attentive. He checked on us multiple times, and never let our drinks become empty.  Food- The food was phenomenal. Based on the server's recommendation, we ordered the Chilean Sea Bass as an appetizer. It was absolutely amazing. The flavors were delicious and the sea bass literally melted in our mouths. We also ordered the chicken fried rice which was exceptional. As far as sushi, we ordered the California roll and baked lobster roll. Both were phenomenal. Overall, everything was extremely delicious.  Atmosphere- The restaurant is dimly lit and cozy. There is a great view of the strip if you are seated inside of the restaurant, rather then on the forum side. It does get a little loud, and some of the tables are rather close. However, that didn't bother us. A lot of the tables around us were having a great time.   Overall, I would definitely dine at Sushi Roku again. Everything was exceptional. It definitely has great reviews for a reason!

1Ehmruve9szToBnfJE7FFw.text: For two people, we ordered a glass of wine, an iced tea, one appetizer and two sushi rolls.  The bill came up to over $80.  And after putting in a tip, roughly $100 for lunch for two.  The food here is good, but it's not great for the price that you pay.  I probably wouldn't eat here again, unless I got a solid discount or maybe happy hour (if the prices are a lot cheaper for the food and drinks).  I'm pretty sure that there are other sushi restaurants in Vegas that could provide a similar tasting meal for much less than what you pay here.

adMGT3e4L33yuwWat44JnA.text: Sushi Roku will always have a special place in the heart of my wallet. I was in vegas for a bachelor party. Initially my group of 16 was going to eat at Texas de Brazil, but after a couple days of buffets and steaks the guys in my group couldn't handle it anymore. We made last minute reservations at Sushi Roku for a party of 16 on a saturday.  I arrived a bit later but when I did some of the guys were getting hooked up big time at the bar with shots and drinks which was real cool. We were seated after taking some shots and just started ordering an assortment of sushi rolls and king crab fried rice. The king crab fried rice was simple yet so pleasing. It really hit the spot and filled us up quickly. Sushi rolls were all pretty decent. Of course we all partaked in sake bombs.   The service was off the charts. The waitresses were so accommodating and polite. Upon getting our check they said we could take $400 dollars off. This was absolutely mind blowing. Apparently one of the guys of our party was chopping it up with the General manager unknowingly and complimented the dude on his $1600 dollar armani suit. BAM instant savings son. We all suspect he performed sexual favors to get us the discount. You do what you got to do when you are a team player I guess. I kid I kid.  Anyway the meal was decent, the service was ridiculously good, the restaurant decor was swanky and chill, and the bill for us, vegas standard wise, was an all time winner.  General Manager Johnny. Compliment the guy on his suit *cough*. The dude is an all time legendary great.

5KlOfUUoHuv0Gow6RMfxCw.text: Edamame with truffle salt was great; really livened up what can be a bland experience.  the sushi was good, but very overpriced; not too much for $25 roll.

6CGXHFzgpuuDpEX3dqjx4g.text: At a lower price point, this would be a commanding 4 star restaurant, but it fails to deliver for the high expectations it sets nestled in Caesar's Palace at about $50 a person.  Sushi is solid, but nothing your usual local Sushi bar won't offer for 12-15 a roll. Service is somewhat irritating- kept coming back too often and wouldn't let me have a decent conversation.  Start with an edamame; try the Filet Mignon Asparagus.

GyIsA7b1QtWzbtyTURJneA.text: Sushi was fresh and first rate.  Had a party of ten. However, service was spotty. Pushy waitress, Agnes, who I had to repeatedly call over put a bad taste in my mouth, constantly trying to get me to order the most expensive items and more than I needed. Was so bold that she then wrote in a hefty tip for herself on our bill! Diners beware!

IQqYzMPNN0NqvI5lrULDqw.text: If you go here for the sushi bar expect to pay around $90-100 for 4 rolls for two people. They have great customer service, clean restaurant and great sushi!

NmFwf2Zzp8ETL0HlvpXOfA.text: Tried it for the first time. Overall, good experience, but would recommend stick with raw fish as that was certainly the highlight.  -salmon sashimi - delicious -toro sushi - heavenly and worth the market price -eel avocado hand roll - like any sushi joint so skip it if you are looking for special items -baked crab hand roll - its much better at katsuya  so this is a definite pass -hanabi - how can you mess up spicy tuna on crispy rice- order it  Look forward to trying more sashimi on my next visit...

4mkHghLJuITQYmUoCwq9-g.text: I'm IMPRESSED!  The view from this Sushi Roku is definitely amazing!  We squeezed our sushi run between a rough gambling sesh and a Boys II Men concert, giving us literally 45 minutes to get in and out of Sushi Roku.  Went with some heavy hitters so they were definitely 100% accommodating for us.  I dont think what we did would have flown well with the staff there... if it wasnt for the heavy hitters!  The service was impeccable and the meal was outstanding.  I cant get over the shiseido peppers.  I dont think I'll ever get tired of this dish!  Here's the one thing that throws me off -- this place is a million times better than nobu.  Why does nobu have its own... tower at Cesar's palace?  I dont get it!  We need a Roku Tower at the Bellagio!  I'd come back here in a heart beat.

jITBBAs1dh6be68xwIH6Lw.text: My husband and I were shocked at how mediocre this place was! Based on great reviews we were expecting great sushi and it just wasn't. The place was pretty dead for a Saturday night, I guess that should have been a sign. We had two rolls both were okay, nothing special. The sashimi was good. Service sucked. Total waste of money.

gs3vUG9dqczK8HXM6Ei3VA.text: Searched for a sushi restaurant that opened before 5pm and Sushi Roku came up. I was happy to see that there was a number of things for non meat eaters on the menu:) The food was awesome, the drinks were refreshing and the service was amazing!!! Thank you to our waiter Rommie! He was so helpful.. He recommended the perfect items and drinks and was super friendly and even gave us dessert!!! Thank you again Rommie!!!

Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garden Roll and Far East Mule:)

Q2In8tkPZvJDtNcwShKX5w.text: Very tasty sushi. Good service. If the amberjack sushi is on the menu I recommend ordering it!

8eXoJf3xrLQIFtWzQ0ykBA.text: The Sushi Roku empire was built out in Los Angeles, but the trendy vibe was transported across state lines to be featured in their Las Vegas location.  The third floor digs inside the Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace provide expansive views of the Strip.  Being only a few flights above ground, you are able to enjoy the towering lights of the hotels, as well as the entertaining antics happening on the busy street.  The dim lighting and Asian-inspired decor make Sushi Roku a seductive spot.  However, the high ceilings and open dining room can get quite loud when full of larger parties.  (Our meal was continuously disrupted by a rowdy birthday celebration.)  Since we were grabbing a late dinner, we decided to opt for some light courses.  I ordered the Mixed Sashimi Salad, which was a mound of fresh field greens topped with radish slices and served over thinly cut raw fish.  The platter included tuna, salmon, yellowtail, and more.  A snappy ginger vinaigrette was drizzled over the dish, providing a gentle spicing.  Each piece of fish was light, fresh, and tender.  I also sampled their Eel Avocado Roll, which contained eel slices so warm that the maki easily fell apart, one of my pet peeves.  My friend ordered the special Katana Roll.  The massive portion contained about 10-12 slices of a mixed spicy tuna and shrimp tempura maki, topped with tuna and yellowtail slices.  It was a fantastic concoction that she reminisced about for days.  Many hip Japanese spots that provide fun atmospheres and innovative cooking styles, such as Nobu, often do not provide the same food quality as more traditional spots.  However, Sushi Roku scores 4 stars on all of points - style, creativity, and taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside the restaurant
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Sashimi Salad and Eel Avocado Roll

r2Pd9FqFuYtZ0iC4qwlEuQ.text: Excellent meal! We did the "family style" dining where the waiter brought out a variety of dishes. Everything was amazing. The only downside of doing it that way was the cost but it was worth it. A must try for sushi when in Vegas!

tlYZZ9hfBgOqhWJzwkn1wQ.text: My favorite place in the whole United States. I have been here many times and it is the best.

mwaM64-4ajL6LNEOCq3gFA.text: Brought to you by the group that includes Katana and BOA, Sushi Roku is upscale chain restaurant found in the Forum Shops at Caesers.   Best sushi in town (at this time). I always let my friend order for me here, so most of the time it's always too much food. Haru, my favorite Itamae, always makes consistent, beautiful dishes. Different items tried:  Ika somen with gold flakes Kimo Mackerel Hamachi Tuna Sashimi Carpaccio Salmon Sashimi Carpaccio Monkfish Liver Tako Tuna Belly Bonito (one of my favorites) Caviar Yellowtail with Foie Gras and Black Truffle (another favorite) Matsutake Mushrooms on the Bincho Tan  Polish this all of with a nice sake.

ou4X4F1au41Ba0vVZs-ZnA.text: WOW! This place is amazing. Great service, fresh sushi, and the mixed drinks are to die for.

ApNwRSsy_KJo0QBlSHCRYQ.text: Went here for Happy Hour with my daughter.  We didn't have our car so when I Yelped sushi restaurants on the strip, not many came up. I felt that the price was right for happy hour, the service was mediocre, but the food items were hit and miss.  Some were amazing and others were just "meh." The California rolls were surprisingly bland. We had an amazing sashimi fish dish that was served with ponzu sauce and had some yummy, fried brown onions on top. It was so good we ordered another!   Overall though, don't expect a lot from this place. Consistency throughout is what I look for in any restaurant and we were desperate for sushi so unfortunately I would say, we kind of settled.  We did feel satiated in the end because we got our sushi fix, but I won't ever go back again.

AaPVpq2-d9L7ZQN0mpSHZw.text: This place is very good for Americanized Sushi, we can here for my wifes birthday and although they lost our reservation they got us in anyway. The sushi is very unique and tasty, its usually best to go with whatever is freshest.  if you haven't been here you will never find it...no kidding.

A9VQuFd0hE3tfkghriIslA.text: Always a stop for us. My son had the King Crab Fried Rice and LOVED IT. We had a couple of rolls and were very good.  Highly recommended!!!!

_x0wO0comIWXGD1jiWPwqg.text: Came in here about five o clock. A friend of mines made a reservations because I've read reviews saying this place is awesome and crowded.... It was a ghost town. I thought they said happy hour on Sundays? I guess not. The sushi was ok. My rainbow roll wasn't really a rainbow roll. It had waaaaaaaaaay too much avocado on top and no fish?! Literally 5 rolls were avocado and 3 actually had fog on top, with a little bit of avocado.   Our server sucked big time. We were done with our food and he didn't  come to give us our bill. IT WASN'T EVEN BUSY. My friend was drunk and impatient. So I told her we will meet her outside. It took a while. YIKES.  I was pretty excited to go here because I live in California and wanted sushi so bad. I didnt know vegas much. It was a whatever experience here. Nee going back. Both my friend and girlfriend made fun of me because I was super excited for this "awesome" place..... Fail!!

cqvs-RRRHBllSkKbrO2VLg.text: This is the sushi restaurant to come to if you want to overpay and feel like an unwelcomed guest.  My girlfriend and I were in a hurry so we stopped by here without a reservation on a Saturday night. Three (!) hostesses (no idea why they needed that many since none of them were doing anything) at the stand rudely told us all we could sit at would be the sushi bar even though we saw many open tables. I did not complain and happily accepted that. Big mistake.  We were jammed into two spots at the tight sushi bar and given a drink list. After waiting about 10 minutes for someone to take our drink bar, the sushi chef impatiently asked if we were ready. Um, no menus yet. He yelled at a server who came by and apologized and gave us menus and took our drink orders. Ok, honest mistake we thought...  Drinks came back and we ordered edamame and our sushi. Edamame never came and we couldn't get our server back until after we ate our rolls, which did come out quick.   I complimented our sushi chef on the rainbow roll and he barely grunted back at me. Meanwhile, the chef to our left was having a very long conversation with the couple next to us. Maybe we got a grumpy chef? Either way, the rolls were good but I felt as if I had done something to piss off the staff which I felt to be pretty impossible since we had barely even got anyone to talk to us and I had been nothing but polite and complimentary.  When asked about the edamame, server just smacked his head and said sorry. He was nice enough but apparently overworked or not prepared to handle weekend volume. Either way, pretty poor from what I expected to be some of the best sushi on the strip.  Bill came to $70 for 3 rolls, salmon sashimi and a soft drink or two. Couldn't wait to get out of here. Food was good but I'd rather have my money back. This is the worst side of Vegas: overpriced, rude service, and no one pushing the staff to do better.

l2ks4phaJrkHQVb2njTj_g.text: Fantastic sushi experience.  Ask for John, probably the best waiter on the Strip.  He recommended the perfect mix of sushi and sake to cure our hard fought Vegas hangovers.  Great atmosphere and a fantastic view.

6tOxyKX-T7b-UT423DHkVg.text: This place is not as good as it gets, but it was sure as good as I wanted it at the moment. Late night, money lost downstairs at the casino, too tired to think where to eat and I stumble into this restaurant by accident. The host is the waiter and his name was a fabulous Paul. Paul sits me down at the sushi bar and the chef just stares at me. I was so hungry I didn't even think to ask for the OMAKASE ! What an idiot! The Omakase is $90 per person, but they serve so much that I saw people fall of the chair from being full. I don't even remember what I ordered, but I lost my balance after the first bite. Then I turned around to face the windows and THE VIEW!!! THE VIEW of my beloved las VEgas Blvd from the 3rd floor of Cesar's Palace with an orgasmic sushi in my mouth made my night.  Cesar's Palace curves at this point on the Blvd. and you end being sort of in the middle of it with bay view windows. I am flying there in two weeks to order the Omakase and I will update the review with details.

up7kJ6lvWFVB7jziAOaUcA.text: Flew into Vegas and had an immediate hankering for sushi and a hope that sushi in Vegas would live up to Vegas' other over-the-top, excellent experiences.  Two types of tuna and a salmon roll later, I was sufficiently satisfied.  Decor could have been better, too dark for my taste, and I got the impression that they were more interested in catering to all of the Japanese customers.

HVDaByk1U_pNpWI5PZoTCw.text: I took my GF here for her 25th birthday. Outside of our snooty waitress (she's the reason I can't give this spot 5 stars), the food was excellent! We tried quite a few rolls - this was back in Jan 2009 so I cannot remember the names. The food is a little pricey but worth it. I even enjoyed the light techno music that played in the background as we ate. Over dinner I tried a drink called the French Maid...it was strong as hell and had me feeling a buzz quickly. This place is nice for small/large groups or dates. When I am in Vegas, I'd definitely try it out again. Two thumbs up.

9c3x2TUHzOmGs4GErQmSYw.text: I can't believe I saw so many good reviews about this place.  The sushi was not fresh, the chef's special was downright disgusting and the prices were shockingly high.   Cost $47 for 5 pieces of sushi and miso soup - couldn't eat the rest on my plate - it was simply gross.

GgdRl66_lT0niDqWVDRpLg.text: I am an experienced sushi eater and I have been to Sushi Roku many times.  I can honestly say this is a top 5 place for me.  The fish is usually extremely fresh (one time it was merely good), the rolls are creative, the atmosphere is terrific, and the service is good.  It's definitely pricey but you're on The Strip, it should be expected.  All in all my go-to sushi restaurant in Las Vegas.

33Wxz72_lcSXirMPwevWBw.text: I've only been to Vegas twice and both times we came here - my favorite sushi place ever!  Great food, great service, love the location.  We brought 15 people with us  and they've all been back!  The chef's selection was amazing and looking out on the strip was great.  I highly recommend and can't wait to get back on my next visit to Vegas!

Wzwq_q1j-BPGrDUixHwrlg.text: Amazing sushi!  Everything in Vegas is pricey, and this is no exception.  However, when the food is amazing and the sushi chef is knowledgeable, it's worth it!  Prices weren't too bad...  I usually check the prices of the spicy tuna roll (since every sushi place has them) for comparison.  The Spicy Tuna Rolls at Sushi Roku were $11.  Again, expensive, but not over the top.  And for delicious sushi, I'll take it any day!  Make sure you go here - much better than Yellowtail Sushi in the Bellagio, and less expensive too!

jzFxacApjqRW7dINWWd_Zg.text: Yellowtail sashimi w/ diced chiles is amazing but if you want to be in heaven, try the specials, they were like a party in my mouth. The sashimi was fresh and tasty, including the uni, so you know it was amazing. The restaurant was beautiful with a great view of the Strip. The managers were very gracious and knowing we had a show to catch, ordered us the chocolate cake for dessert. Plus the sake list was great and we were able to enjoy an excellent Daiginjo-shu. I can't wait to return.

pGGfnRxHuUO0mkaoxHhh8A.text: I have found you, best miso soup of my life (Country Miso Soup). If only we had more time to enjoy Sushi Roku! We ate here for a birthday dinner before a show but were unfortunately rushed to get to the show on time. The interior design is very zen and chic. We had a table with a view of the strip from Caesar's forum shops which was top notch. Our waitress Shaina was awesome, enthusiastic and helped us with back road directions to get to our show on time! I was under the weather so only had the soup and veggie tempura but as previously mentioned, this soup rocked. I didn't sample the sushi choices at the table but only heard good things. Our food was bit delayed coming out considering it was sushi, but upon investigation, Shaina found out the chefs were making the miso from scratch! The country miso had filet mignon to make the broth a bit heartier, hence the extra time apparently. Well worth the wait and they comped us a salmon carpaccio starter. Drinks were also tasty! I'd love to go back!

eE4wrfHCnZTCpcF3Ji7ggA.text: i've been here twice.  it has a good view of the strip and the ambiance is nice, but the food and the price don't go well together.  the chilean sea bass appetizer was good and we did order 2 of those, but everything else was just alright.  the sushi rolls we ordered weren't spectacular either.  the baked lobster roll was pretty plain and the spicy rock shrimp tasted pretty ordinary.  ummm...if you want to eat somewhere for view and ambiance and have a mediocre meal that costs more than mediocre, then this is the place to go.  it's not terrible, just don't expect food that's greatness.   happy sushi roku-ing.

X0TzrZq9OoP5M3JwC9MViA.text: nice decor, view of the strip at certain spots, good variety of sushi, just get ready to spend bank if you want to try all the good stuff, this place is a bit expensive...

w0R_yFEMFRLDLrQPCQUyBw.text: It's on the 3rd floor of the Forum shops, a little stuffy and haughty, but what can you expect?  We popped in for lunch, around 1:30pm.  If you like attentive service, that would be the perfect time to go.  There were exactly 4 other customers in the restaurant...despite the few customers, there was a hostess, a waiter, a water guy, an appetizer/plate clearing guy, 2 sushi chefs, and a manager.  No wonder a vegetarian roll is $14!  Great view of the strip from the booths, and the decor was modern, comfortable and elegant  (think low backed leather couches and natural materials).  My sweetie and I had the Chef's sushi combo, a Harvest roll (skip it), and the spicy tuna roll.  All of the fish was like butter (yellowtail, salmon, tuna, shrimp).  Really fresh, better than some I've had here at home on the the west coast.  I had a cocktail called the Tokyo Cooler--a very delicious, refreshing, dangerous cocktail.  I could have gotten prom-night drunk on those, no prob.  Rolls were $13-26  (approx 4 pieces)each, sashimi $13-24 for 4 pieces.  Handrolls $6.  All in all we spent $55 on lunch.  We were satiated--not overly so--I wanted to save room for gelatto.

hMb_FMScjp9k3C3ulS68KA.text: everything here in this place is bomb.  seriously this place is pretty damn good overall but their service wasnt the greatest cuz they were busy...

3tzJRpHigCCvF4DEzB0VWQ.text: I had dinner here on a Saturday night with a group of friends during a bachelorette weekend. The restaurant had a nice, dark ambiance. I'm usually not a fan of sushi, but my opinion has changed since dining here. We ordered the Edamame Hummus with Vegetable chips to as an appetizer. The chips were so crispy and fresh tasting. We ordered the seaweed salad, a tofu dish, spicy peppers, tempura, two vegetarian harvest sushi rolls, two sweet potato rolls, and two cucumber, avocado, and jalapeno rolls. Every single dish was fresh, tasty and filling. The portion sizes were decent enough to share. The service was excellent.  We were in a rush to finish dinner and our waiter did a great job of getting our food and drinks to us.

gO6pfC0QbEEpC6TDxe4sbQ.text: best sushi around; try their loc@ Sunset Blvd (LA).

LZM41v4dgwXAny_wmcq1aQ.text: this place serves average sushi at premium sushi prices. we sat at the bar, and the sushi chefs and waitress were somewhat attentive, but nothing could make up for the flavorless, lackluster tuna and slimy uni. i didn't try any rolls, or tempura/cooked dishes. if you're looking for great, fresh fish in vegas, this is not the place.

sWbOyi5epZRspOKTNa9WIQ.text: The atmosphere is awesome. We had gotten a seat by the window, and had an awesome view of the strip. We came here for my friend's 21st birthday. I ordered the peach passion drink, it was good but not too strong. For an appetizer, we ordered the filet mignon wrapped asparagus, they were decent. we ordered a couple of sushi rolls, the rice is a bit dry... some of the rice was even hard. i've definitely had better sushi rolls other places. The bill was pretty high for just the two of us. But, the place gets an a-ok to me because as we were leaving, our server surprised us with free shots for my friend's birthday.

NfzORSLXK77wp1Rv1JJooQ.text: Came for lunch and got the Spicy Tuna Don Buri.  They did it with the brown rice risotto for me, instead of the usual white.  It was great, I've never had spicy tuna this way.  It was mushy-style and spread over the rice and topped with some vegetables.  They forgot my miso soup though.

NTS1LKgNqZzyAZC8l17liQ.text: I came by on my last visit when I heard about their happy hour in the bar area. I have to admit it was pretty amazing. Everything came out fast and was warm and full of flavor.  Also, a good thing to know is if you are a local you get 20% off your check when you have dinner.

FzxDhlXNUrNhRlKQG4ylnA.text: This place is great, service & atmosphere are amazing. Makoto roll is amazing and the scallop cut roll is great. Waitress was great with recommendations.  Will be back for sure on our next Vegas trip

brpL8FPWrekpu5t1AJDMOg.text: What a great date place!  Lighting was beautiful, service was good and the food was awesome!  Will go back.

_xWVJ5EtrJcX5sr0lqh-Cw.text: Real good sushi and fresh sat at the bar waiter was on point...

uzpP-1t2s48j3gLXwTYssA.text: Sushi is so great at this resturant I love they roll so fresh and it's so good  Great service and everyone friendly there.

xzo2Q1-lFpAlgs1VAHVCcQ.text: Came here for a late dinner after watching Phantom of the Opera.  Ordered the Sushi combination and Tuna Carpacciowhich I thought was ok.  The Seabass truffle was actually really good.  The best part of the meal.    We had dessert and I thought the banana flambe was really good but the volcano was ok.  Overall it wasn't too bad. If I come back again, it would probably be for the Seabass Truffle and Banana Flambe.

yKefHErtMfJD0B0aQKA7TQ.text: Ok, but not that great.  Very nice atmosphere, but sushi was just ok.  I really wanted Shibuya at MGM, but for some reason they were closed all week.

UJ9mla62oKW_pQuHufmaEw.text: Best sushi we have had to date. Staff was attentive, and very knowledgable. Very impressed with every aspect of Roku!

4TMucJglPRteiaqVplXHNg.text: Just had a business dinner here the other night.  It is located in the shops at Caesars Palace.  This is the second time that I have at there, but I will focus my review on this past visit.  We had a sample menu with a variety of different appetizers and entrees, so we really ate much of the menu.  For sushi on the Las Vegas strip, this place would get four stars from me.  I normally hate spicy tuna rolls, but I absolutely loved this one!  The rest of the food was just as impressive.   Now the bad.  First, the service was only ok.   There wasn't anything that stood out as really horrible, but for the price of the restaurant I would have expected more, especially in Las Vegas.  Also, I am really into my wine, and this place gets an "F" for  their wine list.  There was nothing that really was appealing, and the cab I ended up trying was so bad that I changed to Sapporo.    Overall, nice place to have some sushi while you are in the Caesars area.  Maybe you would have a little better experience than I did with the service only focusing on 2-4 people instead of 20-25.

-l8jJ6XpmaxC_sOvB-oYdg.text: My boyfriend and I are from Vancouver and knew we would be eating a heap of fast food on our trip to Vegas, so scoped out the top Japanese restaurants in Vegas ahead of time. Sushi Roku was one of the top on the list, and as we passed by it during the day at Caesar's Palace, the decor looked lovely, as did the menu.  I was really impressed with the ambiance of the place - it looked like it could fit 150 people easily and the furniture and light fixtures were grandiose. It was quiet on a Monday night, but allowed us to take in the spectacular night view of the strip. We started off with some edamame, Ingen Itame (Sauteed Chinese green beans with garlic sauce, $8), and Miso Eggplant Dengaku ($10) which were already really good. The eggplant was sweet tasting and crispy on the outside (Leo pointed out that it's because they removed most of the skin) but soft on the inside. Leo also ordered some Kobe Gyoza ($12) on special, which he was barely able to touch because of the entrees we ordered.  Since this place is named for its sushi, I tried out the Eel Avocado roll ($9) and Garden vegetable roll ($12). The eel roll was pretty standard, nothing better than what I think I could get in Vancouver, but no complaints. The thing about the veggie roll was that it had a pretty strong japanese herb called Mizuna which is in between mint and cilantro. Not what my tastebuds normally like.  Leo's choices were the special Baked lobster roll with creamy miso ($21) and the special Spicy crunchy shrimp roll ($18) which had tempura batter-like crumbs sprinkled over it. That was my favourite roll and definitely something I hadn't ever tried before. Leo wasn't impressed by the lobster, I think just because it was the most expensive and didn't really live up to the gourmet taste he was expecting. Most dishes involving lobster in the USA are pretty costly.  In the end we had to take home most of the pieces and had no room for dessert. The service at Sushi Roku was excellent - we aren't used to having one staff take orders and check-in and another serving food and drinks, so that was a bonus for us. The server even folded Leo's napkin when he went out to the restroom.  The only thing that lacks the extra star for this review was the dark corner table we had that made it almost impossible to read the menu in candlelight, and the just-above average rolls that were priced more than we'd usually pay at a restaurant in Vancouver.  All in all, not a bad place to try if you're craving some sushi, have some money to spend, and want a romantic place to dine at with a great view of the strip.

lFXVLfgBZj69voLJfz2Vlw.text: Such a romantic sushi spot! But my girlfriends and I enjoyed it sans men-folk .Great view of the strip and comfy/cozy leather lounge seating.  Service was great and always with a smile. Wait, you mean my server is NOT annoyed that i'm here and ordering? nice!  Everything tasted delicious and most importantly fresh. Overall most things are reasonably priced but you will pay a bit more for specialty items. But honestly the food in some of the food courts in Vegas can get pretty pricey so I say you might as well get what you really want.

GhNrSxNRXm-w3kx_Amwt-Q.text: Good lunch.  Empty restaurant.  Skip the chicken teriyaki in favor of the salmon and sushi.  Everything freshly prepared.  A good choice for a decent meal to break mid-shopping at Forum shops.

UnUYDDcWMVv3TM1--fnQoA.text: Don't miss this place if you like sushi.  Awesome quality and presentation.   Very fresh, from simple flavors, to more complex combinations.  Every time we come here it surpasses our expectations!  Looking forward to next time!!!!

-6m4JnJ0ezDZvEPpy8sJSQ.text: 3.5 stars.  Location is nice, with view of the strip. A little too dark in there, but nice decor/ atmosphere.  Shared the Chilean Seabass, which was very good. Had the titan roll which was okay, but nothing spectacular or worth the $22 price. And then go the black cod, which was very good. Octopus roll was very good as well.  For the price, I've had better, but it is a solid place if you're looking for good sushi.

hFEtem9aKuK-mn1VIE5AOQ.text: It is a very nice place to go and have a great ambiance, but I don't think the cost defines the food. The sushi and sashime are very fresh and good, but nothing you can't find for cheaper and with equal quality. Service was very friendly and professional with great recommendations.

cjT0hgbdLi7B4snamVApLg.text: Went here for lunch and got the beef teriyaki lunch bento. The beef was very tender and good!

5NvOb4zeg0QEp2Hq3s6jMw.text: As a purveyor of all food fine, my wife and I ate here this past Friday night.  The serviec was friendly and not stuffy.  Our server Louis was great, very knowledgeable on the menu and a fellow foodie.    The decor was very hip and the Strip view from the main dining room were amazing.  We sat at the large couch-like tables and seating area, which are the best seats in the house.    We ordered the spicy tuna on cripsy rice, which was very good.  The jalepenos were diced and mixed into the tuna which was much better than most places that just place a sliver of the jalepeno on the rice.  Very tasty.  We also ordered the peppered kobi beef skewers which were tender and flavorful. Perfectly grilled.    We also ordered the baked crab handroll...which were the best we've ever eaten and we've had the ones at Katsuya and Koi. These by far were the best as the crab was flavorful and was stuffed in there...unlike Katsuya where they have the tendency to skimp on the ingredients.  The best part of the night was the chilean sea bass with miso glaze. That fish was cooked to perfection, it was light, flaky and ever so sweet.  This place rocks!

ZolbE_XKjvSXDc__B2KEmA.text: The restaurant itself is very beautiful and the service is excellent but the food leaves a lot to the imagination. My wife and I go to a great sushi restaurant every Wednesday in the city of Alameda CA and I ordered the same thing that I always order and am used to paying about $37.50. What I got at Roku was about 1/2 the quanity and about !/2 the quality. The Nigri pieces were cut very thin and the Chirashi pieces were also cut very thin and the quanity was very sparce. We received a bill without the tip for $97.40. What a rip off to say the least. I wasn't expecting it. I guess this restaurant is only for turists who probably never ate sushi or will never go back. I sure would not go back or recommend this place to anyone.

o_NX8NbnER0kBlJPnO00yA.text: Awesome Japanese cuisine. Thanks to Keiko for the great hospitality. And thanks to Lewis for excellent service. I loved the tuna tartar, lobster tempura and mochi ice cream. Great view of the Las Vegas Strip.

7cCkiyOyQsFv4GkJzlb1IQ.text: Im rarely disappointed.. But this placed sucks! Took forever for my food to arrive even though its about 25% full. And the rolls are tiny!! Im leaving and im still hungry! :(

5XXNUVfLnIdY-kXp4WkqBA.text: Where should I start. Our server mentioned about flavor, everything was to perfect full of flavor. Spicy edamame was perfect. Nobu specialty shrimp was out of this world. It was absolute great experience. I highly recommend it.

LreS1AEtgE7jOfj4RWckZQ.text: Amazing! Amazing! Amazing! By far one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas.  Never disappoints and the Prime Rib Eye Steak is a real delight.  I would recommend this place to anyone.  Try the infused Saki!   The server was very knowledgeable and an asset to the restaurant.

NR8Ut9wLSHEGYHOJL6OfvQ.text: We were a little scared from the front since it was a Thursday night and it seemed empty, but after walking to the back of the restaurant, we realized everyone wanted to sit by the view over looking the strip-ROMANTIC.  Honestly, I could live off the spicy tuna here. It's perfectly spicy, perfectly textured, and perfectly great. Try the spicy scallop hand roll and yellowtail sushi too; all their fish is extremely high quality, and it obviously reflects the steep prices.  We ordered a bottle of Saki (can't remember the name, probably because I couldn't  pronounce it at the time), and it went down extremely smooth and had a great, light flavor.. Our waitress would run over everytime she saw our shot glasses empty and pour us another round; ROYAL TREATMENT.

PsyJIH1zx-mUsol7zltVSw.text: Went here with a friend last week to see what its all about. Was good sushi but was limited in the spicy department. I was a little disappointed that they didnt have some spicier options. Overall was good and I loved the bartender. She was a realy great host and made sure we got all the specials. I will go again!

9fIKv_A3Jei4ahyrDs6nfQ.text: Excellent. Staff, food, service, quality, freshness delish. Excellent prices.

j_tD_S5sFz1NHK2yyByF5w.text: I LOVED this place.  Probably the best place I ate at all weekend. lets see what we ate: -Crunchy Spicy Tuna: had avocado, spicy tuna, spicy mayo sauce and a crunchy topping it was AMAZING! i loved it -Baked Lobster Roll: baked lobster, rice paper roll, asparagus, miso sauce.  it was all wrapped up and then baked and the miso sauce is nice and toasted and warm it was soo delicious -spicy scallop roll: i had the cut roll not the hand roll. honestly it was just okkay. nothing super spectacular -shrimp fried rice: pretty yummy just your basic fried rice we all shared it and it was good -miso soup: perfect not too salty but just right I mean lets be honestly everything in Vegas is expensive so I don't think the prices were outraged compared to everywhere else. I think for the price it is way better then anywhere else that we went.  If u are a sushi lover like I am then i think you will enjoy this place and bonus ITS AIR CONDITIONED inside the mall so its nice!

CclRX_qcRJ0GwK7AIYQubw.text: Been here twice now.  The first time, we had the kumamoto oysters and they were the smallest oysters I have ever seen.  I've had kumamotos elsewhere before and these were just very small. Had it again this weekend and same thing, very small oysters.  And they don't taste very fresh.

jWC7U9r37e2T2sG1_2ZGlg.text: We consistently have great service, food and quality every time we visit. We have dinner here at the very least twice a year during our Vegas trips and recommend our sushi loving friends to head over there too when they are in Vegas. I am sure there are other places to go for sushi in Vegas but the location (in Caesar's Forum Shops and there is valet, right off of Las Vegas Blvd., so no mixing with all the other LVB traffic, cabs and hoypoloy!) Our latest visit was much of the same, great service, sushi and quality. They had a private event that took up most of the dining room, but opened up more seating and were able to seat our party of 4, maybe 15 minutes later but it was prime time dinner hour 7:30 pm and there is a Peter Lik gallery across the way so the wait was nominal.   We ordered our staple crab miso, rolls and sushi. The wait staff was attentive and quick to fill waters, change plates and check on us.   We had a great meal!

TQ3t6ozMCdXt-qcemCjo3Q.text: We went to happy hour and had almost everything on the menu. One of the best happy hours I have been to. Highly recommend the shrimp tempura, rolls, Brussel sprouts in bacon.

ETZlOoYj5l4DsGTSiBf7ow.text: Absolutely amazing sushi! They seem to have a small menu but they can make anything you want. I recommend trying the baked carb hand roll with cream cheese!!! Just may be the best sushi I've ever had!

GTzG9bnHHv-SynCefUDRqw.text: One of the Best Sushi places in Vegas!  We went here for a friend's birthday and have returned twice because we can not stop thinking about it.  We ordered so much food, I tried almost everything on the menu and there was was nothing on the menu I didn't like.  The service was second to none and the food was an experience I will never forget.  The flavors and presentation are awesome.  If you have never been, go and if you have gone and weren't impressed go back and give it another try. . . this spot ROCKS!

bHLKB_cwTJD-JvK5VinYBA.text: I rarely give places a five star. A five star place is the perfect model which all other places aspire to be. Sushi Roku is that place.  Obviously the top criterion for any sushi place is the quality of the fish. It tasted fresh--and I mean out of the ocean fresh! I still am having a hard time trying to get my head wrapped around the fact that Las Vegas is nowhere near an ocean and yet it was the freshest sushi I ever had.  With that out of the way, the service was impeccable. More than one person had their eye on me to see if I wanted anything else. What I was impressed by was that they balanced the way to be immediately responsive without being too imposing. All I had to do was make eye contact with one of the restaurant staff anywhere and they seemed to master communication by gesture among the staff so the right person could address whatever it is i was looking for.  Finally, what is a sushi place without a master sushi chef? This guy was good. I even asked if they had things that were not on the menu and he still produced them in less than three minutes.  Granted I did drop 80 dollars by myself here, but with this kind of service and this kind of food, I find it is worth the money.  If you are in Vegas, and you really like sushi, there is no excuse not to go here.

RVQhyg-xYUy-EzjCDCX6GQ.text: I love giant clam, this place always has it fresh and crunchy, Don't let them seat you in the front area where you walk in, sit in the back by the windows , the view is great !.  I, minus 1 star for the price here . Even with my local discount.

rIVkD1Sx6pOlwjgyzKe4Ag.text: I ordered the crispy spicy tuna ($16) with chicken fried rice ($15), both were filling and well prepared. Service was great, ambiance was excellent. Well priced considering you're in Vegas.

j8RrvRWdhc9V9Cx7cnZDqg.text: Made reservations online for our 40th anniversary, and there was an area for special requests.  I asked for a nice table and asked if Chilean Sea Bass might be available (It used to be on the menu as an entree, but no longer).  When we got there we were seated at a very nice table, and we were able to order the Sea Bass, with a Crab Dynamite sushi roll as an appetizer. Service was excellent, the food arrived much quicker than I would have expected, and it was delicious!  After they cleared our plates, the chef (I think) and waitress brought a very nice desert to our table with "Happy Anniversary" scripted in chocolate around the edge of the plate, and a little firework that shot sparks up for about 30 seconds, while the waitress took a picture for us. The manager also came by during the meal to make sure everything was as it should be.  We couldn't have been more pleased.

IUKgaQ9xbCuQ6ClOUffvnQ.text: I absolutely loved the food here! We had a party of 5 and ordered a number of dishes for the table to share. Whether it was a fusion dish or traditional sushi, every single dish was VERY VERY good. I'm not a big fan of truffle oil but I definitely thoroughly appreciated the Yellowtail/Foie Gras/Truffle Oil creation. The kobe was super marbleized. The sampler was a lot of fun. I could go on and on about each dish. As an afterthought, the decor is beautiful and the service is great too. =P  The only thing i didn't like was the hostess. The place was clearly not full but she made it sound like it was the end of the world that we didn't have a reservation and would have to wait. Arrogant much?

QHnl67mFfiYu5k6nMaOiyg.text: Ok, when i heard this was the dinner venue for our guys night in LV, I was quite disappointed.  I guess anywhere you can get a reservation for 12 on 2 hours notice for friday is unlikely to be the hottest place in town.  Not only am I not a huge sushi fan (I know, kind of a dumb comment for a review of a sushi restaurant), but its in Caesar's Palace.  We were staying over at Wynn, so we had to get across town and make our way past all the people with oxygen tanks hanging out at Caesar's (yes, I think clientele at Caesar's tends to be old and stuffy).  Place had no ambience, but that could be attributable to the crowd (NCAA tourney weekend, so lots of sausagefest tables).  However, food was AWESOME (bold statement for a guy impartial to Sushi). We had 4-5 kinds of tuna, and all were fantastic.  I ordered the filet mignon as well, which was almost steak house quality (yes, i shared it).  And by doing big beers and sake rather than wine, tab only came to $100 per person, which is half what I would expect to pay for dinner in Vegas.

Z2bC2LWkD-7R_lx0XPqdHQ.text: I've been here twice and liked both times I was here.  It's located in Caesar's towards the back so might be somewhat hard to find.   We ordered the omakase menu, which came with multiple courses along with some sushi.  It was savory and had no regrets for springing for the extra dough on the chef's choice.  Yes, it's pricey for the dinner entrees.  American Kobe and Japanese Kobe steak not the same - Kobe beef much better!  The sushi / sashimi prices are on par on what you would find in Japan - so the sushi prices weren't pricey in my opinion just the end bill.    We liked the cool, retro interior albeit somewhat dark but it had a good view of the strip.  We had good service both times eating here.  I usually only get omakase (chef's choice) at a sushi restaurant but I would come back.

ooqlC7KFGD-XZMcauIAxgg.text: Update: minus one star. The lunch special changed and you now need to pay $3 extra for miso soup. They also forgot to put in my sisters order.  They don't have the dessert that I used to order.  Fried green tea ice cream is no longer on the menu.

Kea7ZA_ZlowZt7PQYPZe4w.text: After spending the morning at the pool, I needed to run an early afternoon errand to pickup some tailored items I bought as the Forum shops the previous day. The four of us were hungry and decided to grab something right inside the Forum shops. I valeted and was pleased to find most of the food joints on that end of the mall. We all had seen the Sushi Roku sign from the strip so decided to give it a try.  The sushi was off only mediocre quality, at best. For that quality, it was extremely overpriced. Each of us only had one cut roll (I also had one hand roll) and the bill came to $120 for four people.  I can't tell you where else to grab sushi in the Forum Shops, but there are plenty of more cost-effective options in there. I'd suggest Spagos (near the entrance to the casino on the second level).

d7-qWixoI2puS8IuHF4cIg.text: Wow....where do I start. We headed to Las Vegas to celebrate my 40th birthday and because I love sushi I wanted to experience it Las Vegas style. I went onto Yelp to see what people had to say and discovered Sushi Roku. I literally read through each and every review to see what the hype was all about. Everyone kept talking about how great the wait staff was and how if its your birthday you get even "better" treatment.  We showed up for our dinner reservations (and the host staff and wait staff was aware at this time that it was my birthday) and the two hostesses were so cold to my party. We then were seated at a window seat which was great I have to admit, the views were wonderful.  The "waitress" finally after about 8 minutes decided to grace us with her presence and didn't introduce herself to us and blankly took our drink order. My first thought was "wow she is so not personable". It proceeded to go down from there. The food arrived so that one person was eating like 10 minutes before any of the other food arrived for the table. She never gave us the time of day but was working the other tables. Finally one of my friends asked her if she was aware it was my birthday and with a cold glare she said "yes". At that point I was ticked, you would think as a wait person (which I have done for years in my past professions) that you would try a little harder for the tip you EXPECT to receive from a group.  Needless to say I approached the manager on the way out and told him that I felt very disappointed in my experience there and obviously they should look at their staff members. I would never go back there based on my experience. If you do try it good luck hopefully you get someone nice but dont expect anything special even on your birthday.

EMJTAnA_C2u6E2MAtFRmag.text: the sushi here is good. the rolls are good but they are smaller than usual for rolls. the service here is kinda slow too. the prices here are really expensive. the rolls are over twenty bucks each and they are small. its super easy to rack up a bill of a few hundred dollars. although i liked the sushi, i dont think i will be back bc i thought it was really expensive for what i got.

ntoGRu9WTZ3uim4J2xdr2w.text: We had the wild mushroom carpaccio which was exquisitly delicate.  Just the right amount of sweet and vinegar.  The sushi was quite fresh and the decor was wonderful with a nice view of the strip.  Service was also excellent.  Plus the people watching in the mall was an added bonus.

y8iORm0F4nFVOobENzhcvw.text: First, I'll start out by saying I'm a big sushi fan and have made it that I have to try a new sushi spot each trip.  This time around my friend and I picked Sushi Roku for lunch on Christmas day.  Sushi Roku is located in the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace third level right next to BOA Steakhouse.  We had reservations and once we got there was seated right away and the place is beautiful.  The decor was very nice which gave this place a great atmosphere.  The view was looking right down the strip which was very nice.  They get an A+ for the design and setup for this place.  The staff there was very friendly and helpful.  By no means the best service I've had but water and drinks were always filled.  Answered any questions we had when we asked.  First thing to know we had the Yellowtail at Social house at TI and have been looking for anything anywhere as good as there.  Nothing has lived up to it yet.  We started off with the Mixed Seafood & Vegetable Tempura and it was pretty good.  I've never had Tempura before so I can't compare to anything else.   Got the Yellowtail and I was very disappointed it just lacked much flavor and was not impressed.  I also ordered the Spicy tuna cut and this was some of the best Spicy tuna I've had.  Little Buddha was the best before I went to Sushi Roku.  The Spicy tuna was so fresh and just melted in your mouth.  Overall I would go back if I run out of sushi spots but still have Koi, Yellowtail, and Wazuzu to try in the near future.  The prices at Sushi Roku are on the high side and in my opinion not worth it per say.  For just the 2 pieces of Yellowtail and Spicy tuna it was 18.32 plus another 13.00 to split the tempura with my friend.  Overall a good spot to go but not the best sushi in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Tuna and Yellowtail
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow roll

WChd7c7SRRQI8A8gyC3j4g.text: Best Sushi I've ever had.  Get the crispy, spciy, ahi role... divine.

6mZ-CHyGNtT4UkIrDImAAQ.text: I went there for the happy hour (4-6pm). Everything is appetizer sized (except for rolls) and they are dirt cheap (equal or less than $5). My companion and I share 3 orders of sake, 7 dishes and 1 roll and the whole meal is less than $50. Great  for a meal, especially you lose your shirt in vegas. :)

qqWwxNtVUx21mYTy1k7Gvw.text: It always helps out a place when not only is the food great but the service also.  Been coming here ever since the grand opening and even though it's in an obscure area of the Forum Shops at Caesar's, it's definitley worth the trek.  Always have consistently good food here with great decor (and if you sit at the right spot on a nice summer night, they open the sliding windows open so you can "feel" the strip view).  Have come with small groups as well as large and this place never fails me.  Some recommended dishes:  Seared yellowtail with diced chile (extra chile for me please!!), popcorn rock shrimp, chilean seabass, chicken nuggets with that cilantro-like dipping sauce, and pretty much any of their sushi.  I've been to all the Roku's (except the newly opened one at the W in AZ) and this one is as good if not better than any of the other ones.  It's always bigger, badder, and better in Vegas.

wlGJx-NtZ1cFb3Iv79azjg.text: very good sushi cut fresh right in front of you.  had the yellow tai tuna roll which was awesome.  will go back there very soon

QKcvm8xZGT-j9Shs2suP3Q.text: Not what you would expect from being inside a shopping center - Nice! Sushi and Sashimi were good, sides and extras were fresh. Service was very friendly and attentive, pricing was - well, typical for the Strip. All in all, good restaurant, great ambiance and quality service.

RbHWpGYeHVi24VesF44CYA.text: GO. HERE. NOW. I fancy myself a bit of a sushi aficionado, and I am SO glad we tried Sushi Roku at Caesar's.  They have some REALLY rare cuts of fish that I want in my life everyday.  We ordered Nigiri (Sake, Tuna, Hamachi, and Trout). The trout was the recommendation of the server and GOOD GOD, best nigiri I've ever had. Imagine Salmon, which is so fresh and buttery and smooth, but MORE buttery and smooth. It was like what salmon WANTS to be.  We also tried a few rolls which were incredible, but the nigiri is really where they shined.  I can't wait to come back next time in LV! ENJOY!

JbpbuGBAjmDPiQYU8UPTAg.text: Most pleasant dinner in Vegas. Great happy hour with very friendly staff. Owner made a point to check in on all guests.   Only tried the happy hour menu but thought all the food was fanatic, especially for the price.   Highly recommended

hl-3zMGWv5XUmse9UHeEvw.text: I love sushi roku, I go to the one in Newport Beach a lot and the taste here in Vegas was just as good as it is at home. The waitress was very nice and the service was great. 4 stars because the hostess wasn't too friendly but we also came without a reservation so not sure if that had anything to do with it, OH WELL. good alternative to other restaurants like nobu if you aren't into spending nobu money.

XPLrXt3d4f6t__Rsz6Xfbw.text: Really awesome robata sea bass skewers. The katana roll is fantastic. Short rib was done really well. Overall great service and happening atmosphere. Would definitely come back.

FXxZyD2nRmz_hTwCa6yznw.text: Based on my own experience, I'm pretty surprised that anyone would have rated this below 5 stars.  Our experience was amazing.  The head sushi chef, Jason, took great care of us.  The fish was delicious, the rice was perfect, the ambience was very chic and overall I would rank this as one of my top 5 dining experiences.    Probably the best item I had was Foie Gras, wrapped with Hamachi and Chiso leaf, topped-off with a white truffle and gold flakes.
