_n_BbG0iPjSWvu5ryhbASg.text: Perfect ambiance, ultra delicious portions, great service, on the expensive side, but totally worth it to whom who can afford and is interested in a higher end experience. (specially on the Vegas Strip!)

20RWMNHMo9Pbrtredn0yqQ.text: Good food, overpriced, the bill was over $150 for 2 and I was still a little hungry after..  It's like a sushi tasting... everything is a small bite and it's just a few pieces on the plate...  two star off was for the portion and price.  service is great, food is great too.  Just hope that they make it a little more filling then those two stars would be up :\

8lvHAENyZ3R8fKpwCg1ETA.text: From the time we got in till the time we left from the service to the meal...very impressed..

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jgOFom7oSBO2QFo7qnUd1w.text: Excellent service, great sake selection. My new favorite place for sushi in Las Vegas. Ask for a table by the window. Great atmosphere easy to have a conversation but still overall good vibe.  Just simply cannot say enough good things. Try the Kim Chee.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0iKcczgaPDWG-o5r1EinCw.text: Best sushi I've had in a while!  I won't spoil the surprise of the multi-course Omakase, but WOW, was it an experience. Apart from standard Sashimi/Nigiri/sushi fare, you're fed some very, VERY delicious dishes that I've personally never had served to me quite like this before. Okay, so it's not traditional Japanese fare, but it's extremely appetizing never-the-less.  A hint... King Crab w/ Champagne Butter? OMG YES.

677HdsbvDuY1G9jgyJoRAg.text: I was not impressed with this place despite having heard some positive things from my husband's friend.  We sat at the bar as we were not planning on eating an excessive meal and we were just looking to be a tad more low key than what I had seen in the dining room.    I was not impressed with the quality of the fish, or the service here.  Decent, no complaints about the food, but it was just like what I could get back home (which is not all that impressive).

NL5kKKtXnVhXDjQB7h3yDg.text: Nice looking place.  The server was an AZZ.  I don't know if it was because our party of 6 included 2 kids or maybe he didn't like my shoes...  I dont know.  Everyone in our party just got the feeling that we were bothering "Gregory".   There was only 3 other people in the restaurant at 4:30 pm so I have no idea what the problem was.  Check my reviews...  I am not the negative rating yelper that only rates poor service.  This guy made us all just want to leave.

vfGwsFaKHUPkRrYfzq7pcw.text: We walked up to the empty restaurant around 9:45/10 and there was no hostess. She saw us and took her time to come back and asked us if we had a reservation with a lot of attitude. She even made an exaggerated sigh as if we seemed to bother her. We ended up leaving and eating at Nobu which is the better option!

N51urfY4yfFI5tCznt_ZzQ.text: Overpriced,small portions, and bland.  Need I say more?  I have eaten at much better sushi restaurants for much less!  Stay away! Do yourself a favor .

4iEFifEyEbUbboCrgp-4tg.text: I've eaten here several times before & always loved what I got. I'm not a huge fan of the prices as it's NOT cheap (that's the only reason I took 1 star away from my review). But the quality is pretty good & the drinks are strong (just wish they were bigger!). I love the decor & ambience here.  On my last visit here (mid-Jan 2012, on a Saturday), I went for a late lunch (around 2-3pm), got the Shima Roll with a side of Edamame. Ate these with a Grey Goose with a splash of Sprite. Very yummy, wish I had gotten another roll because it was very tasty.  Server was so nice, very warm & friendly. Hostess was also super nice.  Sort of funny story: I was seated on the end of 1 row of tables, on the booth part of the table. 2 guys were on the opposite end of my row. The guy sitting on the booth part kept shaking his leg or something, which caused the row to shake a bit ... along with me attempting to eat my sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 01/14/12: Shima Roll w/side of Edamame (1 piece is missing because I ate it before taking this picture! haha)

qPxud6aAG1lBYSD7qvMYZA.text: Decent but nothing crazy that would make me go back there. I'd actually give this place 3.5 stars. Either way, i would not make an effort to go here again.

kMKP3j_zvRx_39eU5IuzbQ.text: The fish was great. The service was also recommendable. However, considering the size and other factors such as location, third floor of a mall, it was not a 5 stars.

xwCB6cOfISm36hgAmcn5oQ.text: My husband and I were celebrating our 5th wedding anniversary and in search of the best sushi in Vegas. But where? But HERE, recommended by everyone we asked. Over my ginger mojito and baked lobster roll I gazed adoringly at him, the sparkly strip beyond him, and I realized I could not have asked for more succulent morsels, more perfect service, or a more romantic experience.  We hope to return to Roku on our 10th, 15th, 20th and so on. Because truly great sushi makes for long, happy lives together.  Well, probably not. But it should.

vIjt0_TyTV4yRKq4iqfXwg.text: Delicious fresh sushi! Got the spicy tuna roll and absolutely loving it! The sashimi is a bit pricey, but everything is very well done. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katana roll with tuna, yellowtail, and shrimp tempura!

oXEYOiSKT5Rcbf64jIFo5A.text: After talking with friends and getting recommendations, was looking forward to dinner. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to expectations. Edamame came out burnt, the short ribs were extremely overcooked, and the lobster roll had some sort of cheese/Benedict sauce on it that wasn't appetizing. Maybe it was just an off night, but we were disappointed to say the least.

7-khQsHGKTS4qRs2FG5gTQ.text: The Uni was delicious! The service  supper and the experience I can't explain. I will recommend this play to any one. My last time there was many years ago and still the quality isA+ outstanding!

qpG04jR4YEfar38r8Iw7eg.text: This place is a typical example of Vegas extravagance on the Strip. I opted for the Kobe "American" New York steak cut which is priced at over $50. Not sure how many ounces it ended up being but for not being the Japanese version, it was a very tender New York cut. Full of flavor, well seasoned, and a healthy side of varied mushrooms and green beans. You'll have to get your carbs from their various specialty sushi rolls or nigiri options.  Basic dessert menu, actually decided to skip it since it didn't stand out and the pricey entree already made the dinner worthwhile.  Great ambiance and if you have the option, opt for the lounge seating instead of the normal tables.  5 stars for the awesomely flavored food and comfortable interior. Of course I could nit pick about the lackluster dessert options or opine about the lack of real Japanese Kobe beef, but the sushi, entree, and appetizer menu is varied enough to include something for everyone.

GgRb1Z3LxOcl_axk89gfJQ.text: Go during happy hour!!!  We easily ordered over $250 worth of food and it came out to be only $100 for two people. The crispy rice dish was so good we ordered it twice. Get some hot sake and chow down on the hand rolls. The salmon and tuna were fresh.  Also, the manager (or maybe owner) was extremely attentive and took the time to give my friend and I some background on Vegas, Caesar's palace, and the strip. 5/5 for food and service!

MK-DzbQ1P8OSv4mcIdhZAA.text: I was on a work trip last week and went here  after being recommended this restaurant by one of my coworkers that has been to Las Vegas many times.  They had a happy hour menu so we started with some drinks off of that but they also had sushi rolls and appetizers for a discounted price.  My coworkers had the spicy salmon rolls off the menu and enjoyed those.  We then had some of the sushi rolls off of the regular and everything was very fresh.  We sat at the bar and the service by the bartender was very good.

oAWcyKctthN8V24UAf4a5w.text: Sushi R does it again. A buddy of mine hooked me up with this place 7 yrs ago and it's ever bit as good today as 7 yrs ago - do yourself a favor and eat at Sushi Roku  Katana Roll is a std and try the Sea Bass Roboto as a starter kit!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea Bass Roboto

KM0KUoZrS9m_vCD2MgPCbg.text: Quite disappointed with this place on NYE. The portions were soooo tiny, MY GOSH for $145, I'd expected more. The girl on the phone said 7 course, when we got there it's only 6 course. Not only that but seriously, everything is tiny! I been to Japan and even their portions were bigger.   The sushi did not seem fresh at all. The color was quite dull. The tofu lobster thing was alright, and the dessert-- I definitely had better.  The worst part was the fact they kept forgetting about our order and wanted to rush us to finish. The couple next to us was even asked by the Manager to leave and move to the bar if they wanted to stay.   I didn't even get my champagne toast because it took them so long, so I left. The view and the seating was disappointing, despite the fact I have already requested a good window seating.  The cocktail was good, ginger lychee mojito, but gah...I'm quite disappointed and would not come back. Maybe if I was coming back for the Anago since it's the only place I've seen so far that serves it. I should of ordered off the regular menu, but the girl mentioned the pre fixe was better..yea..right..

-KMuqDlSNEyguWSmN2vJlA.text: Boring and bland, it all tasted the same and at a premium price point I expected better. A Slow lazy service.

3TpUpn_8tPBj8xfdnJv7iw.text: First time at a sushi restaurant.  It was great.  I did not try the sushi. Maybe next time!

nCyOaW8xj2DGgQmIH5HWAg.text: 5 stars for ambiance, two stars for both food and service.   Great decor and view looking over the street. Service was slow, poorly timed, and not very helpful. Food was mediocre - my boyfriend and I got the edamame hummus (pita was great, hummus was bland), spicy tuna roll (eh) an avacado roll, and pork belly fried rice (incredibly bland). Definitely over priced.  Won't be returning, except perhaps for drinks to enjoy the view.

ZBo4pKwyo_n9NThA2mDiBw.text: I've been a big fan of the Sushi Roku in Pasadena for years! The Vegas one is a step down from the one in Pasadena, but it's still enjoyable if you're looking for reasonably priced sushi in Vegas. It's located inside a mall, so the location leaves something to be desired, but whatever. We got an assortment of rolls and sashimi as well as some alcoholic beverages. The waitress forgot our sake so she ended up giving us an extra one for free! Really nice of her!  SERVICE: Minus forgetting our sake, the service was really good. FOOD: the rolls were really good but the some of the sashimi were cut unevenly.  I've been to other sushi bars in Vegas, however, and they were all twice as expensive as this place, so I thought it was worth it. Also, they have allot of non sushi items on their menu too, so if you're going with sushi lovers and you hate it, there's plenty for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katana roll
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail and California roll

Gwi21k4pn1xwVdC0ZbeuFQ.text: Because I was here on someone else's dime, I enjoyed the food very much.  I had the pork ramen and the salmon carpaccio.  Living in Austin, ramen is like rain, very, very scarce.  Out of the ramen I've had across the US, this was solid.  Nothing to obsess over, but FAR from the worst I've had.  The salmon carpaccio had wonderful olive oil, mint, and light seasoning that I loveeeeeeee.  $7 for a 12oz Sapporo?  Well, this is Vegas.  Find this place in the corner of the Forum shops on the highest level.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AcwWKPhFivy_Et-EMMpaag.text: This place is a little difficult to find but the food was great. Everything was fresh and taste great. I will definitely go back when I'm in town.

6ZP6OBEhhcsCvjY2tJEFtg.text: Met my brother here for a quick bite... The food was good, but not AMAZING. Prices are high since it is located inside the Caesars Palace Forum Shops- but the service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour

2IbQ4BMWtHU2LEQii6KWtQ.text: Basically overpriced sushi and poor quality. I was not impressed by this place at all..  This place is so dark inside I couldn't even read my menu properly.

jWyVq-aqAlIkAjkUJR98Wg.text: What can i say but the truth a definite stop when we are in vegas right next to tommy bahama at the Cesar palace forums. Food is delicious and fresh try the katana rool and the shashimi all of them wont be disaapointed also shrimp fried rice is off the hook.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oQDfYRYewwg_ER5ky2P8Ow.text: I normally would give this type of restaurant 4 stars, but because of the fact that it's in Vegas and it was a Valentine's dinner, I will go all out and give it 5 stars!   I had Sushi Roku as one of my bookmarks, and as I was sitting around waiting for my boyfriend, I realized that we didn't have reservations anywhere on Valentine's night. We had a show that night at the Caesars hotel, so I figured this would be perfect! I called and they took us in no problem. She did ask for my credit card to hold my reservation, but the machine was broken at the time. I wonder if they charge you if you don't show up..?  Anyway, it took us awhile to find this restaurant and I am pretty sure we went around and found every place you can eat at before we got to Sushi Roku. So for any future diners, the best thing to do just go through the Forum shops since it's located there, rather than the actual hotel. The atmosphere and decor is absolutely beautiful, from the lighting fixtures to the bathroom doors. We were sat at a table that had the view of the entire strip on one side and the other side looked out to Harrah's.. sooo cool! This is worth a visit just for the view alone!  The service was great but the food was even better...   For the appetizer we got the Tuna Sashimi Carpaccio - I have never had anything like it before. It was delicious and so fresh that the tuna pieces just melt in your mouth. For our entrees, we split a few rolls:  -Makoto Roll - It's a spicy Yellow tail & Shrimp wrapped with seared tuna in a creamy spicy sauce. It's probably one of the best rolls I've ever tried in my life.  -Rainbow roll, Crunchy Spicy Tuna, and one more that I don't remember. Every roll was unbelievably fresh and done to perfection.   For dessert, we both had cappuccino's and split a dessert - Raspberry bread pudding with Carmel... OH MY!   This was definitely the best meal of the trip and a perfect place for a date!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Sashimi Carpaccio
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow roll, crunchy spicy Tuna
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Makoto roll

LRJy7m7pqYuc2W9YH1mplw.text: Sushi Roku is a very elegant and fancy sushi lounge and bar inside Caesars. It is somewhat difficult to find, it is up the escalators past the Forum (the shopping area) and is in one of the corners.  Inside you will see lots of empty space despite an okay number of other diners but the place is so big that there are bound to be many open tables. A nigiri (fish + rice underneath) averages 4-5$ a piece, with a blue fin special they had at the time of 13$ a piece. I expected this to be mind blowing but it was very very average. The salmon belly was super fatty as expected, it tasted super fresh but the texture at the end of the day was just not my thing, but not their fault as I just wanted to try it. The salmon nigiri was good, we ordered a lot of "regular" nigiri and those were all solid. The eel one could be a little less cooked but still decent. Overall I would probably not pay that much for this. A friend got some kind of roll for 20$ but it tasted very average as well, I could get the same for 12-15$ in NYC which is really saying something.  The view though is amazing, like a super awesome view of the strip. The lounge is cool as well, you have enough space away from other tables to do your own thing, and the couch chairs are super comfortable (which is also the case at the dining table). Food I would give 2.5 stars given the exorbitant price, but view and atmosphere I would give 4.5.

_aTr6zi0ewjReS7s-3vDRg.text: We used to love this place and would have previously rated 5/5 but our most recent experience was horrendous food.   I'm wondering if there is new ownership?  Regardless stay clear, our group of 6 Connoisseurs was horrified by the food. At one point my wife actually spit out the Lobster roll. We paid our $500 left and went to eat.   I complained to the hostess on the way out but she didn't really seem to care.

UDz_jXVb4IOGSezO3VBipw.text: Having been a frequent visitor to the establishments in LA when I was living down there, I have always had a soft spot for Sushi Roku.  Having been to Sushi Roku a few times in Vegas, this is my first time actually reviewing it!  My fiance and I had dinner here on a Friday night while in town, and Sushi Roku definitely did not disappoint. After getting seated at a table with a beautiful view of the strip, we decided to go with the following:  Drinks: Me: Pear Blossom Him: Salary Man Share: Recommended sake from our waiter  -Tuna Carpaccio: I've said this a number of times (including in my review of Sushi Roku in Santa Monica), this is and has been one of THE best things I've had...ever.  The sesame soy dressing and garlic chips that comes with this makes it absolutely amazing.  As I've said before, if licking the plate was socially acceptable, I would do it, especially for this.  An absolute must-have item.  -Chicken Karaage: Delicious, hot, and crispy, this dish definitely did not disappoint. The delicious wasabi cream that came with this was definitely helpful for this.  -Chutoro sashimi: It's been a really long time since both of us have had quality pieces of fish, and this certainly was worth every bite.  The fish quality was so great, we decided to follow on with another few pieces of Otoro later on.  Definitely nailed both of these sashimi dishes, but the Chutoro was definitely the winner.  -A^2 Fusion Roll: One of the night's specialty rolls with albacore, avocado, and cucumber, I think?  Either way, it wasn't great, and was one of the more disappointing dishes we had that night.  Didn't stop me from eating all of it, but Greg didn't want any part of it.  -Gyoza: Delicious dumplings stuffed with Kobe beef! So amazing! I don't think I've ever had anything like this.  After the tuna carpaccio, this was Greg's second favorite dish.  -Raspberry Bread Pudding: AMAZEBALLS. The dish came with chocolate ice cream on top, and a cream, caramel, and raspberry sauce at the bottom.  With my cappuccino, this was absolutely amazing.  It was definitely a fantastic way to end our meal.  Sushi Roku was definitely everything I remembered and more!  We definitely had a great experience here, and will be coming back for that Tuna Carpaccio!

ZfaskwcK5RV_yUSwYE_rnA.text: Very good quality food but overpriced. Would come again maybe.

LqSdJXxV5GbRgfBVU6BuqQ.text: OK, this place deserved 2.5 stars.  Sushi quality was very good:  4-5 stars.  Prices were obscene, though, even with that quality of fish.  Minus 1 star for that.  Service was lacking.  The place was nearly empty yet I had to wait a long time for everything.  Don't feed me piecemeal when there is NO ONE at the restaurant.  I sat at the sushi bar and had to wait for every pair of sushi to be served to me.  I'd like to pick what order I eat my fish.  Please know what fish you do have and don't have.  This is a sushi restaurant.  It's like a bell captain who has to stop and ask the blackjack dealer where the elevators are (...which happened at the Venetian, btw.  But I digress.)  Minus 2 stars.   Yeah, overall, the experience was lacking.  Aka... sucked.

b5Qxh2tLhCSdF4d-NU7x9w.text: Went with 8 girls and spent $340. Not bad for Vegas.   Pros: Great sushi, even though you're in the middle of the desert. Good drinks. Seaweed salad supposedly amazing, says two of my friends. Atmosphere +++ Squishy seats at the booths.   Cons: You're not really going to feel full after eating here unless you're dropping some serious money.  Skip the miso soup, sooo not worth $1, let alone $4  What we really liked about it is that we got a free dessert sampler thanks to a chef a friend knew and we didn't have to go far to hit up Pure. Good times.

vPoOs6Sd87md4XomK39dWw.text: The sashimi and skewers were incredible.  Also a big fan of yellowtail with jalapenos and ponzu.   Had several bottles of the most expensive nigori sake, which costs almost as much as our entire meal!

UrdTmh8UkaKYRe7nbDmRDQ.text: I'm not too crazy about sushi, but I loved Sushi Roku!  We had to wait quite a while for our table, so we had some apps and drinks at the bar. When we were seated, we put ourselves in the waitress' hands and left the ordering to her. I think it might have been the chef's tasting menu.  We were pretty full on the soup and apps, so by the time the sushi came out, I was pretty full, but tried the sushi anyway. if I can eat at Sushi Roku every time I try sushi, I may learn to love it after all...

pzIo2ZQZZXcJV7iEZoYgXQ.text: I come here at least a couple times a month. Everything you get here is amazing! Asparagus wrapped in steak, tempura shrimp, lobster shrimp, sea bass with miso sauce, katana roll. I can keep going. Everyone there is so awesome and so nice! I love our waitress Mikoh and ask for her every time. You won't be disappointed. Johnny, the manager, is also wonderful and nice. I will keep going here forever!

3Ia3AUq4SBDo8h_iyLoPqQ.text: My friend took me here for a late lunch and surprisingly, there was only one other occupied table in the main dining area. Love the hip and zen-like ambience.  This is by far the best joint at Caesar's Palace. The portions are small and the prices are a bit steep, but hey this is Vegas. I rather  feed my tummy than those slot machines. I would def let my friend take me back here again :)  Oh btw- I had the lobster tempura and calamari salad.

PJYXqWzFr2GMA5r1PzUjQw.text: food was delicious! sake all nite long!  our waitress was the best!   pretty expensive.

IvAKyKpbXHJp2c8m5AUmGw.text: It's hard to give a place in Vegas that does it as big as Sushi Roku any less than five stars. It just doesn't work.  If you are a sushi, sashimi, whatever-i fan - this place has it all, you will not get it as good as you get it here, unless you cross the pond to japan. From the excellent food, to the exclusive sake that they serve, you know you're getting a one-of-a-kind experience here.  The service is excellent, and if you're there for work (boo-yah! expense that junks!) and you can splurge, they know when you're spending money, and you'll find your dessert comped if they can tell that you are dropping some dollars.  Ask for Kenji if you want to feel super duper cool and VIP. Tell him the place came highly recommended by a friend from New York, and you were told to make sure you give him their best. Joke, laugh, exchange business cards. It'll be the cherry on top of the whole experience.  As much as I hate Vegas, it's places like Sushi Roku that make me love Vegas.  Enjoy!

goCd3h-sLt60-xZSngle2A.text: We ate here this past weekend for my Birthday dinner. Overall it's an okay restaurant. The interior decoration is steller and the views of the strip were amazing!  Our waitress also threw in a bottle of sake and if it's your birthday you get this fiery faux drink type thingy and everyone sings happy birthday so I suppose I would recommend for a special occasion.   That being said the food wasn't anything to rave about. Living in SF it's hard to visit another city and not be a culinary snob, but I've eaten at some amazing spots in Vegas and this place did not live up.   When our food arrived it appeared to have been sitting for awhile waiting to be delivered (e.g the sauce looked like something out of a microwave meal and the ginger was browning).  So I wasn't that impressed. The service was mid grade for not being that busy I was a bit suprised by the lack of attentiveness.   If you go expect great ambiance and average food!

1zmQPMwCYrrMsux3wH0t9A.text: Following a friend's recommendations for Sushi Roku, we made dinner reservations for a Saturday night.  Being a self proclaimed sushi nazi, I was very hesitant about going to sushi roku.  I always have issues with going to chain sushi restaurants.  And I also knew a chef who worked at sushi roku...  When we walked in the decor was great, with a great view of the strip.  I ordered my usual list of sushi (uni, yellowtail, toro, albacore, hirame) as well as the Chilean sea bass.  My date ordered the Kobe steak.    The sushi came out first.  We also ordered the special of the night: some special cut of Toro.  The sushi was bland...nothing spectacular.  I could not taste anything special about the Toro.  Very disappointing, considereing we paid $24 for 2 pieces of special Toro.    My Chilean sea bass was cooked very well, flakey and melts in your mouth.  I didn't particularly like the sauce on my fish.  It was supposed to be a truffle miso glaze, but all i tasted was the pineapples of the glaze.  My date's steak came to us dry and well done when we ordered medium rare.  Already disappointed with our experience, I flagged down a waiter and sent the steak back to the kitchen.  The host and staff were very concern about the steak and immediately sent us a new, better cooked steak.    If you do plan to go to Sushi Roku, stick to ordering rolls.  For service, Sushi Roku gets 5 stars.  But sigh....service and decor does not keep my belly happy.

2Bc87RHRD9TZrhyB86ZI4w.text: We ate here on a Friday night as part of a group of fourteen from Vision Expo and the food and service was excellent! The friendly, professional service staff brought out many unique, tasty dishes and all of us walked away very satisfied. We were seated in a private area that looked out on the Strip, which created a very nice atmosphere.

7GQd2R4KIUF-7BWt76unYg.text: I have been to this restaurant twice and I hate it.  I can't believe that this place is so popular.  The sushi was AWFUL.  I hope that I didn't contract parasites from the tuna.  The service here is DREADFUL and the scene is HORRIBLE.   Stick with Wasabi on Sahara...it's the best in the world.

K_uojNP-g8Jx78W8PlFWjA.text: If it wasn't for yelp I wouldn't have found this place, it's tucked away in the shops and on the third floors.    The atmosphere is definitely "uppity."  Very dark modern feel to it.    Ok, so as far as sushi goes, this place is pricey.  But, we went to Vegas for a friends bday and wanted a nicer place to dine.   Started with the edamame hummus - which had a more watery consistency to it than I am used to.  There was edamame beans in there, which added textures.  I did not, however liked the chips that came with it for scooping.    I tried the spicy tuna and spicy scallop roles.  They were good, I guess.  I think I've had better sushi elsewhere.  My friends raved about the crab dynamite roll, but I didn't try it.  The portions for the BBQ chicken special was so tiny for the price - I couldn't see anyone getting full by it.    The best part of the meal was the dessert.  We told our server one of us was having a bday and they brought two sufferer deserts, and a cool flaming firecracker type candle.  Considering the place was dark, it lit up our table and made for a fun presentation.  Also the desserts were very delicious - a very rich chocolate brownie with ice cream and strawberries, and a fruit blend type of tart, I can't describe too well.  I think this place is more presentation than food quality.

DIOckQpTfA9SHpcrCPDotw.text: was here on labour day.  had my money stolen.  staff unhelpful; manager inexperienced and unprofessional; used to frequent often for the mediocre but reasonably priced happy hour menu.  will never return.  advise patrons to hold on to keep their bags close.  horrible experience.  try ra sushi instead for a decent happy hour menu.

_mfryqq2snqrkLNTmq6dnQ.text: Writing this review on my mobile phone while sitting at the bar at Sushi Ruku in Las Vegas. Had a reservation, but as with the last 2 times I have been here, they are overbooked and there is a long wait.  I'm cool with waiting at the bar, but the bartender hasn't done anything but BS and serve the large group of girls at the end of the bar for the last 45 minutes.  Honestly, the sushi isn't spectacular and the location is tiny, but I wind up getting talked into going here more than I would like to.  This is the last time I am coming to the Vegas location of Sushi Roku.

NC_f3forDmukt5UwY93h5g.text: My wife and I just had dinner at Sushi Roku, and we really enjoyed it. The service was terrific, especially our server, Deborah. The ingredients were fresh, the warm dishes were straight from the kitchen, and the portions were adequate. Highlights included the Lobster Tempura with a Miso Glaze and the Kobe Beef Pot Stickers. The sushi was terrific, too. We had plenty to eat, and two cocktails each, for about $150, plus tip.would dine here again, for sure.

LLYuA9U0UPuQe4qJtySbFA.text: We went for lunch and had a really good time.  The tempura was so fresh as was the eel and avocado roll and the spicy tuna roll.  The beer was so fresh and the atmosphere was perfect for lunch. The seating is super cozy and it made us want to stay all day and eat sushi and drink beer! :)

QI5eGoGcvMpX9_luUBYSTg.text: Right when you walk in, this place was pretty nice.  We made reservations at 8pm and everything looked amazing.  They had these booths on the right hand side which looked pretty comfortable, but we had a large group so we took a table.  The decor is really relaxing and the view is awesome.   I had the salmon and scallop dish here and it was really good.  Everything in the dish went with each other, but I didn't order much because we were going out later that night...drinking...so yeah.  I guess I'd say that this place met my expectations and didn't disappoint.  Service was on par with the status of the restaurant so no complaints there.  But for some reason I couldn't give this place 5 stars.  The food was good but not excellent...if it was excellent I would have ordered more after my first dish.   Overall, I'm satisfied with my experience here.

-xjcxafF01JgWFx3o81_fg.text: The baked lobster rolls was amazing! We really liked everything we tried. Great food, great view. Service was a bit slow. They took a while to come by when we wanted to order more food. The view to the Strip was awesome.

FUmo-64qmAM6U7HGvOUOVg.text: There are many things words to describe perfection.  In this case hands down amazing service from front door to the the AGM and GM.  This place will always treat you like a king and Queen. 5 out of 5  and everything above.  Thank you Gary and Sushi Roku for making our night even better than the last time..

eHmS2YEAN-K7KE6NLCdb8w.text: Sushi roku was one of the best restaurant choices we made while in Vegas. Although it was hard to find in the hotel/casino, the Ambiance and view were worth the walk. I had the tuna appetizer and popcorn shrimp along with a few rolls. Everything was awesome. One of our friends didn't like raw fish and still enjoyed the other menu items. From the sake to the salad, I would rave about this place. Next time I'm in Vegas, I will be sure to come back!!!!!

uvQwu86ZSv5sShw90NVx6A.text: We came here for my cousin's birthday. It was a good experience.   The atmosphere and decor was exceptional, very trendy and posh. The view of the strip was gorgeous! The service from our wait staff was impeccable and they made sure that we had a great experience.   We had ordered the following dishes, of course I had to try a little of everyone's dishes.. with some exceptions... hee hee..:   Japanese Yellowtail Sashimi with diced Chilies: Yummy!! The yellowtail just melted in your mouth.  Chilean Seabass with Truffle Miso Glaze & Sauteed Spinach: This was my dish...it was seared just right and the truffle miso glaze was so delicious!! I would definitely order this again.  Sauteed Salmon & Hokkaido Scallops; XO sauce with Asparagus & Potatoes: Scallops were cooked perfectly, not chewy or tough.  Katana Roll: Tuna & Yellowtail atop Spicy Tuna & Shrimp Tempura: Great presentation, and the fish was really fresh  Spicy Tuna Hand roll: I wasn't able to try this as it was only for one person.  Grilled Ji-Dori Chicken with Sauteed Mix Mushrooms & Mashed Potatoes: Chicken was extremely tender, great combination with the sauces.   This restaurant is a little pricey but c'mon it's Vegas. The ambiance, the delicious food, and the service is definitely well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Tuna Hand roll and Katana Roll
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauteed Salmon &amp; Hokkaido Scallops
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean Seabass with Truffle Miso Glaze &amp; Sauteed Spinach

jUHlOaR-BtaqhC_-Q3cugw.text: My boyfriend and I came here for dinner the other night on our trip to Vegas. We're from Southern California so we know good sushi and while this place was absolutely gorgeous inside, I was a little disappointed. I knew it was going to be pricey, but I thought maybe the portions would be a little bigger and the sushi would be more unique. We ordered the jalapeno tuna roll and the scallop roll. The food runner accidentally brought out a roll that we didn't order but he said we could just keep it, so that was a plus! It was good, don't get me wrong, but I've definitely had very similar sushi rolls at numerous restaurants in California. Our server was very nice and our food came out quickly. I would recommend this place for sure, I guess I'm just spoiled when it comes to the sushi places by my house :)

ir1GXmisSEIixtCECcnUbA.text: Thank you!!! The restaurant promised a front row table to NYE fireworks and delivered.food and drinks were great. Fun times!!!

z9ck3h2vJ3TVUURdbmhoEQ.text: Vegas pricing.  To be expected.  I can't get over a certain expectation of quality when sushi reaches a certain cost per roll.  The ambiance is fantastic and the service was outstanding.

SO-puez90GT420g8_K-DWg.text: This place describes itself as forward thinking and the new face of sushi. Well if this is the new face of sushi we are going back in time with Marty McFly. The sushi was mediocre to put it nicely. Luckily I had a gift card to use so i didn't pay much. I will give it that it had a great view. But when the sushi came out it tasted like it had a bit of Clorox on it from cleaning the plate but then rubbed off on the sushi. Very unlikely I will want to come here again unless forced.

nFulIgZelIEG090rUFVEgg.text: We decided on this sushi restaurant based upon other Yelper's reviews.  We were not disappointed.  There were many wonderful choices on the menu but my husband's love for Salmon, avocado and jalapenos was satisfied when the restaurant made him a "special" hand roll with soy wrapper and included these 3 items.  I have posted the picture.  Also try the albacore tuna tacos and the Spicy Rock Shrimp with asparagus cut roll.  Our waiter Khang, originally from Hawaii, was exceptional.  We had a wonderful view of the strip from our table and we couldn't have had a better time.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special request:  Salmon, Avocado, and Jalapeno hand roll in soy wrapper.

oheAdC1Pw4ww1XHoH_0MDw.text: Nice environment...supposedly rated most romantic spot...I think they exaggerated a bit. This place looks, feels, and is expensive BUT the food does not match up. I tried their "best" roll Katana and it was very disappointing. My friend's rolls were disappointing as well, fish was dull in color (not fresh) and didn't taste like the $29 I paid for. Also tried the King crab fried rice and that was disappointing as well: not much crab meat and just nothing that special. In general, the food was not bad but I just dislike places that try to make their food seem good by making it super expensive and making the place expensive. One more thing: I came in a group of 7 people and the server helped us all write in our tip....like rude much, if gratuity is included then get it printed...its unprofessional. To describe this place in one word: phony. If you want to have great Asian food, go to Tao (I'm not advertising for Tao btw). I would go back to Tao a thousand times and probably never voluntarily go here again.

1ylCY9RJp-9Rp4DD_iZE6w.text: This was a perfect spot to get delicious sushi.  The atmosphere was quiet and romantic and the food was amazing.  No doubt about it, we will be back.

J-oC0w6FL6M2xktME1-nPg.text: As a 16yr local of Las Vegas, Sushi Roku is hands down my favorite Sushi Restaurant in Vegas!  Been here several times and this last time we were a party of 7 in to celebrate a friend's birthday and from start to finish the service was excellent & attentive. Great view of the strip from where our table was located. The food & drinks though are what keep me coming back. The menu changes so even for us regulars there's always something new to be tied. I had the edamame hummus (only because I love both edamame & hummus & was curious about it) & crispy rice asparagus appetizers.  Next was the Kurobuta Pork "Kakuni" (braised pork belly) & my main was the Filet Mignon with Ginger Teriyaki sauce.  The hummus was great though they should serve it with a few more wonton chips than they do as those ran out long before the hummus did.  They did however bring out a few more chips when asked.  The crispy rice asparagus was  prepared and served as you would expect, and while it was good, it wasn't as memorable as other dishes the table ordered. The Kakuni on the other hand was my favorite dish of the night (and that's also including all the dishes of my dining companions that I also tried). All you pork belly fans, this is one of the best preparations I've ever had of this fatty delectable treat. The Filet was served sliced alongside mashed potatoes & garlic green beans...the Filet was perfectly cooked and seasoned perfectly! A phenomenal dinner was had by all!   Also if you like cocktails that are sweet, definitely get the cookies & cream & pineapple upside down cake cocktails...phenomenal!  Already looking forward to my next return visit to Sushi Roku!

d3Zx05gwWuU8utkFH6oMlA.text: Great place!  It's in Ceasar's forum shops on the 3rd floor.  I sat at the sushi bar and they treated me so nicely.  Very good service and the food was good!  Fresh sushi, great rolls and interesting appetizers.  I had the spicy yellowtail rolls and the toro jalapeno which rocked!  Really good food, cool place, good service.

rQUNoSwLOHgzdXuPC1PNAQ.text: This place is expensive and the portions are soooo small. The view is nice and decor is beautiful but that's about it. We spent $150 (including tip) for three people and left feeling hungry. Would not recommend this place.

6-u1-iY1LlH6OXs_8W09gQ.text: This is a wonderful restaurant!  Atmosphere, service, and cuisine are top notch! The views of the Strip always contribute to a great dining experience. I recommend the asparagus wrapped in filet mignon as an appetizer. The tofu steak entree is also a fine compliment to any main course. My ginger lychee mojito was fabulous and I suggest you order one or several with your meal. Sushi Roku strives for excellence and always delivers it!  Enjoy, enjoy, enjoy!!!!!!! Dana F. 12/26/12

iqaihdi_cvNzc7cUWFAlaA.text: I cant believe people think this is good sushi. The 8 piece chef special was sour and soggy. Very over priced and terrible. Save your money. I was ripped off.

btpr0ljPMHtZ883BohUMyQ.text: Food was of the chain good. Couldn't give it 5 stars cause of the price and water tasted like hose water when I was a kid.

Z-CCPqpUrGO9LvmlWAuG_w.text: The wait was a little long, but that's because I put in a special request for a booth. Since it was going to be longer, we request the first available. They created an adhoc table out in the front to accommodate which was unusual but great for last minute.  The food was excellent. Very tasty and even though the waitress said that kitchen was behind, came out in perfect tempo. The miso cod was exquisite, not new but cooked excellent. Loved the brussell sprouts and the sashimi was very fresh. Great evening spent.

Jjx6Bo9E6L196Z1vJ3P9Vg.text: The service was great. The atmosphere was great. The price was a bit high. The real problem was in the blandness of the food. Maybe I am a bit spoiled out here on the coast but everything was bland. Maybe they aim the flavor at a mid-west palate? Spicy'less tuna?

bMNBTwofR3mwbODfCM_AkA.text: Yeah yeah yeahhhh...it's another chain sushi place.  I know.  But I really think it deserves five stars from me because we had such a great experience here!  When I go to restaurants in Vegas, I admit that I typically don't expect much from the wait staff.  There's usually some type of "air" about them as if they're above everybody else because they work at a restaurant on the Vegas Strip.  My visit to Sushi Roku pleasantly surprised me.  Our server, whose name I unfortunately forget (I blame Vegas brain, hard to remember), was amazing.  He recommended a Saki that was delicious, and he even offered us tastings of sashimi and another type of Saki on the house!  He truly went above and beyond what I would expect from a dining experience in Vegas, let alone anywhere else.  Also, the view in this restaurant is pretty nice if you sit in the room with all the glass windows.  One of my friends was in Vegas for his first time, and he was able to enjoy a nice view down the strip from our table.

SGi9WEF40tnW6KDEQb39xw.text: I can always expect good quality sashimi at sushi roku. and the black cod is really good too!

CmyTrPLAgx4EpcVk7F9_1g.text: Went here on Saturday night as a recommendation from a friend and it didn't disappoint. The GM Johnny is super friendly and attentive. Our waiter was amazing and checked on us frequently. The entire staff was super friendly and the food was delicious. I will definitely visit again when in Vegas.

9zSrMXpX_CJuWqNEIac9dw.text: Call me ... not impressed?  Okay, I get it, this is again supposed to be one of these hip, nobu type of places that you don't really get sushi, or American food, you just kind of pay for the atmosphere. Well there isn't really much of that here so I'm not entirely sure what you're paying for.  It's definitely another to be seen place, but it's not even very good at that. It's in the forum shops for one ... and they just can't seem to decide what kind of restaurant they truly are.   The sushi rice is terrible, and the sashimi is hit or miss. Their hot food takes eons, literally ... and the drinks are overpriced. Basically, skip.

e_eaGUwg591LIH3uszoLCQ.text: GET THE BRUSSELS SPROUTS CHIPS. They are SO good and I could have ordered 3 bowls of them as my dinner.  They were the highlight of my night.  We ordered TONS of food.  I usually love sushi but the rolls we ordered weren't too exciting. The Chilean Seabass and Grilled Salmon were phenomenal.

tYSWqznQ6iteeMl-0c1cLg.text: This place is a must if you're in Vegas, whether if you eat sushi or not!!! They have tons of options for non sushi/fish eaters. Service and atmosphere is just excellent and very welcoming!  I do visit the one in LA, but let me tell you the service here was much much much better than my experience in LA.   Highly recommended, this is my go to place when going to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nZoyBsXSMnLKLPycYbsi9w.text: The great thing about Las Vegas is you can always find a fantastic restaurant. I've had sushi at other places in town but Sushi Roku is by far the best. We made lunch reservations for 2:30 and thank goodness day drinking had not really started because we wandered around the forum shops for 45 minutes just trying to find the 3rd floor. Ok I am a little challenged with reading maps but I'm sure it would have been way longer if I was buzzed. Finally arriving on the third floor we were seated immediately. I ordered the sake sampler...so good!!! And started with the King Crab fried rice, by far the best fried rice we have ever had in our lives. I had the nigiri lunch combo with a spicy tuna roll and my fiancee had the fried tuna rolls. Everything was just exceptional! I will definitely be back for lunch or dinner on my next Vegas trip! Sushi is after all my favorite thing to eat!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sake sampler
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King crab fried rice
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch special, nigiri and spicy tuna rolls

FkvHqAK9NZqcH9TdS6PYpw.text: It was just okay. I didn't order anything extravagant just a couple rolls. The service was good,not exceptional and the rolls tasted okay. My disappointment comes from the prep time of my rolls. They took maybe 3 or 4 minutes to arrive at my table after I ordered them. This tells me they were made ahead and sitting in a cooler.  I expected more from a restaurant on the strip.

2Z_AXTmUXHZRaMThnOYPuw.text: I feel more 50/50 about our experience here but we walked away feeling positive so I gave it 4 stars. We had dinner reservations after the Celine Dion show and they sat us 20 minutes early which was great. Our table had a beautiful view down the strip but we found the atmosphere to be very rowdy. I know that's Vegas but geez I wish there was such a thing as a classy drunk.  We weren't sure how hungry we were so we shared california rolls, spicy tuna rolls, and a baked lobster roll (which was expensive but very different!). The signature drinks were also some of the best we've ever had anywhere (try the Tokyo Cooler!). Because it was after 10 PM the place wasn't packed so I would've liked a little more attention from our waitor, especially because we like ordering sushi on an as we go basis so we don't over order. Overall the food and drinks were great, but maybe I'd come here at an earlier hour for a different crowd and experience.

4LYYiBE1KE5zTuk6timNCw.text: Not very strong in Nigiri. A server has lack of knowledge where each fish is from. She could not answer any of Nigiri choice that I ordered and ended up giving me very vague answer (Canada/Japan with a hint of hesitation) Roll might be a better choice to order in this restaurant.  Uni Udon is more like pasta with cream made with milk.

p-hmcNOuzxV3fD4f5ooL4A.text: Celebrated my spouse bday last night at Sushi Roku LV. It's located at the forum shops 2nd Floor. Love the ambiance and it's not too loud inside. Food was good but not that great. Their lava cake is a must try! The best I had so far! Will comeback next time and will try their happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We did enjoy the good food.
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cm_m0HO1rPkDdJfleOiyng.text: The foods was amazing!!!! My new sushi spot in Las Vegas The service is very upscale and the people are very attentive to your every needs

a1iZbAHlLB03jj1J8nd5BQ.text: Nothing thrilled us. Either we are terribly unlucky, or we really didn't order anything right that night. Here are the issues I have with this place:   1. The ambiance is dark and when I say dark, I mean I can't see my date's face let alone see anything on my table 2. The menu is short, not too much creativity here 3. I don't care if we have to pay a Vegas tourist premium, just give us quality food and a memorable experience - yet they failed at that here. Although the nigiri was of great quality, we really don't feel the overall value is here whatsoever  Here's what we settled with:   Miso soup $6 - two tablespoons served lukewarm with a miniature bit of tofu and nonexistent seaweed. Yep, I am pretty much sipping on warm, salty water. Skip it. Flavor rating: 2/5  Makoto roll $22 (spicy yellowtail & shrimp tempura wrapped with seared tuna spicy creamy sauce) - Sloppily rolled with lots of rice, minimal fish, and no wow-worthy sauce or flavor attributes. The roll ingredients and sauce were all too dry and bland. I was missing any trace of spicy yellowtail or even seared tuna, that's for sure. Flavor rating: 2/5  Soft shell Crab roll $15 - The soft shell crab had excellent flavor,yet a tad too soggy for my preference. Again, why was the roll so shoddily put together? We did not dine on a busy evening (Tuesday night, close to closing), so there is no real excuse. Flavor rating: 3/5  Salmon Nigiri $8.50 - The salmon was sweet and fresh, yet, they were not generous with the cuts. What felt like a paper-thin, cheap cut was a tease in the end. Flavor rating: 3/5  Uni Nigiri $14 - The uni was vibrant and fresh, but again tiny portion, why would you ever need to pay $14 for uni nigiri, I will never know. It's not like you can't get it anywhere else as fresh, since you totally can for MUCH cheaper. Flavor rating: 3/5  We made the wrong step when we decided to be seated in the dining room floor with an awkward angle of the strip view. We might have ended up on a thrilling note if we dined along the sushi bar. For the same price point, I would have had more bang for my buck and a completely satisfied palate at Nobu. Eh, well you live and you learn.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stingy salmon cuts ($8.50 for a pair) also uni ($14 for a pair) - they are fresh but they don&#39;t hook it up, that&#39;s for sure
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $90 for child&#39;s play. wasn&#39;t worth it.
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Makato roll $12 - don&#39;t even bother. No notable sauce or flavor attributes. Very dry and bland.

xalJHOftv9g-RW3-O7eyVg.text: Amazing food. I work in the shops and they gave me a discount so I can enjoy fresh sushi on my breaks! I would love to come dine in one night when I'm off.

GEQ6MgwpFR81zr_d_MD7jw.text: This place is amazing.  My friend and I started off ordering appetizers. I ordered the kimchee cucumber salad. When it arrived it was cucumbers in vinegar dressing but no kimchee. Another woman, who wasn't our waitress delivered it, and she saw I was confused so she asked me if everything was okay. I asked her where the kimchee was and she said the kimchee is mixed with the vinegar. I was slightly disappointed. She asked if I wanted to send it back and I said no it's fine, I'd give it a try. I took a bite and wow! It was so delicious. Tons of flavor. Seconds later our waitress arrived as she was notified I wasn't 100% pleased with the cucumber salad. I was super impressed they were so attentive to my needs. Our waitress also offered to swap it out for something else and while I told her it was different than what I had expected that it was totally delicious. They really wanted to make sure I was happy with what I had ordered.  Following my appetizer I ordered the baked lobster roll and some albacore sashimi. It was out of this world! The baked lobster roll is drizzled with hollandaise sauce. So delicious! And the albacore was so fresh and served with an amazing garlic ponzu sauce.  Our waitress checked on us several times. She was so sweet and really wanted to make sure we had a good experience. I will definitely come back here next time I'm in Vegas. Next time I will try to leave room to try some dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7uzWa3d8obo418tq6zxb6Q.text: Had a group dining here on Sunday night. It wasn't busy at all so they were able to accommodate a large group.  Atmosphere is dark and not too loud. There is a bar area as well.  It was hard for me to find the restaurant because I entered at the Ceasar's Palace entrance and had to walk like 8-10mins to this restaurant was. So if you are coming here via taxi/cab, make sure they drop you at the entrance closest to the restaurant itself.  To the Menu- They have a nice variety of food here. Some people ordered sushi but if that doesn't tickle your fancy no worries.  Tasty items I particularly remembered- Eggplant Dengaku (So yummy) Edamame Roasted Cauliflower Steamed Shrimp Dumplings  There were a variety of sushi items ordered which I did not taste but everybody enjoyed their meal.

7uJYvrv-6whGmbwnpTf7gA.text: OMG. This place is phenomenal. Went there last night and it definitely did not disappoint. I LOVED the miso glazed popcorn shrimp. Do yourself a favor and order it! We had the beef wrapped asparagus, which was also great. Fried calamari was pretty good, but probably would not order next time just because there are so many other amazing things on the menu. Jalapeno and soft shell crab roll are AMAZING. We also had several pieces of sashimi, which were super fresh. Definitely one of my favorite dining experiences ever. It was extremely expensive but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1NqcxEqLcz6_VrN_ElDsJw.text: We came here for Happy Hour on a Sunday night.  We ordered off the HH menu, a bunch of cheap rolls.  Needless to say that we were super disappointed.  The rice on the rolls were Way overcooked so we were left with mushy rolls.  For such a nice location this sushi restaurant is a disappointment!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bc0exxB8UJ52etFUBPWyxQ.text: We arrived a little before they opened at noon and sat outside the restaurant, inside the mall, for a bit. We were signaled when it was officially open. The waiter took our drink order and asked if we wanted to order edamame while we looked at the menu- loved that! I always forget. We got salmon and tuna sashimi and two tolls. The shrimp roll with salmon and the eel. Despite dining in a dessert, the sushi was fresh and delicious.  Tables along the wall gave one person a view outside of the strip.  It was conveniently located in the Forum shops. I would come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp roll with salmon. Beware the red dot of hot sauce! And eel roll

L_SViXDHhpFKd-eE-4pxbw.text: I made reservations for 7 at Sushi Roku for a bachelorette party dinner and everything went perfectly. We were seated right away upon arrival and received great service throughout. Our server was so attentive and knowledgeable and really made us all feel like he cared about our table. Everyone ordered alcoholic beverages, which were strong and tasty, and miso soup to start. We then ordered individual meals and the server happily split up our tab accordingly.  I ordered the Katana Roll: Spicy Tuna and Shrimp Tempura topped with Tuna and Yellowtail for $23 and it was delicious. It was spicy, but the roll was large (8 pieces) and plenty to fill me up. The Signature Rolls all came with 6-8 pieces depending on their contents and the other Rolls came with 4-6 depending on their content.   I would highly recommend Sushi Roku for a romantic dinner, night out with friends, etc. it has everything you need. The ambiance was slightly dark, but worked perfectly with the Las Vegas Strip right outside the window lighting everything up. Best meal we had during our stay.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katana Roll, spicy, $23

DH_kigsgJyBPS6-vUfbh5g.text: Happy hour was excellent! The spicy tuna and California roll were delicious and just $6/each. Service was on point!  This is what I call a happy hour!

GL_I7Ly_TySU7nYBZvlRiA.text: Came as we had a ramen craving in Vegas, and it was the closest to our hotel at the Mirage. It's pretty swanky located within the shops at Caesers. Service was really good, and we got a popcorn shrimp roll and 2 bowls of ramen. It was a bit pricey for both, but expected. The roll was simple and tasted good. The ramen, the broth was a tad heavy, noodles weren't chewy, but overall, it wasn't bad. It hit the spot for what it was worth, but obviously for the $, you can get better at a hole in the wall. Great view of the strip, so good if you're looking to spend some moola for sushi.

ma3UhE7OvU6pta_b7TR0BA.text: I cannot help but upgrade my review after a meaningful conversation with the management.  They really want to make their business the best and feel the next time I visit, it is going to be a great experience.  Don't forget the purple drink:)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good.

xawm-F9XU-uuAfisuGkY9A.text: We wanted sushi, and like all places in Vegas, it appeared to be next door from where we were (ha!). I thoroughly enjoyed my meal here. Try the oysters - they are surprisingly amazing in a good way. I always love oysters, but with their toppings, these are different than the average. Sushi choices are good, and the servers were helpful!

os-GlaUCQiTPgVM3odUCrA.text: Decided to stay in Vegas an extra night and boy am I glad. After the sports book killed me I said hey why not get a great meal on my way to the strip. Stopped in to Sushi Roku after yelping best sushi. Since I love the one in Scottsdale; I said hey let's go check them out and boy am I happy I did. I started off with Brussel chips and they weren't what I expected so I brought my AMAZING waitress Juliet  and told her what I was looking for and boy did she deliver. From the moment we walked in it was pure delight I'll be back again and again for the one of a kind experience. Also thank you to Johnny for making us feel welcomed from the time we walked in until we left. Anyone who's looking for a great meal and an unforgettable experience will not be disappointed coming here. Can't wait to come back

IuOktm776YqEako1S1Wh9Q.text: Emmy The Manager Is Outstanding! Thank you to her and Andrew The GM aAt The Pasadena Location For Working Together To Make My Boyfriends Birthday Experience With Our Family & Friends A Night To Remember! Our Service Was Excellent With Serving Us & His Patience Once The Drinks Started To Hit Was Very Appreciated! This Is Our Go To Every Year We Visit Vegas & It Has Never Let Us Down! This Team & Andrews Team In Pasadena Never Let Us Down! We Will See You Guys Soon! Thank You Again For Everything!

4yaPhoPja-M0YNogAoGzvA.text: Came here with a group of girls (there were six of us!) and three people were celebrating birthdays! We made a reservation since it was a Saturday night. The restaurant, located in Caesars Palace looks a lot bigger than it actually was! We were brought to the back of the restaurant which had phenomenal views out to the strip- we loved it! The service was good as was the food- we got salads, brussel sprouts, calamari, sushi and ramen! Since we were celebrating birthdays, they gifted us complimentary desserts which was the best part of the meal! We got the cotton candy Carnavale, this lights up on fire and the cotton candy burns down leaving a surprise dessert in the middle! We also got the chocolate lava cake which was superb. Definitely recommend- great for groups, couples, whatever...! Great view, great service!
