Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday dessert

XFAECwePbCzZAQbpMJVkYg.text: We were on our way to dinner, so naturally we had to stop and have a snack. The place had such good reviews, we couldn't pass it up. It happened to be happy hour when we stopped, so we ordered a couple items off of that menu:  *Ginger Lychee Mojito -We each had one and thought they were just ok **Calamari with Jalapeno Glaze  -My boyfriend liked this way more than I did...I weirdly liked it a lot better paired with some of the ginger from the sashimi dishes *Chicken Teriyaki Skewer  -My boyfriend LOVED this, I hated it - he's more of a chicken thigh guy and I'm a lean breast meat girl, so to me it was a bit tough *Sashimi  -We couldn't choose between the three happy hour sashimi choices, two tuna, one salmon, so we asked the bartender. He couldn't choose either, so we got all three and were really happy we did. We each had a diff tuna dish as our fav with the salmon being number two for both of us...the sauces were all slightly different and each had a ton of flavor. Each only had three pieces so it was very manageable to have all three  Service was great, we both agreed we would go back to have full meals off the menu.

EBrajZg4qCIxwThEt0xjTA.text: This place was a great find in Vegas. The atmosphere was intimate and relatively quiet. The staff was knowledgeable, helpful, and attentive.  We never had to wait for drink refills.   We had one of their specialty rolls and they upgraded one of their basic rolls to a spider roll for us without any issue at all. We had Edamame and soup and a couple martinis each (there were 2 of us). And the bill was little more than $100.   The food was flavorful and filling. Really happy we ate here!

tQ0Pi9uwZhn-BERqBTiZkw.text: This place might have the best sushi/sashimi. My boyfriend and I ordered some Nigiri.  Unagi, Scallop, Albacore, Premium Toro. All were amazing; specially the Scallop and Toro. We also got the Crunchy Spicy Tuna Tempura roll which was also very good.  The Chilean Sea Bass skewers are a must try. (Never tasted something so delicious in my life). The Lobster Garlic Noodles were a disappointment. The menu stated Udon Noodles however the dish came with a fettuccine type noodle. It was more of a pasta dish and was too sweet and had no garlic flavor.  However, there were plenty of big chunks of lobster. Over all this was a great dining experience. The service was great. The manager was there greeting the customers and he ever cleared our table. Will come back for the sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Garlic Lobster Noodles. Not a big fan.
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-ENHe20foPkaaxKeQAMnKQ.text: Luwest by far is the  best  waiter Asian bald head surver have us the 5 star treatment and the food was foodgasmic

2NpaYSI5YycOtu5L6o5x8Q.text: Loved the ambiance here! Celebrated a friends birthday and was very impressed. Great service, Sake was great, rolls were flavorful (and quite spicy), and dessert was a True treat (cotton candy? Yes please!!) We had the perfect view of the strip from the 3rd floor at The Forum Shops. This is not your everyday sushi spot, I would be back for sure for a special occasion.

eJNk5SjKk3eDhup4BMS1Qw.text: Everything here is mouth-watering.  The oysters are the highlight, 10/10 on freshness- I am dreaming of them right now as I write this. They come with a house spicy ponzu sauce which makes the oyster have the best kick!   The baked crab handroll is so fulfilling, and the toro felt beyond fresh. Even if something isn't on the menu, the sushi chefs will gladly whip something up for you.   Grab a reservation and don't miss out!

AkiHoBOUKklq5kNE64b2qg.text: I always hit Sushi Roku in Vegas whenever I'm around the area. I love their signature rolls the most and their s'mores dessert. The service was exceptional always. The view of the strip by the window dining was just incredible.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tRIrn5OK2hZKIliYWC65eA.text: We came in few weeks ago for an early dinner.  It was pretty empty since Vegas wakes up later on.  We were seated right away.    Our waitress Debra M was polite and helpful.  Actually,  everyone was very welcoming.  We ordered... Brussels sprouts  Spicy miso soup  Yellowtail diced Hamachi Belly Jalapeno Toro cut Seabass with Truffle oil  Everything was fresh and tasty.  Portions were very small.  This coming from a person who prefers small portions.  So if I am saying small portions,  it's something.  Was it the best ever food?  No.  But it was pretty good.     Since it's Vegas and there are so many other options, I doubt that I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XjQR8_5bWryFQIaQzC7FOA.text: It's good food...don't get me wrong but get your credit cards out. We were a party of 4 for lunch and a 3 of us wanted to try a few different things so 3 of us opted for the "premium" $85 per person chefs special selection (after our waiter convinced us it was a good value). There was jut one issue...he brought the last plate of the selection and we were all still hungry. Does it seem ok to spend almost $400 on a lunch and feel like you need a Big Mac after? It was also irritating to pay $85 per person and have them bring 2 pieces of something or a roll cut in half. Should there not be 3 of everything? One person was always left out. It was very odd and  seemed cheap...like they couldn't make 2 rolls and give one extra piece they would make one and cut it in half. Very unbecoming for an upscale place in the high end Caesar's Forum Shops to come across as cheap. The cocktails were good my matcha mule was 3/4 ice, but delicious.  Lesson learned- skip the chefs selection. I could have selected $85 worth of sushi that would have satisfied the table. I won't leave that up to "the chef" again.

En4U0qqkDgT9KAomQW9Yqw.text: What were we thinking in NOT making this a regular stop??!!  My wife and I had lunch here 2 years ago but somehow let it slip through the cracks.  Not gonna happen again!  We had dinner this time, and Sushi Roku slayed!  First, we were completely surprised by the large and elegant dining room with expansive views of the Strip and the LINQ (we had eaten at the sushi bar last time).   We  started with the hamachi serrano.  The hamachi was sliced thin and melted in our mouths, and the serrano chiles gave it a nice pop of heat - which was cooled by the ponzu.   Next we shared the Brussels Sprouts chips; NOT YOUR MOM's Brussels!!!  They flash-fried the leaves and seasoned them with salt and truffle oil...crispy, salty, delicious.  This dish paired perfectly with the Mer Soleil Chardonnay (which they serve by the glass...rarely done anywhere) or a cold sake.  We shared 2 sushi rolls: the classic spider roll and the crunchy spicy tuna tempura roll.  The latter was genius and addictive.  The roll is filled with fresh ahi & avo (and I think asparagus?) then rolled in tempura, deep fried, then cut and served.  So you get hot & cool, soft and crunchy - all in one bite!  My only ding would be that the wine pours were a bit anemic for a Vegas restaurant (6 OZ).

zUH4gLU6zswKfQmEZ6iPBA.text: Happy hour! Happy hour and happy hour! We only come here for happy hour!   There's so many choices out there and Sushi Roku hasn't reinvent themselves to catch up with the new and better version since they opened.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GbFVclJy4weN2olOW9iTeA.text: Deluxe high end restaurant,  we ordered the omakase 5 course meal from the daily specials menu and came away mostly impressed. The ingredients were all high quality and the service was spot on. Our server was extremely friendly, attentive, and quick as you should expect at this price point.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DDgD2tf1EGWVW1Xo__kf7A.text: -Modern Japanese style of restaurant with an amazing view of the strip and great atmosphere  -Food was absolutely delicious  -It was my friend's birthday, so they spoiled her with a yummy dessert accompanied with a fun cake sparkle  -They could work on adding more items to their cocktail menu. The matcha mule was lovely, the only downside of our whole experience was when we ordered espresso martinis-  they were very disappointing.

65msMmmwi6W_uqRV2BdWNw.text: Went for my birthday,  If I could give this place 100 stars I would. Hands down one of my favorite sushi restaurants. Service is always amazing and sushi is so free and delicious. Highly recommend. Also they brought me the cutest birthday desert on the house. Everything was amazing

fzz05DhySfnOfm9k9sSi9A.text: You are definitely in for a treat if you eat at Sushi Roku. Everything was absolutely delicious and the best quality. The service and hospitality were just as amazing. You will not regret eating here!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

77GNfQmj94LsrfD4YP-m8g.text: I've been to Sushi Roku twice. Both times have been fantastic. The fish was great, and the service was excellent.   I feel like there is a knack to having the best possible experience here.   1) eat the fish in the right order 2) spend a lot 3) avoid the rolls at all cost, they're terrible. 4) the beef  We went through 3 or 4 bottles of sake, which was poured for us as often as we poured each other's. Exceptionally friendly service from everyone who helped at our table.  The fish is excellent. A lot of fish is fairly delicate, so eating from mild to pungent is important. Hamachi after mackerel is not going to be ideal. A little experience is necessary because they're just going to bring what you order. You can also ask your server, and they'll be happy to guide you.  Highlight of my last trip was the beef served with hot cast iron pucks to cook it on. Ridiculously tender and tasty. Right up there with the best steaks to be found in Vegas, but in a few tender little bites instead of an entire cut. I would happily eat this every day for the next 60 years.  Ambience is nice. I didn't notice it being too dark as another reviewer mentioned, but we arrived before sunset and were there for over 2 hours so we probably adjusted.  Having had 2 exceptional visits, I'm always happy to recommend Roku to people and even happier when I get a chance to go again myself.

aiNFeJNPLHHxA0W3lVfkzg.text: Can't wait to visit this place again. I was in town for my bachelorette party and we were running late for our reservation! The front desk was very understanding when we called, and we didn't feel a single bit rushed when we finally arrived and sat down. Our waiter (so sorry I can't remember your name!) was really helpful in deciding how much of what to order and surprised me with a complimentary dessert. Yum!

elMYQFtHOJvoLaQEm0T6qw.text: Ah, Vegas.  It's hard to find a good meal that isn't thousands of dollars.  Sushi Roku was probably our best meal on my latest trip.  The sushi selection is relatively small compared to other cities, but I guess you'd expect that in the middle of a desert?  I don't know...  But I went with the japanese short ribs appetizer for my meal because we didn't expect to eat a full meal.  It was so good I asked for a side of rice to soak up every bit of the juice/sauce that it was with.  The rolls my dining parter had were good, too.  The service was OK - not incredibly attentive but not bad either.  I imagine on a busy night (there were only a few people at the time) it could get slow.

YdZt3QCBhtaPGnNKDMUqHw.text: This place was fantastic!!!   We were staying a Nobu, a boutique hotel in Caesar's.  We just arrived in Vegas and were looking for a nice place to sit, relax and enjoy a satisfying meal.  We happened upon Sushi Roku and decided to give it a try.  We had a window view of the strip.  Not only that but the food was fantastic as well as the service.  I'm a vegetarian and was there with two co-workers who were not.   The waiter was very helpuful at answering my questions about the dishes.  I ordered a couple of appetizers because that's about all there was that was veg. The waiter was great about letting me know that we could start out with just a couple of the small dishes (salad & an eggplant dish),   He said if they were not sufficient he'd put in an orer for an additional dish.  That really impressed me. Often when I order veggie dishes the waiters will act like they think I'll be starving.  Not here!!  And my meal was more than sufficient.  And oooooh, so good!! The Miso Eggplant appetizer was especially delish.    I'm so glad we decided to take the chance and stop here.

_M4Tj0qwZ4zzBwTsyfPmEw.text: Amazing Sushi and we eat it often at different restaurants.  Also, Great Happy Hour 4-7pm! Cheap but professional, food was literally delivered to our table within 2 mins of ordering each course. Had multiple items, but the Spicy Tuna on Crispy Rice was exceptional, ordered a second one after the first! Visit!

DQS3MrbKTEwEZw_nfg5r7g.text: Amazing  Kobe beef accompanied with very good sashimi, and great house drinks = good dining

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k4mbXfkcclRGo78cynAmJg.text: First night in Vegas and we were looking for something light to eat before hitting up the club.  Nobu was booked, so we decided to try Sushi Roku.  Reservations weren't hard to get and I had heard good things so it was a go.  We decided to order a bunch of appetizers and small plates to share for four guys.  One could't eat meat due to lent and I couldn't have carbs. Even with those restrictions we were successful in getting some tasty dishes.    The Truffle Edamame was really tasteful, but you can't really go wrong when its sprinkled with truffle oil, yum!  Shishito peppers were okay, I've had better (at Nobu, haha).    Yellowtail Diced Chilies were really fresh and tasty.  I good balance of flavors with a not too tangy sauce to compliment the delicate yellowtail flavore.  The highlight of the show was teh Chilean Seabass Truffle Miso Glaze!  Delicious.  I have never met a Miso Glaze I did not like, but add truffle to it, and I was in heaven.  Went perfect with the smooth like butter seabass (i kinda wish the black cod had the truffle miso glaze, but it was only described as Sweet Miso, so I passed).    Other items we got were the Uni Tartlette (couldn't eat the pastry so just at the inside. Small, and flavor no so Uni-ish.  The sweet shrimp (Amaebi) was really fresh and the fried shrimp heads with it were the perfect compliment, Fresh and Fried.    We also got rolls, but i didn't partake because of the rice.  All in all, Sushi Roku is pretty good.  Flavors really stood and were well balanced.  Service was excellent as to be expected.  Price was a bit on the high end for what it was but that's normal for Vegas.  I would come back (unless I have a reservation for Nobu).

I96blLvu9IXBk5TUR6V-QA.text: I've been here a handful of times and I'm never disappointed with my meal. Making a reservation is always a breeze, all the employees are very professional and friendly.  I love all the dishes, and have yet to try something that I didn't enjoy. Service is always great. It's always nice to come here for special occasions since they are very accommodating. Definitely put this on your list of sushi spots to try!

AvKtLd26EmbPZA8qIYcUkg.text: The baked crab rolls were excellent!   I went here mid-afternoon and it was nearly empty, but the service was great, and I sat at the sushi bar.   Fun to watch them make your rolls right in front of you.

nBqYLWhVsEaI26HDgG3kSg.text: Great service, view of the strip and food! Must try the braised pork belly fried rice (forgot the name) but here's a picture!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-o9UmNmKo2OpVKbBmBGdyw.text: Sushi Roku is my go-to place for special events such as birthdays, graduations, promotions, etc. the ambiance is wonderful and calming, the service is spectacular and the food is simply delicious!   For appetizers I would recommend the popcorn shrimp tempura (my favorite!) or the lobster tempura. Hot, crispy, and cooked just right, this appetizer has your mouth singing! For sushi, I love the lobster roll with miso sauce, and any type of sashimi is fresh and delectable.   If you are a local, you know there are items that can be ordered off the menu. All are delicious, but the white lotus roll is my absolute favorite.   If you are in the mood for some upscale sushi in a quiet environment with a great view of Vegas, Sushi Roku is for you. The only downfall is the price - a little steep, bit you truly do get what you pay for here.

hGFBkaKVtFDrRZB_oHHg3Q.text: Best happy hour in Vegas!  Bartender was great and steered us to the best items on the menu.  Don't miss the miso eggplant or the rib eye wrapped asparagus - both are amazing and the portions are a decent size.  You can definitely make a great meal out of the happy hour utms and try many different dishes - they have over 30 on the list!

TzZuhX0tcSkXm0YTXoyFGA.text: As soon as we started to check in, the hostess had an attitude with us just because we didn't want to sit at the bar and asked to wait for a table.  I ordered the ramen and this is by far the worst taken I've ever had, noodles were not cooked properly and the broth tasted sour.  I also ordered the katana roll and the salmon was not fresh and really warm. Other than that our server was really nice and took this time to explain the menu.

SML9PDJr5dtKgh1ig3U6OA.text: I'm pretty happy with what he had here. We considered going to Shibuya, since I knew it to be good, but since we're in the Venetian and it's in MGM Grand, that's a serious hike. So we headed down to Ceasar's for this spot, and were well rewarded.  Service is very friendly - we walked right in and sat at the bar. We ended up ordering a decent selection of nigiri, as well as a spicy tuna, spicy shrimp, and white lotus roll. I also had my standard seaweed salad, which was excellent, although tasted a little like there was a fruit dressing, which I could have done without. Maneki in Seattle still has my all time favorite sunomono.  Rolls were very good, especially the white lotus roll, which, if I'm remembering right, was crispy shrimp, avocado, and asparagus inside, with yellow tail on the outside, fresh hot peppers, and some various sauces. Awesome. I'm really starting to like the fresh peppers in sushi, which I'm seeing in more and more spots. Also worth mentioning, the hamachi I had here is maybe the best I've had. Super tender, super flavorful, just awesome.  Price was excellent too - they left an item off our bill by accident and when we reminded them, they just waved it off. Even with that on the bill, for two people including a couple drinks, the total came to under $100. No, not cheap, but it's sushi...in Las Vegas...and we ate ourselves full. Definitely a would return.

Nt66CnOXCw5StJzGG8LZnQ.text: If you want to splurge, you certainly can here. The sushi was very good, but honestly not better than I've had in MUCH less expensive sushi joints. Our waiter was totally put out that we shared an appetizer and two rolls, instead of going with his suggestions. We just wanted something light!  The rolls were good, the fish superb and fresh, but nothing to blow you away. We won't go back, not because of the price, it just wasn't at all memorable.

lOWbGAhFElbhhKhb6Zgotw.text: Ok, ok, I'll give you 5 stars Sushi Roku.  I'm not a sushi fan at all but I was invited to attend a private birthday dinner here with one of my closest friends, how could I say no?  All aspects of the evening were planned in advance and I'm quite impressed with the level of professionalism each memeber of the staff here at Sushi Roku possessed. On point from start to finish!  I experienced some new eats on this night including sashimi (sp?)!  Much to my surprise the sashimi (tuna and yellowtale) was one of my favorite items tasted this evening. Still not a fan of actual sushi rolls, we're still making progress people.  Should the taste buds have a calling for sushi (or sashimi), Sush Roku would be at the top of the list.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with fried something or other below it..yum
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet wrapped asparagus, delicious!

HI6CsnzXIlDNVdqtUQqKdQ.text: My fiance and I love sushi. But you're really paying for the location because the food is not all that. Service is kinda slow too.

49LFuqIx3S_YdhMeiNuqzQ.text: While the ambiance and general vibe is good I didn't care for the food. My eel was fishy tasting, most of the food was too salty, and the prices are a bit high for the quality of food. My friend loves this place and I know she enjoyed her food but mine was sub par compared to the same dishes at Sushi places in LA.

4OMmpcO6kU4z8Iwx9ELiaQ.text: Our waiter was helpful. The sushi had a powdery consistency. It was barely edible. We wouldn't come back.

Xh-Ez2wdjJDEdZnD5MGsqQ.text: I went there with a group of friends during summer. The hostess seated us on the main dining room, it has a gorgeous view of the strip and the restaurant's decor was beautiful. I asked the hostess if we could have the happy hour menu and she went to ask the manager, then she came back and told us we had to move to another table. There were on the other side and there was no beautiful view and we sat beside a big group of table who were very loud, we had to speak up to talk to each other. Anyways, the food was pretty good and fresh. I cannot remember what we ordered but the price were reasonable and we had a nice time.

20DMQ8EIijKi3WYuOCCTfg.text: My favorite sushi place hands down. The tuna role is great along with the crab roll as well. Beautiful view of the strip if u sit by the window. Excellent staff.

kJRabgwj7Rp0x29XcPel0Q.text: This place is amazing I was out here in Vegas in June for my 27th birthday. My aunt and uncle brought me here, considering my aunt is not a sushi eater, so my uncle had a sushi partner lol. Omg.....delicious. amazing. Even the saki was really good except I requested it be chilled. And it was on the sweeter more milder side. People the host there was as fabulous as they get. He was such a diva lol! Ok! Now back to the food. My aunt from what I recall ordered a filet that she loved and my uncle and I chowed down on all kinds of sushi. It was amazing. Wish I lived closer lol! Xoxo

6BM67X2xy1rlRDANsvxpRw.text: Most of the stars that Sushi Roku receives are for its amazing view of the Las Vegas Strip. No doubt about it, my sights were pleased with my experience, beautiful view, beautiful people, beautiful Vegas....  Sushi Roku is like Ra sushi disguised as a Nobu. Adequately fresh fish with subpar textures and preparations for stellar prices. Granted, the miso glazed popcorn shrimp and black pepper kobe beef skewer are standalone wonders, they would be better off in a restaurant that doesn't call itself SUSHI Roku. I guess I should have known something was amiss when the non-sushi appetizers were so astounding. Sushi Roku did rebound well, though, with its fantastic chocolate cake, which was discussed at the table as possibly the best chocolate cake ever tasted, or maybe it was the vanilla bean cream, or maybe..it was because we munched on the decadent dream while peering at the most decadent town in the western United States.

dyiIKQFiJed6wTfFo7Wg4A.text: Two  years ago it was the popped collared short sleeve shirt.  A year ago it was the striped button up long sleeve shirt.  This year, it's the black t-shirt with some sort of skull or crossboney eagle shape that has taken over as the "official douchebag uniform."  Come to Roku and you'll see some of these dudes but seriously, don't stay away because of it.    Roku was de-friggin-licious.  Highly recommend you stick with whatever specials are available on the left side of the menu.    While slightly expensive, it'll make for a memorable experience.    Just watch out for the Jersey douchebags.  Fresh.

PF8gcAaKr2WOlu4lCOIY7Q.text: "Try everything you want on the menu. I mean it. Try everything, don't hesitate now." Those were the exact words that came out of my mouth as I was sitting at Sushi Roku in Ceasar's with a Roku virgin. I first found out about Sushi Roku in Los Angeles located on 3rd and Croft by the Beverly Center and I was hooked. It's no Nobu guys, it's no Matsuhisa, it blows them out of the water.  First I had kimchee (pickeled cabbage) stuffed cucmber salad. Perfectly crunchy, salty, sweet, spicy. I could pop those in my mouth all day like potato chips. You just can't have one. The tofu steak was next with grilled mushroom au jus. Just outta this world. Perfectly done tofu with three types of mushroom, light, complex, and not overly filling which was perfect because we were seated at a table for two and between her and me we had ordered for four, at least.   The tastings started to come, and the sashimi, and the specialty rolls I requested not on the menu from the head chef at the sushi bar. Baby tako that melted in your mouth. Hamachi that glistened and we swear could have been still moving it was so fresh. The fish was like butter. Even the edamamde isn't oversaled, isn't overcooked. It's fresh, light and absolutely perfect. The tempura can be ordered separately or as a combo, which means that I can order six broccoli and sweet potato pieces, which is always what I eat last on my tempura plate because I think it's the best.   My sake was excellent. Nigori, which is unfiltered, was exactly what I asked for, salty, sweet, and heavy. Like a creamy dream, my alcohol was a match made perfect by the suggestion of my extremely helpful and quick waitress. The service is fantastic.   The decor is wonderful. If you're by the windows you can see the strip and all it's glory at night. But look around. Private raised booths that still create intimate feelings are against the back wall. My table was close to others around me, but we didn't care. We talked with the couple next to us about how fabulous their food was and weren't they looking forward to flying back out to Vegas from NYC just to eat here. Of course, their answer was an excited "Yes!".   This Roku is much better than the Los Angeles one in my opinion and I've eaten frequently at both locations. This is some of the best sushi I have ever eaten on the west coast. I will always go back. My name is in the computer system permanently, I always get a great table, and my people there take care of me.   Live the good life ya'll. Sushi Roku is a gem in a luxury "mall". Have a few beverages and order "a la Danielle". Seriously, take one of everything. You won't be disappointed.

APsdkyrcck-2A8jEfGZofg.text: The view is amazing, and that's where it ends.  The selection of sushi really disappointed my girlfriend and I, so we decided to try two of the signature rolls and one old favorite. All of it was bland, over-priced, and just really not worth the time and effort to go there.  The only other upside besides the view was the house Sake was pretty decent. Other than that, spend your money elsewhere.

cOTRIMga_HRlM3JDPKXUfw.text: OMG hands down BEST sushi EVER!!!! We go on average 2 times a month and OMG it is so so fantastic!!! We try other sushi restaurants and always come back to Roku! Does not get any better than this.....There is no better sushi in all of Vegas and Henderson! trust me we have tried MANY!!!  MUST GET the baked crab roll :)

o04hYM2zT0U2eJzAWhboQA.text: There's a sushi roku in L.A close to where I live but I never got a chance to try it out. Glad I did it in Vegas.  Met a friend (then turned date I guess). We were thinking about what to eat for lunch. After a few minutes of discussion, we chose to have sushi. I wanted to have sushi, and my friend said said he loves sushi too. So we drove down the strip, not the fasted way to get somewhere but it gave us time to find a good restaurant. I was looking for recommendations on Yelp, the top choices are all open only for dinner, and then I found sushi roku. Great, I thought. And conveniently, we were right by the entrance of Ceasars Palace.   It was a long walk from self-parking garage. Most of the casinos are extremely self-parking unfriendly. The restaurant is located on the 2nd floor of The Forum Shop. The closest entrance would be the main one on the strip, but we walked all the way through the casino. (I'm not a big fan of Ceasars Palace so touring around wasn't exciting to me.)  The hostess took us in and let us chose our own table. We sat down at the very back of the restaurant by the windows. It was a nice view, you can see the happening strip. (But not anything close to the view you would get in your own room at some nice hotels like I've had.) Since they're open for lunch, we ordered some lunch items as well as some specialty rolls. We also tried sashimi. They had two kinds of meat there - Blue Fin is the more premium one, but we had both. Needless to say, blue fin tastes so much better. It is more tender. I love the feeling that it's like melting in your mouth as you're eating it. But my friend prefered the other, he thought there was more texture on it and he likes to chew a little bit. Blue fin is just too soft for him. The sushi we had was beyond ok, but not even close to the best I've had. Except for one. Unfortunately I forgot what it's called as I always order something I've never tried before. And usually I don't even know which is which when they present it. But the service there was really really good, our server explained to us thoroughly on every dish we had. (Still I can't remember the names..) I would give the sushi a 4 star.  For dessert we had mochi since my friend had never had it before. It was $10 but there were only 3 mochi, each was cut in half. For the same money you could buy two packages of some better ones at an Asian supermarket. But the way they put everything together and decorated it justified the price. It looked amazingly beautiful and somehow romantic. If you're there with a date, go for the mochi. I guarantee it'll be a good choice.   And what's better than a meal with a date that actually enjoyed the food? Discount! When we were about to get our check, I asked our waiter whom we had been chatting with throughout the whole time if we could get any discount had we been staying at the hotel.(I remember seeing coupons were given out upon checkin at casinos. They wanna tie you in.) Btw our server was very very attentive as the whole place was almost empty. If I didn't have to meet with my friend I would've probably been hangover too in the afternoon. But I'm I wasn't. It was nice spending time with my friend together. Before I could finish my question, he said:"you're already getting a discount." It turned out that since we had been chatting so much, he gave us a local discount(which you can find at many places in Vegas) considering my friend was moving there. Nice, so we had 20% off of our total bill. Couldn't be happier about that. It was MLK day and I had a wonderful African-American server.  As we were leaving, my friend and I got confused whether we just had lunch or dinner. It was already dark outside and we probably sat in there for 2 and a half hours which we really didn't feel long at all. We concluded it as our early dinner, even though my friend said it could be he's breakfast since he hadn't eaten anything before that. And then we started getting closer and made out.. It was incredible feeling a cute guy who's also got a hot hot body.  This is not just a review, it's also a journal I'm writing about our first meet because I know "you"(my cute date) could be reading what other people are saying about this place after you got home. If you did read this, consider it a secret way I'm telling you I really had a good time with you being my foodie companion. So looking forward to exploring more restaurants with you ;)

6c_Ozq_q0PuMNXtOC4lfcw.text: I am iffy about anything Ryan Seacrest related...  However Sushi Roku (Seacrest is part owner) was surprising good.    Sushi Roku is a "High-End Sushi" Joint, but with good quality sushi.  Which hardly is the case at a lot of other High-End Sushi places.  The sushi was fresh, portions were fair sized, appetizers were delish, and service was excellent.    I recommend the Toro & Jalapeno Handroll.  It tastes like butter. MMMMMM.  Very pricey, don't come here after a losing streak.  -1 star for price.  Seacrest Out!

wTK0cZ4QTkbTmMbxkbOe4g.text: Expensive but worth it. The brussel sprouts appetizer is so delicious that I've tried to recreate it at home. The sushi was fresh and delicious!

2FQu6rELaZyTBj7JKfSf7A.text: The sister and I took our parents to Vegas for their first time, and to also attend Paris By Night, a Vietnamese music production. They're not too crazy on trying strange things, and by strange--I mean anything that strays away from Vietnamese cuisine. They have traditional tastebuds, but still willing to try flavors closely related to their usual liking. This led me to choosing Japanese, because they've never tried much of it. Plus, I wanted to take them to a cool spot, which most trendy Japanese restaurants can accommodate to, to end their awesome day of music, and to make full use of their play-dressed-up night--dad in a suit, and mom in a purdeee dress.   Service- 5! - I called ahead to set reservation, and requested seating near the window to enjoy the view of the strip since it was my parents first time in Vegas--they were so nice and accommodating. I had to call back and change timing since the concert took much longer than anticipated; they were more than glad to meet our request.  As for the actual dining experience, our server was sweet and helpful. Took her advice on several dishes and it was on point. She even went along with me when I wanted to get my folks to take 2 plum sake shots [they're the one light drink only people]. She told my dad it was a 'pink juice shot', when he asked her what it was. LOL. Too bad I forgot her name, but I remember her a very small frame Japanese lady. On top of that, the manager [a korean fella] came to our table to greet and also at the end, to see how our dinner went. Very nice touch.  Ambience- 4 - The decor wasn't what I'd go 'WOW!' about, but it was definitely still an artistic and trendy architectural attempt. Great view of the strip, mellow, and warm. The way the restaurant was design, you actually don't need a window seat to have a glimpse of the streets down below.  Food- 4 - Our food was great, but the overall effect didn't leave me thinking, "An amazing dinner!"  Apps: 1) Yellowtail sashimi w diced chilies 2) mixed sashimi salad w ginger vinaigrette 3) agedashi tofu [it's off the menu, but can be requested] 4) Popcorn rock shrimp tempura in spicy miso glaze 5) miso cod  - the yellowtail could have been fresher, but the sauce & toppings were delicious/ salad & sashimi was a great blend w the dressing/ soy sauce in the agedashi tofu was so little, but the tofu itself was soft and perfectly battered/popcorn rock shrimp ROCKED! SO DELICIOUSSSS. Much better than nobu's/ miso cod was tender, juicy & fresh, but could use a bit more glaze   Entree: 1) Ribeye w/ soy garlic sauce 2) Chilean sea bass ( in yuzu butter, they have 2 different sea bass dishes, and both sauce are different] - ribeye was yummy, had it medium but the little cooked part was quite dry. my folks and sister loved it and the baby green beans & potatoes that came along w it/ the seabass was perfectly flavored, but texture was a bit dry, perhaps an older piece of fish?  Dessert: mochi & a 10oz carafe of plum sake  - no restaurant can possibly go wrong w mochi....and roku didn't. we were too fulll at the end to eat much dessert, so I figure this was an appropriate portion.  Overall, we all had a lovely evening. My parents had so much fun and enjoyed the restaurant's experience--along w the kirin light and cocktail I ordered for them [hehe]. I would definitely return, but not before I've tried other sushi joints in Vegas [can't help it, there is just too much to eat a one place twice in Vegas. unless you live there or go there 50 times a year!]

Jm3oTtIWgOdKM3llVk-evw.text: The main reason I'm giving 5 stars is for the Bluefin Sashimi that they do topped with shaved black truffles, truffle oil, microgreens, and parmesan cheese. It's an unexpected flavor combo, but it is downright euphoric and should not be missed. I can actually say that this is the best sushi dish I've ever eaten and it's hard to go back to eating sashimi sans truffles. When Bluefin is not in season, you can get it with regular tuna or salmon and they are both amazing. It's not always on the menu, but if you ask, they'll make it. I've tried ordering this dish at other Sushi Roku locations, but instead of using shaved black truffles, they use a measely amount of these sorry crumbled truffle bits. It just doesn't compare.  The other 5 star dish is the Tempura Fried Green Tea Ice Cream. Its a chunk of ice cream encased in a little  spongecake "box" which is then dipped in tempura batter and deep fried. It's also topped with a little raspberry sauce drizzle and garnished with fresh berries. The cake insulates the ice cream so it doesn't melt when they fry it. Not only is the flavor outstanding, but the crunchy tempura combined with the softest spongecake I've ever had is pure heaven.  Some of the other dishes here are just kind of so-so and they are usually quite salty. I LOVE the spicy tuna on crispy rice at Katsu-ya, so when I saw that item on the menu here, I was excited to try it. Unfortunately theirs is extremely greasy so be prepared to blot the hell out of it.

K17bnEP4OGcy85OXnlFhBA.text: Now Sushi ROKU.. I do like.   It is located in a even pricier area of Caesars Palace.... on the 3rd floor. Views from up there are cool.. prices @ Roku are also a  bit high as a result.. but go for the Happy Hour! As of the last time I went.. all beer and liquor was very cheap and most of the Hour items were about $5. Good Food too.. I always sit at the bar, and always get great service.

kpbBSichsXuc7zEeLvuc9w.text: Good sushi and sashimi. Great service. Excellent ambience and decor.  I had the chef's sashimi combination ($26) and a roll of spicy scallops ($9). Companion had the chef's sushi combination ($29). I was going for mostly plain and simple, nothing outrageous or innovative. What I got was plain and simple, I felt like I was eating good quality fish. And I'd never had a spicy scallop roll before and liked it.  Our edamame was really good. More firm than most other places I've tried, and I think the firmness was a very good thing. I also loved the doors to the restrooms, which were designated by beautiful tattooed body art on a man and a woman.   I did think they were a little stingy on the wasabi and ginger. When we asked for more, the wasabi brought to us was really hard and crumbly, almost gritty. A bit of a mellow harsher there.  With some sake, sapporo, tea, nibbles and our sushi, the bill for two was about $100. Overall, I thought it was a good meal, but the food itself did not impress me enough to say it was the best I've had. Nowhere near.  It was similar to what I'd get at restaurants in my own city, but served on black pebbles in a hip atmosphere.

7sIyjK1HczEWEpvvUChBtA.text: Ahhh.. I have fond memories of Sushi Roku in Las Vegas... =)  my girl friends and I came here for dinner during my Bachelorette weekend in Vegas.   As good as the food was, the GM was the highlight of our meal.  Frankly put, the GM Kenji is a gentleman and a hottie patottie.  Whenever someone left to use the ladies room, he would come to our table, pick up their napkin, and put it nicely folded on the table... and then chat it up w/ us. hehe.  When we realized this, we started taking turns being the 'decoy' and he would come to our table every time without fail.  haha jk i'm exaggerating.. sorta ;)  ... 11 girls in Vegas need some form of entertainment at all times I suppose.  Anyway, on to the food:  Fav dishes: Japanese Yellowtail Sashimi w/ Diced Chilies Tuna Tataki Sashimi w/ Ponzu Baked Lobster with Creamy Miso Sauce Roll SeaBass w/ Truffle Miso Glaze & Sauteed Spinach chocolate (volcano? lava?) cake  YUM YUM YUM.    Oh yah, the latte there is excellent too!  I try to come here every time I'm in Sin City! (for the food of course *wink*)

G23HsQo_DZaYTgO0NkroUA.text: Get the lychee sake martini, blackened cod and sashimi.  Fresh and flavorful.  Good for groups.  The view was unexpected and a nice bonus.

FP1vVEfGW7-WsPUsNPcSaw.text: Son of a b*tch this place is good. We had the Japanese Yellowtail Sashimi, the Popcorn Rock Shrimp, the Spicy Jumbo Shrimp with Spicy Potato Chips and the grilled eggplant. OMG....wow, just...wow! There wasn't one thing I didn't like but any of these dishes. The food was fresh, the flavors were divine...I was in heaven.  I also got the Teriyaki Salmon lunchbox which was also very good. The only thing I can say that wasn't top notch was the miso soup...just a tad bit too smokey but all in all this place is a definite on a return trip to Vegas.

DFVkF6Age3Pvkb_dLJ4nig.text: We stopped here for lunch while shopping in the Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace.    We ordered sushi: salmon, tuna, albacore, unagi, spanish mackerel, kanpachi, yellowtail and special rolls: rock shrimp tempura with jalapeno, spicy scallop roll and a Katana roll.  Honestly, there was really nothing that blew me away.  The menu items all sounded awesome but when it arrived to the table I was quite disappointed.  The portions and cuts of sushi were smaller than I'm used to and the quality of the fish was fair.    Don't get me wrong, the restaurant is beautiful and the service is impeccable.  But it you are dropping $150+ for lunch, you should expect the food to be way better.    I should offer up another star for our waiter.  I burned my hand on my flat iron that morning and he let me use their burn spray from the kitchen.  That was nice of him to do.  Thanks!

NeVBKxfMYi_9XIZ_DU6JPg.text: We hit up Sushi Roku Saturday night before heading to Pure for my cousin's birthday. We wanted to have a nice meal that will be just enough to fill us without making have to unbuckle my belt and go for a siesta. Since it's inside of Caesar's it's the perfect location to eat before hopping off to the club. The ambiance was lovely, the waiters were uber friendly (and very cute) and the food was top notch. Their Usuzukuri (thinly sliced of fluke with ponzu sauce) is to die for!!!   It's a bit pricey, but the free birthday dessert of assorted mochi ice cream and the little fireworks show they threw in added that special touch. Be sure to check out their wine list, its ace! I had a phenomenal glass of Riesling that I'm still thirsty for!!!

WluOumnI4ixrJV9PX42J0Q.text: Very good sushi here.  Came here on a Saturday for lunch and was impressed.  Very fresh selections of fish, delicious Ankimo and Uni.  Had a very nice bottle of high end Sake.  Sat at the sushi bar as we do in all sushi establishments and had a good time with the chef's and staff.  Tempura lobster is very good.  Loved the Aji.  I will be back for more from Sushi Roku.

hAKtuv8c-krfnpXVVfZGxQ.text: Love this place and if you get great seating, you have the view to the whole strip. The food here is great! I've asked for certain rolls that I have eaten at their SoCal location, and they were happy to make for me. Servers are attentive and the sushi chefs are all entertaining and friendly. Quality is always above and beyond, no complaints!

kdCkjBIFuwP1YTjucOMqQQ.text: The place looks nice and the staff was really cool. The sushi chefs were actually Japanese. The food was just ok however. It was a steep for what I'm usually getting. The best thing about Roku is they use real grated wasabi.

_cNCFfrnMX4QclITJ2Yo5A.text: Upon entering, we were not sure we'd made a good choice, walking further into the restaurant out reservations settled...the setting is swanky, urban elegant...dim lighting, pretty decor, knowledgeable staff and good food made this a nice experience. We've had better sushi but overall it was a nice experience .

m3ersfvukWb36J0ROHhQiQ.text: I'm surprised that this isn't one of the highest-rated sushi places in Vegas because as an Asian foodie who often overspends on sushi, I was utterly amazed by the quality of sushi and culinary creativity at Sushi Roku. We had the sushi sampler for $65 and when it came, I saw some unusual combinations and thought to myself, "Oh no, this had better not be some kind of Americanized sushi like Californian rolls..." Well, it wasn't. The truffle addition truly worked, bravo. We also like the bartender and the friendly atmosphere. The only thing that I didn't like was the noodles; after all, this place is where you go for sushi, not ramen.

9sxcWTmMbROIqCpYVwmmtw.text: We sat at the sushi bar and were well entertained by the master sushi chef's there. The Sushi and Sashimi was just so fresh expertly cut and well presented. I enjoyed it so much I just had to try the Toro which was exceptional. This is up there with Nobu and Morimoto as far as I am concerned.

UoAiYegNQcnk5ctw5YLreA.text: I love sushi, it is my favorite food so I am always hoping to find a good sushi restaurant when I go to Vegas. This place was okay. I think I am just too spoilt going to Sushi Deli in San Diego which is hands down the best sushi place on earth. The sushi here was just okay to me. I got the black truffle roll because it sounded awesome and someone else suggested it on here. It tasted like absolutely nothing to me. It wasn't bad, it just tasted like crunchy cardboard. We also accidentally ordered cold sake which is quite possibly one of the grossest tasting things you could ever drink. Overall the sushi was fine, but I wouldn't come here again to be completely honest.

YKmtnwlUkdykKMay1RAokA.text: As a sushi lover, I had high expectation for sushi roku, but after my dinner experience here I really think this restaurant is totally overrated. We had blue fin o toro and makuro, the fish was pretty fresh, however not surprisingly good. Despite the size of sushi being too small, the major problem this restaurant had was that the sushi rice was not good. The portion of rice and sticky rice was off, so the sushi rice was not tiny sour-ish nor sticky enough. The decoration of the restaurant was really nice but I don't think I will visit again.

frlvmUg8H27b3fRzgRUEyg.text: I love Sushi Roku.  A friend and I decided to get lunch here one day because we didn't want to fall pit to the "we're in Vegas, let's have buffet" like we did the time before.  I had had Sushi Roku one time a couple years ago, but wanted to try it again.  We were promptly greeted and sat at the sushi bar.  The chef was great.  I threw out a couple suggestions of what I like, but wanted to have his recommendation as to what I should have.  Although they didn't have ankimo this time, he did recommend a few other dishes.    The tako roll was really tasty, but the nigiri I had was by far better.  The katsuo was one of the best preparations I've had in a very long time, light sauce and onion, perfect!  Katsuo is my favorite fish, and actually one of the cheaper ones.  It wasn't even on the menu here, but he had it! =)  I next wanted to have a full aji (i.e. sashimi, nigiri, and then the filet is deep-fried), but the aji was already filleted, so I decided to just have a couple pieces seared.  The next was a great recommendation of saiko sake.  Saiko sake is what the Japanese consider to be the best salmon in the world; this salmon comes from New Zealand.  I normally don't care for fattier fish, but this was exquisite.  I admit the food here is a little pricey, so make sure to get the good stuff.  If you want California rolls go somewhere else.  If you want to be adventurous and have high-quality sushi, this is the spot.

gSRG0pJB9NYc2FOYGpu0-Q.text: I wish i could remember the bartender's name because he was awesome! Had great drink and dessert recommendations! Happy hour is a great deal - smaller portions, but still plenty of food! The chocolate filled mini donuts were great! Also the filet wrapped asparagus and garlic ponzu albacore were both amazing apps!

95XrPQqjt1Br5xceHOsHSg.text: My experience with this place was quite mixed, but overall I had to give them 4 stars. Here's why: At first the experience was NOT good: -We were seated next to a huge party that was so loud I couldn't even hear my friends. The place was full so we weren't able to switch tables and it really ruined the whole dining experience because we couldn't even talk to each other! -Food took foooorever to come out and, when it did, some of it was missing and some of it was wrong. The tempura veggies weren't even cooked! But they did a LOT to try to make it better: -They comped our veggies and brought us complimentary tempura shrimp and shots for the table -The manager came over and personally apologized for the loudness and the mishaps we'd had with our food And overall, the service was great considering how busy the place was. The food did take a long time to come out, but we weren't in a rush so it was fine. In terms of quality food - the tempura shrimp were amazing! The specialty sushi rolls were great, but the regular rolls were nothing special (literally nothing to them - could make them at home yourself). I'd say don't waste money on the "regular" rolls - get the specialty ones! They're pricier, but you get more (8 pieces instead of 5 or 6) and with many more flavor combinations, sauces, etc. So overall I'd say to give the place a chance. It has good food, good service, and good drinks.

DZ0BmRZFZCuGNmx_-hgrig.text: Organized a dinner for 13 of us here. The private room, the attentive service from Miko and the amazing food selection, made for a great night. The atmosphere and view sent the night over the top. The robata skewers of sea bass and Kobe beef were enjoyed by all. The roasted peppers and tempura shrimp were a hit as well. The sliced tuna was amazing and converted two more to sushi.

sXK1-W283GvrpyZ6p3q5MQ.text: Service and ambiance are top notch. Sit at the sushi bar if possible for a great time interacting with the chefs.   Sushi was fresh and prompt. The sushi chefs steered us to the freshest selections.  As others have said it's a little on the pricy side but hey, it's Vegas!.

pka0PN6FVQAXjwzJYFXxKA.text: I've had a handful of sushi places in Vegas. Perhaps from all of the bad experiences my expectations were low...but bar none, this is the best I've had (in Vegas). The sushi was very good, wait staff was friendly.

qrpAoas3VYh4FsUxcnxp9w.text: What a great place for sushi!!! Love the ambiance and the sushi, perfect! Our server Debra was wonderful! We told her we were open to her suggestions, just asked that she keep in mind my sesame allergy...she was spot on with everything, such great recommendations, everything was delicious! We enjoyed the Yellowtail Sashimi with Diced Chililes, Edamame (great flavor whatever they do), Katana Roll, White Lotus Roll (a bit of a kick, so good) and for dessert Uni. Everything was so tasty I would have it all again right now!!! We also enjoyed a carafe of the Sawanoi cold sake which was perfect for us! We highly recommend this place & Debra! Next time we're in Vegas we'll be back for sure!!!

B6M6LQ3eBhgvpfnMqxWhMg.text: Loved this place! I went alone and was seated immediately. The waiter was super friendly and attentive. Not a good selection of veggie rolls but they were willing to accommodate! I opted for the Garden Roll and Miso Soup. It arrived almost immediately! The Garden Roll was $12 and came with six huge pieces. My only gripes are that they're too big to fit in your mouth AND the end pieces have huge pieces of Asian sprouts that there's no way you can eat them without taking them apart. (Which I did. Because they were delicious.) Overall very attentive staff and good food.

Y1qeokpDxrGC3zv1aImG_w.text: Food is really good tastes  amazing too. Also the server was very professional.  BUT literally every dish was like nothing there. If u really wanna try here just let u guys know. U will cost 31 $ for like 5pics of shrimp and tons of chips on the top n it's called pan fried shrimp with chips lol.

8Fl8OvIIqu1Fv63Og3QX2A.text: Went here on our anniversary trip. The food was great, same as in Pasadena CA... service was slower and we were ignored or rushed depending on which server kept coming to our table, since we had 2 taking care of our table...  BUt the food was spectacular as always.

d1xVBFP2CobjTf7ET2L68Q.text: If I could add more stars I would! Ordered the caviar on scallops, Kumamoto oysters, toro andddd hamachi kama. Every single bite tasted like heaven. The oysters with an array of trio sauces, honestly, tasted like a beautiful piece if art on my pallet. Come here and order everything I did and you'll leave giddy! Oh and the honey whiskey/ginger ales help with that too! Johnny the main man is awesome too!

FnjupsRtlbKIqDschRTrBw.text: Excellent service and ambiance but overpriced. Then again, it's Vegas and everything is overpriced.   Everyone in the group enjoyed their food. My fried rice and miso eggplant were delicious. We shared the creme brulee and mochi samplers for dessert, which were both decadent.   I don't know what was in the food, but less than 15 minutes after the meal we were all hightailing it to the bathrooms. :P

KY8oact6T0vOkRGJWmIXqw.text: The service is phenomenal. The food is impeccable. The atmosphere is modern and relaxing. The food is pricey, but completely worth it. The back of the restaurant has an amazing view of the Las Vegas Strip, overlooking most of its well known hotels. I had the Albacore sashimi dish, along with a Spicy Tuna roll. Both left me feeling satisfied. I will definitely be coming back here for sushi soon!

RfZCCYuOHuPFbLFgBMawww.text: My boss had made a reservation for us after working the FN Platform trade show at Sushi Roku- and maaannnnn did this place really top my night and talk about how amazing the food was to all my friends back home.  The experience and food itself was so perfect that my boss and I came back the following night!  Let me just tell you- I rarely eat sushi- not that I don't eat it but its because I never had a memorable moment with it until I ate at Sushi Roku.  The highlights of my night:  1. The view- I'm all about the views and for my first time in Vegas at eating on the third floor of Caesars Palace really set the mood for the night. 2. The service was outstanding. Our server gave us his favorite meals, suggestions and the food was prepared in a timely manner.  3. We ordered Scallops with Foie Gras and White Truffle Oil, Spicy Tuna Rolls, Pot Stickers and Chilean Sea bass. 4. The second night we ordered the Pot Stickers and Chilean Seabass again because it was that good.  Now that I found out Sushi Roku is in LA I will be having dinner there all the time! Next time I'm in Vegas this is definitely the dinner spot I will always go to. Thank you for the experience and best dinner Sushi Roku!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot Stickers
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chilean Sea bass and Pot Stickers.The taste of these two dishes were truly exquisite.

buPn7rnVh1iBOB0JVwPYSQ.text: The wife and I decided to take a walk through the fancy mall with our eyes directed towards some decent sushi, and we found this spot. The service was solid, the food was good. The bluefin tuna was delicious. We had the wagu skewer yum, very tender. I ordered a salad and it wasn't the best, the dressing was very bitter, I was fortunate that they remove it with no charge. We had their version bananas foster, was decent. I'd eat here again.

z0-VJYOcv6jJnkqzwS7Ltg.text: My husband and I had an early dinner here on a Thursday night. There were several people enjoying happy hour at that time, but we chose to order from the dinner menu because the happy hour menu only offers sashimi and rolls, not sushi. The service was very good and our waiter was friendly and helpful. I ordered the baked lobster roll and it was very good. My husband ordered several pieces of sushi and said the blue fin tuna was exceptional. We also ordered the wagyu beef skewer and it was delicious and extremely tender. For dessert we ordered the banana flambe which was pretty good. I would say the prices were a bit high for what we got on the dinner menu but all in all it was a good meal and a good experience.

w2rwtfm1uSt6z1wXXXQGqg.text: Great service. Tommy made perfect recommendations. Fun open environment. We had the 6 piece UME and it was more than I expected. Total piece of culinary art. I'll be back

76townmT8Ow7eLm7WuiPjg.text: Great sushi and service! Highly recommend the katana and brussel sprouts with truffle oil.

jT8ag_K-3G9TN1iaT3uI_A.text: Sushi Roku offers high quality Japanese sushi and entrees. I was very impressed by the presentation and quality of their food. My favorite dishes were the ribeye and Brussels sprout chips. While dinner was amazing Dessert left more to be desired. They served our bread pudding cold which was a little shocking as this dish is usually served warm.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mochi
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pumpkin bread pudding

oNlLou-o2DW2yrv9ny4XKQ.text: Great place for sushi and ramen on the strip. You can shop at the Forum and then do dinner. The food is excellent and the atmosphere is hip and clean.  Now considering it is on the Strip, there are tourists who can act like tourists. We saw a group yelling "saki bomb" and then made a mess, which the servers had to clean. I was embarrassed for them. I understand it is the Strip and would not hold it against this place.   For us, the servers were friendly and helpful. One friend who does not do sushi, enjoyed other their tempura. This place has something for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hakata Ramen

RDuLt29QOmT3i9fdDEH77A.text: Took my gf here for the first time to celebrate her bday and the food/service was great. We got the oyster shooters, beef appetizer, pork belly fried rice, a red sun roll and bake blue crab hand roll then topped it off with their carnival cheesecake dessert. I wanted to try that carnival cheesecake so bad with the cotton candy melting in front of us and it did not disappoint. The manager came around as we were having dessert already and when he found out it's for a bday he apologized that they had missed that part of the info, he brought out a sparkler and helped us take some photos and gave us the dessert on the house. He didn't have to but that just made everything even that much better. Next time I will bring my husband and parents for them to try the food.

Kziht_likeJKhb_MOxV25Q.text: Hands down the best Chilean sea bass I've ever had. Listed as an appetizer, can be a meal with a sushi roll on the side. Great sake and wine selection. Amazing sashimi as well. Excellent service. Great ambiance , perfect for a date or business dinner. Some seats have a view of the strip. I would definitely go back.

0xdeKrgCwbddPbx3gqBHnA.text: Always come here when I'm on town for work. Outstanding food and service is consistently good. Half price apps and rolls at bar during happy hour can't be beat.

VJ14wQb0t_pp4hDoh5WqRg.text: This is probably the best sushi I've eaten in quite some time. The fish was very fresh and reasonably priced. I had the chef's sushi lunch special, the seaweed salad and the Pinot Grigio. The decor was really nice too.   The service was a little slow, but overall it was a great meal.

xkOO56FH-WeibcCoWjuC0g.text: Had a craving for sushi during our last Vegas trip, and decided to try this place. It was a good location (slight view) and the pries were reasonable & service good! The food portions are pretty generous for sushi, so order cautiously. We had a few rolls, & the pork belly fried rice which was yummy! Also, the martini's are good too! Try the lychee (it's off menu).

hvY0fwPWm-P_kObB5nUpjQ.text: This restaurant provides a great view of the strip. The atmosphere is hip and modern. The fish is fresh and very tasty. Most of their dishes are unique and very appealing. You can tell they put a lot of effort into small details. The sushi is very good. You can taste the quality and freshness of the food. They recommend to not use soy sauce as every sushi piece has it's own flavors.  The service is unfortunately slow. Just to give you an idea our appetizer were delivered before our drinks! We had to wait about 15-20 to get our drink. Overall a good place to get good sushi, just be prepared for a larger bill as you need to get several dishes to get full!

qQjT_imxZQQgvU7j2yRFJg.text: PROS: Tasty food, reasonable prices, lovely ambiance, excellent service CONS: ?  We came here to celebrate my father's birthday, and the food blew us away. We got some small plates, ramen, sushi, and desserts to share, and everything was delicious! Our wait staff was also very attentive without being intrusive and made sure we had a good time. Overall, I was quite surprised by this spot, as it wasn't outrageously expensive, considering the quality and location. A definite recommend if you are on the strip and looking to break away from all the buffets and burgers.

hLIUkGpGiUejEKfa1VAMRw.text: Great place to have sushi in Santa Monica. We tried a couple of rolls and they were great. The chefs were friendly and i liked the glass waterfall by the entrance I thought it was special

HnaeoN_gEyouG4RdWe1lXQ.text: We went for their HH deal. It was 3 of us, we were seated right away. Only the bar/lounge area is available for happy hour.   Their price seemed very reasonable when looking at the menu, but when we got the actual food, we were somewhat disappointed with their portion. They literally provide sample portions of their actual food at somewhat reduced price. I do not recommend any roles, as I thought they were like AYCE sushi quality. Very small 6 pieces of roles for 6-8 dollars. I don't know how much they would actually charge for the same role during non-HH price- so go ahead if you want to risk it.   Also, their fried calamari was very oily and sweet level was to the max. Their wagyu wrapped asparagus was very good, but again, only 4 pieces of half asparagus were offeres. Their drinks are "hotel" HH price.   The one thing that I would definitely go back for is their MUSHROOM TEMPURA!! That was the best fried shitakes ever. They were deep fried softly with an essense of truffle oil. So good that I can still smell it!   Their service is just average, nothing stands out. I would recommend places lime sushi Ra or other local places if anyone is craving sushi for HH prices and is looking at this place.

Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Tuna roll, albacore roll, shrimp and Jalapeno roll.

QWT_vRMIIczCDaNPHBV4Ug.text: If I can afford it I would be an everyday customer went again today and again had an excellent dinner it was much more packed than it was the other night and this time I really looked at the place you know and checked out the architecture and everything else and it's just such a really cool place to hang out it's so pretty and very nice owners and workers the lady that greet you at the front door was so impeccably dressed I had to make a comment she looked stunning like she was ready for the Grammys! But all smiles and great service and it's so cold to talk to the sushi chefs because they know so much about the fish and the traditions and everything and it's really cool to check out different fish from all over the world. Another very good plus about this restaurant is it there so knowledgeable of True Japanese Cuisine and culture.

XmQ5oY6BJQpYS9T_XN9BTg.text: Not sure what the hype is all about.  Maybe because it's sushi on the strip?  There's better sushi and it's outside the strip.    Ok, I'm not saying it's bad.  The calamari was good and different from the calamari I'm used to.  The jalapeno glaze gave it a tangy crunchy flavor, which makes it unique.  We ordered 2 rounds of that.    The endamame, I was expecting to have more spices added on to it.  There was barely any salt.    Got the foie gras skewer as an appetizer.  It was just a small skewer wrapped in asparagus.  Tasty, but for the price, I wish I got more than a skewer.  It was so tiny.    I also had the pork belly fried rice with fried egg on top.  I like the flavor of the pork belly and how tender it was.  Runny fried egg made it all better.  This place is good, but pricey since on the strip.  Ambiance was good too.  You need to make a reservation to get strip view seating.

NzC2uh18g7Ivx04TqDdJQQ.text: Pretty good! I've been looking forward to trying this place out for a while and was not disappointing. We had the Kimchee cucumbers as an appetizer, nothing special just Asian pickles, but still good. I had the tuna jalepeno, which was good but really hot! I thought it was interesting that they didn't provide wasabi with out sushi, but after one bite, I realized that I didn't need it. It's pretty expensive here but the food it good and the service is very good as well. Definitely would consider going again and trying more of their menu.

vL0mmqGXrfv9R1LwsnO4zg.text: 2 words to describe this restaurant - Par Excellence!  Service was exemplary. Our waiter gave us the right suggestions and the food was prepared in a timely manner. The restaurant was busy but there was no room for error.  Right from the appetizers to the entrees - sushi and sashimi, everything was prepared to perfection. Highly recommend the crispy Brussel sprouts, popcorn shrimp tempura, filet mignon wrapped asparagus, crunchy tuna and the spicy scallops.  For dessert do order the green tea tiramisu.  Drinks : We just did beer and wine and they have a good selection.  All in all a wonderful dining experience. Definitely a classy and EXPENSIVE restaurant - that's quiet normal for the strip, but it's worth the money you spend.

WTGNKCpEUcNQWukm_OUHmQ.text: Bae mikey and I came to Vegas for a short mini getaway.   He wanted to take me here to try the sushi and by far it was close enough to Michelin Star. Our chef remembered bae and he introduced each Omakase sushi to us so that we can taste each bite. No need for soy sauce or wasabi.  We will actually be back before we leave back home. Thank you!

coN6RFa34bWXDRYK3rd3og.text: This review was for the evening Friday 9/6/19 for a party of 8 for a Bachelor Party.  **Service**  We had a reservation and was quickly seated.  Our server Pam was very helpful with suggesting that we order 3 pairs of the menu samplers (higher priced option) instead of 4 pairs that turned out to be just the right amount of food for everyone.  This was a much better option than trying to order a la carte for the size of our group.  She was also helpful in suggesting some sake bottle choices for the group.  The servers in general were good about switching out plates and keeping our glasses full of sake, beer, water and sparking water.  The pace of how fast the food came out was nice.  **Food**  Overall for the value, quality and volume of food was pretty solid and no one left hungry.  They even spiffed up a dessert plate with congratulations for our bachelor.  Brussels Sprout Chips - Very tasty and crispy and properly salted just right  Spicy Tuna on Crispy Rice - Nice and spicy and crispy  Hamachi Carpacio - Tasty but hamachi was at room temp on plate that took away from experience  Kumquat Fluke - Tasty but again at room temp on plate that took away from experience  Ribeye w Japanese Potatoes - Japanese potatoes paired well with the ribeye.  Japanese mayo always adds a more delicate flavor and texture than western mayo  Nigiri - Toro, Salmon and Hamachi were all nice cuts and very tasty  Baked Crab Roll - Tasted more rice than crab but decent.  The presentation was a bit plain  Tuna Jalapeno - Thinking that was what we had.  Nice spiciness to it  Hamachi Jalapeno? - Looked and tasted similar to Tuna Jalapeno but had hamachi on top instead  Assorted Ice Cream Mochi - Mango, Strawberry and Chocolate were nice  Chilled Sake - First one suggested had nice fruity background and went well with food.  Second one for unfiltered was a bit on the dry side and didn't pair well with the food and would have gone for thicker and sweeter unfiltered one to pair.  Sake glasses were not chilled and ended up chilling them in water glasses.   ***Value/Cost***  10 courses plus edamame and including dessert, 2 bottles of premium sake, 6 beers, several bottles of sparkling water came out to about $150/person including gratuity.  Everyone was stuffed by the time dessert came around.  **Lighting/Ambiance**  It was a bit on the dark side but we were able to use our phone lights to see the menu and the food.  The low lighting did accentuate the light fixtures above along with the view of the main strip we could see from our table and it give a bit more intimacy.  ***Seating/Table***  We had a combination of chairs and low back restaurant booth seating.  The chairs were great but the low back booth seating had no back support for anyone sitting in them.  **Suggestions**  More attention to detail in general such as the following:  * Chilling the serving plate for the Hamachi and Fluke.  Since they are such thin slices, you have the heat transfer from the room temp serving plate that brings the fish up to room temp.  Had the plate been chilled with would have significantly heightened the delicate nature of both those dished.  *Serving chilled sake in chilled sake glasses would have done the same for the heightening the enjoyment of chilled sake.  *Serving the Ice Cream Mochi on chilled plates would have also help for the same reason and kept the Ice Cream from melting too fast.  ***Overall**  Have a very pleasant experience with the food, alcohol, service and ambiance and a very reasonable price for size of our party from beginning to end. I would visit again to try out other menu items.

u1_z3r4BQM97mVBKne9dWw.text: Although this place is beautiful and the serv ice was stellar.  I was really sad because they changed their food selection and I thought the food was fine. The tuna was so fresh and melted in your mouth, but everything else was just fine.  The desserts were basic and nothing seemed appealing so we skipped dessert.

RPGNjsiJsdWBdZTtDPeKiQ.text: Loved coming here! First of all our hostess, server, expeditor where all VERY friendly! We ordered 4 rolls, kids meal, miso soups, ikura and 3 hot sakes.  We loved how the sushi rolls where served anything with a sauce or topping was added at the table which is nice for presentation but also prevents the sushi rolls from getting soggy or falling apart. They offer spicy miso soup and that was some of the best miso my husband or I ever tried! I enjoyed coming here the space is beautiful and the view is nice if you sit near the windows. It's a great place to come for either happy hour or on a date night.

NP72LYkq2bpgN-5tIuDOgQ.text: My husband and I had dinner here tonight at 8pm with reservations we made via opentable. The hostess seated us next to the window for a view of the strip as we requested, however we were realllly squeezed in with some other diners so after we were seated we got up to ask if we could sit somewhere else.  Along our way to the host stand, a server asked us if we were okay and we explained our situation. He said he would take care of us and motioned to an entire section of seats with a view of the Strip/Flamingo that was completely empty and said he'd get us some waters.   His name was Luis M and I'll be honest. He was very nice and I'm sure we threw him off a bit by moving and maybe messing up the hostess' flow but we ended up sitting for a good 5 minutes without menus. In this time we did get our waters from a food runner.   A woman (she's in my photos) who appeared to be a manager also came over as soon as we were seated to ask us where we had been sitting. Like why can't you just ask the hostess instead of us? We immediately felt shamed like we messed things up even though this restaurant was hardly busy.   5 minutes of sitting we waved her down and asked for menus. She quickly brought them over.   Luis came over and made some cocktail recommendations and let us look over the menu. Quite a bit of time passed and he comes back and apologizes. No problem, we've both been servers for many years in our younger days and totally get it. Things happen and you get busy.   We ordered a sea bass skewer and the short rib bao buns for our appetizers. A katana roll and spicy scallop roll for my entree with a matcha mule. My husband got the katana roll and a tuna roll for his entree.   So maybe 5 minutes later a food runner brings out a nigiri tuna. Confused, my husband and I have a short back and forth with Luis and the food runner. We expressed that we wanted a roll and they just looked dumbfounded. You would think they'd immediately take back the nigiri and bring out a tuna roll but they didn't offer so my husband, bless his heart, just says he'll eat it.   Now I'm just so irritated by how the night has gone. This manager comes over to bring our drinks and I ask her "if someone orders a tuna roll, would they get this?" And she explains no, it's nigiri.   So I tell her I'm honestly a little annoyed because we ordered that for my husband but he didn't get that. It's pretty awkward but my husband had already eaten one piece and we're basically just like, we've said our peace but we wanted you to know because we're not getting anything from her. No offer to get the right item out, nothing. Nada. No apologies either but just an uncomfortable smile and she leaves.   She walks away and now we're both just in crappy moods. We're locals and we are at the Forum Shops ALL the damn time and have never had such poor customer service.   Then they bring out my katana roll. A minute later they bring my husbands out and my spicy scallop roll. Lastly the bao buns.   The timing of the meal was just off. Entrees came out before appetizers. I'm just blown away at how poorly this evening went.   Luis was a very nice guy albeit he seemed overwhelmed at one point but what upsets me most is if a customer says they ordered A bit receive B, it is your job to fix it and get what they ordered.   We walked away utterly baffled at how poorly this meal went. We checked in at approx 8 and left 45 minutes later not even wanting dessert after this shit show.   Luis was nice enough to ask us what we were up to after we asked for a to go box (idk why we got a box, it'll just be leftovers we won't eat) and we said we were just going to go home and sleep. He informed us about the locals discount and a pretty awesome happy hour. It's too bad we're never coming back here again. There's just too many awesome spots for sushi in Vegas and we don't have time for mediocrity.   I still don't understand why everyone looked so confused when I expressed dissatisfaction at the roll vs nigiri mix up. It would have been fine if they just took it back and made what we originally ordered. And why even order appetizers if they come out at the same time or after our entree orders of sushi? I just find the deer in the headlights reaction to everything to be unacceptable.   Food was okay. Bao buns weren't good, rolls were okay but nothing I'd pay $24 for again. Cocktails were probably the best part of the meal. I really liked my matcha mule.

zHQuCgMYbnk7gPGMZakX7g.text: We were famished and close by this place, OpenTable seemed to be broken when trying to reserve a table and earn free points.  They happily seated us and had a killer view of Caesar's front area near the window.  Service was attentive and so on the ball and food matched it perfectly. From the Ramen to the sushi to the Yakitori everything was exceptional. Surprised I never heard of this place before, prices were reasonable being in this fancy schmancy casino of Caesar's Palace.  Definitely will come back to this place, they had a nice menu with lot of options to choose from.

gxxCSr2I7tUjvmbaexHpCA.text: Made a reservation on OpenTable, but when we got there, we realized we didn't really need one. It's definitely better to have one and not need one than to not have one and not be able to get seated!  We've been here once before, a few years ago, and I'd say the service is pretty consistent. The menu is on the pricier side for sushi, BUT you're getting top quality cuts of fish.  My boyfriend ordered rolls off the menu, and I ordered the matsu (8 pc chef choice sushi). I would order that 10/10 times from this restaurant. The toro, the uni, and even the yellowtail just melt in your mouth. The flavors were amazing. I can't even begin to describe them.  If you're debating eating here, just do it!

XOe9wAonj1ZcAJ8X5R3XDg.text: Super duper high quality sushi place here in Vegas. I'm from the west coast and if I think the fish is fresh in this place, I truly mean it. They must have carried it with private jet or something.   I ordered variety of dishes from sashimi to special rolls. You've got to try these. Let the waiters/waitress guide you through the menu. Mine did and it was super success.   I sat at the bar and ordered several rolls. They made it one after another in a very timely manner. I walked in without a reservation around Friday 1PM. No reservation needed really around this time. I do think their dinner time would be super pack though so definitely reserve.   If you're into sushi, rolls, sashimi then you must try this place. I'm literally drooling as I'm writing this review.

YIiU9fuyZdS0BzbiaIh-gQ.text: Sushi Roku, located at Caesars, offers diners a sophisticated, artful atmosphere, delicious sushi and a terrific view of the Las Vegas Strip.   The sushi is created from the freshest fish in the desert :-). The contemporary dishes here include non-traditional elements, like jalapenos and olive oil. While sushi and sashimi may be the stars of the menu, you can also choose from hot and cold dishes that encompass and combine a range of Asian and American styles.   Menus include lunch, happy hours, dinner and gluten free. The chef's custom sushi creations come in six or eight piece selections, and the selections for sushi and sashimi plus Sushi Roku's signature rolls will leave you with a variety of options to satisfy any cravings.
