xm5tYJJTUXT-oEJ4v5EdSg.text: We came to Sushi Roku since one of our friends in our party made reservations here. Upon arrival, we waited about 5 ish minutes before being seated. We weren't really next to the window, but we had a decent view. Anyways, our waitress was really kind and attentive. We were a group of 6, but she was nice to split the bill 3 ways. Most of us in the party ordered to share because looking at the price for these sushi was not worth it. Hubby and I ended up ordering 2 rolls and a ramen to share.   The two rolls came out and we are just staring at it like.. "this is worth $14?" It was really mediocre and the taste wasn't even all that. We could honestly get better sushi back home for a more decent price and the size portion would have been worth it.  The ramen came out after and I have to say it was pretty good. The broth was delicious and the sliced pork was melt in your mouth! That was the only good thing that came from our dinner.   Let's just say, we are not coming back. We'll find other sushi places in Vegas whenever we come back for a trip.

_aovoZ0Hhh59aOmbCZPJiA.text: Ah-mazing! Came here for my birthday with my boyfriend & the Manager Johnny, our server Lisa (I think that was her name), and her team showed such hospitality! You can't beat the strip views too! We enjoyed the jalapeno calamari, short rib bao, yellowtail with diced peppers, spicy tuna roll, popcorn shrimp roll, miso soup, beef skewer, cinnamon donuts, and banana flambe. Will definitely be suggesting this restaurant and hope to come back in the future!

pK5RAT-_J0JvnNWC03Rf6w.text: Came here for happy hour and nosh on a Thursday night and had a great time!  We ordered appetizers off the happy hour menu but skipped the happy hour drinks because it looked boring.  Instead, we ordered a bottle of sake and Hendricks cocktails (gin, lime juice, simple syrup, cucumber).  These are the appetizers that we loved and would order again:  shishito peppers, green beans, spicy tuna rolls, shrimp & jalapeno rolls.  The fillet with asparagus, albacore rolls, popcorn/tempura shrimp were just okay and not worth reordering.  My hands down favorite were the shishito peppers!  Service was impeccable!  I can't remember our server but we were there awhile and had 2 different servers and both were excellent!

3BRCrQ_4IINsGl2plE7zBg.text: The food is so good! Yum! Service here was wonderful and the quality of the food was great! Husband and I had a great time here for lunch. I will definitely be back here anytime I'm in Vegas!!

ZNja6yLIf71EAbdhubzpOA.text: Excellent!! Simply superb sushi restaurant!! I have been here numerous times and have never been disappointed. Elegant ambiance with an incredible view of the Las Vegas Strip. The food is always fresh and the service is top notch. Good happy hour, friendly staff and great bar tenders who know how to mix a great drink!! General Manager, Johnny Seo is magnificent and knows how to cater to his clientele to keep them coming back again and again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing desserts!!!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elegant Ambiance
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. General Manager, Jonny Seo is simply best!!!

AuW2cEOtsM8phOkuRt0vpw.text: My friend and I had time to kill before she had to go in to work. We stopped by Sushi Roku since it was close to our work. On Fridays, their happy hour ends earlier than the rest of the week. Monday through Thursday, it goes until 7pm. On Friday, it ends at 6pm.  Since we missed the happy hour by a few minutes, we still decided to grab a bite at the bar. The mushroom tempura is, by far, the best item on the menu. Light batter, fried crispy, and tossed in truffle aioli makes for the perfect snack. The miso black cod is also very delicious. The fish flakes into beautiful slivers. The octopus carpaccio is not as tender as I would hope. It pales in comparison to the first two dishes.  Now I need to sneak away at a decent time to attend their happy hour.

Ffe1a_uBBB_0GmW6jZ1O3w.text: Delicious sushi and cocktails. A bit pricy but worth it. Bartender and manager were very nice and made me feel welcomed and special. Come for happy hour for cheeper sushi rolls and drinks. Happy hour starts earlier on the weekends   They have happy hour everyday of the week. They are always happy to also customize a sushi roll to your taste or make you something not listed on the menu. Will be back again soon for sure. Make sure you try the pineapple brown sugar cocktail...so delicious!  Enter the forum shops across the street from Harrah's, that way you are not walking miles through the mall looking for the place.

syf_8VsnjRWyrTLiwc3rAg.text: Why are you wasting time reading this?  You need to go to Orbitz or Expedia, something and book tickets to Vegas just to eat here.  I mean it.  There is no time to gamble, catch a show, or hang out in front of the Bellagio.   This is the BEST sushi i have ever had in my entire life.  (Trust me- I am old and I have lived in Japan.) I suggest you bring zip locks to line your coat so that you can bring home  black truffle tempura hand rolls in your purse. I don't know how food safe that would be but  it makes me smile just thinking about! We had a fabulous meal with an incredible view and just being there in a beautifully designed place.    Very nice attention to detail. I looked through the review remarks about the price and I will say this- again, I am old- you get what you pay for and the food here is worth paying for!

HCLEYz1JcbHm_S75M1o4MQ.text: Lunch - seaweed salad, pork belly fried rice, sushi sampler lunch with miso soup, all fresh and delicious. Beautiful dining room with a view of the Strip; excellent and attentive service.

2TWSuigCS3omKZO6PlCZnw.text: Salmon sashimi was fishy and the hot sake was not very smooth.  Expected a lot better quality for Vegas Strip sushi.

Zx_J8Km5JM0NgDcAnzJj3g.text: Food: 4 Stars Service: 3 Stars  I give it a total of 3.5 but I always round down.  Thursday night we had reservations at 8:45 PM. Did not get seated until 9:10 PM so the reservations did not have much help. The ambience is nice, dimly light, bar near the front, big open space.  Food: Sashimi - VERY fresh, this is probably the best thing on the menu. We ordered Salmon, Tuna, Yellowtail, etc. all very good.  Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus - this was a nice treat, beef was tender, and well marinated.  Kobe Potstickers - nothing special, save your money. Don't get it.  All of their rolls were nothing special.  Chilean Seabass - This was very very good. I highly recommend this.  Overall the FOOD is good, just the service wasn't the best. This review is based on food + service. I recommend this restaurant if it was based on Food only.

OymLa3MNcKvKTcEXkhgZ9w.text: Rushed service. Poor quality sushi and really mediocre food. One of the worst restaurant experiences that I ever had in Las Vegas and I go there at least three times a year..

ZMdYGSYtHPP-2LyMt2pvhA.text: Amazing place!  Staff was great, sushi was fresh and atmosphere was upbeat and had a great view of the strip.  Pricy, but worth the experience.

c1h4BIWJhvoGqT14WmiUEQ.text: This place amazing I took my boyfriend here for sushi and he loved it  The ambiance was great every plate we ordered was great and even the drinks were great. I do think this place should have $$$$ instead of $$$ because our bill was like $250 but hey its Vegas baby. Even at the end they gave us a free birthday shot which taste like chocolate mmmm really good and a tiramisu cake which was just divine. We left happy and full and it was a great time. Even the service was great I'm actually really impressed at how nice Vegas people are oh and yes ill def come again

K0PbqtUJuUjDFRTCHsVZdw.text: Located in the Forum Shops, Sushi Roku was your standard quality sushi, but pricier.  The view is nice (you can see Las Vegas Blvd from the windows), but their sushi was nothing special.  The yellowtail with chillies was probably my favorite dish, but the nigiri and rolls did not do much for me.  (+) location, view, waitstaff (-) value

bdoKWhqfNb7o8YmbKagcQA.text: I love it !!! The spicy tuna on crispy rice is yami yami The service is fast and welcome

wyct4fNHPMZivBAjaW1gEQ.text: Fantastic food,  awesome ambiance and terrific service!  We were celebrating our 23rd anniversary and we loved it. Try the foie gras, absolutely love it. Salmon dinner was terrific. Yes, we'll worth the price.

ufp6IT6jsRwQ_JXLxDSjtw.text: Awesome food and very friendly stuff. Happy hour menu is spectacular. Try miso eggplants and popcorn shrimp. Also tried the chef menu which was exceptional. Many years we were dining there and never were we disappointed.

2Mx6qzvI2Euks04LBqqYgQ.text: Stumbled on this place while on a shopping excursion at The Forum Shoppes.  The timing couldn't have been better since we arrived during the afternoon happy hour.  Nothing we ordered from the happy hour menu was over $6, including - Stella Artois - Blue Moon - Spicy Tuna Roll - Rock Shrimp w/ Ja Roll - Shrimp Tempura Roll - Whitefish Tempura Roll - Eggplant Tempura Roll - Albacore Tuna Roll - Filet Wrapped Asparagus - Crispy Chicken - Chocolate Volcano Cake  The sushi was fresh and the tempura was crispy.  The True testament to this place is that my wife, who does NOT each sushi, actually enjoyed most of the sushi!  We both thought the Eggplant Tempura Roll was inventive and as good as any of the traditional rolls.  You'd be wise to skip the Crispy Chicken completely as it was tasteless and dry.  The Chocolate Volcano Cake was...amazing and I could drink the vanilla bean sauce that came with it with a straw!  Keep in mind, this is basically a happy hour review, so there are probably much cooler and fancier offerings on Sushi Roku's full menu.  Lastly, a shout out to James our great bar tender!

tHINNWDF51GwHfTKSjICng.text: Came in on Saturday evening around 830 and sat in the front of the resturant by the bar. The food was so so, however  our waiter was amazing(wish I would have gotten his name). He was so kind and compassionate and very knowledgeable of the menu.  Las  Vegas restaurants need to take notes on this type of service; as we will be back to try the menu again and hopefully get the same gentleman who service us last night!!!!!!  We came in Saturday evening December 26th  around 845.

dUFcuFw11AbX4h2YDJLpoQ.text: Wasn't a huge fan of any of the rolls, and the gyoza was different from what I'm used to I guess. A lot of beef taste... Service was good. Dirty martinis were great. Felt like the food took a little more time than usual to come out. Great looking place with a great view though!

-Ae7spRFPaOA8n6LSvVD1Q.text: We spent the last night in Vegas and this is where we chose to eat.  We had a large group of people with usually high expectations of dinner, especially since the night before dinner was a disaster.  Sushi Roku was AMAZING and the service was top notch.  We had Bailey as our server and she made all of our sushi dreams come True.  Everything tasted wonderful and I would 100% return when we go to Vegas again!

lK6x6zpjkkeXYtuajC1IzQ.text: I had one of the lunch specials and was very satisfied. In particular I had a bento box with chicken, salad, rice and tempura. Everything was very delicious and filling. I also sampled one of the rolls was pleased and wished I'd gotten that as well. To drink I had a sparkling saki which was small but very good if you like sweet drinks. I would come back to try the rolls next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3vzt0bpvsEQXICZQrXEUWw.text: The happy hour deal is great! Had the spicy tuna and spicy scallop roll - both were excellent. The service was also fantastic.

RDcO-vmsQSpuRKP7KnxJWg.text: So here's the skinny on Sushi Roku.  It's overpriced (welcome to Vegas!), better-than-good-but-not-great food with a very nice view of the Strip.  Did we enjoy the meal?  Yes.  Would we go back?  Probably not.  I would recommend getting a window seat, especially in the evening, when the lights are up.  Service was mixed; the greeter / host was really nice and engaged, but our waiter was somewhat absent.  It seemed he was covering a lot of the floor himself, but still.  The sushi itself was very well presented.  We got the chef's selection, which had some intriguing and tasty combinations - I'd recommend going that way.  Oh yeah - the Wagyu pot stickers are almost worth another star by themselves.  So -- not a place to avoid, or one to seek out particularly.

HGr7oxnzm4Is73ZVNqV1QA.text: Came here and got the seafood udon noodle dish. It's not in the menu but recommended because I asked if I could add meat to the udon noodle. The server was great - the Brussels sprouts chip were great. Next time I go to Vegas I would definitely go back

FyJZneRcLkL_e25699CTZQ.text: So glad we dropped in after shopping at the Forum. The edamame was delicious with the garlic and spicy. The sushi was delicious and our server Luis was excellent. I look forward to coming here again when we return to Las Vegas. Get the shimi roll

V23wod-W_20HecggpldQaA.text: Surprisingly great fish buyer for the desert. Actually pretty great fish buyer for anywhere. Well prepared..

6GBtkXi64UyZuzL-s-9GSw.text: Delicious. We were craving sushi something fierce on our Vegas trip and this place hit the spot. Friendly and prompt service and delicious food. Get the roll with the curry paste (balls it's good!). We also enjoyed the crab dynamite roll, shima roll, and spicy scallop roll. The chicken skewers were awesome too.

8vGhURLHc8hq3jD3GBvTgw.text: Awful. Some of the worst sushi I have ever had. Maybe the happy hour menu is full of leftover sushi from the night before, but I'd rather eat grocery store sushi. Mushy and unappetizing. Thank goodness I didn't pay for the same items at $20 each. $50 I wasted at happy hour here. Never again. Worst sushi experience by far. Save your money and go somewhere else. Yuck!

6qaCAAj1XBnX98HxhIHikg.text: Had a business meal here and all i can say is WOW. Loved it. Great service and very good food. If you like Sushi then this is a must.  Visited July 201

E0d1cvWuIGVZnPY35xV31g.text: Sort of hard to find, on third level in the Caesar's shops, just find an information booth and ask for directions.  Can park for free at Caesar's self parking, parking garage is close to the shops.  Come out of elevators, take first right, take left one you get to Fizz, take another left after  you enter the shops, good all the way down until  you hit a fountain, walk around it and go to the right, walk straight until you get to the escalators, go up, you'll see it in the back to the right after that.    Only did rolls, tried:  - Crab Dynamite (favorite) - California - Popcorn Shrimp Tempura w/ Jalapeno (really good!) - Shrimp Tempura w/ Asparagus - Spicy Tuna (tuna melts in your mouth, one of best i've had)  Does take reservations, used OpenTable  Nice ambiance, service kind of slow but nice people  3 people, 3 drinks, 5 rolls, $100 bill.

7jOgdRvYL44AwoRCDGGTFg.text: The server was a bit arrogant when we tried to order dessert after we paid our bill....Bento box lunch was OK...the fresh sushi rolls tasted somewhat better. Just disappointing for the location of this restaurant.

yoHBht32aEfEmF4Z1zAmcQ.text: Best of the best. The quick fried nori is incredible, the spicy tuna on crispy rice (hanabi), the king crab fried rice, the fabulous rib eye... I can go on and on. Coupled with attentive and friendly service, this is the place to go. Congratulations to Johnny and his team, for not just the food and service, but the amazing consistency.

LL9RyXNeru9p-WJgvHSKgQ.text: Love this place. Everytime we come to Vegas, we get our Japanese fix here. Plus we always ask for Courtney, who is a magnificent server and super awesome!

GLd1_Vh0xCU85f1Wid9hoA.text: sorry but worst japanese food ever.  I've eaten Japanese food so much I could not even taste the food was delicious Japanese nor Chinese food.  Fortunately, the service good to give a star

d0Ta4px3Gh4THJJ2yAjKOg.text: Abolsutely wonderful! Great central location and view from Ceasar's Palace! I had sushi while my daughter had the ramen bowl. Now, we have been to Japan before and this ramen bowl was better than the ramen that we had in Japan itself. The food also came out varily quickly which surprised both my daughter and I. Wonderful place and I would very much recommend if you want sushi on the strip.

o0zsfJA4bMEl0fke7cJx_g.text: We stopped by for lunch as it was the closest Sushi place nearby. I'm definitely glad we checked it out, the food and service was excellent.   We had the Specialty Roll: Shima Roll and the flavors were superb. I recommend the Banana Flambe for the dessert!  Will definitely come back again on our next trip!

b9S3UFAfI4uy-vc466BAsA.text: Inventive, creative dishes in a weird location.   Yes it's mall sushi. But Vegas mall sushi means ignoring the entrance near the dress shop and escalator and sitting by the window overlooking the strip.  With hip decor and a robust menu, there's a lot here to like even before taking your first bite.  And the first bite changes everything. Butter poached lobster. Truffle edamame. Ginger marinated octopus with citrus. Even things that you've had taste unique. It's not to be missed.

SuCquCVDMx9dR9DfmZqQsw.text: Like many of the reviews I thought the sushi was very fresh and the spicy tuna was actually spicy which u very much enjoyed. I also ordered the ramen and it was on point in terms of the broth being rich and flavorful. This is my new go to spot for sushi in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ramen was delicious as the broth was rich and flavorful

zXj2iYa0gWpUvPdPKzMFig.text: Came here with my wife on Sunday evening. Didn't need a reservation we were seated right away. We ordered 2 sushi rolls and the sliders. Portions were small but the food was deeeeelish!!! We will definitely be coming back.

UPIiSlgxD-XYOgdhuyJvkQ.text: Fantastic restaurant, though a little overly expensive for what you get. They have an excellent selection of different sushi rolls, both classic and some very interesting ones. The appetizers were all excellent and i could have easily used the entire meal just sampling through the appetizers menu. The lamb was particularly good. The cocktail menu is also fantastic and they do some pretty awesome and original drinks. Definitely worth trying a couple different ones. I always like to see restaurants with a mezcal cocktail. Overall, there is better sushi out there but Sushi Roku offers an interesting experience with some extras on the menu to make up for it. Just be prepared to spend a good bit, and don't come here if you're extremely hungry or your wallet will hurt!

iUqGvB-Wv1D9zfbQjUexJg.text: I LOOOOOOVE sushi. I've had some truly amazing sushi in Los Angeles, San Francisco, even DC.   This place is... ok. Not bad, but not astounding. But, good enough. Definitely below par what I've had before and what I was expecting for the venue and price, but it's Vegas, so it's quite doable. According to my boyfriend, it's the best sushi place in Vegas/the Strip.   Also, I'm pretty sure their mocha green tea ice cream was from Trader Joe's! D:  Loved the ambiance and the decor though.

DeYIjBBK4yKx-2WeA4ohKw.text: Day 2 of my four day getaway in Vegas.  I try to eat at a good sushi restaurant wherever I visit and Sushi Roku was well rated everywhere.  I was not disappointed in my expectations.  I asked for a seat with a view of the strip and was obliged with a great view looking south down Las Vegas Blvd.    I ordered the chef's tasting menu, a sake sampler, and a cocktail suggested by the waiter (muddled tangerine and cucumber with gin - Yummy!).  Each course in the tasting menu was brought out by one of the chef's and I was given an explanation of the food and its preparation.    The appetizer course was amazing.  After two weeks it is hard to remember which each item was but I think the first item was a squid sashimi with olive oil and lemon.  The second item was a tuna tartar and the third item was a salmon sashimi.  Every item was sublime.  Course two was the hot appetizer.  This was a shrimp skewer with a mango salsa and a skewer with bacon wrapped cherry tomatoes.  Course three was a sashimi sampler with three types of tuna.  Beautiful presentation here.  Course four was perfectly seared scallop.  Course five was a sushi sampler with three pieces of tuna poke hand roll and 4 nigiri.  The salmon nigiri was the best salmon sushi I have ever tasted.  Course six was desert, a tiramisu with green tea infused lady fingers.  Heavenly.  Top rating in my book for service, view, ambiance, and most of all, the amazing food.

Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Las Vegas - Sushi Roku - Sake Sampler

7Wiogc5I84CfS6jPpJ7AQw.text: Amazing customer service and great food. They truly went above and beyond.. the yellowtail appetizer is amazing, we ordered two..

IdlHSsOIEbZ9hEWkU15new.text: This place is fantastic. Beautiful view, delicious food and amazing service. We were a group of 9. Our waiter was friendly and very attentive. At the end, he asked if we wanted to split our bill according to our orders. I was shocked that he even asked. Most places give us a hard time about splitting bills. He gave us our separate bills and they were precise. I was flabbergasted!

wrdaTSek1AuIsFMHNr63vA.text: Awesome sushi/atmosphere in the forum shops at Caesars. The sushi was fresh and the very good. It's your standard high end sushi restaurant in Vegas. The prices are a little steep but what do you expect from a restaurant in the forum shops. A good place to take a date for a nice sushi dinner.

bHNnlwi0OfFhyfqopjmIZg.text: I went here for their happy hour and it was a great deal. The sushi for happy hour were basic rolls, but the fish tasted fresh and good. They have a more extensive menu that seems delicious! The happy hour was fantastic though, 3 rolls and a beer for around $20. Decor is nice. I went here after walking all around Las Vegas and sat at the bar. I felt a little uncomfortable in my shorts, sneakers and casual shirt so I recommend looking fairly decent and not like a tourist a Disneyworld like me!

M8royVV9Nl-bhGr9lbpkDQ.text: Happy hour was a great deal. The sushi was really delicious and tasted fresh! They have great prices like $4 rolls and $5 cocktails during happy hour everyday if you sit at the bar. The bartender was very friendly and personable. This was one of our favorite meals during our stay in Las Vegas!

rc4rXE2MCZOzZ5NPkrFzwg.text: Came here for lunch May 2015 and had the spicy tuna roll with avocado.  I am the person who gave NO tip because of the following bad service: - my server was basically not existent.   -I asked for brown rice instead of white rice and they said it's impossible to do brown rice because of the it ALL the time.  -I got no avocado on it at all when asked.   -No condiments on table or offered.  -my food took forever to come and when it did it was luke warm/cold (it's deep fried) so it must of been sitting around for ages. The place was very quiet and after the lunch rush time. 2.30 - the serving size was not worth the price - after I was finished, I was still hungry but there was no one around to get a menu off. Frustrated at waiting, I went to the front desk and checked out

kterPkNs7sUyXLxViRLSLQ.text: So I went in with a couple of friends first time going we had $200 worth of gift certificates we had to use there ... being a local I never got to try this spot since I always just go to my local sushi spots but sushi roku impressed me! :) if you're looking for a sushi spot with a great ambiance and great view of the strip I recommend it ! My favorite was the rock shrimp I think that's what it's called omg and their rolls are to die for ! Also the shishito peppers wow! Yes def better than NOBU (no shade ) the waitress I wished I knew her name was a sweetheart and her  recommendations were on point , she knew what she was talking about ;) def sushi roku my new favorite sushi spot

spK5gsQSZD_vwpYdf71BrA.text: Delicious food!! Only to be outdone by the service- our waiter, whose name I can't recall but he had a great beard, was freaking awesome! We were a bit late to our dinner reservation so we only had 45 min to eat before our show- he had our whole order at out table in 20 min! The other wait staff was equally awesome and super attentive- never a half empty glass at our table! Would definitely return and give my highest recommendation! Every dish was just as yummy as the last!

oKApJboSFpMuUP-TzoX0bg.text: 2012 Fall Restaurant Week Lunch #1. I'm going to try pump these reviews out fast. Just in case people had a hard time choosing where to go... like me!  My friend and I wanted to find a sushi place who offered a lunch course for Restaurant Week. We both never dined at Sushi Roku previously. It's located on the Strip side, 3rd floor of the Forum Shops. For Restaurant Week, they're offering a 3-course lunch for $30.12. We ordered each option. I've posted pictures of all our food.  For lunch:  1st Course: Choice of: Spicy Tuna Hanabi (crispy rice cake) OR  Seaweed Salad (cucumber sunomono, plum vinaigrette)  2nd Course:  Choice of: Sushi (tuna, yellowtail, salmon, albacore, whitefish, spicy tuna roll, miso soup) OR Grilled Petite Filet (homemade teriyaki sauce, steamed rice or mashed potatoes, miso soup)  3rd Course: Choice of: Mini Chocolate Cake OR Fresh Fruit & Sorbet   The appetizers were nothing spectacular, not even spicy. The sushi fish and miso soup did taste fresh. They didn't ask us how we wanted our filet cooked, it came to us medium-well. My friend didn't mind it, but I'm more of a medium-rare steak lover. Not only was I confused that a sushi place was serving mashed potatoes, they were pretty dry and ordinary. Spicy tuna roll was pretty standard.   The chocolate cake was good, a bit too rich and dense for me.   The tastiest thing was the mango sorbet. I'm not a big sorbet person, but this one was truly delicious. It wasn't mango-flavored. You could actually feel the strands of real mango in the sorbet. Best I've ever had.   The presentation was great. The service was on point, from the hostess, bussers, our server, and the sushi chefs who greeted us hello and farewell.  I had a good time, it was one of those lunches where nothing went wrong, yet your tummy wasn't doing the happy dance when you left. The service and presentation, (and of course the sorbet!) made this 3-stars for me. I wonder if I would've had a better experience if I had come to order off the regular menu. Other than it being an opportunity to donate to charity, if Restaurant Week is a chance for establishments to show what they can offer, Sushi Roku didn't impress me that much...

MX8lR8kKl7QqTFbLN_yL2g.text: Do you like sushi? Do you consider yourself sort of a sushi pro? Then check out Roku. It is creative, fresh, fun, and an excellent dinner spot. If you can get a table by the window, you might have a great view of the strip. The service is attentive and professional, the wines are great, and the sushi is extremely good. I've been to a few sushi places in Vegas...all are good....this is the best.

uDPYWQJGO_v55hmJhlsRVQ.text: I came here for Happy Hour, and it's the best deal in town! Swanky restaurant in the Forum shops, they have an excellent variety of Happy Hour choices for so reasonable! I ate tuna takari, shrimp tempura. hand rolls, all were phenomenal! I ate and drank up a storm and my total bill was $40.  And I got to hang in a relaxing place!

EmzvkRCHxWUMNPXfS5ePBw.text: Good sushi. Reasonably priced some expensive rolls some inexpensive. Bailey was a very sweet and friendly server. We had simple rolls, edamame and the ginger mojito. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This couple was celebrating their anniversary

jFR0NMvTVGPiZv7drB_nSQ.text: This is another expensive sushi place, so it better be good.  I went here late night.  The music is loud, the people are beautiful and the food is good.

GEEQtDWXLQazjNCmJxBa8g.text: Cool atmosphere, nice waitstaff, awesome cocktails and the food....I had this lobster sushi (I don't recall the name) that was to die for.  I had never really had sushi before, at least not as a meal and I have to say I was impressed.

HAiUM_gAEcmkefMwhbFM-g.text: The sushi was good (not great), so the fourth star is due to the ambiance and service.  It has a trendy feel while still being somewhat casual.  The elevated booth seating is fantastic and affords you a view of the strip.    I recommend the Far East Mule if you're in the mood for a cocktail. I'm not normally a gin drinker and am definitely not a fan of sweet drinks, but this cocktail is smooth and delicious.  One or three will help make the night.

nMj_PGI5dlzqjDCdsLncqA.text: This is absolutely the best sushi restaurant  in Las Vegas.  Expensive but worth it.  I ate lunch there with 3 friends and we were all blown away from the Kobe beef appetizer to the toro to urchin. All of the tuna you can imagine.   Atmosphere is great, service is great and of course the food is great.   This is the place for top notch sushi.

CHwQnp-oKryLz_Y35Mc7hA.text: Awesome view awesome sushi. priced on the high end but quality is top notch. our server was great. the service is A+. great place to take a date or with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gNYYFj5Qov7hAOhsmMVR3A.text: I'm not sure I can unbiasedly review Sushi Roku because we went there straight after a big win at the tables, so we were really excited and a little tipsy. :)  The truffle roll was unique and delicious...it was my favorite one.  We also got the tempura crab roll (good, not amazing) and something with unagi and avocado (may have been a dragon roll?).  We only had a few rolls and then were pretty hungry later that night, so next time we'd order more.  But we were in a hurry to catch our flight later and couldn't spend a lot of time.  The service was great..I don't remember our server's name, but she was great.  We also chatted with the sushi chef as he was making his creations.  It was pretty expensive, especially because we didn't fill up on the food.  I think for what seemed like 3-4 rolls plus 2 sakes it was like $85!  Kind of crazy.  But it was good quality and good service...so I thought it was worth it this time.  Or maybe I was just feeling rich. ;)  We would go back just to see what else they have on the menu and to spend a little longer relaxing with our meals.  It's so hard to decide where to go in Vegas because there are SO many options - but I'd say this is a nice spot for a date and a pretty good experience overall.

zuzGSG0kiPvpyQUBIcimDQ.text: Delicious food with a great little view of the strip.  A co worker and I came here while journeying on a business trip. We were hungry and this menu looked good. The place was fairly empty and peaceful on Wednesday at about 1:30 pm. The view is small, but you see the Imperial Palace and a bit of the strip. The interior is beautiful and incredibly comfortable, I really loved it.  Our waiter was kind and courteous and service was great. Our warm sake was delicious and my mixed tempura donburi bowl had delicious shrimp and impeccably cooked rice in it. I was filled and happy by the time I left and I wish I could go back daily and that it was closer to me!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mixed tempura donburri bowl
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. inside sushi roku
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. inside sushi roku

nnWMllscjZ3Da-g_v2zwhQ.text: Brussels sprout chips are omg delish!  Also had the sweet potato roll, also very yummy. Service was excellent and fast. Location is on the 3rd floor of the forum shops at Caesar. Seriously try those Brussels sprout chips...the truffle oil on top is sooooo yummy!

RMkdzDhcEAnfi3pBzNahKw.text: After the disappointment of Joes Stone Crab (see my review), we left and went upstairs to Sushi Roku. Great service and great specials adding to a great menu. Not too extensive, but a fine selection. Thank you Joes. We'll come to Sushi Roku now.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clay pot hibachi for Kobe. And a great table heater on a cold night in Vegas!

_3u0koWBP6ss9jMuPsWuGA.text: Awesome! Rainbow roll was delish. Sit at the bar, great service and atmosphere. Beautiful place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nf5n2OL3-iIi8j0e5nQUxg.text: My fiance and I came to Sushi Roku while on a trip to Vegas. It was our first stop on our 3 day trip and we had a great time. The truffle oil edamame had good flavor and was different than what we typically order. Our waiter recommended the Yellowtail diced chilis appetizer and I thought it was perfect! My fiance did not care for it but he enjoyed the sushi. I felt the sushi was average. Our waiter was very helpful and professional. We also requested for a window seat to look out over the strip which they accommodated. We had a great time and will be returning on our next trip!

nww0RDuBDhCCOwyaeh2cWQ.text: We had the soft shell crab roll. It tasted like shrimp that had the tail on and was rolled in sand. Very odd flavor and textures. The staff is really nice though.

Us0m06IJx5E457VJwGG-og.text: Lots of great sushi places in Vegas and this is one of them! We tried the special A2 roll, baked lobster roll, and tuna jalapeno roll. All were excellent and super fresh fish! We had a nice table with a view of the strip. Service was alright but could have been better since we never got water.

mORi3qX_FXXoIvb1ZNwmvA.text: We came for lunch and it was alright. There was no one at the front counter when we walked up and we stood there for about a minute or two looking like a couple of lost souls because we were unsure of the following: 1) Are they open? It looks empty. But there's a waiter walking around and there's sushi chefs behind the sushi bar. 2) Should we just walk in? But I don't know where to go... the sushi bar looks open but I can't tell if we're allowed to seat ourselves.  (Even the waiter who was walking around the sushi bar area, who obviously saw us looking confused didn't greet us...)  We walked in, got maybe ten feet inside before the waiter finally said, "oh she'll (referring to the missing hostess I assumed) be back... she went somewhere...." We said okayyy and went back outside to the front, where we waited a few more minutes.  My bf got the bento box with teriyaki chicken and spicy tuna roll while I ordered a vegetable tempura donburi and a shrimp and asparagus roll. There was something strange about the roll I ordered, though, but I couldn't place it... I think it might've been the fact that it had some kind of white sauce that may or may not have been mayo (thankfully, I didn't get sick after lunch that day or the next for that matter!)... the teriyaki chicken was excellent - prob the best I've ever had! The chicken was cooked perfectly - moist,  succulent and flavorful!  And the spicy tuna was also pretty awesome - way better than the roll I chose.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable tempura donburi
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo bent with teriyaki chicken and spicy tuna roll... excellent!!!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tempura and asparagus roll ... it had some kind of mayo in it that made it taste a little weird...

t_I0-4zrHdVpdefXyiPz7g.text: A few days ago I got an itch I could not scratch.  Not in the pubic way, but in the sushi way.  (That's right,  I had a sushi craving.)    I had traveled to Vegas for some business.  And, I had had enough.  I became gravely ill.  I was homesick.  But, before I could ride that wave.  I had to make one quick pit stop at a sushi joint.    It was difficult finding a sushi place from Bally's casino.  But, finally I found Sushi Roku!  It was delicious!  I ordered 3 items.  The entrees and appetizers were all divine!  The hostess asked where I wanted to sit.  I shyly smiled and scanned the room.  Just as I was about to sit at a table.  To the corner of my eye I seen him.  Thats when I decided to sit at the sushi bar.  By george, the sushi chef was so handsome.  And, to top it off he made Amazing sushi.  Not to mention this place has a great ambience.  Nice music!  And, cheerful employees.  Its definitely sexy!  A+, yay.

e3j3yUO1hXSrp6TfME43lQ.text: Alright I am not lying when I say Sushi Roku has the and I will say it again the best filet mignon I have ever tasted!!!!....!!!!! (medium rare). I could take it apart with my fork and sight pressure from my knife.   We had popcorn shrimp too (big portion). I was so full when I left.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is dark  but sexy and has a great view of the strip (so ask for a window seat).  My girlfriend had the spicy tuna roll which was good.    The app menu is long so don't get confused like I did, but I was impressed with  popcorn shrimp, so no telling how large the other apps unless I hear it from you yelpers. But there was some stuff that sounded good.

b9Ol-WG7LgBC-bj2DDV4Xw.text: Great service, amazing Sushi, conveniently located in the Caesars palace shopping forum. I was thoroughly impressed with everything we had. Which included the Katana roll, Dynamite Roll (which was outstanding), rainbow roll, and various Sashimi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katana Roll

J6jrjxHr_8SpJtNTeQF0EA.text: First time here, food was amazing with the quality (fresh toro) and sashimi. Great service and amazing atmosphere. The manager Gary was very nice greeting the tables and making sure everyone is taken care of. My new favorite Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh toro

n01H2_w_j9oIIDFg11fKqQ.text: I love Sushi Roku, I've been to the one in Newport California and this one in Vegas. However, the one in Vegas did not meet my expectations. Being in the city of everything excessive I expected more but actually the portions were much smaller and not as good as I've had at the other location in Newport. The beef skewers and sea bass skewers were smaller and the Salmon carpaccio was skimped on the truffles. The picture I have shows Newport Fashion Island with the larger and cleaner cuts of truffles and Vegas has 2 nice cuts with a few shavings instead. The other difference was with the White Lotus roll, it didn't taste the same and the presentation was different because it did not have the crispy onions on top. I was expecting the same experience but so it was a little disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rHDX5O7jEQfse7nkCNRXbQ.text: Such a great happy hour! And they do it 7 days a week..... Only gripe is that it's at the bar only and sometimes it's a little tight seating...... Best thing we had was the cauliflower/date dish. Amazing!!! And their signature martini cocktail! Must try if you like sweeter cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores

5UzwM9UmBQO0Se3Ds4VcAg.text: Quite literally one of my favorite restaurants in town, little on the pricey side but it's well worth it. My friends and I come here a lot the food and service is nothing short of amazing. We always ask for Maiko she's great, very personable and loves food and recommends so well. Also the environment is comfortable and elegant. Do recommend and recommend this experience with Maiko as your server.
