eEl-Ky9KeWORW70gaHHayg.text: Very surprised with the quality of sushi here. Even though Vegas is in the middle of the desert the fish was FRESH! I highly recommend this place, the service was great and we got a great view.   The only complaint I have is that the hot stone plate I ordered wasn't what I was expecting. It was still good though!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chefs special, each piece was paired with something to compliment it. It was amazing!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bass, absolutely delish!

HxIj1V5JeJ7g3QgVyqdORQ.text: My friend Dee suggested that I should try Sushi Roku at Forum Shop. I went there tonight with my family and the food was amazing. It was fresh and delicious. The service was awesome, friendly staff...our server Eric was great. I tried Omakase and I got so much food that I can't finish. My parents shared popcorn shrimp, stir fried eggplants and crab fried rice. Every dishes were excellent. We ended the meal with lava cake and pumpkin bread pudding...so yummy. We'll go back again soon :)

zOwadbq7hDNzGcSrkOuA-g.text: The worst service of any restaurant.  Waitresses are rude never come to table and didn't even acknowledge when we walked in the door.

ZQgB_iug6Ezxt4zoL5BZyA.text: Good food, but way overpriced for the quality. $24 rolls ?? come on I know we're in Vegas, but come on. The service also needs major improvement. Food was dropped off and never once were we checked on. Extra charge for wasabi ?? at a sushi place.. lol really ? Never again!

2sPuaMqoU_x2XIjLVaWCWg.text: The food was great and incredible but the staff was absolutely rude, condescending and rolled their eyes at someone in our party because she asked for vegetarian information. Made the mood extremely displeasing.   UPDATE: After speaking with their customer service and their astounding apology. I reconsider my review based on how it was handled. I am still a bit mad to be honest how we were treated at the restaurant but management was extremely accommodating and apologetic. I will give them a higher review based on my experience with management. I would give their other restaurants a try if I am in the area.

KlkQghwQe8R3-uZo5riB3g.text: First time at this place, my husband and I love fresh sashimi, and we got some really good sushi at this place. Pretty pricey but well worth it. It was delicious!

wZr06cwIUEM46K_5WpJK2w.text: Fantastic sushi...amazing rolls. Their specialty rolls are where it's at. Get the one with the sriracha!!! (Sorry running a blank now on name of role).  Yellow fin tuna sushi is perfection. Quite pricey, being at $50-ish for four pieces, but honestly so worth it.  Took us a while to find this gem, but we're satisfied that we found it. Top floor of the ceaser's palace forum, take the escalator to top floor and you won't miss it. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ImBa29hOK847AGK5Pc_gMg.text: Ordered the free ranged chicken. It was dry and tough to eat. Overall experience is over priced food for mediocre quality

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free range chicken

ZVKFD2PBImrySPBBBDIDbg.text: You have to order the Avocado Hanabi as an appetizer. It's insanely good. I also ordered the tuna jalapeno roll with olive oil but substituted the tuna for salmon and it was amazing.

3Y_llO3hf33lCxj4gwCkKw.text: The restaurant is very cool, and the location is convenient. We had a table overlooking the strip which was nice. Some of the sushi rolls are excellent quality, but the basic rolls (California, spicy tuna, etc) are less than impressive. The wagyu beef was delicious. Good value for the money.

9Me7KukFo6y3_VgS7M2Gnw.text: We were here on a Saturday night and we're so happy that they were able to fit us in for a last minute reservation. We both ordered the omekase and it was some of the best sushi we've had. My favorite was the toro. They also had a dish that was like a Japanese crab cake (yum!). The panko crusted sea bass (omg)! I forgot to take a photo of the first dish. Everything was amazing. I was sitting in my seat filled with joy because of the flavors and textures of the food. So happy that we went with the omekase even though it was pricey. We think it was totally worth it.   The ambience of the restaurant is classy and they have a great view of the strip. It is located in the Forum Shops on the third floor. I wore my heels that day and boy, did I wish I wore flats. We did quite a bit of walking to and from the restaurant.   Anywho, can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese crab cakes
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the 6 courses from our omekase
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panko crusted seabass and daikon salad

VkQ84Cu_5ejHybHn6SlYRQ.text: You know how they say not to order fish in a steakhouse? Reverse that statement completely at Sushi Roku- despite being named for their traditional fish dishes, they do a damn good job with meats. Order a steak or at least try a meaty app if you visit, you won't be sorry.   GET IT: Tuna Tartare Phyllo Cups with yuzu guac and soy truffle- beautiful and delicious! Brussels Sprout Chips with truffle oil- crispy and addictive. Mushroom Tempura with Creamy Miso- so savory, great sauce. Hanabi- spicy tuna on crispy rice. But only if you've never had it. I'm a fan. Salmon Sashimi Carpaccio- this was the better sashimi app we tried. Diablo Salmon- a daily special roll, served with an incredible honey soy sauce. Wagyu Sliders- thick and meaty, get more than one because you won't want to share Grilled Lamb Chops with Chimmichurri Sauce- two piece app, super juicy! Prime Rib Eye Steak "Japonais" or Filet Mignon- you can't go wrong with either of these large orders of tender, flavorful meat, sided with garlic green beans and potatoes.  DIY S'Mores OR Chocolate Lava Cake- I mean, if you have to do dessert, you can either go with a something fun or something reliably good. Don't expect both.  SKIP IT: Yellowtail diced chilies- It's the same dish you can find anywhere else. Seared Salmon Sashimi- the fresh was better Roasted Cauliflower- a fail.  Katana and Shima Rolls- pretty basic, actually. Assorted Mochi, Bananas Foster, Pumpkin Spice Bread Pudding- one was unremarkable, one was a little weird, and one was served cold.  Presentation of all dishes was stellar but the service wasn't as attentive as the location and price point led me to expect. Being that it's in Ceasars and specializing in seafood, be prepared to shell out (pun intended!) for your meal. They've got a solid HH available daily from 4PM til 6 or 7, depending on the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime steak
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy truffle Brussels sprout chips

WgflJXguUpvMQItG_-9e7Q.text: The food was fantastic they put a great different spin on classic sushi dishes, the view and atmosphere was also great and so was our waiter and the service. I would highly recommend going here!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vqv-leIjSa7utJNHyBCrXw.text: Delicious food, lively ambiance, and super attentive staff. The sushi here is of good quality (and I have lived in Japan). Go there for happy hour - it's everyday (4-6 pm or 4-7 pm depending on the day of the week) and get some really good deals on rolls and appetizers.

x1lKrvPV6cCxsNE18uOQMA.text: Everything is overpriced in Las Vegas but sometimes the price - quality difference really astounds you. The prices here are a little too extreme for the quality. The sushi was OK. If I'm going to spend 50-65 dollars on myself for dinner I would expect better service or better food- either one. The sushi seemed rushed oh a rather empty night- I was in not in. hurry as I told them but maybe they just wanted me out of there.   If they sit in the back you have very good views of the strip but if you are toward the front it kind of looks like it are sitting in a mall restaurant- and a rather low rent one at that.   I went there because the reviews were very good and there was no line and the menu looks pretty solid. Unfortunately, I will not be back.

NdNgdiXgYZByP_fV0VBL1Q.text: Sushi Roku is kind of hidden since its on the third floor of the Forum Shops. Few people have told me that this place was pretty good, so I knew it existed. However, we never actually dined here until recently. Came here on a Saturday night, but the restaurant was empty. There were a few people sitting at the sushi bar and maybe 3 other tables that were occupied.   We started off with three of their Signature Rolls - the Crunchy Spicy Tuna, Crab Dynamite and the Baked Lobster. My husband and I liked the Baked Lobster one the best. They put a creamy Miso sauce on top of the roll which was good, but if it had a stronger Miso flavor, it would have been perfect! There was nothing special about the other two that we ordered. They were basically your standard Spicy Tuna and California Rolls that can be found at any sushi restaurant. We also ordered the Popcorn Shrimp Tempura. Kind of hard to screw up Shrimp Tempura, but it was tasty with the sauce. My only complaint is that maybe they should consider having the spicy creamy sauce on the side because after a while, the shrimp seemed sort of soggy.    Service was excellent. Our server was friendly and checked on us often. Our drinks were always being refilled and empty plates were taken away quickly.   I'm glad I tried Sushi Roku, but there was nothing special about this place that makes me want to come back. I think they need more selections for their signature rolls. I'm a snob when it comes to sushi, so I already have my favorite sushi spot! But for a $100 bill for 2 people, there are definitely better places to eat sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popcorn Shrimp Tempura
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunchy Spicy Tuna Roll
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Lobster Roll

LUSFB7gn1KnBQmTzR8sAow.text: We enjoyed lunch there last Wednesday.  We had Edamame, Miso soup, Sea Eel and Yellowtail rolls.  Service and drinks were excellent.  It's pricey but considering the ambience, quality of food and drink and level of service, it is worth it.  We will return.

BmWODul1Z32ZWo-PL35h8Q.text: Food is good. Not bad for Las Vegas Resort Restaurant. You won't be disappointed. The music is not so good. The service was okay. The decor is okay. The food was the best

_iwxHZfUQYPcf8OzkxofwA.text: Service was wonderful and the food matched. Really High quality fish and they made our anniversary special! The kobe meatball was also fabulous as the one thing we tried beyond sushi. We would definitely go back. The bread pudding was a nice balance with sushi too!

OMaauMPwUaZA2G7WFls7AA.text: The best restaurant for sushi in Vegas!!!!!!! Love this place and the View of the strip is fabulous. They have great filet also that has a great garlic butter soy sauce and saki mixed drinks. The staff is wonderful and that has a lot to do with the  management there since (Johnny) is by far the best manager making sure that everything is perfect:)

lgBxxJ9-RZlFTCT23VuDww.text: Second time I was there to entertain business guests. Excellent service and great view of the strip. Tasty food, though a bit pricey. Of course, that's expected in Vegas nowadays.

I2wFWdI6dtiSyQoU3wEW6w.text: Sushi roku is one of my favorite sushi restaurant in the US. If you are in Vegas you must try this place inside the Forum shops at Caesars Palace. The sushi chefs are Masters creating some of the most creative and delicious dishes you will ever eat. The fish is super fresh and they have some really great specialty rolls. The crunchy tuna roll was excellent as was the salmon egg sushi and get this octopus suction cups filled with sake. Sashimi was great especially the scallops....very fresh.  Go figure being in the desert.

dCXbB4-FR3LK69rtEBXUoA.text: Great food, AWESOME HAPPY HOUR!!!!! Tuna Tataki, best ever!!! Highly recommend Tuba on Crispy Rice!  Also Foie Gras Sushi Roll is phenomenal! Highly recommended!!!

-_HWtQvtYJPjJix9G7whdg.text: This sushi place was okay. Expensive like everything else on the strip. I had the Crush cocktail which was actually very delicious. Good food that just costs a little too much

ZVGZBdfgQhWLnh96fg7oPw.text: Wow - this may go down as my least favorite meal in Las Vegas, ever.  While the decor is a very chic contemporary japanese and quite pleasing, there are huge windows all around that turn this place into a sauna - even in January, when the outside temp is 60, it was borderline unpleasant while dining - can't imagine how it feels when the sun is really on.  Onto the food: I ordered 3 things from the menu - I sent 2 of them back - when I received my last 2 plates the fish inside was cooked, and this wasn't the description on the menu.  The only reason I didn't send all 3 back was because the first item I got, Hamachi sashimi - was "ok" taste wise, and since it was the first dish - I was hoping things would get better from there.  Yes - when I goto a sushi place, I expect raw fish.  Anyhow - the server didn't blink when I told him of my displeasure with the dishes, and the check was settled without any obvious display of annoyance.  I will say that this was a far cry from my experiences at Sushi Roku in LA, which were delicious.

tTSYBrLhTN4zPPgslmfJVQ.text: We went there to dine after the Rock n roll marathon. The place was highly rated on Yelp and we were very excited to try it out. The sushi/fish was fresh and delicious. However, the miso soup was salty and they forgot to add in seaweed. Our waitress service was subpar especially for this upscale restaurant. She didn't refill any of our drinks. She didn't check back on us to see if we needed anything else until it was time for dessert. She came to the table in front of us more than 5 times during our visit but no more than 2 times to our table. Also,  the 2 hostesses at the front were not welcoming compared to other restaurants in Vegas. This was a total disappointment.  Sad to say but we will not be coming back to this establishment.

60wp2daOTywKLHNLD4iwkw.text: We had the fixed menu with 8 nigiri. Best sushi I have ever tasted! By far. It was a mystery how the fish could be so tender and tasteful.

gT6i_GNBCx9n5PTHEENgIA.text: Don't believe the hype.   $16 dollars for 4 skinny pieces of salmon sashimi. Bogus. If you are going to drop dollars, don't do it here.  It may be an awesome restaurant for LA, but it didn't work for me in Las Vegas.   Reservation highly recommended.  Even then, hope for the best!  We had to wait over 30 minutes for our food, hungry. It didn't help that we saw tables seated after us getting food before us.  From what I gather, everything else that was ordered was good:  the halibut fish special, the ramen, the chicken skewers, and the sushi were delightful.  If it wouldn't of been for the the wait, you may have seen 3 stars from me.   If you are a party of 6 or more, 20% gratuity will be automatically tacked on to your bill, regardless the situation.   Luckily for us, our waiter couldn't refute the mistakes and updated our bill.  Too bad he ended up with a couple of dollars, but maybe next time....a little more communication or some chips and salsa please...well you know what I mean.   Drinks seemed appetizing, the bar staff was friendly, and the hostess was nice.   My company of 5 HOT woman made up for my meal.

Lv12-5_m34vPy-szo_5YsQ.text: Ambiance: Stylish, sleek, authentic Food: fresh seafood, melts in the mouth Presentation: fabulous Service: very attentive and knowledgeable Price: high but reasonable for what you get  The three of us (my dad, my husband and myself) had miso soups, a garden salad to share,  2 sets of sushi rolls (we had to go for a second of the baked crab roll -  sooo good), octopus sushi,  2 plates of Chef's Sashimi combination, and a carafe of sake.  Oh, and don't forget to go for their deserts!!  We had mochi (strawberry, espresso and mango). Espresso was by all means our favorite. Very rich in flavor and don't be surprised if you leave your plates crystal clean :)   For our dinner, we paid close to $270 (with tips, taxes). High, but something worth the experience.  Bon appetite. Ulyana

0thOU6zTYA0VgXqQIo7nnA.text: A friend of mine RAVED about this place. Always going on and on about how they fly the fish in fresh every day and it's amazing and the service is great and blah blah blah. I like that they offer a locals discount. That's awesome. But overall, I wasn't blown away. The salad I ordered was OK, it LOOKS great, but flavor wise, I really felt it was lacking. The veggie roll I ordered was cool. I've never seen some of the veggies they used in it. But again, something was missing. I like when your food just hits all the right notes and I didn't think either of my dishes did that. The service is eh. Nothing amazing, but not horrible. I would eat here again, but I dont see this as a '"go to for me.

_XrBJcMAQcMXSwG_kD_umw.text: Was seated and ignored for 5 minutes, no greeting. Then the waitress comes up asking if I was "ready to order?" Of course I said yes because I didn't know if she would come back if I had said "no".  Where the service lacked, the fish was their saving grace. Had the yellowtail sashimi and their specialty roll - the Titan! Delicious all around. Wish I could do 2.5 stars cause that was my overall experience.

dGnsbjUV4LQyKZRniM17Xg.text: Outstanding! We had a group of 21. Service was quick and friendly.  Food was outstanding.  I had the chefs special plate of 8 sushi pieces.  The sushi was different than I have ever had and was just as good as the sushi in Tokyo.

rlO3Qtspr3tpuyZqwfyzzA.text: In las Vegas as well as other big restaurant/entertainment towns, good food is expected but in Las Vegas it sometimes does not fully compare to Chicago and NY.  However, the one place I finally went to was Samba Sushi and what a great surprise.  I tend to avoid sushi in several places when traveling unless in Hawaii and some parts of CA and Japan.  Sushi Samba had some of the best dishes I have had and the quality was great.  They have a variety of menu items with small plates and full entrees.  They do some traditional sushi but mostly more interesting variations as well as the S American dishes.  Some of the items were: Rock fish Wagyu Gyoza Rock shrimp tempura Green bean tempura Pork belly Moqueca Mista. Seafood coconut milk and rice with green onion Yamato sushi roll(maguro, Fois gras, Osetra caviar) Uni shushi outstanding  Great sake list  All the fish and shellfish were fresh and well prepared.  It gets busy so we ate at the bar and the service was excellent there.  Luna and Maria can help with picking some great dishes at the bar.  It is on the higher price side but worth it compared to a lot of other places where the food doesn't always live up to the expectations in Vegas.  Looking forward to next trip back there.

Ntf9CCqNQquNsB-IyYHnxw.text: Sushi Roku - how I thought I liked you!  I first went to Sushi Roku a few months ago, with the darlings Alysha N and Joanie M. We were having a very enjoyable night and were quite starving by the time we wandered into Roku. So we had a very good time, but with that caliber of company the restaurant was the last thing I was paying attention to. Also, that meal was very early in my sushi-eating career. Since then, I've been looking to go back.  Enter: 20% discount for locals. That's all it took to get me through the door for my 2nd run at Sushi Roku. This time, accompanied by Ramze S, and Mr & Mrs Mark G - all accomplished sushi enthusiasts, with Mark being something of a gourmet. Let me give it to you breakdown-style.  FOOD: The food was pretty good. Plenty of pretty good. and not enough great, especially with the prices in mind. The sushi & sashimi was pretty good quality, but nothing outstanding about it - and that was the consensus from the table. Where they seemed to do better was with the prepared dishes, which on our table was mostly appetizers.   SERVICE: Acceptable at best. Yes, it was early in the evening and the place was just getting rolling. But on the other hand, it was nearly empty, so why not go over the top, Mr. Waiter? They didn't really foul anything up, but it wasn't the quickest service ever, and not only was friendliness or charm out of the question, but so was knowledge! The question "Can I get fresh wasabi?" took a 5 minute trip to the back before a "No, sorry." could be returned. (And, for what it's worth, this is the first sushi restaurant Mark's ever been to that didn't have fresh wasabi)  ENVIRONMENT: It's a pretty nice place, that's for sure. And not uncomfortable. But it definitely doesn't look so hot while there's still light pouring through the giant glass windows, so come post-nightfall.   OVERALL: "Meh" is right. We had a good enough meal, and a good enough time, but that's not enough these days, especially not at the prices that Sushi Roku charges. Even considering the 20% off, there was nothing special enough about the place to make it worth a return trip. We didn't feel taken or anything like that, but it takes more than not feeling robbed to get 3+ stars.   Take some decent quality sushi, add all the pitfalls of a chain restaurant, mark the price up 100% and put it in the hippest room you can find. BAM! Instant Sushi Roku. If you wanna spend big bucks on sushi, even on the strip, you can find better places to do it.

iJEEwAZ5-mgtnNq56BrMxw.text: Had a business dinner here and it was really good! I had shushito peppers, which were tasty and flavorful. Then the amberjack sushi (2 pieces) and an eel roll. That was enough food for me and I typically get 3-4 rolls at other sushi places. I really enjoyed this.

PC1-JEhR9vUYwdvb7cCLGg.text: We enjoy eating here whenever we are on the strip. The sushi is always great, and I am extremely difficult to please in that department.  I think we have our best meals at the sushi bar.

q6NygOQ5hcLnCWy7d7XQVw.text: My favorite sushi place in Vegas. We went to several sushi places in Vegas while we were there and this one was easily the best. The rolls were great and we went during their happy hour so they were also well priced. The food is fresh, the service is great and the location (view of the strip) was phenomenal.

sLNuCYmDM0_vhj0rZmLwHg.text: I ordered unfiltered sake, seaweed salad, toro, albacore tuna, japanese snapper, yellowtail, salmon. Huge pieces of sashimi. I should've ordered the specialty rolls but I stuck with simple stuff. I wasn't that impressed BUT the service  was phenomenal. The waiters soooo attentive. They even packed my leftover sushi on top of ice and gave a to go cup for my left over sake. They were knowledgeable and let me taste two different sakes. I sat at the sushi bar and the chefs were friendly. The main dining area looks over the strip. It's also on the top floor of where the stores are.

zuupe1hlzSCTKL0o_hFYdw.text: This place is great for groups. We were a party of 12 girls for a bachlorette party and spotted 3 others that same night. Service was wonderful and I must say it is no easy task to please that many gals.   The non sushi dishes were perfect but the plate of sashimi and rolls was just average. The server underestimated a few of my friends' appetite including myself. We were still hungry after our omakase and had to order ramen.....good bowl of noodle, I must say.   Note the kobe beef on hot stones is a MUST.

XkAKXZVj-RjiFLP031Jv1A.text: Good sushi makes me cry.  This night, I was a baby that couldn't stop.  Seriously, wow.  Hot damn.  More please.  Expensive? Yes, but who really cares when it is mind blowing good.  I started with a Lychee Mojoito (tasty) and miso soup (average to good).  My world officially became rocked when the Hanabi: Spicy Tuna over a Crispy Rice Cake came to the table.  I'm sure if I saw a video of my reaction, I would be completely embarrassed but I can honestly say it was one of the best hot appetizers I have ever had. My poor waitress had to put up with me through all this.  I'm so sorry.  We ordered two rolls, Shima roll: spicy tuna & avo w/shrimp, cilantro & wrapped with soypaper; and the Baked Lobster Roll: Lobster & asparagus on the inside and a baked yellow sauce consisting of sweet miso & egg.  I was in sushi heaven.  Great service, awesome atmosphere, pretty good chill music for the environment.  All this with a beer and another mixed drink, approx $150.    You can not stop me from going back the next time I'm in Vegas.

X1i4s9yghWtjvfhEyUeo2A.text: Short version: The food is good, but it is overpriced.  The profile should have 4 dollar signs.  I expected to be blown away by $25 rolls, but they didn't taste any better than rolls you can find at any local sushi joint in SoCal.  I didn't have anything that was worth more than $15.  If you don't each much sushi or sashimi then perhaps you will have your expectations exceeded.  I will not go there again.  Green Tea ice cream for $10, Sake sampler was $20.  Neither of them were any different than you will find anywhere else.

k7IAmnEJiCEtMl23w7H-9w.text: Been here twice, and I love almost everything about this place. The restaurant itself is a site to be seen and the view of the strip is just as ppealing. I've tried almost everything from the sushi, to the kobe beef and tempura and being a veteran of many high end Japanese restaurants I'll put this place up there with the best.   The staff and service was also top top... and if you ever get a chance to come say hi to the GM Kenji!

W0ZXaw-tPLMaW41pr0fEtQ.text: Sushi Roku, good reputation in LA. Sushi Roku in Las Vegas should be called Sushi Fooku, because that's what they're going to do to your wallet and your palate.  A group of 5 of us came here around 9:30PM on Saturday night, in need of pre-late night nourishment. Yelping before leaping, this place had a decent review on Yelp. This is one of the only times I have  been steered wrong...but it was oh so wrong.  The problems started when we began to select rolls to order. Usually I'm a sashimi girl, and I shy away from rolls. But I knew I wanted something to fill us all up. So I started everyone off with the Spicy Tuna on Crispy Rice, and the first roll Spicy Canadian Rock Shrimp with Asparagus. The Tuna w/ Crispy Rice was great, but this is a standard for any sushi restaurant. The roll, on the other hand, was so tiny, 6 small pieces with even smaller ingredients - 11 dollars down.  I asked our waiter what he suggested in terms of rolls, and wouldn't you know it, the rolls he told us about were both the MOST expensive rolls on the menu, 26 dollars a piece. A-hole.  We ordered three more rolls, all small and average tasting and then were told that the kitchen was closing - WTF, 11, this is Vegas? But whatever, that's fine, we're done anyway. One round of drinks for 4 people, 2 edamames and four of the CHEAPEST rolls was $150 dollars. I'd happily shell out twice this if I didn't think I was merely paying for the overhead of the restaurant, because I know the food didn't cost 1/4 of that.  If you do go here, don't expect anything great from the rolls.  It's an expensive tourist joint, plain and simple. The worst part is that it's now highly unlikely I go to this place in Los Angeles. I was so sad to have this experience because of Roku's great name out in LA, but I have to say, this location is the King of Meh.

u3xiKfyfttYGHdN3fFyJWw.text: Was in Vegas this past weekend and we came here for dinner. It was a nice place and heard good things about it. Its Vegas, so its going to be expensive on the strip let alone its in the forum shops at Ceasers. Anyhow, the sushi grade was great and most of the rolls were really good. The Katana roll was amazing. I ordered a side of the sweet potato tempura and i got two slice for 6 bucks. Had i known that, i probably wouldn't had ordered it. Anyways, it was good, but i would rather had eaten somewhere else for that amount of money.

gen4FAclIzbuQbDmsPCjtw.text: When you are going to be the only male meeting nine pretty girls from New York City,  you know that your 7 o;clock reservation needs you to call at 7 and ask for it to be pushed back to 730 as you leave your hotel at the other side of the strip.  So imagine when to my surprise I still managed to be the first one there with ample time to sit at the small bar and enjoy the company of the friendly bartender and review their nice selection of wine.  Only out of California for 24 hours, I still missed it enough to settle on a crisp Russian River Sauvignon Blanc.    By its name, you know that Sushi Roku is Japanese fare with a lot of Sushi options.  If you know me, you know Japanese food falls behind Korean BBQ and anything with "Steakhouse" in the title as my least favorite dine out experience.  Nonetheless, I persevered for my sister's birthday weekend wishes, as I did much that weekend.  I was nonplussed to see that they had a seaweed salad that I managed to combine with a few other small items for one full meal.  I did not enjoy how both my miso and salad which ended up being my largest course were both served before anyone else received an appetizer.  Perhaps the gentleman servers were overwhelmed by the prettiness of the nine ladies while I was appreciating the artistic bathroom doors.

0gFgUomdKGdnv6hvpJEebg.text: Best sushi of my life... FOR REALS. Better than any place I've tried in SF...and there's no ocean nearby Nevada!!   Everything I had was amazing. Def try any type of tuna. The toro was deliciously-incredibly-mouth-wateringly tender. It was like butter. Or yogurt, or something just a smidge stiffer then yogurt...umm... basically it was super soft.  mmmm!!  I don't want to go back to Vegas anytime soon...but when the time comes, I'll be looking forward to 2 things- Qua Spa & an amazing meal at Sushi Roku!!!

jOfetXDYWj9mXWAx2q8DXw.text: Moved to Vegas two years ago from LA and have really struggled to find good sushi. So far, sushi Roku sets the standard. The chefs are extremely good at what they do. They bring their own flair to standard items. They also have managed to create some very tasty and interesting dishes of their own. The hanabi is very tasty as is the tuna tartare. The salmon skin hand roll ordered a little extra crispy is the best I've ever had - the taste of the salmon skin though delicate, is not oily or overwhelmed by the other ingredients in the roll. Suggestion for all diners - try the sushi before you bathe it in soy and wasabi. You don't want to mask any of the flavors. Only real downsides - 1 it's on the strip so getting to and from can be difficult, and 2 it's expensive (but sometimes, you do get what you pay for).

fucVd9W_STigff5PfkR91A.text: Good food, very overpriced because of location and the view. Servers were knowledgeable but had an air of pretentiousness. I had the 6 piece chef choice, 2 pc bluefin, uni and spicy tuna rolls. All good, but much better AYCE places for $60 for two exist in the valley. But if you are in the Ceasar's shopping this is a good sushi spot. 4/5

jqU7KuYrpUEq_Quv3DeMZg.text: Try the talons roll GREAT! Good service with a manager that cares.

KFRP_1P2VF7BNzutVwjXhQ.text: Come in here during CES w/ friend.  We were able to book it thru opentable the day before & got seated about 15 min after we got there with the busy crowd there, I say their time managment is very good! ^^  Seated at the Sushi bar, the chief was very friendly & so is the server. We ask him the promotion I got from my AX card-$30 gift after $100 spend that expired just two days ago, they were still able to honor which was pretty cool, except we stuff it about $100 worth of sushi & Sappro to make to $100 bill. & it was so GOOD, & so Fresh for this sushi.  If you not much a sushi eatter, you can always try their other chain right next to it, BOA steakhouse, that is right next to it in the Ceaser Palace Form Shops.

xoaWgb_Rw4PQ5jd3z7zmxA.text: Just mention this place and my mouth starts watering with the memory of the fantastic toro they served on the night I visited.  Soooo good....  I sort of don't remember the rest of my meal b/c the toro was THAT good.  I believe I had a roku roll...yes, that was good too.  They have a nice cocktail list.  I'm pretty sure I had a saketini, and I'm pretty sure I liked it.  Oh, and we had edamame, which was also good.  Even the non-sushi eaters at our table enjoyed their food!  They serve a variety of cooked items, for your friends who don't dig raw fish.  Which is fine, because that means more toro for me!

6HuK-P6nxf75vRRcj7ihHA.text: What a great place for Sushi!  Located in the Cesar, the locals we were staying with pointed this out as a great place with an excellent "Happy Hour".  We decided to give it a try and to my surprise they had an excellent selection of rolls decently priced from 4-6pm!  As well, they had some drink specials too.   A couple nice large Sapporo for $5 for me and wine for the other guests and about 6 rolls and a couple appetizers for us to split, all for just about $60 was a great deal!  Check them out for the happy hour, it is totally worth it!

aSNP6FSLnAo4P6dev7IWjw.text: Really good deal for happy hour.  The food is excellent.   But for dinner it was way too pricy.   The standard sushi wasn't anything special.  But the pricier items were tasty - like the yellow tail with chilli and ponzu.

nwIugPvC0hQikplg0LeVXQ.text: My First Sushi  the best ever... i was a bit nervous, I was a virgin to the cuisine... everyone new what to do with their towel & chopstick... I was a total newb... I caught on just fine though...The best  I've ever had...This place really ruined every place else, the chef was friendly & kind, will for sure be back, this time on a Business expense

-Ex9UD0XY9Hgh8kJvhq1OQ.text: Once again, for sushi restaurants all I gotta say is OMAKASE!!!  The $95 omakase at Sushi Roku kind of gave me a mini heart attack because you never know what you're gonna get....I've heard of Sushi Roku before, but didn't check out the reviews for it before going in. So this was either going to be really good, or really crappy!  Apologies ahead of time for the lack of details, as it was on a girls weekend to Vegas that I dined here, and as with any Vegas trip - details are a bit blurry!!!  This is what our omakase came with:  kobe beef  foie gras wrapped in toro (i think it was toro)  fantastic tuna sashimi (sorry, can't remember exaclty what kind)  miso halibut (or was it cod...regardless it was so good, it melted in your mouth!)  sushi plate of various oceanic delights  mini chocolate souffle  Service was great, ambiance was great, my only complaint - they need to carry magnum size sake! For five girls a magnum liter sized sake bottle would have put this dinner over the top, but we managed to tame ourselves and ordered only one bottle and cocktails..  : - )  Overview: Omakase - do it!  Tip:  This is in the shops at Caesar's, at the beginning rotunda, third floor.

CHRpYdmY5aHSzc5akn_Hrg.text: We came here for a really fun birthday celebration! The decor is stunning, and views of the strip are amazing. What really cracks me up is that front and center is the Imperial Palace, and I have never seen it look so good as from this vantage.   The lychee martini was to die for, and sake bombs tasted like sake bombs always taste. Once the waitress found out we were celebrating a birthday she comped a bottle of sake! I loved our crispy chicken appetizer with delicious dipping sauce. Our rolls were decent, but the eel was a little off. The sushi wasn't as fresh as I am used to, but you are in the middle of the desert for god's sake!   The birthday desert was the best part of the meal! They brought out this crazy sparkler that shot sparks about 2 feet above the table. I was seriously worried birthday girl was going to get burned by more than the sake. Sushi Roku had it under control. The chocolate cake and vanilla ice cream they brought out was great, and they were super quick with our bill as soon as we let them know we were running late.

ciTDFhPZ_Z4C1pX0W8DPtA.text: Amazing service and food! The sushi tastes very soft and fresh. Plus we had the king crab fried rice which was pretty fantastic! Our server was very attentive and polite. The best service we received while in Vegas for the weekend.

zs274bWqjg4uVJxbzOoqaQ.text: People should seriously stop whining about prices in good restaurants. The sushi here isn't "mediocre" as others claim. it's GOOD, quality sushi. it melts in your mouth and your taste buds will thank you for every bite. We were hungry, we wanted a good restaurant and that's what we got. lots of food + sake + tax n tip cost us 80 bucks a person, but I can confidently say it was worth every penny, especially considering the gorgeous interior and the view of the strip while you're indulging. Keep up the good work Roku!

mp-7BxbmTU1hiGQoQi14YA.text: Loved it! Came here for lunch.  Ambiance was nice and the view of the strip was beautiful as well.  The sushi was very good, but the sashimi was what was memorable.  We had salmon and toro sashimi.  The toro sashimi was absolutely delectable.  It was like butter!  The california roll was very good considering we were in Vegas.  I loved the options for vegetable tempura (considering my sister is a vegetarian) and the fact that they don't use peanut oil to fry it (my sister is allergic to peanuts)...When they found out that it was my mom's birthday they brought out free dessert and a sparkler (an actual firework). That was nice. This was a very pleasant experience and if I am ever at Caesars again, I will come back.

B_ZEe1igo7z6fCfXmqZiKw.text: Having been to Sushi Roku in Santa Monica this was truly a let down.  Although the fish was fresh, the preparation, menu and overall experience lacked what compelled us to go there after having had many good experiences in LA.

5TyhW8JKWzGvrnq4P7oHHg.text: Went for lunch recently and the place was empty! So we ordered the chef's special, a combo of sashimi and rolls and it was alright. The spicy tuna had a strange, mushy texture-I was not a fan. We also ordered the shrimp tempura roll which was great. I may have been expecting too much; I was not impressed with this lunch. With two cocktails and tip it was over $80!! Ouch! I do not think I will return-there is better sushi out there for less money. Only go here if you want to over spend on sub-par sushi. The view was nice!!

k5-sJ294EkAAM3RDYQDqPg.text: Great sushi, but expensive!! Then again unless you're buying a hot dog for dinner, EVERYTHING in Vegas is expensive!! We loved our meal. We had salad, one cocktail, 1 spicy tuna roll and a bento box...are you ready? $100!! Yes. But worth every penny. Every dish was flavorful!! Worth it!!

yDgy0LDFoQZR5ZcuuOvsrg.text: I would give this place negative starts if I could.  Food poisoning aside (this could happen anywhere), it was truly the worst dining experience in Vegas.  The wait staff were rude, unattentive and just gave off a general bad vibe.  And since we were a party of 8, they slapped on an 18% service charge.  Again, that would've been acceptable if we received ANY SERVICE at all.  Views were great but how can you enjoy it when you spent the evening trying to flag down your waiter?  I ended up having to get up to get someone to get me more tea.  I felt sorry for the booth next to ours because the waiter served my tea climbing OVER their seat.  Maybe he was too tired to walk the extra 3 feet around to fill my tea cup?  Given the level of competition on the Strip, one would think service would be stellar but I've had better service at any strip mall sushi diner.    Truly awful, stay away.

2_yDV95f2iPrPv1CQTaXVQ.text: "Jane, you ignorant slut..." - Dan Aykroyd (That's basically what I'm thinking as I read some of these sushi bar reviews. I mean, who the heck rates a sushi bar based on the distance of the walk to the restaurant or the taste of the 'prime rib' they order there?) First of all, I think this is about a 3 1/2-Star. Let me explain why but before I do... I want you, dear reader, to think about an important question: "What is the criteria for good sushi?" I believe there are some very basic criteria: -- FRESHNESS How soft is the fish? Does it smell? Is there a slimy texture to it? Does it melt in your mouth? And doesn't this depend a lot on when fresh fish arrives? DUH. Ladies & gentlemen, I think we just solved the question of "why are the reviews all over the place for Sushi Roku?" -- CHEF SKILL (Selection, cut, preparation) What portion of the fish is served to you? And how that portion sliced? Is it prepared with something in addition to rice, like a plum sauce? How is the formula for this restaurant's sushi rice? These are all things that should be considered in looking at sushi because they can all drastically affect the overall meal. -- PRESENTATION Does the dish appear appetizing? What kind of wasabi & nori is used? Is special sashimi shoyu provided with sashimi dishes? Sushi that looks unappetizing is just plain poorly made sushi. A significant part of the experience of dining isn't just eating but the anticipation of eating as well. The fact is that Sushi Roku's sushi is just "okay". On the days they get their shipment of fish delivered, the quality is very good. Other days, not so much. Their chefs aren't bad but like most touristy places in Vegas, you don't form a relationship with the chef. At best, you get to know the restaurant manager. What compensates for some of the variation is the fact that Sushi Roku, despite its upper crust placement, is about 20% CHEAPER than the other big name sushi restaurants. (i.e. Nobu) This difference in cost will be important later when I go over group visits. The sushi starts them 3-Stars. What gets them a little more over 3-Stars however are the other things. -- FOOD/DISHES They have a fair number of "group oriented" dishes both incorporating raw fish or those that are cooked, allowing dinners to be eaten & shared by people who both "eat sushi" & "don't eat raw fish". (Here's the menu: sushiroku.com/sushiroku/...) Additionally, the atmosphere is a lot more "relaxed" with the pretension & arrogance turned down a few notches, compared to some other sushi joints. This makes Roku surprisingly "party friendly" for folks doing group get-togethers or Bachelorette Parties, etc. since with the well-balanced menu, everyone can order something cheaply that they'd be willing to eat, & then pass it around w/out getting too dressed up. You don't comfortably get this in many restaurants in Las Vegas, even Nobu. -- SERVICE The wait staff is okay but what defines Sushi Roku however is Kenji Tamida - General Manager of Sushi Roku, Las Vegas. Most of the time, you can find the well-dressed Kenji personally greeting & escorting guests like VIPs to their tables along with the hostess, shaking hands, & making people feel welcome. Kenji has a knack for remembering people & providing that high quality, repeatable touch that is lacking in so many turn-and-burn Vegas restaurants today. And if you've got a group , he'll even sit & have a drink with you if you ask him to & tell you about what's hot in the city, 'cause he's a high profile partier too. Ask him, & he just might be able to point you to the quickest way to the party, if you know what I mean. If you stop by, be sure to say hi to him by name & tell him you read about him on Yelp. He'll take care of you. -- DECOR The decor is similar to what you'd see in Nobu, Yellowtail, etc. What's nice is that the restaurant is configurable for groups of 4 all the way to 30+. Additionally, their view is great: It hangs directly over the Las Vegas Strip & give you a rare up-close 3 story view of everything going on while you're dining. Be sure to make a reservation for a window seat. BONUS: For some reason, a lot of bachelorette parties come here. I think it's because Roku's known for being a quieter, less dressy, lower profile place & thus I've seen as many as 3 parties going on at the same time, each with the signature wedding veil on the bride to be. CONCLUSION: I want to stress that you're not going to go back to Roku over & over for the food. While it's decent, it's stil a notch below places like Nobu & Yellowtail. Ultimately, however it's an all-around good place for groups, birthday parties, bachelor parties, etc., w/ a good balance of raw & cooked dishes w/ something for everyone, personal attention from the management, an unbeatable view, & consistently less lower prices than other sushi houses. 3 1/2-Star

TOmWs8l5Yl6jCRYsWWtgow.text: Dear Sushi Roku,  How dare you not have any uni when I came here!   I don't care if you said your Friday was busy and you ran out - ORDER MORE!    Also, your yellowtail sashimi with jalapenos was so slathered in sauce that I thought the fish might come alive again thinking it was back in the ocean.  I was going to give you two stars because your black cod miso was decent but then you sat me next to some whiny girl complaining about how there are no decent men in Las Vegas (does anybody go to Las Vegas to be decent?) and some teenager who was introducing sushi to his girlfriend and kept asking her "isn't this like the best thing you have ever eaten in your entire life?"  barf barf barf barf.    Toodles, Zach

C6GvRvBJBfOtPQOLmXz2TQ.text: This place was amazing!!!! I am getting married in August and was in Vegas for a Bachelorette party! We came here for dinner and were all blown away.  Sat at the bar in order to get the happy hour menu, and had Donald (donnie?) as our server.  He was amazing, attentive, and gave some great suggestions.  We ordered a ton of appetizers (the brussell  sprouts and shrimp with miso sauce were a few favorites) and each ordered some rolls (the Jalapeno shrimp roll was great).  All the food was great, someone at the bar bought us a drink (some kind of infused vodka with champagne) and Donnie arranged to have a desert brought out for me to congratulate me on my upcoming wedding, complete with a gorgeous firework sparkler thing in a champagne glass! Will be recommending this place to everyone and will be coming back every time I come back to Vegas! Thanks for the great food, ambiance, and of course, the customer service.  Amazing!

EvBzrNvOPsC-kNc2r-aiqg.text: Dinner was absolutely delicious. We had the special and 2 rolls. We also had 2 lychee martinis that hit the spot. We requested a table by their magnificent view and they agreed with a smile. We will definitely dine here on our next trip to Vegas. They get 4 stars because of price.

2RBgCTi88eReB0M4y1h7gg.text: Location, Location, Location... the view from this Caesar's Forum Shop's Eatery is amazing.  I'm sure the sushi is fabulous (didn't personally order any) but the Ingen Chinese Style Green Beans and Garlic Sauce and their Chicken Kara-age served with a Cilantro Mayo Dipping Sauce was the sh%#!!!  Pair that with a Cucumber Infused Martini on the rocks... you will be on Cloud 9.

zAKCKTe7vOn1IQNZiSygDg.text: Fantastic sushi--and great atmoshere. My friend told me this is a chain store in LA, but the quality was great. WAY overpriced, but that's okay on the corporate expense account---LOVE corporate! I showed them some magic and the management was very sweet and friendly and open and nice. I'll be back!

Ube6Jv9vQE2p33b9rwyTVQ.text: I was recommended to go to Sushi Roku by one of the guys serving the big yardstick tropical drinks on the strip.  It is very chic looking, excellent decor and the sushi chefs are quite funny yelling out something in japanese whenever hot chicks come or go.  They were also very accomodating, allowing us to bring our large drinks in from outside.  The sushi was fantastic, excellent portions, very fresh and quite tasty.  I had the spicy tuna and dragon rolls and loved them.  Service was great and the manager came out and introduced himself which is always a nice touch.

14dUipUXgmwHEM4VDSnPOQ.text: The sushi here is very good, however, I don't feel like the high prices are worth it for the quality of food. One thing that upset me is that they secured the raw fish to the rice with wasabi!! I was disgusted as I hate the taste of wasabi and they didn't have that information on the menu. The appetizers were good, especially the seaweed salad. It was nothing to write home about here. I'd definitely try another sushi place before I come back here.

TkZHIKFloHY-N0Oh4mJI7A.text: Went here with a group size of 8, was able to be seated within minutes, had a spectacular view of the strip. Food and drinks were amazing, sushi was very fresh. I think the price is expected for sushi and Vegas and totally worth it.

7LGLRGJFH3BvSU-GVVZN7A.text: You have got to be kidding me... Sushi Roku is ridiculous!  Ridiculously BAD, that is!  In fairness,  I give them one star for the service and another star for the ambiance (the restaurant is really gorgeous; if you sit in front of the windows, you get an amazing view of the strip).  But OMG, this place way overpriced!  I had dinner with 2 friends and it came to $300!  What the hell?!  The rolls were small and really not that special, and most importantly, they were NOT FRESH!  The nigiri looked like it had been sitting out all day!  Unacceptable!

MGMmkGDV2uAGon9qBjgElQ.text: Thought the place was decent. Liked the Shima roll. Everything else was good. But did not have the WOW factor working for them

Ea6i5OHi0TQ-NFFJZVHd0A.text: If there is one place to eat in Las Vegas, it's Sushi Roku. It has great sushi and other items are available if you are not a Sushi person...

R0WjufQQngnO1WqHSrBcog.text: Had dinner with five friends here a few days ago.  We're from Boston and trust me when I say we have good sushi.  This restaurant's strength is the ambiance.  The view of The Strip from the main window is great, and the decor is competitive with the best of them.  Music is new agey/lounge, but I know a lot about this genre and it could be a lot better.  The food was fairly good taste-wise when compared to other sushi restaurants in its price range.  However, it is more than a little overpriced considering the portion size.  You are literally getting mere morsels for $35-40.  When the waiter brought me my "main dish" it was something that looked size-wise like leftovers from someone else's meal.  Our total bill was in the $350 range and absolutely nobody had enough food.  In terms of taste, two out of six dishes failed to impress, one was mediocre, and three were good (including mine).  Overall, probably would not recommend.

oj_6iIaSWWXXla2xAj7Bdg.text: No reservation and still got a table....I say that is why I gave 3 stars and it would have been 4 stars had the host not tried to pawn us off to eat dinner at the cocktail area lounge. We strongly said a big NO and that we wanted an actual table. We did get a table and then proceeded to do the famous Saki bombs I love so much and have become accustom to doing at this place it seems on every visit. We even got the east coast ladies across from us doing them too. Sushi was excellent . The lobster special rolls though $21 were delish and worth the splurge plus the lava chocolate souffle desert was heaven. Pricey food but hey I figure its Vegas so I deal with it. I know I will be back on my next visit for sure.

3eag7nlDnKBgVmTc6baabA.text: Had dinner here and they helped me charge my phone! I like the noodle soup and salad is good but small. Overall a good place to go when you want sth Asian.

uXq4-HfLyI8pPqporI3Kpg.text: By the time that I got off the plane in Las Vegas, I was already starving. After dropping our luggage off in our rooms, we promptly took to yelp to find some sushi for my poor landlocked friend. We ended up at Sushi Roku and had a pleasant lunch. We each ordered iced teas. The iced tea had some sort of fruit flavor that we couldn't place. It wasn't sweet, but you could taste something tropical.  I opted for the lunch special which included salmon teriyaki, salad, rice and sashimi. I also added a miso soup. My friend ordered a specialty roll and a seaweed salad. My expectations were actually kind of low (this place is inside a mall) and they were easily surpassed by this lunch. The miso soup was flavorful and served at an appropriate temperature. My friends salad was really delicious. It was made with the very dark green seaweed and not the weird neon kind. My salad was pretty generic and with the exception of fishing out and munching on the the bitter micro-greens, I basically left it untouched. My sashimi was ok. Nothing really special. It could've been a bit colder. My salmon teriyaki was very flavorful, but a tiny bit overcooked. The rice on the plate was plain steamed rice. It was exactly as expected. My friends roll looked pretty good, but towards the end, she just took it apart and ate the fish because the ratio of rice to other ingredients was too high.    Not a terrible lunch, but also not the best I've ever eaten. It was definitely OK.

4ze0PWrt_3t1TRYEcP1fIA.text: I have been here for lunch and dinner and it was fantastic both times. The space is hip and modern and the wait staff and manager were really friendly and helpful with recommendations. The omakase had a great mix of creative dishes and the sake selection was nice and diverse. From the cooked dishes to nigiri/sashimi and rolls, everything was fresh and well executed. Definitely get the pumpkin bread pudding to finish your meal.

zgvIdeojZhdYrNa-ak5UMQ.text: Amazing place to eat sushi, the beef asparagus was amazing, sea bass was the best I ever tasted highly recommend this place and our server Agnes was amazing she ordered our selection and my wife and grandaughter was enjoying every bite. I will be back. If you go here try the sea bass.

qIAxqrEn9ELsuYKRtlf22w.text: For a sushi place in Vegas...  This was so good.  Omg.    In a heart beat I'll be back ...    Everything was fresh..  The chicken, steaks shrimp skewers and the sushi was all so good..  The drinks were spot on.  It is expensive though.  But hey...your in Vegas.

1MAP1aGdJXGlIrWU3wuu6Q.text: This place was amazing! After looking at the prices, the table decided to get the tasting menu, because as it was rather well priced in comparison. We were all SO glad we did. I now have so much more of an appreciation for the art form that sushi and all of Japanese food. Flavor combinations that I NEVER would have thought of were simply magic. I just wish there was more of it!   Service was also wonderful. I love hot sake, but haven't had much experience with cold. She recommended first a sampler to pair with our courses. Wonderful!   Pair that with a fabulous view of the strip and you have an unforgettable experience!

vfuEXcwTzE64zr2GIoIkMw.text: The place is beautiful and the view of the strip adds to the ambience.  Sushi is fresh and delicious, just like you would expect from a place like this. We ordered several rolls and they were all great.  One roll was off the menu called White Lotus and was the best. If you like crunchy rolls, try it out as it had a great combination of white albacore, aspagharas, avocado and crispy onion strings. Frank was awesome!

9EqHWgUNaE0BdyNnRBfaDQ.text: Went here for a birthday. The food was good and the service was good, I would go definitely go bavk again (especially since I found out they have a happy hour)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G9zdssqX66dU7rFz8ZcXYg.text: 2.5 stars  Loud and crowded restaurant with over-priced sushi and misc. Japanese food items.  Ordered the miso soup ($5) and the BBQ chicken ($14). 40 minutes later, our food arrived. Long wait much?  The chicken were 4 pieces. Seriously?! Come on, dude. 4 pieces for $14? Don't cheap out on me. Ugh, I was still ravenous after my meal.  The miso and chicken pieces were good. But wished the portions were a tad bit more.  My girlfriend ordered the $14 ramen which was price-worthy.   Despite our longer than average wait, our group was charged 20% gratuity. We protested, they returned the money. Seriously lame.  Not a fan of this place. Will not return; there are better places to eat on the strip.

X2KnNaOZQWJSI_mvZfpsuQ.text: Best sushi I have ever had in Vegas.  Not cheap, but what do you expect.  Blows Nobu out of the water.

9ow3dTzB9q8wnod-iiJESg.text: Amazingggggggg sushi!!!! By far the best I've ever had!!! The fish was sooo fresh ad melted like butter in my mouth!! View was amazing and ambience was great! Suchhh a clean and tasteful place!!

hd8NuCWZkfbzzY7IrFuEHw.text: I come here every time I'm in Las Vegas and have done so for years. There is one close to me in Los Angeles, but I truly believe the Vegas location is the best of them all.  Yes, it is expensive, but the fish is flown in daily and it is consistently the best tasting fish available.    Do yourself a favor and order the Shima Roll with spicy tuna, shrimp, cilantro and sriracha.  It is fantastic. Other Must-Try menu items are the garlic green beans, tuna carpaccio with garlic chips, the baked miso black cod, yellowtail sashimi with diced chilis, anything from their sushi/sashimi menu and their specials are always great. Whenever foie gras is on the specials menu, my partner always orders it because he can't get it in California and he always enjoys what he orders.    When you make your reservation, request a table by the window for a spectacular view of the strip. This makes an already romantic setting even more special.

6POnM6fOnb4BdXp06HP4aQ.text: Happy UPDATE!!  So I'm happy to report, I've been back two times since this first review. I must have been there on a bum night the first time, but overall, I like this place.   The Miso Soup is delish, the Tofu-yaki (tofu teppan yaki) was REEEEDICK!!  I get happy thinking about it. And the edamame has pieces of salted-crack sprinkled on them, I don't know what makes theirs soo flippin' good.  But it's pricey and we left a tad hungry.  The ambiance is quite pleasant and modern, the service both times was great!!  I'll go back and I'm happy to RE-review.   Local Discount 20% off

3ltvBMhhiYu6B9mPk8RqaQ.text: First thing: 20% off entire check for LOCALS! Second: birthday dessertS (yes that is plural) are complementary!  So we had a pretty good waiter, we got the strip view table, and waters were regularly refilled.  Everyone at the table (party of 6) had very different meals - some had the special sushi assortment, one got the seabass (supposedly the best ever), one had tempura, my bf had salmon and scallop entree (he thought the salmon was dry), and I had the complicated order.  My boyfriend and I split the crudo roku appetizer (all 6 sashimi specials in mini format): halibut with chili paste, yellowtail with diced chile, tuna carpaccio with ponzu, albacore with crispy onions, salmon with fresh greens and truffle, and octopus with salsa.  Yum little flavor fest.  The menu had daily specials which had Japanese and Spanish mackerel, and the regular sushi menu had regular and Spanish mackerel.  They were out of all of it (the waiter said new owners are too lazy to swap out daily menus.  He also said previous owners made poor cocktails...thanks for the commentary) - instead I got whole scallop sushi (Hotate), softshell crab roll (very nice, not too fried, lots of yummy sprouts), a yellowtail scallion handroll (good quality fish, but not fresh nori), and miso eggplant appetizer (good sauce, yummy, hot).  Also, I had the ginger yuzu martini - very refreshing with the meal...yuzu juice, ginger vodka, and ginger-vanilla something.  Overall, it was very pricey but tasty and delicious.  For our birthday girl in the party, they brought out TWO desserts ON THE HOUSE: wonton wrapped ice cream with tropical fruits, and chocolate lava cake with ice cream and berries.  Those were polished off fast.  Then I told our waiter that my bf and I were locals and he gave us 20% off the entire 6-person check (we saved $60).  Don't think I would rush back because of sheer cost, but I would recommend the experience.

8rQ85zrLzx_5ci3u8Ry-8A.text: Great food presentation, taste and sushi is fresh.  Thank you Las Vegas restaurant week  for the opportunity to try their food.  I'll come back

4039xZ3HX5Q7qCmY8yw-aw.text: Located in Caesar's Forum, Sushi Roku's seating view of the Vegas strip is amazing. The decor was romantic and modern. We ordered the 4 course prix for two and the entire meal was about an hour, it was long but it was satisfying. The service was excellent, you almost have to sit still and any movement they will come to ask how you are doing.   Next time I'm in Vegas, I will definitely come back for more Sushi Roku.

W6k4Koh0T_g1f3OwmeXDCA.text: Really, 6 bucks for a cup of hot tea? Ell with avocado was pretty plain and tasteless. Server also forgot out green peas (never got them) very pricy. Not recommended.

erD4nhOsbnmus-kDD172tA.text: I set up reservations for 2 for a birthday dinner. The service was excellent, they comp'd any dessert on the menu for the birthday and they even served the dish with a sparkler. I would highly recommend this restaurant for any occasion/dinner.

41bPEVUrqvQAGGSGNBkayA.text: Very nice! The atmosphere is a bit mall restaurant and there were kids galore, but the fish was super fresh. We tried several inventive dishes, including blue fin tuna with truffles.

cq17pwp_CRlKDBWV278Eyw.text: Wonderful Japanese cuisine. I am not a Japanese so I am not sure if the food here is authentic, but what I am sure is that the food tastes great. This place has unique cuisines like mako sushi and katana roll that are definitely worth trying. Food is well prepared and fresh.

bYYeFK1nDy7NYwK84KhcEw.text: Some of the best sushi I've ever had! The lobster rice was to die for! The decor was slightly dark but out really worked for the romantic dinner my husband and I were looking for.  I wad super happy to find a good sushi place in Vegas that wasn't too outrageous on the price side

RkUB-9ObuSfV94vZUVuQ_Q.text: Great service great food it's almost as good Nobu minus the Ambience and 1/3 of the price  ... The staff was very knowledgeable staff... Their sashimi toro was very fresh....

OGj8TQ3O4CRYhg2wOg6Vzg.text: The owner is very nice and the view is beautiful. I feel like I'm away somewhere ...so nice. Delicious food. Yum.

Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster

2fMpZvHttyNhwotd4SSRkA.text: I recommend the Chefs Sushi plate - delicious and artistic sushi that is a pleasure to eat! The Kobe Beef is delicious as well!!! Yummmm

_t2pv0M9LQplTf0JUzRVSQ.text: It's one of the best sushi places in Vegas. The dining experience was simply superb. Their manager Johnny provided omakase dinner complete with multiple courses of nigiri, crispy brussel sprouts(a must have),  Waygu beef on hot stones and many more.  Prices are reasonable as compared to other upscale venues on the strip.

AVcZeRIOkSkuegj_o3pJNg.text: This review is solely based on food because I ordered this for take-out. My lunch consisted of:  Baked Lobster Rolls Scallop & Salmon Nigiri Spicy Scallop Hand roll Filet Foie Gras Skewer  First Impression, Fish pieces for the nigiri was relatively smaller than other a la carte places. Foie Gras Skewer, I was expecting a bit more for the price of $18. It was literally just 1 skewer. With super thin slices of Foie Gras between meat and asparagus.   For the taste, the salmon, I couldn't tell too much how fresh the fish was. It had a little bit of aftertaste, a bit fishier than normal, although did not have a freezer burn taste, so I can't tell. The scallop tasted fresh though.   Spicy Scallop Hand Roll, might be too spicy for some people, but I like my food SPICY. So I enjoyed the taste, but the texture was just too mushy.  The Foie Gras Skewer - biggest let down of my whole order. There was literally not any noticeable foie gras on this. I was expecting more. You can't even taste it. The beef filet was dry. Bleh.   The only thing I semi-enjoyed was the baked lobster rolls. Chunk of lobster in each bite. But even so, still mediocre at best. Sushi Roku didn't really do it for me. It definitely did not live to its hype. Overpriced, and mediocre.

drGQt-YJi-9bt3e_jlzvAg.text: The service was horrible!!! Have never had service like this anywhere, especially a higher end sushi restaurant!!! Food took an hour and twenty, the wrong order was given, our appetizer never showed up, no water until I requested it. It was 3pm. Empty in there. No excuse. Our waitress was terrible. Two other couples arrived after us were in and out in 45 minutes. The sushi was good but not for the service or price. Go to Koi, Sushi Samba or somewhere else.

MI6MeHMRqGE62afQaOCvow.text: Good sushi but pretty pricey! I had a dynamite roll that was not bad. I believe it was $14 for 8 small pieces. I guess you're paying for Vegas prices.

3hu84gfZFijV1XAmeJdLTg.text: Omg this place has amazing food!!!! Can't wait to go back. Our friends were raving about how the tuna tartare is the best they ever had! I don't eat raw, but all the cooked food is sooo delish! Dinner with a view! Service was greaaaat. We ordered a total of 12 dishes. I'll try to update w/ more pics later

0bXB-tHnGOBLYkdYFi3zwQ.text: Trendy place with great service and atmosphere. But like any tapas place, it is "starving in style" :-)  Will definitely visit again ... And even though I am not a tapas aficionado, I do appreciate the attention to detail in presentation and taste. This place meets or beats anything I have experienced in DC.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NxHQCFIzKFFrGlhgKHSGjQ.text: Great service, great food. Loved the ambiance - romantic, inviting, fancy. Soup was good, we enjoyed the food, edamame with chili garlic was yum. The rolls were delicious, a tiny bit overpriced for what it was - that's my only complaint. For the portions and menu variety and quality, it was just a bit overpriced in my opinion (i am an avid sushi eater). I still highly recommend it either way. Our service was outstanding, our water never reached the half level, it was constantly tended to.

plP83vErTaQhNUGAl7Xddw.text: Bring back the Crab Dynamite! Great restaurant - but now indistinguishable from the many other great sushi restaurants in Vegas,

WFkbb2HiBR_t6jW6-SvKXw.text: Greatest sushi in Vegas I will always come back here , the service is amazing and I always get treated well

8_HWQHMuRIfIZIMkeo1h6g.text: Ordered $35 executive Bento box, food is well prepared  with quality ingredients, I won't say it is a bargain as lunch special but I am not disappointed either.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Executive bento box lunch special

aJ6OtEU1vFDCzEMIJ7m1dQ.text: The service is friendly and pretty efficient.  We arrived Friday night with a party of 8 and they got all our orders correct.  The tempura took longer than our rolls.  Waitress explained that tempura does take longer.  Each one of our dishes was artfully presented and delicious - I tried almost each dish at our table.  The kale salad is a must - the mushrooms and tangy dressing add texture and great flavor.    We had reservations but I don't think they're necessary unless visiting during peak Vegas visiting periods.
