-F-nX6GTVqiLbTdlAZgRUw.text: Great Food with Great Price point especially during Happy Hours. But all their food are delicious, fresh and nicely presented. A must try when in the neighborhood.

6Qufhad6QZckUYSYMjqHPg.text: My son was in the mood for sushi, came to yelp and decided on sushi Roku. The place is nice it did not have a wait time in which we found convinient due to the fact that we where starving :). Let me just say this place is average in my opinion and this was the smallest and most EXPENSIVE roll i have ever purchased lol . The place was average ive had better, i would not come back and i would probably not recomend this place. P.S waiters where nice and attentive so was the lady who seated us.

q1zqcH0nGiZnr92ppHExpA.text: They charge $50 for 8 pieces of sushi. This place should have four dollar signs instead of three!!!!! It was okay. The price is not worth it and no one was even full. The service was pretty bad too. We had to ask for wasabi and ginger.

2Y3Ckz3qbPlxaHX13VsMEw.text: 5 stars for me. Went for my birthday and was impressed with the service and quality of the food. Great atmosphere.

o2OxJVc9cOVQQFEn5Nib-A.text: My second chance to visit this place again. And I think my first visit was a bad day for me. This time everything is good.  The choice of Chef selection of sushi is too fusion, but it taste very good and adventurous.

biTU1xMXWJHGpTGTSKyH2A.text: For what it cost, Sushi Roku was just okay.  Lunch for three of us ran nearly $250 (with no alcohol).  We ordered the mixed tempura, three of the signature rolls and three of the sashimi choices.  With just one sashimi selection costing nearly $40 and signature rolls hovering at $30 each, it didn't take long to run up the tab.  The sushi rolls fell apart way too easily.  The rice didn't have the right texture and there's no excuse for that at these prices.  The service was also spotty.  Again, not cool at these prices.  The decor is fine, but I am sure this place benefits from candlelight.  It was a bit dark and spare in the afternoon for lunch.  It also smelled like fish.  A sushi place that is this spendy shouldn't smell like fish.  Frankly, I think you can get better sushi for the money in Vegas.

8dN3rPESg5IJEuQJt-xtgw.text: A bit pricey but well worth it!  The views at night are pretty cool as you can see the strip all lighted up....the sushi is delicious and the Kobe is a must!    They bring you the raw meat out in thin slices (about 6 slices I think?) and you cook it at your table so you can eat it fresh off the heated rock!    The service is top notch, very attentive and ready to answer any questions you have.  It also helps that the servers are pretty attractive, pretty people only please.  =P   Yes, it's one of those places in LV, like many....you're there to be seen and look cute.  The ambiance, food and service are all right on....really romantic and fun...you won't be disappointed...a nice stop after a day of shopping at the Palace.  =)

JcD81CGrHD0eAwdeLYQoYg.text: I really am giving this place 3.5 stars for two reasons.  The noise level and the lack of server loyalty to our table.  Atlhough that's not necessarily a bad thing, it was a bit confusing.  I'll get to that shortly.  We arrived just a few minutes after our reservation, but that's because we got dropped off by the cab on the wrong side and had to hike to the other side where the shops were to get to the restaurant.  When we arrived we were seated promptly.  We were placed in a nice two top right against the window overlooking The Strip.  Really nice view.  However, although were so close to each other, it seemed difficult to have a normal conversation.  The music was a little loud, which in turn had the patrons talking louder, and the two tops are so close together, we were having to talk over each other tables conversations.  I'm sure they felt the same way. This is where I get to the lack of server loyalty.  We had someone greet our table almost immediately.  He offered us menus and water and said a server would be over shortly.  He even put in an order of edamame for us.  Server #1.  Our edamame came out almost immediately, brought to us by what I assume was a runner.  Person #2.  The server came over to take our drink orders. Server #3.  This was also the same person that took our food order.  The previous runner brought out our first round of sushi.  The sushi was delicious.  We had a couple rolls and the Chef's Sushi sampler.  The tuna and salmon we had was like butter.  Definitely high quality. When we were finished with our first round, a server asked us if we wanted anything additional.  This was a different server from our initial one.  Server #4.  We said we weren't sure and asked for another menu.  Once we decided, we had Server #5 come take our final order.  He also brought us our last roll, and brought us our check.  When we got the check, I was confused as to who would be getting our tip due to the number of people that served us.  While I certainly appreciated the constant attention, I wanted to make sure that the tip was given appropriately.  I tipped 20% as I do normally and hopefully the servers receive their tips appropriately, however that may be.  Not once did we ever see Server #1 again. All in all, I would probably return here again.  Maybe not on my next visit, but at some point.

GyKj_aedBslAnI3STlvtXQ.text: Went here for lunch. Ordered lunch sized teriyaki chicken with salad and spicy tuna roll and a specialty roll of shrimp tempura, spicy tuna and tuna and yellowtail sashimi. I thought it was waaaaay overpriced for the quality. I eat sushi at least once a week and this was not good. The chicken was over cooked and the spicy tuna had the consistency of baby food. Moreover, we spent $50 on lunch and left hungry. I would not recommend this restaurant.

_1JTD698-PHB9ls-ytbz0w.text: Roku is to sushi as "The Golden Child" is to Eddie Murphy movies -- far closer to the bottom than the top. Roll selection was weak, and construction was worse. Having said that, their crab dynamite was delicious.

cTX0162ChdxNOn084Og2_w.text: First of all we missed our reservation time due to Hennessey. Worried that we may not be able to move to a later time, I was pleasantly surprised to receive a later reservation. So of course our party still showed up late to the restaurant still in thanks to said Hennessey. The staff still managed to be very friendly despite our lack of grace and composure (aka Bachelor Party).  In fact they locked us in the private room with an equally crazy Bachelor Party also from our hometown (Go Niners).  The food itself was good. I had the Crab Dynamite Roll, the Spicy Scallop roll and the Crispy Salmon dinner. None of the above stuck out specifically but the quality and presentation are enjoyable. Drinks blurred into Sake Bombs and shots of Patron. The check was a bit rough but I felt it matched my expectations well.  My overall star rating is 3.5

JKknFMlpQ4jXXIIfBJ3CgQ.text: Ehhhhh.... its okay.  Gots to give it to them for the decor and ambience they've got going on.  The service was fabulous and they checked on us, refilled our drinks and what not.    I had a bento box with spicy tuna sushi rolls and the food for some reason tasted mediocre to me.    But what really impress me about this joint is that the decor was very nice, but I hate it when I go to a restaurant where the food isn't up to par with the restaurant though.  I like the factor that they used real bamboo as their coverings in the window as tourists would walk by, and the atmosphere was very relaxed and somber like.    I wouldn't mind coming back here, but I just think that you could've found a better place compare to here.  Its just overrated.

jVl8Tmb6CrJolEXtxiw8CA.text: Wonderful sushi and creative desserts to top it off! Sleek and cool ambiance with service that isn't rushed. You may want to give yourself extra time though if you're seeing a show after dinner or are on a tight schedule.  This is a nice spot for sushi and more. There were some pretty unique dishes...a sea bass with black truffle oil for appetizer was really good. The sea bass was so tender and yummy. There was a caulifower with some very light breading that was very good too.  For sushi - the fish seemed really fresh and melted in your mouth. We didn't try the really unusual rolls though - they had some pricey ones.  What I remember was the dessert. The green tea mousse was light and airy topped with matcha powder. The apple fritter with dulce de leche ice cream was very good too. They have a chocolate souffle on the menu too but we were running late so we did not try it.  They also had a variety of sake and cocktails so there's something for everyone here whether you like sushi or not.

504c3YDD2HAPrAWsZsyJxQ.text: I would give them 4 stars for service, everything was good nothing spectacular though. It's more for the ambiance  and going with friends or on a date.  One of the managers there were super nice and gave us really good service.

G7J3HTmdnmS0oTBzM9iAvQ.text: I love love love Sushi Roku!!!  Sushi Roku is the epitamy of first class sushi dining experience!  Our birthday party was seated immediately even though half of our party was five minutes behind us.  Our table had an AMAZING view of the Strip.  Our birthday party was greeted personally by the GM - Kenji.  Our server was attentive and our food came timingly.  Everything was good, not a complaint from our entire table.    We LOVED our dinner and would go back anyday!  Tuna Carpaccio, Chilean Sea Bass, Ramen, Shima and Katana rolls were good.  I'd definitely recommend the molten chocolate cake for dessert... OMG it's to die for!  Overall a little pricy but definitely worth it for the ambiance, impeccable service and tasty food.

dZ-h02NzLu3HjdL65AavfQ.text: I was referred here from a friend.  We went this past weekend and it was good sushi.  Nothing out of this world but good.  The waiter was cool, we had some great cocktails!  He then brought us the regular glass water.... OMG it was the dirtiest tasting water.  I thought it was just me but then my girlfriend said her water tasted dirty.  I tried hers and sure enough it was gross.  We told the waiter and he agreed the water was not good there.  We asked him why didn't he tell us and he said because he didn't want us thinking he was trying to sell us a bottle of water.  SOLD!!! we asked for a bottle of FIGI.  For an upscale place like this the regular / tap water was the nastiest I have had in Vegas.    Anyways!  sushi was gooooooooooooood, over priced but still good and I would go there again and bring water or drink sake instead.

aUgd1j5tlQryRXkp6tYf8g.text: We heard great things about Sushi Roku and decided to try it.  The space is great, beautiful strip view, but it ends there.  Service was less than spectacular, and the food was nothing special.  Rolls were very uninspired, sushi/sashimi was ok but nothing great.   I've had much better experiences at Blue Ribbon and Nobu.

k8lnYmGpasAeXFA8a0e3-g.text: We are regulars whenever we visit Las Vegas. The service here is excellent, and the food quality is second to none ! The Manager, Johnny, is very accommodating, and makes sure everything is perfect. The yellowtail with diced chillies is one of our favorites, all seafood is the freshest you can get. The hot appetizers are consistently excellent as well. Tempura is great, too. The atmosphere is very friendly and upbeat. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that is looking for a great japanese meal, with a great view of the strip. Don't miss out on this rare treat !!

C6OOSzBHCMpG1USebbkGwQ.text: Staff is snobby and unhelpful, place is nice, their sushi was gross and way overpriced for tasting so horrible will never go back

3mxiJDp3mcrlEdU5k38DRw.text: PRICE         1   stars    (Too Pricey) FOOD         3.75 starts (Good quality)      SERVICE    4.5 stars    (Good host and great staff) QUANTITY  2.5 stars   (Really small portions)  Hence I gave it a total of 3 stars  Items we got  - $5 Miso Soup - $18 Tuna sashami Caprico (Cold Appetizer) - $22 Katana Roll (Special Roll) - $11 Spicy Shrimp with Asparagus (Regular Hand Cut roll) - $10 Wine for the wife (Argentinian, she really liked it)   Total $71 with tax. Total bill $82. Still left hungry and only got 1 drink.  Would I go there again ? Yes only if I win money while I gamble.

ae5pieb4Z6UhE85sMNDINQ.text: Awesome happy hour menu!! This is definitely my go-to Japanese restaurant in Vegas. My sisters and I enjoyed delicious authentic Japanese food -  chicken stuffed shishito, mushroom tempura, salmon and avocado sushi roll etc... The staff were all friendly and professional and the manager was very hospitable and accommodating. I can't wait to come back next month - this time, dinner with friends. I highly recommend Sushi Roku.

DNsOqbIudKYqGZbUqGemQQ.text: There was something just a little off about this restaurant.  Maybe the fact that it was virtually deserted influenced my perception, but the interior was just too dark and gloomy, this despite the fact that our table had a picture window view of the Las Vegas strip in its full neon glory.  The hostess seated us at a table that was broken--the bench seat backs were gone and were "being repaired."  There were at least two other similar tables on either side of us, so I dont know why she seated us there.  At first our server had a bit of an attitude, but she became very pleasant later on, so I forgive that.  Anyway, the sushi was okay, not spectacular.  I did enjoy the monk fish liver.  But the California roll was mealy.  Also, eel is suppose to be served warm, mine was cold and tasted refrigerated.  The tempura was kinda greasy, which is just unacceptable.  The Saki selections and mixed drinks were very good.    Overall, a ho-hum experience.  Maybe I'm spoiled by the sushi restaurants in San Francisco, but this place just isnt up to snuff.

C6HIIchk3M9mGingA4oLBg.text: At here about a month ago with my wife & cousin before catching a red eye flight.  Food was a 10.  Great menu, great service, excellent atmosphere.  Its attached to Boa Steakhouse and has similar look & feel (& service).  You will find a diverse crowd...mostly hipsters and dates...pretty trendy overall.  I think this place is on par with the high-end Japanese restaurants in vegas like Nobu.  Will definitely return again.  WBV

WV7lc7I_a8qHC7wRic9e_g.text: There was this superstar basketball player at  my high school: he was tall, rich, handsome, got the ladies, and was very talented in comparison to the rest of the high school population.  All of those aforementioned things caused people to hate him, no, loathe his very essence, so every time he got the ball, the opposing team would yell, "Overrated!"  Some people would say that Sushi Roku is overrated, but I say those people are jealous losers who are sad they can't eat here everyday.  This place is soooo good, and I will not comment on the price because I never saw the bill (thank you to my employer).  But I will tell you about the fanciful meal I experienced.  We started with the BEST DISH I had there: the lobster tempura in a miso soy glaze.  Lobster, check.  Fried, check.  Tempura, check.  Yummy sauce, check.  It's like a Chicken McNugget on steroids!    After that, I was afraid the other dishes wouldn't hold up, but they did.  Some sushi/rolls to try (I can't eat fish, only shellfish...don't judge me!): crab dynamite, hotate (so sweet, so buttery!), amaebi (yes, i like to eat the crunchy heads), and the baked crab.  P.S. Note on high school basketball star: he plays basketball for some other country because he didn't make it into the NBA, and there is a hilarious video on youtube with him trying to dunk and instead falling and banging his head on the ground.  He's okay so you're not going to hell if you laugh.

1GPb4TuuBe4E8cOrZF_zuQ.text: Here's a perfect example why I am hesitant about fine dining sometimes. You get great service, pretty looking food but it doesn't even taste good. So what are you coming for? The food itself or the service and food presentation?   If I had to describe the food here in one word, BLAND! A few more words, EXPENSIVE FOOD COURT FOOD.  And the walk here is such a PAIN IN THE @$$ from the front entrance of Caesars.  Ok, the place is very nice. The service is excellent. Food presentation is wonderful but that does not mean it tastes good.  The Calamari was way overcooked. I sent it back and the chef said that's how it is. It's supposed to be dry and rubbery? I should take the cook over to Cheesecake Factory and let him try to Calamari there. I couldn't even chew it. Spat it out and they were willing to take it off our tab. Thumbs up!  Prime rib was so so. I wanted to ask for some A1 sauce so you know the marinade wasn't flavorful enough.  Crunchy spicy tuna roll and lobster specialty rolls were absolutely bland. No one at my table tasted a single thing. Of course, there was no way they could mess up a regular tuna roll so that was fine.  Sea bass was probably the best dish and when I say the best, I'm being generous. It was still so so.  $6 extra for miso soup and rice to add to your entree? Ehh...  $160 including tip for 4 people. Never again. Social House @ TI is a bit more expensive but at least the food tastes MUCH better.

j1f9EVgKUiaATddXSGsXaA.text: Sushi Roku was a very fun atmosphere with pretty great food and a fun way to spend a Friday night in Vegas. We had a group of six eating here and everyone was excited about what they got. Everyone at the table had assorted rolls that they were incredibly happy with (especially the Dynamite Crab Roll). The spicy tuna was VERY spicy, which I love. We also shared the Katana Roll and the shrimp tempura roll, all very yummy. They did find out we were celebrating a birthday at the table and brought us complementary desserts to share. Really fun atmosphere -- only downgrade would be that the service was a bit slow.

yIQLPXybhWnvFoDDwEH1Vw.text: I wanted to like this place more than I did.   Let's start with the good... Our waiter was excellent, truly top notch. He was attentive without going overboard. The restaurant is lovely. Nice layout, comfortable tables. We were shown to a table immediately without a wait. The restaurant was relatively quiet, which I appreciate.  Now for the not as good... We ordered the tower of fish. They had two versions on the menu. Their standard one for $99 and the premium one for $172. We initially ordered the standard one thinking that ought to be enough to feed three of us (2 adults, 1 child).  We figured this would give us some variety. Our waiter suggested that the premium one would be more satisfactory since it was all we were ordering.They had several special fish on the menu that sounded delicious so we agreed. However, it turned out there was nothing special about the selection we received. 6 oysters, 6 crab legs, 4 pieces each of albacore, tuna, salmon, and yellowtail sashimi, 1 scallop and 6 shrimp. The tuna was so-so.  The rest was well prepared but there was nothing special or exotic about it. We also ordered the sake sampler which again stuck with fairly standard sakes. Nothing particularly interesting that you wouldn't have had if you enjoy sakes.  For the price, I was let down by the dullness of their selections. That issue aside what they did serve was fine though not spectacular.

AQHe4J2VKQk9A5ZIjEuggg.text: We went here New Year's Eve. Nice venue, on the third floor (?) Of the Forum Shops. We purposely made late reservations to stay in the restaurant to view the fireworks from the balcony. Full house, it took an hour to get our seats. We already had dinner so we didn't mind. We were asked if we would like an exclusive open bar option since we had to wait for so long. The majority of our party was nearly one shot wonders and passed on the kind offer. There was a live DJ. The restaurant had a good vibe to it. Despite the business, our server was very attentive.  We ordered a few desserts: creme brulee, fruit plate, ice cream/sherbet and a few drinks. They were out of creme brulee so the server gave us 2 banana flambes on the house. My sister and her bf wanted to try them so it turned out great. All the desserts were to our liking and presented beautifully.  Before midnight, the restaurant opened the balcony to show a direct view of the fireworks to be lit on the roof of Planet Hollywood. Champagne on the house was passed around for cheers. Countdown was amazing. We all had a wonderful time. We enjoyed the rest of the desserts and a few more drinks and left the restaurant around 1am. Nearly no traffic or any trouble getting out and escaping the strip.  A nice venue to celebrate New Year's Eve with your loved ones and to avoid the crowds.

aejrc86uez60vU0Le50JRA.text: Extremely tasty, nice ambiance, and good #customerservice. However, small rolls, can be a bit pricey, but a cute little date spot.

z1OdRunJniDMtATnNoGCrA.text: Not bad for Vegas.  But is that really what you want when you're splurging on vacation?   I came here looking for an authentic Japanese meal.  They tell you the fish is flown in from Japan.  And to tell the truth, the food is not bad, it's just nothing special.  It's Americanized touristy stuff, without the exotic fish one finds in establishments that target connoisseurs.  The fish was certainly fresh, but that was not enough to overcome the abominable service.  That was unJapanese enough to ruin the meal.  The waitress didn't know the menu and had to go find the answers to our questions, until we got tired of asking.  Why is she even serving if she doesn't know what she's presenting to the customers?  We tried to ask the sushi chef about the menu, but his English was limited and he based his suggestion on how we could save money, when instead we wanted him to knock our socks off.  Then the bus boy took our plates away while we were still eating, which is downright rude.  I felt like just another tourist passing through a shiny hollow Vegas cash drainer.  I'm not coming back.

3sxPHxD3-1xfeiGKwP1z4w.text: YUM. I went recently and was very happy with not only the food, but the service. My water glass was never empty, and they often came by to check on us.   The food: I had the Yellowtail Sashimi appetizer with diced chilies. For an appetizer, $17 is a bit high--the portions were a bit small, but this was so delicious. The chilies did not seem spicy to me /at all/ but the whole thing was really flavorful. I could have easily eaten a pound of this.   I got a few sashimi pieces (maguro, hamachi), and the crunchy spicy tuna roll. Yes, I evidently love tuna. At any rate, these were all really delicious and I was totally happy with my selections.   The restaurant itself is beautifully decorated, and its location inside the forum shoppes is convenient.   Would definitely eat here again!

oEumhWfKxbTY_t960aTELA.text: Great sushi off the strip. Reasonable priced and overall a solid experience.

f72Ba5lm7VglIzzqr4DPVw.text: We ate here for lunch our first day in Vegas. We both ordered sushi rolls (can't remember which ones). No draft beer and the sushi was just okay!  View of the strip and decent decor but not a great atmosphere. Probably won't go back!

14O4CR2jJWSkIlZLJIAwhA.text: Great view of the strip. The sushi here is good. You will end up spending around $80 (inc. tip) for 2 for an appetizer and 3 different types of sushi/sashimi (average priced ones). The service was great/quick however they were not busy at the time we ate.

sy8bAXEj3foVOU5QPdNmnA.text: We were  here for lunch during our engagement weekend and loved this place!   Appetizer = Edamame Hummus *nothing special, just yummy hummus with plenty of chips for it  Beef with Sushi Lunch Plate *The MOST AMAZING beef ever. We asked our server what kind of meat it was and she said "filet tip". We are still thinking and raving about this beef when we order beef at other places.  Teriyaki Chicken with Tempura Lunch Plate *chicken was seasoned very well. Tempura was perfectly battered  Fiance had scaallop sushi and a few others and said they were fresh and tasted great!  Service *VERY attentive, not sure if it was because it was lunch time but it was great.   As said by others, the view was amazing and we loved it even more when we realized we were eating right above our Trevi Fountain engagement site :)   Priced a little high but worth it totally for us!  We will 100% be back here whenever we are in Vegas again!  Thanks Sushi Roku, you Rock hehe!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Teriyaki with Tempura Lunch
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop Sushi
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The MOST AMAZING Beef lunch

zYQu6R2fc3SNZJQOE7Y46g.text: Place is really nice and servers are really. Ordered some sushi and sashimi and fired rice. Rolls don't tastes good, sashimi and sushi are really good for this price. I would expect much tasty than other sushi restaurant.

WakVw9z4cn-vqBxweWNFog.text: Stopped in here on a Tuesday night after hoofing it through the Forum shops for a while. Super friendly hostess met us at the door and walked us past the sushi bar where all the chefs hollered out a welcome.  Loved the decor--dark, rich, invitingly modern and warm without being dreary. Never having been here before, what did we do? A little of everything. Edamame beans as well as edamame hummus served with wonton crisps. Husband had salad with a delightful peanut-based dressing; I had crab miso soup that was good, but not worth the money. Better off just ordering standard miso soup.  Then came the rolls. A spicy tuna with a serious kick, and very good flavors. But my favorite? The Takana roll, which was draped with the most perfect, buttery yellowtail I have ever had in my life. It melted with each bite, and was the highlight of the meal...so much so that when we finally launched into our baked lobster roll, I did the unthinkable--I sent it back. It was positively bland and flavorless compared to the Takana roll, and was a real let-down following that amazing yellowtail. The manager, Gary Min, came over and removed it without batting an eye, and was incredibly gracious and accommodating from beginning to end. Our waitress, Tina, was also delightful, and very helpful and present without being overbearing.  Overall, a really good meal. We'll be back for sure!

8bIu3WLhaSE8bcH9lZLnRw.text: Best happy hour in Las Vegas!   Wow!  Great service, food and atmosphere. Lisa the bartender was awesome!!! She made some great happy hour suggestions and you can tell the manager (Gary) cares about the dining experience of all the guests.  All locals are treated very well... Let them know.  Happy Hour is Monday - Thursday 4-7 and Friday - Sunday 4-6...   The Lava cake is the best!

X9DBGURNRf7HBp2fRkhk8w.text: While the rolls were very good, the best aspect of this place is the service and hospitality. Certainly not what I expected inside a Vegas mall. The atmosphere and the decor was pristine and the staff tended to our needs well. The pricing is a little high, so if you're a sushi connoisseur I'd try something different each time before making a conclusion.

yu6nOFQgh8_bIR0lj8eBHw.text: This was our second Thanksgiving dinner here (weird, I know).  We came back because the food is good and the decor is nice for a dress-up family dinner.  I'm from Hawaii, so my standards for raw fish are high (which explains the lower rating for some of the sushi items).   Spicy tuna roll w/ avocado: 3 (boring) Hottate (scallop sashimi): 4 Ikura (salmon roe): 4 Oysters: 4 Tofu 3 Ways: 5 (served with truffles, caviar, and ginger with delicious sauces and red dipping salt) Miso eggplant: 5 (so good!) Shishito peppers: 5 Tuna tartare: 4.5  Service was a-ok, no problems.

at4sa1XOH_DHGVAppcYQcw.text: I Love Sushi Roku :)  Ok, now that I've said that.. the review.   Came here after not being in Vegas for a couple years.. I'd just gotten tired with Vegas. We walk in and even after not having been here for 2yrs our waitress Jessica greeted us by our names! Impressive! We'd not made a rez, so she didn't get it via that method .. she just remembered. If I had that type of memory, well I'd be lucky.   While we'd like to check out the new Sushi Samba, and we know there are "trendier" places for sushi in Vegas, the service here is really what makes us repeat customers. There was a time when we would be in Vegas twice a month and would come here every time. The dining room/restaurant is chic, the view is amazing, and the food is fantastic but without the service we would probably spend more time exploring other places. It is as plenty of people have pointed out  "pricey", but it's Vegas and I've never thought of Vegas as a place to go when on a tight budget. In my opinion the price is justified by all the pluses of Roku.  The Food:  We started off a comped tuna carpaccio our lovely waitress brought for us. It was very flavorful and light at the same time. It was a great light starter. We nibbled it up too fast to get a picture.. sorry :x   Tuna sashimi with garlic chips and sesame soy. We order this every time we go to a Sushi Roku.. it's so good. I love the clean taste of the tuna complimented by the sesame soy and the little bites of garlic flavor, mixed with the crunchiness of the chips.. it's such a great bite to have all of those at once!  Kobe with king crab. I don't remember much of it, but I do remember liking it. I just think that I prefer my Kobe either raw or very rare and it was too cooked for me. Kobe is fine on it's own :) If you want to try something different tho and you like your Kobe on the cooked side, this dish may make you go "mmm"  Foie gras wrapped in yellowtail and sprinkled with edible gold. This is another thing we can't pass up. Every time we have it, I think we know it's great before we order it, but we don't fully remember just how decadent and divine it is until we actually eat it. It really is fabulous! I'm seeing less and less foie gras on menus. I know the Roku in Santa Monica dropped foie gras so I'm going to enjoy this while I can and when I can.  Kobe Yakiniku. This is the thin slices of kobe that you cook yourself, usually over a hot rock. We thought it would be a fun dish for my daughter. I had a piece and it was perfect, however the cooking method needs to go. Instead of a hot rock, they bring out a mini grill and the meat kept sticking to the grill. It wasn't easy to get it off with just two hands.. I had to hold the grill part down(because it wasn't attached) with my chopsticks, while my daughter peeled the meat off. And it smoked a lot! Like up to the ceiling.   Shrimp Tempura. It's shrimp tempura, I don't eat it my daughter does. That's that.  Sushi. We had Salmon, Tuna, Toro done two ways.. seared and not seared. Everything tasted super clean and the texture was perfection. I love the toro here and I get the feeling the sushi chefs here would never put something on your plate that they wouldn't eat. Some places have given me some nasty stuff. Never the case here. Only complaint, they forgot two or our seared toro.. apparently they didn't believe us when we ordered what we did haha.   The waitress brought us two comped desserts, which I myself was too full for. They were eaten and they were super cute and pretty so I imagine they were yummy as well :)  Cocktails. I love the drinks here! I have two things I usually stick with.. the lychee mojito and the lychee martini.. they are both delicious. Sometimes I get the Kyoto Rose, it's different and it's grown on me.. the rose flavor threw me off a bit the first time I tried it.  Sushi Roku is the mix of everything that makes me a fan of a restaurant.. great stetting, fantastic and attentive service and food that makes me and my mouth happy :) If you go ask for Jessica and tell her I said hi!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lychee Martini
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lychee Mojito

WjWh3hNHztcy1MSb6dRjvA.text: Unimpressed.   Our dishes got progressively worse as the meal went on.  The decor here is the highlight. Super-cool ambiance.  Otherwise, the food was a very poor value, even by Vegas standards.  I loved the Yellowtail Sashimi with diced Chilies. Very yummy!  We had 2 Tempura rolls and both tasted like a camp fire. Not sure if the oil in the deep fryer was burnt? But it was foul. Also, experience some severe fishy-ness in the couple of Tuna rolls we tried.   I could find better fish at a run-of-the-mill strip mall sushi restaurant. Too many great restaurants to bother with this one.

97kCreIt_4juM98vnaP1UA.text: Sushi Roku is tucked way out of sight at The Forum Shops at Caesar's. It is romantic and dark. Our server was very professional. We ordered a bunch of apps to start.   The tuna carpaccio was fresh but lacked in flavor so I had to add soy sauce. The Kobe beef skewers were tender and juicy but I am not sure if they really were from Kobe. The chicken skewers were ok - afterall it is chicken. I recommend the Seaweed salad and Miso Eggplant Dengaku.  We were ready to order dinner and then a friend of mine got sick and left and her bf went after her. So my gf and I finished the apps and were full. We explained to the waiter that we had a problem with out friend and he understood but I felt bad for him since the place was almost empty.  One thing I noticed in a lot of Vegas restaurants is that they are so dark inside. It's draining. Liven up and be more fun, it'll increase business.

aFin8quubTyRwKrKy52Nig.text: ALWAYS amazing...we started with miso soup, then the shishito peppers (YUM) and then bluefin tuna and Japanese mackerel sushi, then a roboto skewer of filet wrapped around fois gras and asparagus,  Next, a spicy yellowtail nigiri sushi, plus uni and masago.  Perfect balance, great view, romantic, YUM.

psLZqrnCtpHyk2bIgXzO6A.text: Expensive, tasteless Japanese food.  There was no flavor in teriyaki salmon, tempura, and California roll. Price was expensive, but I do not expect any less from Vegas.

cr9Az1kRXHhl9KRZSTpCCQ.text: Absolutely loved this place! Their food was delicious- so fresh and well made. The service was exceptional- and our waitress was so sweet to answer all our questions + provided the sweetest desert for our bachelorette!!!! Thank you so much sushi Roku!

q6HWNWJCaiAqV70UZp9K1Q.text: Amazing service and the best food!  Pricey but worth it.  Take your time and enjoy everything.  Careful not to order too much because it is filling but so delicious.  The wait staff was super friendly and the atmosphere was great and the seats comfortable.  I don't think I've been to a better sushi place yet.

E43NKqtdAd5UwXkTde2CJA.text: Underrated. Hidden gem. Great find.  Sushi Roku was a fantastic little hole in the wall that without a little investigating, may have never found. My fiance and I got reservations here and were astounded with the view. You could see the entire strip from our table in a beautifully dimmed atmosphere that was everything we were looking for.   We started with the usual - sake and edamame. The hot sake was pretty good, but it was the sushi and sashimi that stole the show.   My personal favorite was the Katana. I have not had anything like it. The server also recommended the skipjack with my choice of yellow tail sashimi.  Big fan!

PpwdO6BykFcV--m1eZ--KQ.text: Hostess was rude, unaccomodating and happy hour sign outfront is misleading. Place was not busy as happy hour had just begun. Might have been 4 tables with guests. Hostess was on the phone for an uncomfortably long time before she acknowledged us. We asked if we could sit next to the window and she said she would have to check. Almost 5 minutes passes! We are worried that she just forgot about us. She eventually comes back tells us we have take our baby out of the stroller and leave it at the front desk and attempts to seat us near the entrance (opposite side of restaurant) and not near the window. We asked again about the window and she acts as if we had never requested a window seat in the first place. Says she will have to check if there's a server in that area. She leaves us standing at the front to check and eventually comes back to seat us. Upon being seated we see 2 other tables with their waiter near the window! So obviously there was a waiter already serving the area. She didnt want us there....for what reason I dont know. So uncomfortable. Upon being greeted by our server we find out that happy hour only applys to outside area. Ok...fine we check out the menu and it looks nothing like the menu we viewed online. Totally bummed as my daughter wanted a bento box. We told the waiter we were bummed and he was nice and apologetic. We decide to just leave and as we walk out down the hallway the hostess passes us and just says "dont forget your stroller on your way out". So rude!!

Lf_R-XXMUwfKRI0D9h5b6A.text: Went for happy hour, weekdays 4-7pm. Great good, great service, great prices. Highly recommend !

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon &amp; avocado roll and California hand roll. Delicious!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Organic Ginger Salad and garlic green beans - so good!

Ed90tB1LirdJ4-bF6CfZxg.text: Sushi is just sushi but this place takes it to another level.  With the location, view, ambiance and of course THE MANAGER AND STAFF!! They make it worth the experience.  Highly a must do in VEGAS BABY!  Johnny and Gary Thank You! Hope to see u soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just getting started with a fabulous dinner!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Who&#39;s this pimp daddy? Of course Johnny!!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Time to get our drinks and sushi with our friend Johnny Seo

FK41n9IPeNCGNWKl3alO7g.text: Another great dinner in Vegas. Craving something lighter than the Italian fare that every restaurant seems to have, we opted to walk to this restaurant in Caesars Palace. The atmosphere and food were good. We ordered dishes to share including a veggie roll, miso eggplant dengaku, and roasted cauliflower.   We liked everything but the tofu three ways. It's just three blocks of cold tofu, with different soy sauces and toppings. We ordered it without the caviar, but neither of us liked the truffle or kimchi one. This could just be us being picky eaters, but I didn't like that we left 95% of it untouched and the waitress didn't ask what was wrong; she just cleared the plate.  All in all, a nice pre-drinking dinner.

ANjnMdGKeFP46zhR80DFDw.text: Sushi was decent, service excellent and best of all, love the hours of happy hour.  The spicy garlic edamame was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy garlic edamame.  Amazing and finger lickin&#39; good!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu.  Great hours!

La6HU9Bj6m7Pmr26E7GAWQ.text: Hands down some of the best sushi I've ever had in my life. We were worried that there weren't many people here, and it was tucked way back into the Forum Shops, but we were completely blown away by the food. If you are looking for very fresh and delicious sushi, definitely come here!

t3lKQAyCW1JyulO2Dm5XzA.text: Waaaaaahhhh, this review is a long time coming as I've been here 5x within the last year.  Whether it be during happy hour (which is the best sushi happy hour you can get in Vegas) to restaurant week (best choices of prie fix menu); and best of all their anniversary week (50% off food menu); EVERYTHING was melt-in-your-mouth amazing.  I'll just name off my favorites:  - foie gras and scallops - yellowtail sashimi - shishito peppers - tofu steak - grilled filet - tuna tataki - oysters with gold flakes - waygu sashimi -oysters with gold flakes -fois gras wrapped in yellowtail  Foie and ANYTHING is just B.O.M.B.  One of the many reasons Sushi Roku is uhhh-maaaaze =)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pumpkin tuna carpaccio x Yellowtail wrapped foie x Ramen x Boa 405 x Tofu 3-ways (minus dessert &amp; handful more of dishes)

uJ-MeJVagNGomsivdFYJWw.text: This place continues to amaze me. The service and quality of sushi with a great Las Vegas feel cannot be beat. It's really the ultimate sushi experience on the strip. I highly recommend it and Johnny Seo does a wonderful job keeping this restaurant in top form. The sushi chefs are amazing. I continue to go here every time I visit Las Vegas and love it.

K3QkcrOlc15VPaPT2x9DaA.text: I came here on a Saturday night with a huge group. They accommodated us very well. We had reservations at 8:30 and were seated immediately. The service was great, our server was on top of everything. The sushi was delicious and it is obviously pricey because you're paying for grade A quality fish. Appetizers were great, especially the peppers. Serving sizes were fairly small but it is expected. Definitely recommended!

_gTczSvldAxt4EhcQoIVOg.text: We decided to create our own sushi tour while visiting Las Vegas. We researched the sushi restaurants and picked 5 to try. We went in with the thought that we would ask for a recommendation from the staff and that is what we would order. GREAT EXPERIENCE!!!! recommendation was Excellent!

fl_gBAFmBy5hc25eA6q17w.text: Tasty sushi (though not mind blowing), friendly staff, great atmosphere. We sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chef next to us was fantastic - memorizing all our orders while he was completing 3 other orders was no big deal for him, even the waitress couldn't keep up with him! Spicy tuna cut roll was just okay, along with the Hirame nigiri sushi. But what blew my mind was the hotate nigiri sushi. It was so fresh and melted in my mouth! Suitable place for a date or with groups.

4dVYREGRUJtZAMXT4lYRFA.text: It is the terrible Japanese Restaurant I have had been in my life. I was order one fry rice, but the fry rice about triple salty could not eat at all. I asked them to give me a bow of rice to mix with it, but they charged me extra fee for the rice. I could pay for it, but they were not even try to make another fry rice for me, but charged me the extra fee to make me feel very bad service. I will never go there any more in the future....

44W82HA_OOmqcjEbd_zh9Q.text: - Solid edamame - Squid sunomono was delicious.  Tangy, crisp, and the squid was perfect - The shishito peppers were ok.  Not crisp enough and the sauce was a touch too strong - The sushi was all very nice - The saba was strong - The kampachi was probably the best I've ever had (firm, but not too firm and borderline buttery) - The ocean trout was much different than I've had before.  Usually it's a little strong.  Sushi Roku's was smooth.  I liked it - The oh-toro was amazing, as it should be.  The bacon of the sea - My only quibble is that the portions were a smidge too small, even for a higher end place - Service was solid - Loads of gluten-free options/substitutes

ZT6PQCxVvzCGDYt6aLfiLA.text: The sushi and gyoza here is very good.  The restaurant staff is very helpful and walked us through how to find the place over the phone by giving us shortcuts around the Caesar's Palace mall.  The restaurant is on the 3rd floor at the top of the spiral escalators in the Forum mall.

zE-6Z0X1XosOR64FcjHf4Q.text: Yeah, this is without a doubt the best meal we had in Vegas - and it wasn't even a meal in the traditional sense.  We had their Happy Hour, which my wife assured me would be LIKE a meal.  I don't usually believe her when she says stuff like that.  This was outstanding.  Lots of vegetarian options and the food was out of this world good.  I'm still thinking about the sweet potato roll I had and even better was this amazing mushroom tempura.  I am not someone that believes Happy Hour food = a meal but in this case,  I was sold.  We had so much food we had to take some back to our hotel.  And the service at the bar was perfect.  Cannot recommend enough.  This is the best deal in Vegas.

Z32man8zkrPjFXCSB-v17A.text: Eating here now. Excellent food, Juliet is awesome! Glad we came. Will stop here again on our next trips. The shrimp appetizer is huge. The Katana roll is delish.

ocgRgBeXhuLF-ieXvc_RrQ.text: Excellent sashimi. Ok sushi rolls. Music is way too loud, we could barely have a conversation.  The bartender service was slow - our food came before drinks. Decor is very cool. Do not recommend the desert menu. Our bill was overcharged cocktails we didn't order, but they corrected. Very high price tag for mediocre/slow service.

GKFe7VGVQmp-V8dW6mUahg.text: Listen to your server when she tells you to order appetizers.   The fluke sashimi in yuzu is fantastic. The bf still talks about it a year later and says it changed his understanding of what good fish is.  The rolls are totally forgettable and very small for what you pay. I honestly can't recall what else we ate there.  The service is great - everyone is a real sweetheart and our server had a wonderfully dry sense of humor. She also helped us stay within our budget (we tend to go WAY overboard when we do a la carte).   The sake was served at the perfect temperature.   Honestly, the three stars are because I think your money is better spent elsewhere in Vegas and because there's such a huge difference in quality/value in items on the menu. The sashimi was some of the best I've ever had, the rolls were some of the worst.   But the fluke was so good that the bf suggested going back just for that.

XPL_DT2LBsgz4djxiBiitQ.text: We ate here on the first day of our trip to Las Vegas. We quickly learned that happy hour was the best time to check out the restaurants we were most looking forward to, Sushi Roku was one. Located at the forum shoppes at Caesars, we were quickly pleased with their happy hour menu, lots of delicious choices.   There was not a huge amount of bar seating, a smaller bar and a family style high top table were the only options. We ended up having to wait a little for two seats together. After we did we were quickly greeted by our waiter.   I ordered Hanabi- spicy tuna on crispy rice, an organic garden salad with yuzu ginger, a salmon avocado roll, shrimp tempura with asparagus and Wagyu Skewers (not on happy hour menu) along with a glass of their happy hour champagne.   I loved the hanabi. It was absolutely delicious and something I have never had before. The salad was not the typical Japanese salad I was hoping for, it was just Ok, this was something I could have done without. The salmon avocado roll was delicious and exactly what I was hoping it would be. I was pleasantly surprised at how much I liked the shrimp tempura with asparagus because typically I don't care for asparagus. So far, so good.   Here is where I knocked off a star for the overall review. Never having wagyu before I didn't know what to expect it to look or taste like but I have heard incredible things about this particular meat. I was very clear in ordering the Wagyu skewers. However come to find out thats not what I got and unfortunately I didn't realize until after I had ate them. I saw a plate of actual beef and skewers pass me and I realized...thats definitely not what I got and I didn't even enjoy it. So I looked back at the menu and what I received was the Rib-eye wrapped asparagus. How does one screw that up? They don't even sound similar. But again, I just figured okay the asparagus was the skewer and I had no idea what the Wagyu would have tasted like because I had never had it. I was beyond disappointed. I called over the server and I asked him what it was that was brought to me. He said, It was the rib eye asparagus. I kindly replied, that wasn't what I ordered. His response "oh I rang it in wrong" ... no apology or anything? Then not only that, but I was charged for what I didn't even order and mistakenly ate. Had I not ate it, I would not have accepted this but being that I ate it I just let it go. However being that he acknowledged he rang it in wrong, he should have compensated in some way. This was incredibly disappointing.   Overall we enjoyed our meal. Aside from our server- issues and the rib eye wrapped asparagus which I did not enjoy, I would still recommend this for anyone looking for a sushi happy hour.

Tn_7J1O-ZsW4RCePgSTW9Q.text: Sushi Roku, located inside Ceasar's palace, has some of the best sushi in town! Keep in mind that there is no all you can eat and it can get pricey very quickly, but the price is sure worth the taste. All the fish melts in your mouth like butter. The oysters are of the freshest and tastiest I've ever had! Their shrimp tempura is done in dish a style where the breading doesn't feel overbearing or dry, it has a rich juicy flavor that doesn't stop. If the food was t enough they have some amazing cocktails that pair well with your meal.

Ci5RhxTVbRPY7WxB_T8wDA.text: Went to Sushi Roku to celebrate my girlfriends birthday. Met Johnny the GM and Chef Alan. We had an amazing and wonderful dinner here. Everything we tried was really delicious. Really love the Spicy Tuna on Fried Sticky Rice and the Japonais Ribeye Steak. All of my girls had a blast here.

nEU5uRbrHnO1aQU0PJFVLA.text: For some reason can never go wrong with getting sushi on the West Coast. Came here for lunch a few weeks back while in Vegas. Ordered a Bento Box with steak, rice, salad and California rolls and it was fantastic. The right amount of portions, just the right amount of ginger and wasabi sauce. Everything about it was great. Service was just as good and attentive. Only paid a little less than $20. Definitely coming here again whenever my next visit to Vegas is and try something new from Roku.

_7QLmq3IvUYUSNs_mJ-Fnw.text: We had a lovely sushi dinner tonight at Sushi Roku! I enjoyed the delicious calamari and ramen. We are celebrating a bachelorette party and they brought out a complimentary dessert with a sparkler. So unexpected and so nice! Great view of the whole strip.

3mSe3TVIjTofixlYsKvzxA.text: What a great night! Had our wedding anniversary weekend early in Vegas and Sushi Roku took great care of us!!! Eric was our waiter and he did a great job!! Thanks Eric!!  Our favorite menu items:  -Tuna Pizza - Japanese Fried Chicken  ..And Roku was so sweet to treat us with the best & most fun dessert, like, EVER: S'MORES!!!!  Thank you for making our Anniversary dinner so special!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedding Anniversary S&#39;mores!!

MgJuv_J54Sj7tl0xhbN3Uw.text: Let me just say straight off the bat; yes, the prices are expensive for what it is. But keep in mind, all restaurants and foods are usually overly priced on The Strip.   Besides that, food was delicious! Boyfriend and I wanted to try the brussel sprouts chips but they were out for the day. -__- what!? awwwwww......man! So we got gyoza dumplings and the seabass sliders (one order came with two) as appetizers. The sliders were my boyfriend's favorite item of the night. The tartar-type sauce had a kick to it. The seabass was crispy. We would definitely order that again.  We decided to order three kinds of sushi. As a staple, we always get an order of spicy tuna roll at any sushi/Japanese restaurant we go to. This one here, ehhhhh....it was only alright. We could definitely do without. Average and I've had spicier, better ones at other places.  We also order the Shima roll: shrimp on top of spicy tuna, cilantro and avocado. It looked like it was wrapped in soy paper. And we got the Baked Lobster roll in a creamy miso sauce. Both those rolls will definitely be a repeat.  Only reason why I gave it 4 stars (really a 4 1/2 star review) was because we really wanted to try the brussel sprout chips. If they had it available that night, this might have been a perfect 5 star rating. Plus I know the prices here might turn some people off. We got two drinks, two appetitzers, 3 sushi rolls and our total was a little over $100.00. Overall, I have no hesitation to come back here (if I want to splurge on sushi).

zeFwZkdQfRCZRYDvfcZEOQ.text: This is the first sushi spot I've hit up in Vegas and was not disappointed. Like 99.9% of places in Vegas it's a little pricey BUT everything was really fresh and delicious. The Yellowtail belly sushi was fantastic and they offer a variety of sushi and sashimi I don't get to see in San Antonio. I was really excited that I got to have an order of Uni and the rolls were just as wonderful. We had Katana Roll, White Lotus (our favorite of the 3), and Titan Roll. White Lotus and Titan roll were from the daily special menu.

kwkjS7LxyFBPPaE0XB1_kw.text: Best meal I have had in Vegas.  The wagu (American) beef skewers and wagu gyoza both excellent.  The three people at the table who got king crab fried rice all said it was excellent.  They also had Japanse wagu on menu although I did not try it.  No wait on a Monday at 6pm even with our party of 8.  Tuna tataki sashimi was fresh and not overcooked.  Wait staff attentive.    Great choice if you like sushi and even the non sushi afficiandos said they would come back.

Mswji8tQ_-pKQQOomKDAPw.text: Tofu was overrated but the wagyu on the hot rock was amazing! You can't get wrong with their fish and beef!

-MM_GBJvz4Us68vgxIHyQQ.text: This is one of our favorite vegas spots to grab sushi.  It has actually become a tradition! Everyone is always so nice and the service is great.  I always make a reservation as we are usually a party of at least 4+. We've never had to wait.  Moving onto the food. I stick to what I know and like. We get salmon sushi, albacore sushi, baked crab hand roll, spicy yellowtail handroll, ikura with raw quail egg (Kinda bland). Everything has always been fresh and delicious. The sake is great as well.  The shishito peppers were AMAZING! One of my favorite things about this place is the torch bday candle. Can't wait to be back again.

HLtiBnekuVQk3Q1_rAQRGQ.text: I had some time to kill after my meeting got out. Nobu wasn't open for lunch so I decided to give this place a try. I had the restaurants two signature dishes: a sashimi sampler that included Toro and Sea Urchen and a roll. Both were amazing. I capped it off with their signature cheese cake, which come wrapped in cotton candy and is lit on fire. Also very good.   I only gave it 4 stars because although the foot was good, my bill came to $100 with tip (with green tea and miso soup). I thought he price was a hair steep for what I got. But a great experience nonetheless.

iS4BFh2IEVvJb6TvEwV2Tw.text: First time here! Jenny the bartender was amazing.  It was only her second week bartending and she was off the charts with the service she gave. She was amazing. Made me the best drink.  Chatted with us about where we could go to golf.  Loved the service!   Then there was Carlos our waiter..he was so nice  And took his time explaining the food.  He spent time with us chatting about Vegas. Never made us feel rushed.   We will go there again and again because of Jenny and Carlos!

_iyrXHxD-2DleG1S99yKag.text: These guys lie about happy hour from 4pm-7pm and said there is none. Terrible business practice and 1 star for that. Food is decent though a good 3 stars.

eLlUJmW6MQOHBy6-_S7b5g.text: I took my best friend here when we came in town. We loved it so much. The staff was so friendly and made great recommendations. Courtney and Will were so great and brought our food out very quickly. Sushi Roku has an awesome view of the strip and a very tasty happy hour! I love bringing friends here when they come to visit because they always like the food and the service is always on point!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ch0aWV1-BsWUEOrO22eqeA.text: Sushi Roku was spectacular with their food and service! I mean, sure I don't eat sushi often and had a crazy strong hankering for some while scoping out the casino but that doesn't mean I'm biased! Proof? Very well eager Yelper.  First, the service. The ladies poised at the podium up front were all smiles and will be very quick to guide you to your seat. The lady at the bar was pleasant and helpful in her suggestions of what dishes were most popular (as well as her personal favorites).  Next, le food. Oh lawd. Each dish was elegantly plated, the food on the plates were excellent in quality and taste. I don't know how to put into words how happy the food made me. Turn to the pictures for a deeper understanding of what these morsels look like.  Finally, decor. VERY cool stuff. From the layout of the restaurant and seating, to the art on the bathroom - Sushi Roku made the food, the view, and the experience very much worth it! I'll definitely be back again.

GvuWKF-Et5TNG3a-mFjJcw.text: One of the best places for sushi in Vegas! Their toro is the bomb and their uni rocks, both of which are the measure of a good sushi place... this place more than measures up!

j4J0td6ctss9wizsiSAHXA.text: Hello everybody I'm a Vegas local girl and tonight, my husband and I went to celebrate the anniversary of Sushi Roku.  Everything went perfect, the food is always impeccable, except for one thing:  The service! We ordered a $43 small bottle of sake.  When we're almost done drinking (but still with some sake left in the bottle), we ordered a second bottle.  When he brought the second one, he took the first bottle without pouring the rest of it.  I stopped him and nicely asked him to pour the rest of the sake before taking it, and he got upset and poured the drink fast and said:  "you drink a lot!"  First of all:  Why does he care??????? My husband and I were shocked with the comment, specially when it comes to where this guy works. Vegas!  The sin city!! I should have complained to the manager but I don't like to do this kind of thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rude waiter!

2RAHErgJpyweQEV5OeJD0Q.text: Food was really good, however service was lacking. We chose to celebrate our anniversary here and felt super bummed it was acknowledged in no way. We have been to other places that go above and beyond to make the dining experience memorable when there for a special occasion. Too many great places in Vegas to go back here ever again. Would not recommend.

mXa3fp6hAfke2a5nBDu8yw.text: Beautiful restaurant? Check. Amazing service? Check. Mouth-watering food? Check, check, check!  To end our mini vacation in Vegas, my family and I selected Sushi Roku as our last lunch spot before heading home and we couldn't have chosen any better. Located in Caeser's, Sushi Roku is on the second floor and offers a marvelous view of the strip for your dining pleasure. Inside, there are plenty of tables and since we were grabbing a later lunch, we didn't have to wait long to be seated.  One of my BIGGEST regrets was not getting our waitress's name because she was absolutely amazing. Not only did she surprise us by busting out in Vietnamese, impressing my entire family with her clarity, but she also came by frequently to check on us and gave great explanations of each dish as they arrived to our table. Her service alone deserves five stars.  Portion sizes at Sushi Roku aren't too large so for a party like ours, nine people in total, it definitely meant ordering multiples. We chose a variety of dishes such as: yellowtail diced chiles, fluke kumquat sashimi, baked cod "saikyo-yaki," beef rib eye wrapped asparagus, spicy pork belly "kakuni" fried rice, the spider roll, and the Katana roll.   The yellowtail sashimi was mighty spicy, but mighty delicious while the fluke sashimi had a more refreshing flavor profile, thanks to the sweet kumquat. The beef rib eye was cooked on an iron hot stone, creating a sizzle that would make anyone's mouth water in anticipation. The meat was tender and the asparagus had a good crunch as well. The baked cod, however, was melt-in-your-mouth buttery and literally fell apart with the slightest touch. The miso sauce was sweet, but never once overpowered that delectable fish.  One of my favorite dishes was the kakuni fried rice with pieces of fatty pork belly. It is definitely not a waistline-friendly dish, but your taste buds will thank you profusely. The Katana roll was dressed in a creamy, spicy mayo sauce that added a buttery flavor to the yellowtail and spicy tuna while the spider roll was a bit more simplistic.   Because portions aren't too great, we all still had room for dessert so we ordered the yuzu creme brulee with green teen ice cream as well as the green tea tiramisu. My pick for the best dessert had to be the green tea tiramisu. It was an incredibly light and airy dessert that had you inhaling the whole piece without all the guilt. The matcha flavor was prominent and paired well the espresso layers. The yuzu creme brulee had a refreshing orange-like taste and the green tea ice cream was deliciously smooth.  With food of this quality, it's no surprise that breaking the bank is a must. But even though you won't feel stuffed silly, I'm certain you'll still remember every dish with fondness.   Sushi Roku is outstanding!

o61i_JlWz1Jizn4gKsgavA.text: Stopped by, had a couple of rolls, a bit of salmon nigiri and some tuna poke, a beer and sparking water.   Not bad, just like its franchise brethren here in LA, and one of the better sushi places in the Vegas hotels but at a price point that wont suggest you're actually in Tokyo.

QBKZesTn049hNxl3Urb36A.text: This was a tough sell considering we are from Seattle.   The restaurant itself was beautiful  The architecture and design of the eating areas was like a work of art.  The staff was very kind and we got our tea and appetizer right away.  We waiting a long time for our sushi dishes.  When they finally did arrive, it was not worth the wait.  The sushi did not seem fresh.  The flavors were lacking.  For a restaurant of this caliber in Caesar's, we were surprised.

t1r3DSOeA59SwPBaQWvjRg.text: Great lunch and even better service from our bartender, Jenna. I have to say that Jenna made our lunch extra special; she goes above and beyond to make sure that each guest is satisfied.  There are not many servers that really take an interest in their customers like Jenna. The food was amazing and we will definitely be back.

zZAubyisClwNeZ3dyK0Oyw.text: Lovely atmosphere and truly AMAZING sushi!  High quality sushi, created by knowledgeable sushi chefs.  The nigiri was perfection. Can't go wrong here; it's all delectable.   Our server was great too.   There was a large party dining at the same time and it did not affect the timing in our meal.

7Y4JqhXKd27mSgNva-dUjw.text: No reservations,no problem ,we can accommodate. That's what we all love to hear once in a while and that's exactly what we got when we came here.  As I was reading the menu I couldn't decide what to order,so I did my usual and started off with dessert. Chocolate volcano cake and the banana flambe. The chocolate cake was rich,moist,decadent and came with a scoop of ice cream that worked really well with it.The flambe was just like the name,simply  bananas.The next item I was eyeing,Pork belly with egg on top of spicy fried rice.If I could give a dead man walking a last meal,this would definitely be it.The pork wasn't to fatty and the egg actually help calm the spice of the rice to balance out the dish. Most of the sushi items were great but some them were not at room temperature and had a little to much ponzu sauce but that's just my tastebuds.  Overall this was a great dining experience and must  give them a 4.5 star rating.All points were hit I just feel they came up a little short on some of their items.Great ambiance and decor mixed in with chill eclectic beats make it a must if ones hanging out in Vegas and looking for a sushi spot.I am out,Peace

GNl2BkuMjf7--t9ad7RY8A.text: This restaurant was absolutely at the top of our most memorable experiences at Vegas, along with a few others. This was certainly my best sushi experience ever. My partner and I shared a few rolls and dessert together.. and I must say it is not an exaggeration that I had a culinary experience similar to that of exploding fireworks! We were thrilled (and disappointed at the same time) to pay the bill at the end.   I was particularly intrigued by the ability of the masters behind this food to capture these amazing smokey flavors in sushi that I had otherwise never experienced before.   I highly recommend going here for either a romantic experience for two, or for taking out your team for an amazing meal! You could certainly see that the patrons all fell between these two categories judging by the Expo name tags and dressed up couples.  We will definitely be back.

FkjHGpWBP4X84DwHuBXEKQ.text: We ordered a full spread of food and everything was tasty!!! We started off the the spicy edamame and miso soup. Soup only had 2-3 tofu pieces, but no biggie. Chilean sea bass--just do it!!! We ordered the pork belly fried rice (had 3 slices of pork) which had a little kick to it, but overall a tasty side dish. Veggie tempura. Pot stickers. For sushi rolls we had the crunchy spicy tuna w/ spicy mayo, and the white lotus. I like the white lotus better it had a more fresh spicy kick with the raw jalapeno slice on top!

uH4P25kK8_k6e70HOKSD9g.text: One of the best meals I had in Vegas. Menu had nice variety of Japanese items other than sushi. Our party ordered ramen, pork belly fried rice, katana rolls, California rolls, poke, and the wagyu beef. Everything was fantastic, nothing was a disappointment. Quality of fish was top notch plus I really appreciated how the katana roll wasn't swimming in spicy mayo. The wagyu beef was amazing.   It was perfectly seasoned on the outside and had a soft buttery rare center that melted in your mouth. One of the items we ordered was out so they substituted with a rib eye wrapped asparagus which was delicious. Our toddler enjoyed the vegetable tempura and the noodles from the ramen. Service was great; they were very nice to us with young kids in tow. This place is worth every penny.

-Q-_H4Yocuu7si4D-GqGLQ.text: Come for happy hour! It's the perfect timing to eat before going to a show. 4-7pm. Good sushi and appy selection that's half price. Their HH is more about the food than drink. Limited selection of lower priced drinks and cocktails aren't part of the deal at all. Surprisingly good little deserts for $4.   Their sushi is much better than your average place. Very fresh with tender rice makes it worth it whether you're paying half or full price. The menu is pretty traditional. No weird combo rolls here. Just great quality. The creativity on the menu is in the hot and cold appetizers. Yum.  One bummer thing is their cocktails. Don't bother. I tried 2 - a ginger lychee mojito where I couldn't taste the ginger and the lychee and mint were served as garnish and not in the drink. So this drink was a rum and lime where the lime was a tart mixer. I don't like like my cocktails deconstructed thanks. So I tried a different drink...Cant remember the name but it was supposed to be a spicy vodka lime cocktail. Again the drink came deconstructed with the chili skewered on top as a garnish so the drink itself wasn't spicy. The lime was so tart I asked for simple syrup to sweeten it up and make it drinkable. Insult to injury, both the drinks came in short glasses with one huge ice cube that took up almost the whole glass do you couldn't possibly mix in the 'deconstructed' drink components. Avoid the cocktails!  Stick with the food.

qI6KDWWBclaJ6IjN64ihMw.text: This is one of the best happy hours in Vegas - amazing selection of happy hour rolls and yummies! Great atmosphere, amazing service, and fun and hilarious bar tenders - my friend and I shared 3 rolls, 2 apps, 2 desserts and 2 glasses of wine each and it was very affordable!

3a7QV2dfv8_OPkcvYKiZmg.text: Dined here on a Mon night with an 8pm reservation. Sushi Roku wasn't overly crowded so we probably didn't need a reservation, but always safe to make one just in case!   Split two apps (between 2 ppl) - the asparagus wrapped beef which comes on a hot sizzling stone and the tofu 3 ways. I do not like tofu, but this tofu was out of this world. We then split salmon sashimi, the katana roll, and an eel cucumber roll. The katana roll was SO good, but pricy. We each got dessert too - mochi (3 ways) and the smore's. Definitely enjoyed sushi roku but felt that it was overpriced.

Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu 3 ways
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon sushi

gjiKfrRbfdTmoJJpPsFQDg.text: I try to check out Sushi Roku when ever I'm in Vegas and down at the Forum Shops.  Sushi Roku always has excellent sushi and wagyu beef.  The sake selection is also top shelf and they have one heck of a happy hour.  You should take the time to check them out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j0JMVriR2U12SwHPcpFgAg.text: This place has a beautiful view of the strip! I have been here before a couple of times. I started with some Okunomat Sake for $35 for me and my husband to share. That was my first time trying it and I loved it. I then ordered the "Avocado Hanabi" for $15. It is a cube of greasy fried white rice topped with Avocado, it needed some kind of sauce and crunchy topping. I also tried the "Katana Roll" for $23. Again it was good, but just wasn't amazing. Overall, 5 stars for view, 4 stars for service, 3 stars for food.

Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skewer
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado Hanabi $15

8RUTND_3bCCufNguh_nR6A.text: Definitely one of the highlights in my trip in Las Vegas.  The seared salmon with ponzu sauce melted in my mouth & I loved it. The Wagyu skewer was cooked to perfection... and it was very tasty. We also had the salmon nigiri, wagyu gyoza, a handroll, & pork belly fried rice. The pork belly was delicious.  Overall, this place is one of the finest sushi place I've ever been to. I really liked the interior as well. Service was great, so that's definitely a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

unWQorCspOnQefupjL8m-Q.text: Great view and the spicy tuna crispy rice is an all time favorite. Also the baked crab hand roll.   Frat drink menu. Overall I don't think it will disappoint :)

i8ZIMotdmuogWeygiPhSiQ.text: Titan and Senshi rolls were very good.  Also enjoyed the Everything Zen cocktail.  The ambiance was very nice for a Thursday night.  Perfect view of the strip.

VcTfar68Bo2bTO6qKbbFvA.text: I let my non-Yelping brother-in-law select where we would have dinner on his final night in Las Vegas, and his choice, Sushi Roku, did not disappoint. He doesn't eat sushi but his lady and I both love it, and we all left Sushi Roku very happy with our meals.  Sushi Roku is located on the third floor of The Forum Shops at Caesars Palace, almost directly above the valet (so really easy to find). The space is sleek and sexy, and we had a great view of the Strip from our booth. Service was excellent all night;  patient (we are a chatty group and I think our waiter must have come back to take our order 5 times before we decided on anything) accommodating to special requests and able to answer the plethora of questions we had about the menu.   Highlights from our meal would be:   Brussel Sprout Chips with truffle oil - addictively delicious  Spicy Pork Belly Fried Rice - My brother in law was so in love with this dish he had the waiter bring out another order before he was even halfway finished. He was kind enough to share the pork belly which was absolutely divine.  American Wagyu Beef Skewer - The pork belly stole the spotlight, but this skewer was a close second. Melt-in-your-mouth deliciousness.  Albacore Sashimi - Super fresh and served with a nice, light ponzu sauce  I didn't see the check so I can not tell you what our meal set us back, but based on how happily my brother-in-law paid it, our meal was obviously worth every penny to him and that's all that really matters to me. I will absolutely return to Sushi Roku in the future,

X70xFt5vEspjFCRQv-UiaA.text: Sushi Roku in Vegas is not exactly a great option for sushi IMHO. The food here is ok, a bit on the pricey side for what you get as nothing really stuck out for me as good nor recommendable. The establishment itself is fairly nicely decorated and has a decent location within the forum shops overlooking the Las Vegas strip. The ambiance is pretty cool with nice decor and quite a functional layout. The cuisine and service however just didn't do it for me and there are several better options for sushi consumption in Las Vegas.   Pros- Nice location  Ambiance  Great sake selection   Cons- Below average food  Small portions  Somewhat confused staff  Price per portion ratio is not great  Lacks any sort of "wow" factor for the price point

LAzraSC61XOj3N6br6Oiyg.text: I hate shopping because it makes me hungry. So, after a half a day of shopping at Forum Shops, we went to Sushi Roku. They have big tables and couches so you're not cramped/ feeling claustrophobic.  Since we weren't terribly hungry, we only ordered a few rolls/nigiri ($7-22 or market price): black truffle tempura handroll, salmon, albacore uni and tuna. We also ordered from the specials menu ($6-90). With a glass of Riesling in hand, we got...  Yellowtail-wrapped Foie Gras with Truffle Soy: My eyes automatically scope out "foie gras" and "truffle" and send a signal to my taste buds that I'm about to have something amazing in my mouth. So amazing that my hands did not get a signal to take pictures. You'll just have to try it to know how beautiful this is. 5/5  Robata Style Japanese Wagyu Beef with Hawaiian Pink Salt: You get a nice presentation of your skewer on its own robata grill and a spoon with pink rock salt. The wagyu is tender and fatty - feels nice on the tongue. The pink salt accentuates the flavor of the wagyu. 5/5  Scallop and Foie Gras Togarashi with Black Pepper and White Truffle Oil: It's like a re-run of the first dish I had except this time, I got distracted by the black pepper taste. The scallops were perfectly cooked. 4/5  Blue Fin Tuna Sushi: The fish was at the right temperature. The texture of the rice was just right. The fish to rice ratio was perfect. 5/5  Black Truffle Tempura Handroll: This is wrapped in a thin soy paper. There's avocado inside. The truffle flavor is in the sauce. 4/5  The service was excellent. Our server was attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Robata Wagyu Beef Skewer with Hawaiian Pink Salt
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni nigiri and salmon nigiri
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops with Foie Gras and White Truffle Oil

Bp-sXaRTdoZgHY6iGR9feg.text: This place is one of my fave sushi restos eva!  The highlights are the Japanese bier selection and a place that serves ankimo (monkfish liver)  We had at least 4 servings of the sashimi version.  The rolls were amazing.  Don't worry about price as it's worth every penny.  Next time, i'm going to try the omakase menu as i'm sure it will be off the chain!

YBm60bTZNnBVO8ltZA8uBA.text: Loved this place! Such a neat location, overlooking the strip, and very kind servers/hostesses. The sushi was delicious and I would love to come back!
