-UWssUrPgrGjayXYqm4V8Q.text: Nice restaurant all the time we come to Vegas wait over there with a friend with a family where they get the seven is the weather is amazing the guys over there is very good the food is very good and I enjoyed to eat over there I'm going to arrive to Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3YN1sAAns-THgJXmnXj9xw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas.  I love the chic atmosphere, the fresh sushi, and the great views of the Strip.  Wonderful spot to people-watch.    Tip:  The $19 lunch specials are an excellent value.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WsVdNoldffICWAjZwAwPwg.text: Roku is one of the best places in Vegas. The omakase was unbelievable. The uni was incredible! Everyone here is the nicest person imaginable. Just an all around wonderful place to have dinner. The view isn't bad either.

gTAZv-WpXo6-xW-tw3Ah1g.text: TOTALLY COMING BACK HERE!!    My absolute favorite thing to order here is the SPICY TUNA CRISPY RICE! It was soo good i ordered two! MMM dreaming about it as I type.  I ordered the bento box too from the lunch special. BLACK COD and SHORT RIB? HELLLLL YESS!! I loved everything in the bento box! EVERYYYTHING :))) I would totally order this again! The miso soup was delicious too!  The people working here were reallyyy nice and the view was incredible! I am definitely coming back here and I am excited about it! YAY!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tuna crispy rice is my faaaaaav

Zdjuo1rSAgASqDyp-09KzQ.text: This is by far one of the best Sushi restaurants that I've visited in Las Vegas.  This service was absolutely phenomenal from the wait staff, bartenders and the chef going around and meeting everyone.  The atmosphere was cozy and intimate and although on a busy work dinner, we were still relaxed in this environment.  Also, you must try the dessert!!!

_fZAt_fe8k6LMq6Ys-Arcg.text: Amazing happy hour menu. The service at the bar was actually great and it didn't really feel like "bar food or service".... the bartender made sure to clear our plates fast, kept our drinks refilled, and engaged in conversation. Food was fast yet very tasteful and satisfying. Wanted dessert but didn't have any room left to eat lol. Definitely try the glazed shrimp, SIMPLY AMAZING! I ordered 2 servings!!! Will definitely return on my next Vegas trip!!

juyuQFVoNKKFSSNzXOnzrA.text: Geat happy hour spot! $6 cut rolls $4 hand rolls and $4 donut holes filled with chocolate served with vanilla and carmel dipping sauces! Great atmosphere and nice view if you get a good seat

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 donut holes filled with chocolate served with vanilla and carmel dipping sauces! Great atmosphere and nice view if you get a good seat!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great happy hour menu! $4hot sake  $6 cut rolls $4 hand rolls! The rolls are delicious I got the sjimp tempura and asparagus

XN5SyRqQNJPc7fL5rB9y3w.text: We had dinner here on 01/13/17. Place is very hip and comfortable with lots of people enjoying dinner and celebrating occasions (make a reservation). Service was decent. Took a little bit for the waiter to get to us, but was still okay.  We ordered lots of different sushi rolls and shared them among our table of four, that seems to be the best way to go. My favorites and biggest standouts were the Shishito Peppers (so good), the Black Cod is jaw-dropping, blow-your-mind delicious and also loved the Crab Dynamite Sushi Roll.   We would not hesitate to eat here again.

I6BEQJWXVL4R3dd_5lFEog.text: Ok let me start by saying we eat alot of fresh sushi, we salt water fish, we have been to 4 countries eating sushi so this is an educated sushi review. We have noticed alot of sushi restaurants are Phillipino owned and operated however if the fish is DNA real and the knife is sharp we eat.   A few years back we searched best sushi in vegas just to test the area. We figured VEGAS being VEGAS the who's who would eat sushi. I don't recall the name my wife found but it was behind an escalator down a hall across from a sports bar, it was a True hole. This place was unbelievable great. 6 years later we did same search as our daughter (9) loves sushi everyone and there mother has a sushi restaurant.   My wife picked Roku. We sat down and it was a typical restaurant  other to flashy but sushi bar was awesome long and chef's were very visible. I scanned the menu and wow the prices were outrageously high like Toro was 26$, Halibut was 18$, saki by the glass Nigori super $$$ and it was a small glass. We decided to stay and try it is got Albacore, Halibut, Toro, seaweed salad, saki. The Toro was old and mushy, Halibut was tail ends and chewy if you know Halibut you would know this was awful and a cheap cut, the Albacore was very thin and almost white. My son got typical spicy tuna rolls and 1 lobster hand they were TINY. My wife well same. Daughter well same. Our bill usually runs 100 to 125 locally and we're treated like royalty I'm talking everything from desert being free to chef compliments in sushi. Roku was 345$.   We were thinking wow like we didn't get the special water or anything. We watched another family gorge and fancy water for the kids and this roasted marshmallow desert. Another family looked to be locals sat. Started ordering and we thought man we must be cheap or over our heads nope. The waitress brought all kinds of fancy things and the mom said he'll no we drink tap water, get drunk before you come in, and order cheap. I asked her why just go to a different place she said they work near by. By the way we came here at 630 and the place was empty. When we left we talked to a guy that ate at the bar and he too said the most expensive fish he has ever ate.  So if your in the mood to look important and spend but get average fish this is the place.

C0kTNrAx5r3FRFYeyF5Acw.text: So I was just here at you would expect great service for someone from out of town . I received garbage service along with terrible looking rolls . If your looking for delicious sushi at an amazing price visit El Paso Tx . Danny at makoto will serve you delicious sushi with fresh fish

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Visit makoto sushi in El Paso ex better service and the best sushi not garbage
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Visit makoto sushi in El Paso ex better service and the best sushi not garbage
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Visit makoto sushi in El Paso ex better service and the best sushi . Not garbage

hj9XLToVFbKptz4NX_NsnA.text: This place is located at Cesar's forum shops.  It is a really cute small space with modern decor.  I went there for happy hour with a friend and they have a decent menu.  We were greated right away and sat at the bar because we wanted happy hour.  There were hot and cold appetizers, sushi, sashimi and desserts to chose from.  Wine and cocktails were 5 dollars i believe.  We ordered the spicy scallop role, the spicy tuna roll, the calamari and the albacore sashimi. Everything was really good.  My favorite was the albacore.  It came with crunchy onion bits and they gave you really decent size pieces for 5 dollars.  The fish was tender, fresh and delicious.  The calimari was good too.  Squid was really small so it was a little over-fried.  I wanted more of a chewy texture.  Came with a sweet plum sauce to dip.      The rolls were really good too.  I really liked the spicy tuna.  The bartender told us to order it with rice paper because she likes it so much better and we did.  It was alright..and we got charged a dollar extra for it.  But the fish was good and their sauce was more than just sriracha.  I also liked the spicy scallop roll but it was not as fresh as I hoped it to be.  A little too much mayo in it too.    Drinks were good as well.  We ordered wines and they have good house selections for the price.  I would definitely come back for happy hour and for their regular menu.  Place is not crowded at all so it will be quite easy to get a table if you don't go at a prime hour.  Can't wait to visit again!

ZmaTDFE3QYmJPgDromidAg.text: Yummmmm.... sushi was awesome!!! We sat at the sushi bar so we got to see them create our plates along with everyone else's. It was super cool to watch!! Would definitely go back

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hJcO1ycCldS_r5PWNmJA-w.text: Recently my husband & I returned to Vegas & made sure to eat again @Sushi Roku! It is absolutely delicious. Tucked away @ Cesar's Palace. Endless menu & made to order. We prefer to sit @ sushi bar, engage chefs & watch them make our dinner right in front of us for a full experience. Sushi Roku will not disappoint. I do recommend making a reservation & maybe next time we'll check out Happy Hour, I read prices are great! Till next time Sushi Roku!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers Sushi Roku!

_fkux8P70X7olfcNo8I0bw.text: We made reservations to come here for dinner. It seemed like a high end sushi place. I had the organic salad and spicy miso. I enjoyed the spicy miso. And that organic salad is definitely organic. We had the hanabi "crispy rice" for appetizers and you definitely should try it. It's really yummy. As for the sushi. I wasn't super impressed, but it was good. Usually I stay for dessert at restaurants, but I felt like the atmosphere made me feel uncomfortable. It felt like the workers were a little judgmental, as if we didn't have money to eat there or tip. Which is unTrue. I would never go to a place and not have money for either. So ya I didn't get to try their desserts.

Kp8ASO8YLEfTqsnS2uuekg.text: We love this place! We have visited each of the last 4 times we have been in Las Vegas and it has yet to disappoint us. They have an excellent happy hour with some great sushi deals (currently 30% off their specialty rolls). This time we ordered a spicy scallop roll which was so good we ended up getting two, as well as a California roll, which was also excellent. We also got a couple of their apps--ribeye wrapped asparagus and brussels sprouts with bacon. All of them were DELICIOUS. We sat at the bar and the lovely bartender was attentive and friendly but not obnoxious. The place can be a little hard to find as you wander through the mall from Caesar's Palace (it is up on the third floor), but it is well worth the hunt. The decor and ambiance are great, and if you sit out by the windows, you get great strip views. I highly recommend Sushi Roku!

trvLx1BNdWirCCQW0rc0nw.text: I ate here with my husband. The prices were standard for Vegas. The restaurant is in the mall and somewhat open to the shoppers. We had lunch without reservation at 2p and were seated without issue. The service was fast. I would recommend the tuna sashimi Carpaccio.

yoRPZYwjIB-BK1IUktFLNA.text: Went to Sushi Roku for dinner last week with some friends and family, I frequent this place often for lunch when I'm in town.  This was the first time I've actually been there for dinner.    Our dining consisted of the following items:  Appetizers (compliments of the host):  Filet Mignon Asparagus w/Soy Mirin Sauce 16 This was ok, didn't leave a lasting impression on me.  Japanese Yellow Tail Sashimi w/diced chilies 17 The Yellow Tail is a must have.  The fish was fresh and melts in your mouth.   KaraAge with Cilantro Mayo 12 The chicken was prepared just right and with the cilantro mayo, it was quite yummy.  Rolls: Shima Roll: Shrimp wrapped Spicy Tuna w/Cilantro & Avocado 18 This roll was quite heavenly.  Entrees: Grilled Fillet Mignon w/homemade Terriyaki Sauce and Mashed Potatos 36 The fillet mignon was tender and cooked to perfection.    Chilean SeaBass w/Truffle Miso Glazed and Sauteed Spinach 28 The seabass was pure perfection, cooked medium w/the truffle miso glaze... My mouth waters just thinking about it..  Sauteed Salmon & Hokkaido Scallops; XO sauce with Asparagus & Potatoes 26  The presentation of this entree was pretty cool.  The fish and scallops were cooked just right.  Desserts: The Chocolate Volcano Souffle was quite delectable.    I was surprised with a some sort of Fruit Cup Birthday dessert which had blackberries, carmelized bananas, strawberries, and raspberries.    The ambiance and decor is quite appealing. As always the service is impeccable.  I would like to thank Kenji for being such a wonderful host and great dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yellow tail sashimi w/diced chilies
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chilean seabass w/truffle miso glazed
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my bday suprise.. fruit cup of some sort

HKkBwK7-dBiTPOd5lfXWQA.text: Top notch service all around! Food was all good but I can't say that I was truly blown away by any of it. Nothing to complain about at all if you're looking for good sushi and a good atmosphere!

MpHQsQErcdJubNxQwWHVDw.text: Have been here twice and love their selection of sushi and sushimi. On this trip we tried Octupus and a sushimi combination. Fantastic. The curry sushi we ordered exploded with flavor with each bite. And the crab fried rice may have been among the top 3 fried rice dishes we've ever had. Delicious.

YhSMjeeaKSaiySgeGCq7ng.text: Consistent, fresh quality fish.. I like that they don't drown their sushi in sauces .. Very clean and all about the fish ... On the downside it's extremely pricey.. dinner was $150 for me and my hubby.

9FYOENXV4gg-AqWby1RBQA.text: After incurring sufficient gambling losses, getting the lunch combo seemed like the smart choice. Too bad it wasn't. I had the beef teriyaki and sashimi combo. While you get a good amount of food for the price, the quality was lacking. The meat was too chewy and gristley. The sashimi was OK and nothing spectacular to rave about.   However, the a-la-carte items were phenomenal. My friend ordered the premium homemade tofu three ways, one with black truffle, one with caviar and lemon oil, and the last with scallion and sesame oil. Tofu was silky and smooth and almost hard to grab with your chopsticks as it would break into pieces when you grabbed a hold of it.  I ordered the chicken karaage with cilantro mayo. I enjoyed the light crispy coating surrounding the meaty pieces of chicken. The cilantro mayo was a nice condiment but I didn't notice the flavor of the cilantro too much despite the light green color of the mayo.  Service was good, except for the server for getting my order of Sprite so I had to ask for it again. At least she came by later and gave me a refill when I didn't ask for one.  Lesson learned this time, Sushi Roku. I'll be back to try more of your delicious a-la-carte items. Hopefully with more money to spend.

y2jfX7FJWx_6MXCUB3N5bg.text: EXCELLENT! You must come to Sushi Roku while in vegas. The food is perfection, the GM is first class all the way, and service is spot on. This restaurant is in The Forum Shops at cesars. It has great views of the strip. I was there this Friday and everything was beyond amazing. Great for late night dinning. Thanks Sushi Roku Vegas team.

EVL1nY4ssM_IirBOKKV8UQ.text: I love this place. Very friendly inviting staff, the ambiance is great and u have a view of the strip. The sushi is fresh and always good as well as the choice of sake.

bV8nVRjkjDQZF4ORQl7M2A.text: Yum! Summer picked Sushi Roku for her Vegas birthday celebration dinner and I'm so happy that she did! The six of us were seated at an awesome round table with a super view of the Las Vegas strip.  We started with a large order of sake-bombing materials (two of the six were sake-bombing virgins!) and a couple of the signature cocktails. I tried the lycee mojito which was good but not lycee-y enough and the other girls loved the tropical peach passion and lycee martini.   We ordered a wide variety of dishes to share and for personal consumption. I liked the crispy chicken appetizer with yummy dipping sauce and the spicy tuna and california rolls. I usually love eel sushi but our eel was overly fishy. Summer tried a signature roll with tuna, cilantro, and more which was yummy though wasabi-infused and spicy! The salty edaname were also very good and Rachel couldn't stop raving about the sea bass main dish.   Our sweet waitress gave us a complimentary birthday sake jug and a fun mini-birthday celebration of molten chocolate cake and a crazy sparkler. For about $65 each, we all left satiated and ready to party!

OMHtgbK738cpSEQV5OBYWg.text: As good as it gets, We had a party of five and were treated like royalty, Combo of servers kept the food and drinks coming. We shared sushi rolls and they even worked in the timing for our person that ordered a steak. Rolls were excellent and the servers helped suggest a few new ones for round two, a bit of a shock when the bill came because it was lower than expected.

td4CfgwQIxWIdTXugGCIpg.text: The food was horrible.  Do not go here.  The only thing that was decent was the beef teriyaki and seaweed salad.

DnHJcKbRD1PzXPMWWUUuGQ.text: Pleasant atmosphere, stunning view, the staff is ultra friendly and helpful, and they'll do a huge portion of their menu gluten free!! This the first time ever that I have been able to order gluten free spicy tuna.  Also their sashimi is melt in your mouth good!

3Y3grWE_4phj3q0Zi2tkAQ.text: Great Sushi. Some of the best I have had in Vegas.  Very creative in their Rolls. Love there Lunch Bento Box. Great portions and very tasty presentation.  The only thing they need to work on is getting the food out quicker.  Lunch took a little longer than it needed to be.  However the manager was excellent about fixing the situation.  Definitely a place I would go back too.

LtXBas2KO40gzxQwYPgaYQ.text: I thought this place was overpriced and the service was definitely lacking.  I have a food allergy to avocado and they treated me like a leper.  One of the items on the lunch sushi special was a california roll, which without avocado is a simulated crab roll since they apparently don't have cucumber on them here?  Anyway, it was my birthday and we paid more than $40 for lunch here...I felt like I wasted my money though they did give me a cool sparkler and sing happy birthday with a cool dessert...that was the only thing that got them up to two stars.

7S9QKs8CdjOQFuUTBQ4pZQ.text: Setting is beautiful, service is great, food is delicious.

G7ued-sttxS2-2QjCNyCpA.text: Stay away. For being moderately expensive I was expecting good sushi but all that came was mediocre one.

UoZmyuRkolSA-CUc7cp--Q.text: Service was great!!!   Food was good.  Now I understand the difference between normal mackarel and japanese mackarel.  Japanese one is better.  Portion sizes were very very very small.  We ordered the Omakase, and left hungry.  Had to stop at I *Heart* Burgers at the Palazzo shops to fill up.  So, go for a snack, not a meal.

GbnGyQxYKMu8om1Ksh7ndQ.text: Great sushi in Vegas..not a prime location, but if you go for happy hour (until 7 M-TH), the prices are super reasonable. I recommend the tuna tataki app, fried mushroom app, filet wrapped asparagus and spicy tuna roll. Note, you have to sit at the bar to get happy hour prices. Def give this place a try!

miwNVgzsx-KnYmP91ebgkQ.text: I stumbled upon Sushi Roku on the 3rd floor of Caesar's Palace. This place has a cool decor and an amazing view of the strip from the dining area. I wasn't too hungry when I stopped by, I just grabbed 1 roll, the Katana Roll. It was a solid but pricey choice. Actually it was quite delicious but no better than sushi I could get back at home for half the price. Still you don't go out in Vegas for value eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katana Roll

UvkgxBCfTdndBH6H4QTEJA.text: Tuna Carpaccio and tuna tataki sushi was fresh and delicious! Celebrated a birthday here! Friendly wait staff and sushi chef! Highly recommended!!!

oJR6Q0FLdCiZ4CtqeXw3bA.text: While I would opt for Nobu if I could, Sushi Roku is a GREAT second choice in Vegas. I come here every time I visit. The sushi is fresh and delicious. I generally never have to wait for a seat. A touch on the pricey side - but it is Vegas. Order the tofu steak as an appetizer. Overall a huge fan. I've also been to the Sushi Roku in Pasadena - like the one in Vegas better.  UPDATE: Went back again today for lunch. The Uni and Hotate was awesome. Love the consistency...

Q0HDehh3NmvbEYXrpcDs5w.text: Very nice setting, very plain sushi.  I had heard so much about this place. I gave it a shot and ordered some of their best stuff. Very very boring, very plain. The fish quality is superb, but at these prices it better be. But in terms of being creative, having a vast list of fish, etc -- not there. The jalapeno white tuna roll sounded interesting and it turned out plain awful. After the waiter saw I was not enjoying it one bit, he asked if it was ok and I said I dont like it at all and he started explaining why it is a creative fusion dish. A high class place would have taken it away and brought me a miso soup at the least to cleanse my palate.   Poor service, nice ambiance, ridiculous prices. If that is what you like, check it out.

zAzJHg1Va5XYCX6GYyfFHw.text: Good quality sushi a little heavy on the wasabi. But for me very overpriced but I guess that's Vegas.

xTj4Imw0i7_A4KpqtMHKjw.text: We went with our kids and it was good.  The kids thought their rolls (California roll and tuna roll) were just ok.   We loved the roll we had and the sushi sampler.   The location is good, the view is great and the wait staff was very good.     The prices are definitely on the high end but overall it was a good night out.

MFJra_OFVE_yDYxpeIU7kg.text: The flavors were great in the rolls we ordered, and it was very clear the quality of the fish was high and fresh.  However I wish especially in the specialty rolls that there was a better balance and variety in texture. When a roll is specially designed like that it is always nice for me to have an element of crispness or crunch that was not present in the majority of the sushi we ordered.  We had two of the gin specialty drinks in the menu and they were extremely refreshing!  Lovely, aromatic mixtures though the cucumber garnish was not in great condition.  Ambiance was nice -- competition with Tao it would seem.     Our server as well was sweet though it seemed he was a but overwhelmed... It took him a while to get our last roll to us, and he double checked with us on the order at least 5 mins after he should have already punched it in.  Overall,  I might not dine here again because it was extremely expensive, and I'd rather explore other Vegas options.

HogDbGKet4XOiVViTqtmSA.text: I really enjoyed our meal at Sushi Roku.  We were fortunate enough to make it for the 5 year anniversary and everything on the menu was 50% off, except for drinks!  It was an awesome deal and we took advantage of it.  During this Vegas weekend, I went to Sushi Roku, Okada, and Sushisamba....Sushi Roku was my favorite. The sushi rolls were awesome...I ordered all of the rolls my waiter recommended and the most expensive ones too.....heck it was 50% off!  They were all good, however, I wasn't a big fan of the lobster roll.    We did encounter some problems with service, however.  It seemed our waiter disappeared on us.  We ordered another round of drinks and it never showed up.  We asked another waiter to check on our drinks and she said it was coming soon...but still no drinks appeared.  We asked yet another waiter to find out about our drinks...finally the manager came and apologized and offered our round of drinks for free.  Since our round of drinks was offered for free,  we still enjoyed our time at Sushi Roku.  The food was awesome, drinks were great, ambiance was cool, but service is a little lacking. Okada had better service but I didn't think food was as good and I would prefer to go back to Sushi Roku next time I'm in Vegas.

p2pWJWVM9MO66ztO9_htZA.text: I live very close to a Sushi Roku in Santa Monica, California so its a bit strange that my first experience with the restaurant was so far from home (in the middle of the desert no less). On the brighter side, it was a business lunch so the price tag didn't hurt as much as it should have.  All in all, the food was really great. It wasn't the best sushi I've had, but it was pretty close.  I really dig spicy food, so the spicy tuna with jalapeos really hit the spot! Also had a "Shima Roll" which I highly recommend... spicy tuna, shrimp, soy paper, and hot sauce. Yummy!

cAYtIFlbeJc1XO2mSQ8V4w.text: J was dizzy from low blood sugar when we walked in. I was still stuffed from breakfast but I figured I'd have a nosh. She ordered a cornucopia of sushi (salmon, toro, one handroll with tempura shrimp and asparagus) that she devoured and was highly pleased with. I had the 'new' chicken salad and some mixed tempura (veg and seafood). Both were good but I really liked the chicken salad. The dressing is that sweet miso-y dressing you can some times get at some Japanese restaurants.     The service was really wonderful. Our waiter was highly attentive to our needs and my water glass wasn't allowed to be less than half full. We appreciated it.    The price was pretty high for a couple of women on limited budgets. My salad was $16 and the tempura was $12. I have no idea how much J's platter o'sushi was but it wasn't for the faint of heart. But you are paying for quality, not quantity.

Zq_XsErnZFJI0nZ5iFevdA.text: Best sushi I've ever had! My wife and I came here last night for our 1 year wedding anniversary. The service was excellent. The food was absolutely amazing. My wife made a reservation through yelp, mentioned our anniversary in the occasion section, and our server surprised us with an amazing dessert and champagne sparkler.  Couldn't have asked for a better anniversary dinner. Next time we come back to Vegas, we'll be making a point to come back to Sushi Roku.

1pngiTK_KmJOXbqG4EFhrg.text: I had some sushi. I had some sake. I had something with black truffle. Oh yeah, I had some seaweed salad too. Let me tell you, everything was delicious. That's all.

0ADXIUM7kueNgZPoKR9qAg.text: We ate at several sushi places while in Vegas, this one was the very best. Great ambiance, great server, fresh sushi. Crunchy tuna sushi was amazing. California roll with real crab and a special tuna roll with cilantro was awesome! I would go back to Vegas just to eat here

jqkxDm51pQ21DqdA8DBJwA.text: Awesome venue.  Music and mood is really fun.  Nice dark lighting, but still bright enough.  The food is good, but be prepared to get multiple courses.  The portions were a little small but expected in a great ambience like this.

XlJ9iuKc6mj6sXV_soagRw.text: Perfect location, great atmosphere, outstanding selection, stellar service. Each of the zillion items we ordered, was so good; and given all of the above, we did not at all feel it was overpriced. Will recommend and will return.

Nj_zN8AxztH1B_EJTXCdwg.text: LOVE THIS PLACE! The Katana roll is amazing! It is a little pricey but considering what my husband and I paid at Tao- it's not bad. The atmosphere is wonderful, very romantic and unlike Tao- we didn't have to yell to hear each other or feel like we were in a high school cafeteria. WE WILL BE BACK!

0wYGE4bT5zLc8JgloNLmCg.text: Japanese food + fine dining = usually not a logical mix unless we're talking omakase or kaiseki. However, Sushi Roku did a pretty good job of taking care of my friends' birthday dinner here.   Recommendation #1: Chilean sea bass with truffle miso glaze. Though it's listed as an appetizer it was big enough to be an entree.  Recommendation #2: Kurobuta kakuni. I ordered this for myself, but the rest of the birthday party descended on it like a flock of vultures before I even got a bite.  The plate came back to me with only the veggies and brown rice :( but I'm guessing the pork was really good?  I would recommend Sushi Samba at the Palazzo over Sushi Roku only because Samba has a more unique menu that imo is worth shelling out a few extra bucks for.  But if you're looking for more traditional Japanese flavors, Roku gives you more bang for your buck in a similarly high end setting.

DtWYSog0gC7z3bynZrEZCg.text: AMAZING!! My husband and I dined here for my birthday this past weekend and although I was at first let down by not getting a view seat due to a private party, the food more than made up for it!   We started with the Yellowtail Sashimi with Chilies appetizer which was recommended to us by our waiter after attempting to order the Crudo Roku sashimi tasting. He said it was much better, and it was actually a few bucks less so we took his advice and loved it! The chilies added a great flavor to the Yellowtail and the presentation was great.   We then moved on to the Shima Roll and the Albacore with Scallions cut roll. That Shima Roll...OMG...pure heaven!! I'm pretty sure it is the best roll I've ever had!! The combination of textures and flavors was pure perfection.  The avocado was so soft and ripe, the tuna was buttery and wonderful, and the cilantro and little dab of hot sauce added just the right amount of zing. The Albacore was also wonderful as were the subsequent items we ordered, the Live Halibut sushi and the Toro & Jalapeno Roll.  We enjoyed a carafe of sake during our meal and indulged in a few sake bombs before I finished with their wonderful Lychee Martini. I was then surprised with an awesome chocolate souffle birthday dessert! I was so stuffed already but managed to polish it off!   The service was great as our waiter was very attentive and friendly. Though the prices are indeed a bit high, I felt it was worth it for the wonderful food, ambiance and service. We look forward to coming back to Sushi Roku the next time we're in Vegas and will also make it a point to try out the other locations in LA next time we're up that way! We've dined at their Katana Restaurant in Hollywood (see review) and loved it equally as well!

7jdfxjunP3_O5wYEGP7Eew.text: Friendly great staff. Some of the sushi is good, and some average. It's pretty expensive. You can get a table with the view of the Strip. I had the Salmon which was good but just expensive. Lol.

Rr6sL4_gC_0fGLJ4ksKi1g.text: The ambiance of the restaurant was nice. There was an excellent choice of different foods in the menu. The chef's specials were delicious. The waiter was wonderful, we never had to look for him, he was very attentive to our needs. Overall, the dining experience was excellent and we would visit again. However, I would like to point out that when I made reservations through Opentable.com I had stated that this was a special occasion we were celebrating (my parents 40th wedding anniversary) and no-one had bothered to bring a special dessert (as others were receiving) with candles. This was disappointing that the note in my Open Table reservation to the matradee was not read. (We had spent well over $300 that evening.)

EhsQi_Qt-tx_KVTebTs3Dg.text: we got 3 rolls and they were some of the best we've had. the prices aren't too bad for sushi in las vegas. if you can get seated in the front, there is a nice view of the strip  when we went, there were 2 huge birthday parties that were extremely loud and disturbing. I am hoping that isn't an every day occurrence or i wouldn't want to return

d5zcTJ_APjuR0CYZMaNvEw.text: Sushi Roku was a great experience. We were seated and served so quickly. We had an 8 o clock friday night dinner reservation and although they were quite busy, many members of the staff made sure to take care of us. Highly recommend the cocktails and the makoto roll, so yummy. They also brought out a huge sparkler and decorated plate of desert for my boyfriend, as we were celebrating hid birthday.

11GaMNJz5UsELRvVExXHDQ.text: This was great!  Sea bass sliders, rib eye wrapped asparagus, and lamb chimichuri define the label of Japanese fusion.  Service was wonderful and a well earned 20%.  Ask for Juliana. So here it comes.  Al says; You gotta eat here.

PH4Tr0lCrV38oIH97qDSrQ.text: AMAZING.  Best Sushi I've had in Vegas so far. The Ambiance was beautiful, service was very friendly & food was top notch. I ordered the Katana Roll which was my favorite, the lobster roll was really great as well. And the toro? BEST TORO I'VE EVER HAD. My mouth starts watering even thinking about it now! & the great thing was, my boyfriend, who hates seafood, ordered the Ji Dori Chicken & loved it. If you're looking for a top notch sushi dinner with a romantic setting & nice view of the strip, this is the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Toro I&#39;ve Ever Had
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Roll
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katana Roll - Soooo Yummy

dlWrvlwWyKUlhEkNjWefJQ.text: Food was good, happy hour prices were a little steep for the quality of sushi. I got a simple California roll, and it wasn't too special, wanted cream cheese inside, she brought it to me on the side ? Argggggg. The waitress wasn't very attentive I was going to order a bottle of wine for the table, or at least a glass for me, and couldn't find her, you would think if we were the ONLY ones at the bar she would be able to help us 100%..nopppeeee. Maybe I should try something more innovative next time I may like it.

VZ9crXM_2h11XryftPGkiQ.text: Excellent sushi for happy hour. Daddy & I ate some rolls with soy paper. We had fun eating at the happy hour.

9_W2kM_MmwktprxqYk1uuA.text: I came here for a friend's birthday dinner. The best part about my experience here was the service. Our waitress was super sweet and awesome. She was helpful, made great recommendations, and even went over and beyond by asking her manager to print out some tickets we needed printed. She definitely went the extra mile. All of the staff was super sweet. The food was tasty (even with me not being a sushi person)! I got the crunchy spicy tuna roll and a side of the cauliflower. My only hang up is that it's super pricey. The cauliflower I ordered was $12. It was delicious, but it was the smallest portion. I expected a heftier portion for $12. The ambiance is nice with nice big windows for a good view of the strip! I tend to prefer more budget friendly places, so I would be interested to try their happy hour - which looked a little more budget friendly for someone like me!

37XUaxMDA4dvKWI2RTuXXw.text: Great happy hour specials and attentive staff. We like sitting at the bar during happy hour because the bartenders, Joy and Ryan, are so wonderful. Gary, the manager, walks around and talks to customers to make sure they're taken care of. All in all, great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple fusion cocktail and happy hour bites (from the top): mushroom tempura, Miso eggplant and brussel sprouts

vgU-HC6yLNaFeDTCiG1pIw.text: Fresh uni with a sashimi platter of the chefs choice was amazing. The saltiness of the ocean laid nicely on my palette with a cool and light sake to wash it down. This place is never a disappointment if you're on a quest for great seafood.

rBAoDllsJYqUUIlAFIo-xw.text: Amazing restaurant. We tried almost everything on the menu and it was delicious. Great atmosphere and it's not super loud so we can talk comfortably.   Highly recommended! Drinks were great too.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe beef

5koltBEgcADxM1SYQLmK0g.text: This was one of my two favorite restaurants this trip. Great ambiance. It is dark and semi-romantic if you want it to be with an awesome angle of the strip.  We did not have a reservation and were seating immediately by the window.  Our waitress was perfectly attentive and very helpful with recommending new nigiri for me to try when I was feeling adventurous. Pricing is not the cheapest I have had but it is more than worth the money.

mBkoEui8uIMqkbs__OnZlQ.text: We had reservations for New Year's Eve on our first visit to Las Vegas.  There was a $160/each omakase but we decided to order a la carte since it was way more food than we would want.  The first warning sign should have been that the restaurant is located in a mall, and the second that it is on the strip in Las Vegas.  The food was just ok but the prices astronomical.  For what we paid for the entire meal we could eat twice at the best sushi restaurant in Atlanta (which blows this place away).  Most annoying was the "Tofu 3 Ways"... It was 6 slabs of raw tofu taken directly from the package with 3 "ingredients" sprinkled on top.  I think one was caviar, one maybe scallions and I don't recall the third (it was that forgettable).  Really a 6 year old could assemble this dish with minimal adult assistance.  The shrimp tempura roll was fine but nothing special and small compared to what would be found at the average sushi restaurant.  The tuna carpaccio was good (for $26) but overpriced for what it was.  The seaweed salad was good and we also really enjoyed the king crab fried rice but beware that it does have some sort of hidden pork not disclosed on the menu.  Finally, while trying to enjoy a relaxing evening out, it's kind of difficult when the waiter is jacked up on something, and running around like a maniac.  Really, as we dined at this place, I came to realize the reality of Las Vegas, shiny and glitzy on the outside, but in reality built to draw in suckers.  However that's another review for another time.  Not recommended.

tUIwAi6UcxVt-4sWJRIRRw.text: Enjoyed the salmon nigiri and Toro jalapeno. Sushi chef was great!  From caesers walk into forum shops near food court  and hang a right at fountains. Kind of difficult to find the restaurant.

v0z85MzrLQUlN8H0M13ZgQ.text: Was excited to try Sushi Roku for the first time, and let me tell you I was NOT impressed and was very disappointed.  Customer service was great but the food, nothing to rave about.  If you come here, you are paying for the name.    We came here for lunch so it was a slow afternoon.  We got a table right away without a reservation.  Ordered a $6 miso soup (since I was feeling under the weather) and it sucked...nothing special for such an expensive soup. The tuna sashimi...delicious; the rolls....terrible and bland.  DO NOT come here for the rolls!  The drinks were just okay.  If you are looking for overpriced sushi, then come here.

PgtrcZxr5xWoh8hDeLBLcg.text: The best sushi in Las Vegas and probably the U.S.  The sashimi is flown in daily form Japan.  We came with a large group, gave him our price point per-person, and he brought out outstanding dishes.   If you like sushi, this is the place to eat it in Vegas.

F-CLz9npFFiK4XRyYy8YMg.text: Food was good.  Service was off the hook! Joy is the bomb!took care us us on our annual anniversary celebration. Even took care of hubby with warm salt water for post root canal. JOY IS THE BEST. Perfect for happy hour!

ehSI6VjdWSF6VlY59GLSOw.text: Awesome sushi!! The restaurant has couches at some of their tables which I thought was cozy. They have a separate gluten free menu and Tamari. The waitress we had was so wonderful, kind and attentive. They had a special king crab fried rice and they were able to modify it gluten free for me. I tried the baked lobster roll, which I didn't care much for, but the hand king crab rolls were delicious! My husband loved the shrimp tempura with jalapenos, something a little different. This place will definitely be added to our list for our next trip back!

1hKJqPn05RY9fkHeTj01ig.text: Exceptional service and even better food!! From the filets to the sushi. Highly recommend this restaurant!

_COnW7f-gKd9rPpVUteNmg.text: At Sushi Roko the Sushi was ok, albeit extra small portions, but what can you expect on the strip, probably never outstanding food quality and service.  The interior looks tired and needs some updating, especially most of the black wooden chairs that all need some serious attention.

nN8r_k_sMiP4pQk7M9EwUw.text: We had a great dinner here this past weekend.  The service was prompt and friendly and the food was incredible.  We all had a round of cocktails to start out and then ordered a ton of sushi.  I would highly recommend the Tuna Poke with wonton chips, it was a yummy appetizer.  We also tried a few different rolls and had AMAZING yellowtail sashimi.  I could've eaten the entire plate myself.  The only thing that wasn't great was the butterfish and I think it was just a personal preference.    It was my birthday weekend and they generously let me pick a dessert of the menu.  I tried the donuts which were filled with ganache and had dipping sauces with them.  It was probably one of the better desserts I've eaten in Vegas.  They also brought out a huge obnoxious sparkler with it which was fun!

mr0RT-X8hjqx-ICZoJDURw.text: Food is really soso.  I came with a hope that the precious 'low stars' were just occasional.  The fish is fresh.  Chef is nice (I sat at bar).  But that is about it.  Service is soso.  Waiter never came back after taking initial order.  Splash the $18 (5oz) sake on his trade, and did not say any.  Ordered the assorted sushi.  Rice too dry, no moist.  Not enough vinegar tan in my humble opinion.      Do not come with high hope.  Random sushi place in Japan would probably exceed this place.  PS.  Choose Nobu, similar price, much higher quality.  They're only open after 5pm.  Hence me being here sharing a friendly warning.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assorted sushi

Ha2fLBPyo79aUx6YUufXAQ.text: This Place is very good I love the food fresh very friendly very kind and I would always come here when I come to Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bYGomKBw9Pnz5PPKuRW6IQ.text: I went here for Restaurant Week and tried a combination of the offered menu and some of the other items on the menu.  The sushi was delicious, the specialty items were unique and tasty, and I would definitely come back again.  The service was also top notch!

i96pM7pLYrtGetnWZI9NiQ.text: Happened upon Sushi Roko when looking for lunch options with my boyfriend. The modern, zen-like decor beckoned us in. This place is hip, right in the midst of the strip with sweet views. Our server was very nice and extremely helpful. Gave us a run down on the sushi and offered great recommendations.   The sushi concoctions here are unique but a bit on the pricey side ($20-30/roll). We ordered the Katana Roll (spicy tuna and shrimp tempura on top of tuna and yellowtail), the Shima Roll and the Baked Lobster with Miso Sauce. The Shima Roll was excellent with a nice melding of flavors -- shrimp, spicy tuna, avocado and cilantro. The Katana Roll had a funky sauce drizzled on it -- not a big fan. My boyfriend loved the Lobster Roll -- generous pieces with a mouth-watering taste.   Sushi Roko is a nice choice for couples, friends or large groups.  The atmosphere is fun, hip and elegant. Just be prepared for a big lunch/dinner tab. Our lunch bill topped $100 with no alcohol and I still had a little bit of an appetite when we left. Awesome sushi and vibe though!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QxrIyaShxTnoA49bERWkJw.text: We got the shishito peppers, yellowtail dice chilies, hanabi, spicy pork belly fried rice, and uni udon. The hanabi was perfect. The spicy pork belly fried rice was ok but a little too sweet. Uni udon was not what we expected and more like Alfredo but tasty.

K7IwrE9eBLY3R4Wen8FOmw.text: DESSERT.  I know, I know, it's a sushi restaurant - the fish dishes were great and the service was topnotch.  But what stood out to my boyfriend and me was the last part of our meal.  His three Pate Choux were filled with different-flavored housemade ice creams accompanied by a small cup of melted chocolate; each was unique and we loved these light and airy puffs!  My rice tuile cup filled with mango, green tea, and sesame (?) seed ice creams resting on a bed of delicious apple pie filling was FABULOUSLY inventive and pulled together very well!  Presentation of these dishes was artistically appealing.  Loved the vibe.  Beautiful, romantic night scene of the Strip played out before us from the large picture windows, and we were seated Monday night at one of the cushy tables along the opposite wall (which can fit 6), so BOTH of us were able to look across the entire dining room and out through the windows.  The space was much bigger than it looks from the entrance inside The Forum shops.  All I can say is the sushi dishes were outstanding.  Delicately displayed, each plate contained quality, fresh ingredients, and it all tasted as good as it looked (we ordered 3 dishes before the dessert).  Sure, everything is a little pricey, but what isn't along the Strip?  At least this one was actually worth it.  Service was excellent; in fact, the best I experienced at any food establishment in Las Vegas during our time here in Sep 2012.  We were seated right away even though we were 20 minutes earlier than our reservation, and our server and team were coordinated, quietly friendly, and discreetly responsive.  There were no pretentious airs.   I would not hesitate to go there again and give it my full recommendation.

kr_qH5gXyWDetL6H3t0OPQ.text: Very good sushi. GREAT view. Good service... all of the recommendations my waiter made were great.  favorite dish was the tuna w/ cilantro and shrimp roll. delicious.

1MhtsfE5D9ZPMBMQw_T9fg.text: I went here for their happy hour, which really cannot be beat for good sushi on the strip. House Chardonnay was $5 and was very smooth & drinkable. $4 hand rolls: the spicy tuna was just okay, but the AB4 fusion was the bomb.com. I'd also order the popcorn shrimp with miso glaze again ($6). You have to sit at the cocktail bar to get the HH specials which was no problem, besides the 10 bar stools there is a separate long table with maybe 15 seats that also counts as the HH area. Staff was great and the place was pretty empty, so service was super fast.

c7Hyu96Uw0BYJNY53BhtOw.text: Because the buffet at the Flamingo I'd originally chosen to go to had closed that day for remodeling (lucky me), I had to find an alternative. I ended my search at Sushi Roku. I sat at the bar and my server, an inked young lady whose name slips my mind, cordially suggested their Happy Hour menu. I obliged and quite honestly, I had ten very good sushi rolls and a drink for around $15, a 1/4 of what they wanted for the buffet at the opposite end of the Palace. I had the spicy tuna and something with salmon. Both were fresh, not over spiced so much that you couldn't taste the fish, and a nice serving. Service was attentive, quick and spot on with the recommendation. I'll stop in here again if I get a Jones for sushi while on the strip. The lounge itself is rather nice as well and would make a quality spot for a dinner date too, if I had a date (groan...). Maybe next time.

o7zRjbWW0mW4Pa5RQGIrJQ.text: The view was nice! Food was okay. Spicy tuna hand roll had too much rice. Overall awesome atmosphere and great service!

DBeUGf7tvlCc7wzjV5ItSA.text: Ate here for lunch. Everything was delicious. Love the U-shaped booth seating. Super comfy..Our waiter was very friendly and put up with us changing our order a bunch of times. We randomly mentioned us celebrating our friend's birthday and to our surprise our waiter brought out a yummy banana flambe with a champagne glass filled with white sugar and a giant sparkler.   Although we enjoyed our meal, service, etc. there are so many great sushi places in town to try, so it might be awhile before we come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautifully done Banana Flambe dessert compliments of the waiter
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday Sparkler

YnMtdF-si1LibHn7swXwPw.text: I have been coming to this place for almost 2 years now and...I LOVE IT. Joy, Lauryn, Lisa and Ryann are AMAZING. Their entire staff has been more than accommodating. Overall the place has a great energy. I will continue to come here and I recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice environment and great food.

eltCeMNSdvvEHTv3cthiNQ.text: Went looking for a sushi joint in vegas, friend recommended the omakase (chef's special) for $95. It's a 6 course meal, but it was more like 6 bite meal. Altho fancy and each bite was tasty, we felt hungry when the dessert arrived. I personally wouldn't go back for the omakase, but maybe try something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster
Photo of Sushi Roku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omakase

foZ18MLXpCM96yWWpc99mg.text: I consider myself a sushi connoisseur and all around foodie.  This place was everything we hoped for and then some.  The vibe is ultra hip Vegas, inside of Caesars on the third floor of the Forum Shops.  We get there for our 9:30p reservations and promptly sat at a wonderful table with a view.  We wanted for nothing and the service was magnificant.    We had the Sparkling Blueberry Sake, amazing.  At $12 a shot we were a bit skeptical but it's so worth it.  We then ordered about 5 rolls in total but the two that stand out are, The Crab Dynamite, our FAVORITE and the baked lobster roll was a close second, just delectable.    There is nothing that I would have changed about this restaurant or experience and really glad it was recommended to us.

-2liV1PW-gXJKULHRyLI8A.text: Not worth the money you can find better sushi for better prices just trust me. Because there is no negative -1 star I have to settle with one star.

4Wj7cNtweO2yHAZrDMNkhA.text: The food was good but don't let them reccommend your Saki or just expect a very large bill. Certain things were very good others average but I have to agree very pricey but isn't most of the sushi places in Vegas?

E0MnNF8S4XwdPVW5Rr6mdg.text: The food had so much flavor! I'll definitely return; their happy hour was so worth it. 5 happy hour menu items for $27. My favorite was the mushroom tempura and Calamari.

JcyTkd0iqM85QjfGaxEbww.text: Unreasonably pricey. Crazy service fee. We weren't been clearly explained about the 20% fee in the bill. We had sashimi, wagyu beef, tempura, sushi and ended up paying $1500+ for a party of 9, plus a hard $300 service fee, which is crazy because we only ordered platters to share. The waitress was busy and we had to call on her a few times to order things. Not the best service around town but charging too high. Don't go there!

BThG_XJuw2QwTsgy5iKRUg.text: Sushi Roku is an excellent sushi restaurant, my favorite in LV, and one of my favorites in the USA.  You can fall into the trap that I always fall into- which is ordering a ton of the most expensive sushi- but you can also take a more reasonable path and eat lunch specials, omakase plates, etc, and you will save your wallet.  The quality has always been consistently excellent.  They generally have excellent, juicy / fatty toro, and the nigiri slices are generously cut and well executed.  Although I seldom eat rolls, they have a creative selection.    **LV residents should note that they give a 20% off locals discount- huge score!  I will always return to Sushi Roku when in LV- absolutely love it!  Highly recommended for all levels of 'sushi expertise', and the non-sushi menu (which I don't venture into) is extensive enough to satisfy non-sushi eaters as well.  Enjoy!

oBv96oS1q5aJ6TVY8AoJog.text: My wife and I were looking for sushi we stopped at Sushi Way. We had the all you can eat for dinner 26.95 Bacon wrapped scallops are awesome coconut shrimp tempura was awesome every thing we had was awesome many things to order off all you can eat menu. The chef was great he helped us order and surprised us with different rolls. A great experience I had never had all you can eat sushi and was nervous but for no reason it was awesome.

B_Mm1DfMI5kGvGbe61LL0A.text: Amazing fish to be savored here.   Quiet mid week lunch I joined 3 others at the sushi bar and scanned the menu.  Sashimi combo- 2 cuts of 4 fish but mouthwatering delicious.  Monkfish Liver sushi was a nice change. Never had it before and actually I don't recall seeing it on other menus. Not bad. I'd order it again.  Tako roll was small. A let down compared to the amazing presentation of fish.  The takeaway here is high quality in an upscale location with warm charm and great service. You do pay for what you get but it's worth it. I'll be back for dinner with friends.

XtNNAI3ApcU_n9hrT0Vfrg.text: Had a couple of really good appetizers here back in December for happy hour.  Just needed a quick bite before the Shania Twain show. This place fit the bill.. Both the calamari and chicken satay skewers tasted great.. Along with that enjoyed a nice tasting glass of nicely chilled white wine.. Sat at the bar and enjoyed friendly efficient service and the price was right.. Will definitely be back next time in Vegas

56h1zW-GVD3ls4WFC4sRcg.text: Better the second time around. First time in March second time this past weekend. Ask for Paul if you're there on Sunday morning or afternoon. He's helped us out both times and hes one hell of a guy. Just tell him Carlos and Luis (the regulars from L.A.) recommended the place. As good as this place is Uni is disgusting...dont believe me? Give it a shot!

y5xx91xfOKyCXO2yx0o8iQ.text: The shrimp tempura and asparagus roll is one of the best things I have ever tasted. California roll was pretty good, but where was the cucumber? Heirloom tomato roll was... weird. But I can't really fault them for that, I think my tastebuds just weren't used to such weirdness. Jess said the salmon sushi was delectable. I'd maybe give this place 3.5 stars normally, but I'll bump them to 4 because I'm in a good mood.

grBkQP0OlBIRN2ujacw12g.text: Gotta say, I was definitely disappointed in this place. You are paying for the strip view and nice atmosphere at this restaurant. The sushi was average at best. The sake we got a bottle of was good - though it was $35 for a 330ml bottle (barely bigger than a beer bottle). And that was one of the cheapest there. Would not recommend it to my friends.

cB3ZUFMsBcdYvX0i_XT6mg.text: Overpriced average sushi, with a staff that made us feel like we were bothering them.  I don't get the hype.  If we spend over $200 for a party of 3 I would expect stellar food and a bit of ass kissing.  Had to remind them of items we didn't receive and the sushi chefs are as rude as they get.  They pretend to greet you nicely, but they are miserable and added to the fact the place was a huge disappointment.

I_VhXda3_3wqxoqfl_Bu4g.text: came her for lunch after a crazy huge dinner experience, sushi sounded perfect! this place did us just right. The fish was fresh, the service was cool, but then again...there weren't very many people there eating lunch=) Toro was and has always been delicious to me, but one thing you should get is their japanese snapper? not too sure what it's called, but it's a fish that's hard to find...sashimi wise....almost as good as toro!=) but worth every penny!=) and their spicy tuna mixed with something (a recommendation by our waiter) was really good too!!.. so do your homework before dining at vegas, so you won't regret not losing it on a crap table=)

0HSOBSynI3czlqwrwVdK0A.text: I'd give it 5 stars if it wasn't in a mall. Granted, a very very nice mall, but it takes away some of the allure for me.  That said.....the food is VERY good and I love the atmosphere inside. Tuna tartare spring rolls -- why didn't I think of that? The sushi was also very fresh and well-prepared....  Pricey? Yeah, but not outragous. We splurged on $125 bottle of champagne and got dessert and I think it came to $260 for two people.  I'm not sure if I loved it enough to go back on my next trip to Vegas, but it was definitely worth it for the first trip.

6uQFUmMeyOykfTo0IwDPtg.text: the restaurant is trendy and has a great view. even though the place was not too crowded, the noise level is a bit intense - so on a busy night, it would probably be really noisy.   we came for the sushi and overall, it was okay. it was fresh enough, but not the best i've had. we had the 'special' which was foie gras wrapped in hamachi and topped with black truffles. that was yummy - and you paid for it! ($50 for 3 pieces). dessert was actually very good - we had the tempura green tea and it was pretty awesome.  service was a bit uneven. you really expect great service for the price you pay, but they were just 'okay'. for a part of two - we ordered several sushi rolls; sake; and dessert and spent about $150.  overall, a good experience but wouldn't frequent this place.

hcsaGYn1ITdJBw-LmWVv8A.text: Beautiful decor! They gave us some free champagne since were there for our honeymoon. The tasting menu is very decadent, with caviar and truffles. If you like sushi, this is the place to go.

3m4CMLSkNpWt6Y7V8xAvCw.text: This is a small California based chain. The atmosphere at the sushi bar is OK but needs work. For example, when you first arrive, you are greeted loudly (good). However, after that most of the sushi chefs are silent. Only one chef (left most, perhaps the most senior) was a little talkative. On the positive side, the patrons were very friendly; I don't know if this is normal, or was just a coincidence.  In my two meals at the sushi bar, I've tried: * ankimo (steamed monkfish liver). Five medium slices; firm, with a very rich texture. Excellent. * uni (sea urchin). Pretty good, but wasn't as firm or tasty as it could be. * ama-ebi (raw shrimp). Good overall. The heads were served tempura style, but were not as juicy or as crispy as they should be. * awabi (abalone). Good * unagi (barbecued eel). Pretty standard. It should have been hotter and a little crisp. * hamachi (yellowtail). Good. * Smoked salmon wrapped ankimo topped with toro tartar, uni and caviar. It also included a layer of spinach, and gold leaf was placed on top. There were three pieces, each piece too big to eat in one bite, so eating it was tricky. Other than that, it was very tasty.  * Bincho maguro (albacore). Seared, topped with onion and a vinegary sauce. Good to very good. * Kohada (shad) served with shiso leaf. Moderately strong flavor, but milder than other similar fish (like saba/mackeral). Very good.  The sushi was generally very good, but not quite up to the standards of Hyakumi or Okada. It was cheaper than Hyakumi but no cheaper than Okada. Keep in mind that I'm comparing Sushi Roku to my two favorite sushi bars in all of Las Vegas.

zKYzD05XkGk85WKLuW3JYg.text: Another overpriced sushi joint in vegas where you pay for ambience, this time in Caesar's.  I ordered one of their lunch specials, for $18 I got 7 sushi pieces and spicy tuna roll.  It was lunchtime so hardly anyone was in there, I can see this place banging at 10pm on a Saturday night.  Ambience is pretty and loungelike, paying for ambience here kids.  Sushi is fresh and made right.

xTYpPu31NhotyIN_pHDGrg.text: Our waiter was awful. He was absent for pretty much the entire meal. It seems like the flavor of choice here was Wasabi. There was so much Wasabi in some of the Sushi that my throat was on fire. I like to be able to taste all aspects of my food not just one particular spice or seasoning. On the bright side the view if you have a table by the window is really something else

dq_QaGzNJVrDnNwmwylYLw.text: I must say this place was pretty awesome, from the decor, to the view of the strip, and the food was amazing, the chilean sea bass was rocking, all the rolls were delicious and even the cooked steak and asparagus was tasty, a must stop in Vegas if you love sushi, good service and cold beer.

0M_RQDk0_s-jtTowO_dmOg.text: Dining at Sushi Roku on an expense account was the main highlight of the experience.  Although the dishes were good, it wasn't up to the rave I expected.  Perhaps our group was there on a "bad day."   Overall, it was a nice dinner.

bHSBFIyt6Aor025H5LSmlQ.text: We made reservations, and our table was not available when we arrived.  Sat at the bar and ordered a few drinks.  When our table was finally ready, we had to walk our own drinks to the table.  I would have expected better service from a place like this.  The food was no better than the service.  On the bright side, our server did inform us that a particular dish we wanted to order was not up to par on its freshness that day.  I really appreciated his honesty.    We expected some good sushi out of this place, but was not impressed at all.  The sushi was mediocre, and so was the rest of the food.  Nothing we ordered stood out.  Only worth going because it was in Vegas.  If this place was anywhere else, they would definitely not get the business they get.  I don't intend to come here again.  Spent enough money here to receive two desserts compliments of the manager, but the food just was not good. There are plenty of other places in Vegas worth the money.

jbPe-Ad6oN_Z-BK247SFEg.text: Sushi was good, decor was great, service was solid..BUT the price was silly! I expect to pay more in Vegas, but double...Other than that it would warrant four stars, but all things considered its a solid three.

BngsNPMz_GNuEVC1ubLqUw.text: My husband and I shared a late lunch at Sushi Roku because we were SO famished after shopping the forum shops. It was pretty pricey (though, what ISN'T in Vegas?), but the roll we split (the Shima roll) was great! Quite spicy, but in a really good way. The tempura was good, crispier than tempura usually is. That made me happy. :) The view of the strip is wonderful from here, I can imagine it'd be gorgeous at night. We may visit Sushi Roku on another trip to Vegas. I'd recommend it!

zivlER_6oobugddrdMiDDQ.text: I spent my 21st birthday with my family in Las Vegas and this is where we chose to eat on our first night. Due to a freak snow storm, the restaurant as well as the city was mostly empty. It is a beautiful restaurant, providing an escape from the mall it is in. The best Japanese cuisine I have ever had and the price isn't ridiculous as many restaurants in the area. I highly suggest trying the sake sampler. Being more of a wine snob, I never considered sake with a meal mostly because I knew nothing about it, but each glass came with an explanation. The service was right on point as well. I will definitely be returning.

L82GT-4lCjowscej0ieDzQ.text: We both ordered the Chef's choice, wow, it was delicious & included some hot surprises!! Great view of the strip!!!!

nonX3R77ZwbQWwDh-RSBNw.text: We had a wonderful meal here on our recent trip to Las Vegas.  We tried some items from the menu as well as some specials - all were delicious - flavorful, fresh & creative.  Excellent service too.

6S4k1R0IDuEPPPDXKiqpZQ.text: I'm mainly giving this restaurant 4 stars for its awesome view of the strip and hip interior.  Medium to high noise level.  Me and my friend had miso soup, edamame, beer, the "Hanabi" spicy tuna on rice cakes appetizer and shared the Katana Roll.  My desert was the most memorable part of the meal.  I got the flambe fruit desert.  Mixed sauteed fruit, served in a crisp pastry shell with vanilla ice cream.  Very good.  Everything else was fresh and good, however, I feel it was rather pricey for the amount of food that we had.   You probably pay for the view.
